translated: I. The Section on Birth

analyzed: atha śrīmat nyāyasudhāyām jijñāsā adhikaraṇam
translated: Now, in the glorious Naya-sudha, the section on inquiry.

analyzed: maṅgala ācaraṇam  śriyaḥ patye nitya agaṇita guṇa māṇikya viśada prabhā jāla ullāsa upahata sakala avadya tamase
translated: Auspicious Invocation.🔽To the Lord of Shri, whose radiant light, clear as a string of gems, surpasses the darkness of all faults,

analyzed: jagat janma sthema pralaya racanā śīla vapuṣe śeṣa āmnāya smṛti hṛdaya dīptāya haraye  /
translated: To the one whose form is inclined towards the creation, sustenance and dissolution of the world, I offer salutations to Hari, who illuminates the hearts of all scriptures and traditions.

original: yena prādurabhāvi bhūmivalaye vyastāri gosantatiḥ prābodhi śrutipaṅkajaṃ karuṇayā prākāśi tattvaṃ param /
analyzed: yena prādurabhāvi bhūmi valaye vyastāri go santatiḥ prābodhi śruti paṅkajam karuṇayā prākāśi tattvam param
translated: By whom the cow lineage spread on the surface of the earth, who awakened the lotus of the Vedas with compassion and revealed the highest truth,

original: dhvāntaṃ dhvaṃsamanāyi sādhunikaraścākāri sanmārgagastena vyāsadivākareṇa satataṃ mā tyāji me mānasam // // /
analyzed: dhvāntam dhvaṃsam anāyi sādhu nikaraḥ ca akāri sat mārga gaḥ tena vyāsa divākareṇa satatam mā tyāji me mānasam  /
translated: Who destroyed the darkness and created the group of the virtuous, and who showed the right path, may the mind of me, the sun of Vyasa, never be abandoned.

original: vyāptiryasya nije nijena mahasā pakṣe sapakṣe sthitirvyāvṛttiśca vipakṣato 'tha viṣaye saktinar vai bādhite /
analyzed: vyāptiḥ yasya nije nijena mahasā pakṣe sapakṣe sthitiḥ vyāvṛttiḥ ca viṣaye vai bādhite
translated: To the one whose pervasion is in each individual with one's own great power, who abides in the hypothesis and in the similar instance, and who is excluded from the dissimilar instance, and whose object is not contradicted by attachment,

original: naivāsti pratipakṣayuktiratulaṃ śuddhaṃ pramāṇaṃ sa me bhūyāttattvavinirṇayāya bhagavānānandatīrtho muniḥ // // /
analyzed: na eva asti pratipakṣa yuktiḥ atulam śuddham pramāṇam sa me bhūyāt tattva vinirṇayāya bhagavān ānandatīrthaḥ muniḥ
translated: May the incomparable, pure means of valid knowledge of the sage, the revered Anandatirtha, be for me to determine the truth.

original: bhavati yadanubhavādeḍamūko 'pi vāgmī jaḍamatirapi janturjāyate prājñamauliḥ /
analyzed: bhavati vāgmī jaḍa matiḥ api jantuḥ jāyate prājña mauliḥ
translated: By experiencing which, even a dumb person becomes eloquent, and even an ignorant person becomes the crest-jewel of the wise.

original: sakalavacanaceto devatā bhāratī sā mama vacasi nidhattāṃ sannidhiṃ mānase ca // // /
analyzed: sakala vacana cetaḥ devatā bhāratī sā mama vacasi nidhattām sannidhim mānase ca
translated: May that goddess of speech, who is the totality of words and mind, be present in my speech and thoughts.
The abode of Lakshmi, the land of Uchiva, the birthplace of the Nyayarajatara,

analyzed: vairāgya bhāgyaḥ mama padmanābha tīrtha amṛta abdhiḥ bhavatāt vibhūtyai  pada vākya pramāṇa jñān prativādi mada chidaḥ
translated: May the ocean of nectar of the Padma-nabh-tirtha be the cause of prosperity for me.

analyzed: śrīmat akṣobhyatīrtha ākhyān upatiṣṭhe gurūn mama
translated: I bow to my gurus, the illustrious Akshobhya-tirtha, who are proficient in words, sentences, and logic, and who destroy the arrogance of opponents.
On the lake of the mind of the noble Sri Anandatirtha,

analyzed: anuvyākhyāna naline cañcarīkati me manaḥ
translated: My mind is like a bee in the lotus of the Anubhavyakhya.

original: na śabdābdhau gāḍhā naca nigamacarcāsu caturā naca nyāye prauḍhā naca viditavedyā api vayam /
analyzed: na śabda abdhau gāḍhāḥ na ca nigama carcāsu caturāḥ na ca nyāye prauḍhāḥ na ca vidita vedyāḥ api vayam
translated: We are not deeply immersed in the ocean of words, nor are we skilled in the discussions of the Vedas, nor are we proficient in logic, nor are we acquainted with the knowable.

original: paraṃ śrīmatpūrṇapramatigurukāruṇyasaraṇiṃ prapannā mānyāḥ smaḥ kimapi ca vadanto 'pi mahatām // // /
analyzed: param śrīmat pūrṇapramati guru kāruṇya saraṇim prapannāḥ mānyāḥ smaḥ kim api ca mahatām
translated: But having resorted to the path of compassion of the illustrious guru, the perfect-minded one, we are honored, even though we speak a little to the great ones.

analyzed: bhagavatā bādarāyaṇena prāṇinām niḥśreyasāya praṇītam api brahmamīmāṃsā śāstram asādhu nibandha andhatamasa avakuṇṭhita tvena apraṇītam iva
translated: The sacred scripture of Brahma-Mimamsa, composed by the revered Badarayana for the welfare of living beings, is considered by the revered sage Anandatirtha as if it were not composed due to being obstructed by the darkness of bad compositions.

analyzed: manyamānaḥ bhagavān ānandatīrtha muniḥ yathā ācārya abhiprāyam asya bhāṣyam vidhāya anubhāṣyam api
translated: Desiring to compose a commentary on this work according to the intention of the teacher, he will also compose a subcommentary.

analyzed: kariṣyan vilīna prakṛti tayā svayam antarāya vidhuraḥ pi anavaratam īśvara pravaṇa kāya karaṇa vṛttiḥ api  nārāyaṇa praṇāma ādikam prāripsitasya anantarāya parisamāpteḥ pracayasya ca hetu tayā avigīta śiṣya ācāra paramparā ādinā avagatam avaśyam
translated: Although he himself is free from obstacles due to his dissolved nature, and his bodily and mental activities are constantly inclined towards God,

original: karaṇīyaṃ śiṣyān grāhayituṃ granthādau nibadhnāti nārāyaṇamiti // /
analyzed: karaṇīyam śiṣyān grāhayitum grantha ādau nibadhnāti nārāyaṇam iti
translated: he still considers it necessary to make his disciples understand the worship of Narayana at the beginning of the work, as it is the cause for the completion of the work without obstacles and for its propagation, which he has learned through the unbroken lineage of disciples and teachers who are not opposed to the Vedas.🔽He therefore composes it at the beginning of the work.

analyzed: nārāyaṇam nikhila pūrṇa guṇa eka deham nirdoṣam āpyatamam api akhilaiḥ su vākyaiḥ
translated: I bow to Narayana, whose body is the sole abode of all perfect qualities, who is faultless, who is attainable by all good words,

original: asyodbhavādidamaśeṣaviśeṣato 'pi vandyaṃ sadā priyatamaṃ mama sannamāmi // / / //
analyzed: asya udbhavāt idam aśeṣa viśeṣataḥ vandyam sadā priyatamam mama sat namāmi
translated: who is born from this, and who is always to be worshipped by me, even more than by all others, I bow to him, my dearest one.

analyzed: atra nārāyaṇam san namāmi iti anvayaḥ
translated: Here, the construction is I bow to Narayana.

analyzed: uttama puruṣa prayogāt eva aham iti labhyate
translated: The word I is obtained from the use of the word uttama (supreme).

analyzed: sam iti bhakta yā ādi atiśaya sāhitya lakṣaṇām pramāṇasya samyaktām āha
translated: The word sama (together) indicates the correctness of the means of knowledge, characterized by the association of excellence such as devotion.

original: tathāvidha eva hi nārāyaṇapraṇāmo bhavatyabhimatasiddheraṅgam /🔽nikhiletyādīnāṃ tu pramāṇakarmaṇā nārāyaṇena viśeṣaṇatayā sambandhaḥ /
analyzed: tathāvidhaḥ eva hi nārāyaṇa praṇāmaḥ bhavati abhimata siddheḥ aṅgam  nikhila ityādīnām tu pramāṇa karmaṇā nārāyaṇena viśeṣaṇatayā sambandhaḥ
translated: Only such a salutation to Narayana becomes a means to the desired accomplishment.🔽The words nikhila (entire) etc. are related to Narayana, the means of knowledge, as qualifying it.

analyzed: prayojanam ca stuti padānām viśeṣya praśaṃsā eva
translated: And the purpose of the words of praise is only the praise of the qualified object.

analyzed: tatra ārthika punarukteḥ stuti tvam eva samādhānam avadhātavyam
translated: In that case, the solution should be understood to be only the praisefulness due to the repetition of the meaning.
Explanation as referring to the qualities that justify salutation

analyzed: athavā
translated: Or rather,

analyzed: kutas nārāyaṇasya namya tvam
translated: why is Narayana to be saluted?

original: tathātve 'pi kṛto 'nyāsu devatāsu satīṣu tasyaiva namanamityatroktamaśeṣaviśeṣato 'pi vandyamiti /
analyzed: tathātve pi kṛtaḥ nyāsu devatāsu satīṣu tasya eva namanam iti atra uktam aśeṣa viśeṣataḥ vandyam iti
translated: Even if that is so, it is said here that he alone is to be saluted among the other existing deities, who is to be worshipped even more than all other special qualities.

original: viśiṣṭate vastvebhiriti viśeṣā asādhāraṇadharmā aśeṣāśca te viśeṣāśca /
analyzed: viśiṣṭate vastu ebhiḥ iti viśeṣāḥ asādhāraṇa dharmāḥ aśeṣāḥ ca te viśeṣāḥ ca
translated: The special qualities are the uncommon attributes, and they are all without exception.

analyzed: apiḥ abhivyāptau
translated: The word api (even) means complete pervasion.

original: yāvanto vandyatvanimittabhūtā dharmāḥ tebhyo viśeṣebhyo 'pi hetubhyo vandyam /
analyzed: yāvantaḥ vandya tva nimitta bhūtāḥ dharmāḥ tebhyaḥ viśeṣebhyaḥ pi hetubhyaḥ vandyam
translated: Even from those special qualities, which are the causes of being worthy of worship, he is to be worshipped.

analyzed: tathā aśeṣāt vandya tvena samāśaṅkitāt padma bhava ādeḥ jagataḥ
translated: Similarly, the excellence of the world, which is suspected to be superior to Brahma and others who are to be worshipped, is complete, i.e., it is the best of all.

analyzed: tatas hetoḥ satīṣu anyāsu devatāsu vandyam iti
translated: For this reason, it is to be worshipped among other deities.

analyzed: etat ubhayam katham nārāyaṇasya iti atas bhihitam nikhila ityādi
translated: How is this twofold excellence of Narayana? To explain this, it is said Nिखिल and so on.

analyzed: trividhā hi devatā vandyā bhavati
translated: There are three kinds of deities to be worshipped:

analyzed: viśiṣṭa adhikṛta iṣyā ca iti
translated: The superior, the authorized, and the desired.

analyzed: nahi devatā vandanam vyasani tayā kriyate
translated: For the worship of deities is not done out of addiction.

analyzed: kintu vighna vighāta ādi prayojana apekṣayā
translated: But rather with the aim of removing obstacles and so on.

analyzed: viśiṣṭā eva devatā tasya iṣye
translated: The superior deity alone is desired for that.

analyzed: adhikṛtā ca sva viṣaya grantha prabodha ādikam sampādayati
translated: And the authorized one accomplishes the understanding of the texts on its subject matter and so on.

analyzed: vandanam khalu bhakta yādi upetam eva saphalam
translated: Indeed, worship is fruitful only when accompanied by devotion and so on.

original: tacceṣyāyāmeva devatāyāmupapadyata iti /🔽tatra vaiśiṣyayopapādanāya nikhilapūrṇaguṇaikadehaṃ nirdoṣamasyodbhavādidamiti viśeṣaṇatrayam /
analyzed: tat ca iṣyāyām eva devatāyām upapadyate iti  tatra vaiśiṣyayā upapādanāya nikhila pūrṇa guṇa eka deham nirdoṣam asya udbhavāt idam iti viśeṣaṇa trayam
translated: And that is possible only in the desired deity.🔽There, to explain the superiority, there are three qualifications: Nिखिल, पूर्ण, गुणैकदेह, निर्दोष, उद्भव and so on.

original: nikhilā niḥśeṣāḥ pūrṇāḥ pratyekamapyanavadhikā guṇā ānandādayaḥ /
analyzed: nikhilāḥ niḥśeṣāḥ pūrṇāḥ pratyekam api anavadhikāḥ guṇāḥ ānanda ādayaḥ
translated: Nिखिल means complete, without remainder. पूर्ण means each one is unlimited. The qualities such as bliss are गुणाः.

analyzed: eka śabdaḥ kevala arthaḥ
translated: The word एक is in the sense of only.

original: ta eva deho yasya na punaḥ prākṛtādiriti tathoktaḥ /
analyzed: te eva dehaḥ yasya na punar prākṛta ādiḥ iti tathā uktaḥ
translated: He who has that very body, not one made of primordial matter and so on, is called so.

analyzed: niṣkrāntaḥ doṣebhyaḥ pāratantrya ādibhyaḥ iti nirdoṣaḥ
translated: He who has gone beyond faults such as dependence is faultless.

original: asya pratyakṣādipramāṇasiddhatayā buddhisannihitasya svavyatiriktaprapañcasyodbhava utpattirādirasyetyudbhavādi janmādyaṣṭakaṃ tadyathāsambhavaṃ
analyzed: asya pratyakṣa ādi pramāṇa siddha tayā buddhi sannihitasya sva vyatirikta prapañcasya udbhavaḥ utpattiḥ ādiḥ asya iti udbhava ādi janma ādi aṣṭakam tat yathāsambhavam
translated: The origin, i.e., birth, of this world, which is present in the mind as established by perception and other means of knowledge, is the beginning of this, thus it is the origin etc. The group of eight beginning with origin is that. As far as possible,

analyzed: dadāti iti udbhavāt idastam
translated: He gives, thus he is the giver of origin etc.

analyzed: asya iti sambandha mātre ṣaṣṭhī
translated: The genitive case in asya (his) is used merely to indicate relationship.

analyzed: pi iti etat asya udbhavāt idam iti anena api sambaddhayate
translated: Even in all respects is also connected with this is the giver of origin etc. by this.

analyzed: viyat adhikaraṇa ādi vyutpādya samasta avāntarabheda sahita udbhavāt idam iti
translated: The giver of origin etc. along with all the subsidiary divisions explained in the Adhikaraṇa on space etc.

analyzed: adhikṛta tva pradarśanāya apyatamam api akhilaiḥ su vākyaiḥ iti
translated: In order to show the topic, even one of all the good statements.

analyzed: api śabdaḥ vandya tve hetu samuccaya arthaḥ
translated: The word api (even) has the meaning of including the reason in the praiseworthiness.

analyzed: abhivyāptau vā
translated: Or in the pervasion.

original: apauruṣeyatvena tanmūlatvena vānāśaṅkitadoṣatvādinā śobhanāni vākyāni vedādīni brahmasūtrādīni ca suvākyāni tairakhilairāpyatamam /
analyzed: apauruṣeya tvena tad mūla tvena vā an āśaṅkita doṣa tva ādinā śobhanāni vākyāni veda ādīni brahmasūtra ādīni ca su vākyāni taiḥ akhilaiḥ āpyatamam
translated: The Vedas and the Brahmasutras etc. are good statements because they are not composed by a person, or because they are based on that, or because they are free from suspected faults etc. Even one of all those good statements.

analyzed: atiśayena pratipādyam
translated: To be taught in an eminent way.

original: yadi vyācikhyāsitena brahmamīmāṃsāśāstreṇa tannirṇetavyārthena vedādinā ca pratipādya iti nārāyaṇo vandanīyaḥ /
analyzed: yadi vyācikhyāsitena brahma mīmāṃsā śāstreṇa tad nirṇetavya arthena veda ādinā ca pratipādyaḥ iti nārāyaṇaḥ vandanīyaḥ
translated: If Nārāyaṇa is to be worshipped because he is to be taught by the treatise on the investigation of Brahman, which is to be expounded, and by the Veda etc., whose meaning is to be determined,

original: hanta tarhi tata eva dharmādikaṃ prāṇādikaṃ vā vandanīyaṃ syāt /
analyzed: hanta tarhi tatas eva dharma ādikam prāṇa ādikam vā vandanīyam syāt
translated: then, alas! Dharma etc. or the life-breath etc. would be to be worshipped.

analyzed: na syāt  tasya nārāyaṇa pratipatti aṅga tayā veda ādi eka deśa pratipādya tvāt
translated: That is not so.🔽Because he is to be taught by a part of the Veda etc. as a means to the realization of Nārāyaṇa.

analyzed: asya punar an anya artha tayā akhila veda ādi vedya tvāt
translated: But this [Nārāyaṇa] is to be known by the entire Veda etc. as having no other purpose.

analyzed: tathāvidham eva ca adhikṛtam ucyate iti āśayavatā apyatamam iti akhilaiḥ iti ca uktam
translated: And it is one of this kind that is said to be qualified. With this intention, [the author] has said the one and by all.

analyzed: sadā priyatamam mama iti
translated: The statement of being desired is always most dear to me.

analyzed: atra api pūrvavat sadā āpadasya tamapaḥ ca prayojanam avadheyam
translated: Here also, as before, the purpose of the word always and the word to me should be noted.

analyzed: lakṣaṇa para tayā vyākhyānam
translated: The explanation as having the nature of a definition.

analyzed: yat vā
translated: Or rather.

analyzed: na anirdhārita svarūpasya praṇāmaḥ yuktaḥ
translated: It is not proper to bow to one whose nature is not determined.

original: na cāntareṇa lakṣaṇaṃ vastunirdhāraṇamityato vibhavādanekāni nārāyaṇasya lakṣaṇānyanenocyante /
analyzed: na ca antareṇa lakṣaṇam vastu nirdhāraṇam iti atas vibhavāt anekāni nārāyaṇasya lakṣaṇāni anena ucyante
translated: And without a definition, a thing cannot be determined. Therefore, by this [verse], many definitions of Nārāyaṇa are stated, from among the various [possibilities].

original: tatra nikhiletyanena nikhilaguṇatvaṃ pūrṇaguṇatvaṃ svato guṇaikadehatvaṃ ceti vipakṣābhedena trīṇi lakṣaṇānyuditāni /
analyzed: tatra nikhila iti anena nikhila guṇa tvam pūrṇa guṇa tvam svatas guṇa eka deha tvam ca iti vipakṣa abhedena trīṇi lakṣaṇāni uditāni
translated: There, by the word 'entire', three characteristics are stated by the division of the opposites: having all qualities, having complete qualities, and having a body consisting solely of qualities.

analyzed: nirdoṣam iti anena ekam
translated: By the word 'faultless', one [characteristic].

analyzed: āpyatamam iti anena veda ādi mukhya artha tvam akhila veda ādi artha tvam ca iti dvayam
translated: By the word 'most comprehensible', two [characteristics]: being the primary meaning of the Vedas and other scriptures, and being the meaning of all the Vedas and other scriptures.

analyzed: asya iti anena āṣyau
translated: By the word 'of him', two [characteristics].

analyzed: aśeṣa iti anena mukhya vandya tvam uktam aśeṣāt viśeṣeṇa vandyam iti
translated: By the word 'entire', the primary worshipfulness is stated: 'worthy of worship by all, especially'.

analyzed: sadā iti anena parama prema yogya tvam
translated: By the word 'ever', [the characteristic of] being worthy of supreme love.

analyzed: tasya an ānubhāvika tvāt asambhavam āśaṅkaya sadā mama iti uktam
translated: Fearing its impossibility due to its non-manifestation, it is said 'ever mine'.

analyzed: anyeṣām api jñāna uttara kālam idam ānubhāvikam mama tu sadā iti
translated: While this is manifest for others after knowledge, for me it is ever.

analyzed: api śabdaḥ lakṣaṇa samuccaye
translated: The word 'api' [means] 'also'.

analyzed: athavā
translated: Or else.

original: nikhiletyādyuktalakṣaṇopapannatayā nārāyaṇaḥ kena pramāṇena pratipattavya ityataḥ
analyzed: nikhila ityādi ukta lakṣaṇa upapannatayā nārāyaṇaḥ kena pramāṇena pratipattavyaḥ iti atas
translated: By the word 'entire', etc., it is said that Narayana, endowed with the characteristics stated, should be understood by what means of knowledge?

analyzed: su vākyaiḥ āpyam iti uktam
translated: Therefore, it is said 'by the most comprehensible statements'.

analyzed: nanu veda ādi eka deśe nyathā api ucyate na
translated: But is it not said otherwise in a part of the Vedas and other scriptures? No.

analyzed: tad pratīteḥ aparāmarśa pūrvaka tvāt iti āśayena akhilaiḥ iti uditam
translated: With the idea that [the Vedas and other scriptures] are preceded by the non-consideration of that [other interpretation], it is said 'by all'.

analyzed: tarhi dharma ādi asiddhiḥ syāt
translated: Then there would be no establishment of dharma, etc.

analyzed: tasya pramāṇa antara agocara tvāt
translated: Because that is not the domain of other means of knowledge.

analyzed: mā evam
translated: Not so.

analyzed: amukhyayā vṛttyā dharma ādeḥ api veda ādi vedya tvāt iti āśayavatā apyatamam iti abhihitam
translated: With the intention that even dharma, etc. are known through the Veda, etc. by secondary usage, the word also was stated.

analyzed: api śabdaḥ vakṣyamāṇa pramāṇa samuccaya arthaḥ
translated: The word also is for the purpose of including the means of knowledge that will be stated.

analyzed: sakala jagat nimitta kāraṇa tva ādi hetubhiḥ api ukta lakṣaṇaḥ nārāyaṇaḥ pratyetavyaḥ iti abhipretya uktam asya iti
translated: With the intention that Nārāyaṇa, who has the characteristics stated by the reasons such as being the primary cause of the entire world, should be known, it is said of him.

analyzed: bādhaka nirāsa para tayā vyākhyānam
translated: The explanation is in the sense of refuting objections.

analyzed: yat vā nārāyaṇasya deha sadbhāve duḥkha ādi doṣa anuṣaṅgaḥ
translated: Or, if Nārāyaṇa has a body, there is the consequence of faults such as suffering.

analyzed: tad abhāve jñāna ādi guṇa abhāvaḥ
translated: If he does not have that, there is the absence of qualities such as knowledge.

analyzed: ubhayathā api jagat janma ādi kāraṇatva asambhavaḥ iti āśaṅkayā uktam
translated: In both cases, there is the impossibility of being the cause of the creation, etc. of the world. Thinking thus, it is said:

analyzed: nikhila pūrṇa guṇa eka deham nirdoṣam iti
translated: Whose body is the sole abode of all perfect qualities, and is faultless.

analyzed: dehavat tvāt jñāna ādi guṇa pūrṇaḥ
translated: Because he has a body, he is full of qualities such as knowledge.

analyzed: tasya api nikhila pūrṇa guṇa mātra tvena duḥkha ādi doṣa rahitaḥ ca iti
translated: And because he is the mere abode of all perfect qualities, he is also free from faults such as suffering.

original: athavā nāyaṃ nārāyaṇaśabdo ḍitthādiśabda iva bhagavati sāṅgetiko ghaṭādiśabda iva vā rūḍhimātrapravṛttaḥ /
analyzed: athavā na ayam nārāyaṇa śabdaḥ ḍittha ādi śabdaḥ iva bhagavati sāṅgetikaḥ ghaṭa ādi śabdaḥ iva vā rūḍhi mātra pravṛttaḥ
translated: Or, this word Nārāyaṇa is not like the word Dittha, etc., which is figurative in relation to the Lord, or like the word jar, etc., which is used merely by convention.

analyzed: kintu viśiṣṭa guṇān api ācaṣṭe iti  sakala śāstra artha para tayā vyākhyānam
translated: But he also mentions the distinctive qualities.🔽Therefore, the explanation is in terms of the meaning of the entire scripture.

analyzed: athavā śrotṛ buddhaya anukūlanāya sakala śāstra artham saṅkṣepataḥ nena ācaṣṭe
translated: Or, in order to favor the understanding of the listener, he briefly mentions the meaning of the entire scripture with this.

analyzed: vidita saṅkṣepāḥ hi prapañcam jijñāsavaḥ bhavanti
translated: For those who know the summary are eager to know the details.

analyzed: tatra sadā vandyam iti prathama sūtra artha uktiḥ
translated: There, always to be worshipped is the statement of the meaning of the first aphorism.

analyzed: manaḥ vṛtteḥ tad pravaṇa tā hi vandanam
translated: For bowing is the inclination of the mind towards that.

analyzed: jijñāsā api tad viśeṣaḥ eva
translated: Inquiry is also a particular form of that.

analyzed: tasya jīva ādi vyāvṛttaye yat brahma iti uktam tasya arthaḥ nikhila iti
translated: In order to distinguish it from the individual soul and others, it is said to be Brahman. Its meaning is entire.

analyzed: tad upapādanāya dvitīya sūtre lakṣaṇam abhihitam
translated: For its establishment, the definition is stated in the second aphorism.

analyzed: tat āha asya iti
translated: He says that with of this.

original: tṛtīyasūtreṇa tatra śāstraṃ pramāṇamabhidhāya tasyādhyāyaśeṣeṇa tadviṣayatopapāditā /
analyzed: tṛtīya sūtreṇa tatra śāstram pramāṇam abhidhāya tasya adhyāya śeṣeṇa tad viṣaya tā upapāditā
translated: Having stated in the third aphorism that the scripture is the means of valid knowledge in that matter, its subject matter is established by the rest of the chapter.

analyzed: tat kathanamāpyatamam iti
translated: That statement is also the most important.

analyzed: prathama adhyāya arthe śaṅkita doṣa nirāsaḥ dvitīye bhihitaḥ tam āha nirdoṣam iti
translated: The refutation of the faults suspected in the meaning of the first chapter is stated in the second. He says that with faultless.

analyzed: evam brahma svarūpe siddhe adhikāriṇaḥ tad prasāda sādhana upāya bhūta tad sākṣātkāra jananāya vairāgya bhaktibhyām akhila veda artha śravaṇa ādi
translated: Thus, when the nature of Brahman is established, for the sake of generating the knowledge of Brahman, which is the means of attaining His grace for the qualified, by means of detachment and devotion, he listens to the meaning of all the Vedas, etc., as the third

analyzed: guru tvena vyāsasya praṇāmaḥ
translated: guru. He bows to Vyasa.

analyzed: tam eva śāstra prabhavam praṇamya jagadgurūṇām gurum añjasā eva
translated: Having bowed to him alone, the source of the scriptures, the guru of the gurus of the world, effortlessly,

analyzed: viśeṣataḥ me parama ākhya vidyā vyākhyām karomi anu api ca aham eva
translated: I shall explain the commentary on the supreme knowledge, and I alone shall do it further.

analyzed: nārāyaṇa praṇāmasya iva guru praṇāmasya api abhimata siddhayaṅgatayā kārya ārambhe vaśyam anuṣṭheya tvāt tad ācaraṇa puraḥsaram
translated: Just as the salutation to Narayana is necessarily to be performed at the beginning of an action for the attainment of the desired goal, in the same way, the salutation to the guru is also to be performed. Therefore, with the performance of that salutation at the forefront,

analyzed: brahma mīmāṃsā śāstra vyākhyānam samarthayamānaḥ pratijānīte tam eva iti
translated: he, desiring to support the explanation of the scriptures of Brahmana inquiry, declares🔽him alone.

analyzed: tam pūrva praṇatam nārāyaṇam eva
translated: Him, Narayana, who was bowed to before.

original: anvapi punarapi praṇamya bhaktayādyupetatālakṣaṇena prakarṣeṇa natvāhaṃ paramākhyavidyāyā brahmamīmāṃsāśāstrarūpāyā vyākhyāṃ karomīti sambandhaḥ
analyzed: anu api punar api praṇamya bhakta yā ādi upeta tā lakṣaṇena prakarṣeṇa natvā aham parama ākhya vidyāyāḥ brahma mīmāṃsā śāstra rūpāyāḥ vyākhyām karomi iti sambandhaḥ
translated: Having bowed again, with devotion and other qualities, with excellence characterized by possession, I shall explain the commentary on the supreme knowledge, which is in the form of the scriptures of Brahmana inquiry. This is the connection.

analyzed: vartamāna sāmīpya ārdra vartamāna vyapadeśaḥ
translated: The present tense is used to denote the near future.

analyzed: saṅkṣepataḥ vyākhyānasya prakrānta tvāt vā
translated: Or because the commentary is begun in brief.

analyzed: nanu praṇatasya punar praṇāmaḥ kimarthaḥ
translated: But why is there a salutation again after the salutation?

analyzed: nahi praṇāma āvṛttiḥ vighna vighāta ādi hetuḥ iti atra niyāmakam asti
translated: For there is no rule here that the repetition of salutations is the cause of the destruction of obstacles etc.

original: bhāve vā pūrvaśloka eva bahuśaḥ sannamāmīti vaktavyam /
analyzed: bhāve vā pūrva śloke eva bahuśas san namāmi iti vaktavyam
translated: If there were, it should have been said in the previous verse itself that he bows down many times.

analyzed: mā evam
translated: This is not so.

analyzed: guru tvena atra praṇāma ācaraṇāt
translated: Because the salutation is performed here as a teacher.

analyzed: katham nārāyaṇasya guru tvam iti atas āha śāstra prabhavam iti
translated: How is Narayana a teacher? To this he says born of the scriptures.

analyzed: śāstra śabdena prakṛta tvāt brahma mīmāṃsā śāstram veda ādikam ca ucyate
translated: The word scripture refers to the philosophy of the Vedanta and the Vedas etc., because they are the subject matter.

original: prabhavatyutpadyate prathamamupalabhyate vā yasmātsaḥ prabhavaḥ /🔽yathāsambhavaṃ śāstrasya prabhavaḥ śāstraprabhavastam /
analyzed: prabhavati utpadyate prathamam upalabhyate vā yasmāt saḥ prabhavaḥ  yathāsambhavam śāstrasya prabhavaḥ śāstra prabhavaḥ tam
translated: He from whom the scripture originates, is born, or is first perceived, is the origin.🔽The origin of the scripture is the origin of the scripture. He is so.

original: yo hi yacchāstre pravartate tasya tatprabhāvo gururiti prasiddhameva /
analyzed: yaḥ hi yat śāstre pravartate tasya tad prabhāvaḥ guruḥ iti prasiddham eva
translated: It is well known that he who engages in a certain scripture is its origin and is the teacher.

analyzed: prakṛta śāstra sampradāya pravartaka tvāt ca nārāyaṇasya guru tvam iti āha jagat gurūṇām iti
translated: And because Narayana is the promulgator of the tradition of the primary scripture, he is the teacher. He says of the teachers of the world.

original: jagata etacchāstrapravaktṛṇāṃ brahmādīnāmañjasā mukhyatayā na tu vayo 'dhikatvādimātreṇa gurum /
analyzed: jagataḥ etad śāstra pravaktṛṇām brahma ādīnām añjasā mukhya tayā na tu vayaḥ dhika tva ādi mātreṇa gurum
translated: The world, the expounders of this scripture, Brahma and others, are the Guru, not merely by seniority in age, but primarily.

analyzed: asya śāstrasya pravaktāram iti yāvat
translated: The meaning is: the expounder of this scripture.

original: prakārāntareṇa gurutvaṃ nārāyaṇasya samarthayate viśeṣata iti //
analyzed: prakāra antareṇa guru tvam nārāyaṇasya samarthayate viśeṣataḥ iti
translated: In another way, Narayana's Guruhood is established by the word visesatah.

analyzed: gurum iti vartate
translated: The word Guru is used.

original: viśeṣata iti sākṣādupadeṣyṛtvena na tu jagata iva paramparayā /
analyzed: viśeṣataḥ iti sākṣāt upadeṣyṛ tvena na tu jagataḥ iva paramparayā
translated: Visesatah means directly as the instructor, not indirectly like the world.

original: atra yadi śāstraprabhavamityādyevocyeta tadā pṛthakpraṇāmena devatāyā gurośca pārthakyaśaṅkā syāt /
analyzed: atra yadi śāstra prabhavam ityādi eva ucyeta tadā pṛthak praṇāmena devatāyāḥ guroḥ ca pārthakya śaṅkā syāt
translated: Here, if only yasya prasadad etc. were stated, then there would be a doubt of difference between the deity and the Guru due to separate salutations.

analyzed: tad artham tam eva iti uktam
translated: For that purpose, tameva is stated.

analyzed: na ca evam pṛthak praṇāma anupapattiḥ
translated: And thus, the separate salutations are not inappropriate.

analyzed: nimitta dvaya samāveśe naimittika vilopa niyama abhāvāt
translated: When two reasons are combined, there is no rule to omit the result.

analyzed: śiṣya śikṣāyai ca etad granthe niveśanam
translated: And this text is included for the instruction of the disciples.

analyzed: śiṣyāṇām ca asti guru devatā bhedaḥ
translated: And disciples have a difference between the Guru and the deity.

analyzed: tad apekṣayā eva jagadgurūṇām iti uktam
translated: Jagatgurunam is used only with reference to that.

analyzed: anyathā viśeṣataḥ me iti uktam ayuktam syāt
translated: Otherwise, visesatah would be inappropriate.

analyzed: vyākhyeya tva samarthanam
translated: Establishing the need for commentary.

analyzed: syāt etat
translated: This may be said.

analyzed: atha atas brahma jijñāsā ityādikam grantham vyākhyātum ayam devatā ādi praṇāmaḥ
translated: This salutation to the deities etc. is for the purpose of explaining the text beginning with Now, therefore, the desire to know Brahman etc.

analyzed: na ca ayam vyākhyātavyaḥ
translated: And this should not be explained.

analyzed: artha vivakṣā pūrvakasya eva pauruṣeya vākyasya vyākhyātavya tvāt
translated: Because only a human statement preceded by the desire to convey meaning should be explained.

analyzed: na hi mātṛkā mātra vyākhyāne prekṣāvān pravartate  na ca asya artha vivakṣā pūrvaka tve mānam asti
translated: For an intelligent person does not engage in the explanation of mere mātrkā (text).🔽And there is no valid means of knowledge for its being preceded by the desire to convey meaning.

analyzed: praṇayana mātrasya vyabhicāri tvāt
translated: Because mere composition is inconclusive.

analyzed: prekṣāvat praṇayanasya ca aniścayāt
translated: And because the composition of an intelligent person is uncertain.

analyzed: niścaye vā viṣa hara mantrasya iva japa ādinā abhyudaya siddhaye nirmāṇa upapatteḥ
translated: Or if it is certain, then like a poison-neutralizing mantra, it is reasonable to compose it for the purpose of attaining prosperity by recitation etc.

analyzed: gṛhīta saṅgateḥ artha pratibhāsaḥ hi viṣa hara mantre samānaḥ
translated: For the appearance of meaning is the same even in a poison-neutralizing mantra for one who has grasped the connection.

analyzed: na ca artha vivakṣā pūrvakatva mātreṇa upādeya tā vyākhyānam yuktam
translated: And it is not proper to accept an explanation merely on the basis of being preceded by the desire to convey meaning.

analyzed: vipralambhaka ādi vākya vyākhyāna prasaṅgāt
translated: Because it would lead to the explanation of the statements of deceivers etc.

analyzed: kim nāma yāthārthye ca sati
translated: What is it? When it is true to the meaning.

analyzed: na ca asya yāthārthye mānam asti
translated: And there is no valid means of knowledge for its being true to the meaning.

original: tadbhāve 'pi tathāvidhavākyāntaraparityāgenāsyaiva vyākhyāne kāraṇaṃ vaktavyamityāśaṅkānirāsāya paramākhyavidyetyuktam / /
analyzed: tad bhāve pi tathāvidha vākya antara parityāgena asya eva vyākhyāne kāraṇam vaktavyam iti āśaṅkā nirāsāya parama ākhya vidyā iti uktam
translated: In order to remove the doubt that even in that case, the reason for explaining this one alone by abandoning other similar statements should be stated, the word 'parā' (supreme) is used.

analyzed: ayam abhisandhiḥ
translated: The intention is this.

original: asti tāvadasmingranthedve vidye veditavye parā caivāparā ca' /
analyzed: asti tāvat asmin granthe dve vidye veditavye parā ca eva aparā ca
translated: In this text, there are two knowledges to be known, the supreme and the inferior.

analyzed: ityādau para vidyā ākhyā  atra vidyā śabdena artha vivakṣā yāthārthyam ca asya avagamyate
translated: Here, in the beginning, there is the designation of the supreme knowledge.🔽Here, by the word 'vidyā' (knowledge), the meaning is intended, and its truthfulness is understood.

analyzed: yāthārthya jñāna tad sādhanayoḥ vidyā śabdasya yoga rūḍhibhyām pravṛtta tvāt
translated: Because the word 'vidyā' is used for true knowledge and its means by both primary and secondary meanings.

analyzed: saṃjñāyām sama jani sada
translated: In the grammatical rule 'saṃjñāyāṃ samājanisada',

analyzed: iti atra saṃjñāyām iti anuvṛtteḥ
translated: the word 'saṃjñāyāṃ' (in the case of a name) is repeated.

analyzed: para śabdena ca yāthārthyāt vākya antarāt utkarṣaḥ
translated: And by the word 'para' (supreme), the superiority over other statements is due to truthfulness.

analyzed: tat evam āgamena asya sarva uttama praṇāma āpya pratīteḥ gahana artha tvat ca upapannam anya parityāgena asya eva vyākhyānam iti
translated: Thus, since this is understood to be the most excellent salutation by the scriptures, and since its meaning is obscure, the explanation of this one alone by abandoning others is appropriate.

analyzed: tathā api anyaiḥ eva vyākhyāta tvāt na punar idam vyākhyātavyam iti atas vyākhyām iti uktam
translated: Even so, since it has already been explained by others, it need not be explained again. Therefore, 'explained' is stated.

analyzed: viśiṣṭa ākhyā vyākhyā
translated: 'Vyākhyā' (explanation) is a special kind of explanation.

analyzed: anena para kṛtānām apavyākhyāna tām abhipraiti
translated: By this he intends to show that the commentaries composed by others are faulty.

analyzed: tathā ca tatra tatra pradarśayiṣyati
translated: And he will demonstrate this in various places.

original: tathāpi svapraṇītabhāṣyeṇaiva kṛtavyutpādanamidaṃ śāstramiti kimanena vyutpādanenetyato 'nvapi cetyāha /
analyzed: tathā api sva praṇīta bhāṣyeṇa eva kṛta vyutpādanam idam śāstram iti kim anena vyutpādanena iti atas nu api ca iti āha
translated: Even so, this treatise has already been explained by his own commentary. So what is the use of this explanation? Therefore he says even so.

analyzed: caśabdena anuvyākhyāne prayojana sadbhāvam samuccinoti
translated: By the word even, he includes the existence of the purpose in the Anvvyakhyana.

analyzed: tat ca vakṣyate
translated: And that will be stated.

analyzed: prayojana sadbhāve bhāṣya diśā śiṣyāḥ eva anuvyākariṣyanti iti atas
translated: When the existence of the purpose is understood, the disciples themselves will explain it according to the commentary. Therefore it is said I alone.

analyzed: evaśabdena anyeṣām asāmarthyam sūcayati
translated: By the word alone, he indicates the inability of others.

analyzed: āgamena śāstra prāmāṇyam
translated: The authoritativeness of the scripture is by the scripture itself.

analyzed: prādurbhūtaḥ hariḥ vyāsaḥ viriñca bhava pūrvakaiḥ
translated: Hari, having manifested as Vyasa, was requested by Brahma and Shiva,

analyzed: arthitaḥ paravidyā ākhyam cakre śāstram anuttamam
translated: and composed the excellent scripture called Paravidya.

original: yaduktaṃ nārāyaṇo 'sya śāstrasya prabhava iti tadayuktam /
analyzed: yat uktam nārāyaṇaḥ sya śāstrasya prabhavaḥ iti tat ayuktam
translated: What has been said that Narayana is the source of this scripture is incorrect.

analyzed: vyāsa upajña tā prasiddhi virodhāt
translated: Because it contradicts the well-known fact that it is composed by Vyasa.

analyzed: na ca nārāyaṇaḥ eva vyāsaḥ
translated: And Narayana is not Vyasa himself.

analyzed: janana virodhāt
translated: Because it would contradict the fact of his birth.

analyzed: kṛtakṛtyasya prayojana abhāvena śāstra praṇayana asambhavāt ca
translated: And because one who has accomplished his purpose cannot compose a scripture due to the absence of purpose.

analyzed: yat ca asya śrautyā para vidyā ākhyayā sarva uttama prāmāṇya siddhiḥ iti tat api ayuktam
translated: And that its authoritativeness is established as the highest by the name of the supreme knowledge, that also is improper.

original: paraśabdasyānekārthatvena vidyāśabdasya cārthavivakṣāvirahiṇyapi mantre prayogadarśanena paravidyākhyāyāḥ sarvottamaprāmāṇyāniścāyakatvāt /
analyzed: para śabdasya aneka artha tvena vidyā śabdasya ca artha vivakṣā virahiṇi api mantre prayoga darśanena para vidyā ākhyāyāḥ sarva uttama prāmāṇya a niścāyaka tvāt
translated: Because the name 'supreme' has many meanings, and because the word 'vidyā' is seen to be used in a mantra even without the intention of meaning knowledge, the name 'supreme knowledge' does not establish authoritativeness as the highest.

original: kiñceyaṃ paravidyākhyaitadviṣayetyatrāpi na niyāmakamastītyata āha prādurbhūta iti //
analyzed: kiñca iyam paravidyā ākhyā etad viṣayā iti atra api na niyāmakam asti iti atas āha prādurbhūtaḥ iti
translated: Moreover, there is no restriction here as to whether this is named 'supreme knowledge' or has this as its subject. Therefore he says 'manifested' etc.

analyzed: atra kṛtakṛtyaḥ pi hariḥ ātma kṛpā āspadaiḥ viriñca bhava pūrvakaiḥ amaraiḥ arthitaḥ vyāsaḥ
translated: Here, even though Hari has accomplished his purpose, he, being requested by the immortal ones headed by Brahmā and Śiva, who are the objects of his compassion,

original: prādurbhūto na tu jāto granthamimaṃ cakra ityanena nārāyaṇasya śāstraprabhavatve
analyzed: prādurbhūtaḥ na tu jātaḥ grantham imam cakre iti anena nārāyaṇasya śāstra prabhava tve
translated: manifested, but was not born, and composed this text. By this, the impossibility of Nārāyaṇa being the source of the scripture

analyzed: nupapattiḥ parihṛtā
translated: is refuted.

original: dṛśyante hi kevalaṃ kṛpāpāravaśyena paropakārāya pravartamānāḥ sutarāṃ tairarthitāḥ /
analyzed: dṛśyante hi kevalam kṛpā pāravaśyena para upakārāya pravartamānāḥ sutarām taiḥ arthitāḥ
translated: For those who are solely impelled by the irresistible force of compassion to engage in benefiting others are indeed most earnestly requested by them.

original: ata eva paraprayojanamapyātmagāmīva manyamānasya bhagavataḥ śāstrapraṇayanamiti jñāpayitumātmanepadaprayogaḥ /
analyzed: atas eva para prayojanam api ātma gāmi iva manyamānasya bhagavataḥ śāstra praṇayanam iti jñāpayitum ātmanepada prayogaḥ
translated: For this very reason, the use of the reflexive pronoun indicates that the composition of the scripture by the Lord, who considers even the purpose of others as his own,🔽is to be understood.

analyzed: atra ca nārāyaṇāt viniṣpannam ityādi āgamaḥ pramāṇam
translated: And here, the scriptures beginning with arisen from Nārāyaṇa are the means of valid knowledge.

original: paravidyākhyayā asya sarvottamaprāmāṇyasiddhiṃ vyutpādayituṃ paravidyākhyamityanūdyānuttamaṃ śāstramiti vyākhyātam /
analyzed: paravidyā ākhyayā asya sarva uttama prāmāṇya siddhim vyutpādayitum paravidyā ākhyam iti anūdya anuttamam śāstram iti vyākhyātam
translated: In order to explain the establishment of its being the best means of valid knowledge by being called the supreme knowledge, it is translated as called the supreme knowledge and explained as the best scripture.

analyzed: na asti uttamam śāstram asmāt iti anuttamam
translated: It is the best because there is no scripture superior to it.

analyzed: śiṣyate yathāsthitam pratipādyate tattvam anena iti śāstram
translated: It is a scripture because it teaches the truth as it is.

analyzed: idam uktam bhavati
translated: This is what is said.

original: dve vidye veditavye parā caivāparā ca' /
analyzed: dve vidye veditavye parā ca eva aparā ca
translated: Two kinds of knowledge should be known, the supreme and the inferior.

original: iti vidyādvayamuddiśya tatrāparetyādinā sāṅgānvedānaparavidyātvenoktavāatha parā yayā tadakṣaramadhigamyate' /
analyzed: iti vidyā dvayam uddiśya tatra aparā ityādinā sa aṅgān vedān apara vidyā tvena uktavā atha parā yayā tat akṣaram adhigamyate
translated: Having mentioned the two kinds of knowledge in this way, and having said that the Vedas along with their auxiliaries are the inferior knowledge by saying the inferior one is that by which one attains the worlds of Brahman etc.,

analyzed: iti para vidyā pradarśitā
translated: the supreme knowledge is shown by saying the supreme one is that by which the imperishable is attained.

analyzed: sā tāvat veda ādi śāstra prakaraṇāt parama akṣara adhigati karaṇa tva liṅgāt ca śāstram eva bhavitum arhati anyathā sakṛt ukta vidyā śabdasya aneka artha tva kalpanā prasaṅgāt ca
translated: That can only be a scripture because of the topic of the scriptures such as the Vedas, and because of the indication that it is the means of attaining the supreme imperishable. Otherwise, there would be the consequence of having to assume multiple meanings for the word vidyā (knowledge) used once.

analyzed: śāstram ca apramāṇam ca iti vipratiṣiddham
translated: And it is contradictory to say that a scripture is not a means of valid knowledge.

analyzed: tasya ca para tvam
translated: And its supremacy is

analyzed: nāma anyat na sambhavati iti anuttama tvam eva
translated: It is not inferior, because nothing superior to it is possible.

analyzed: tat api sannidhānāt pramāṇa tvena eva
translated: And that is also [considered] a means of knowledge because of its proximity.

analyzed: śabda antara samabhivyāhāra vaśena sāmānya śabdasya kalpanīya tvāt
translated: Because the specific meaning of a general term must be assumed based on the force of the co-occurrence of other words.

original: tadyathā paramadhārmika ityabhihite paramatvaṃ dharmeṇeti jñāyate /
analyzed: tat yathā parama dhārmikaḥ iti abhihite parama tvam dharmeṇa iti jñāyate
translated: For example, when it is said supremely righteous, it is understood that the supremacy is in terms of righteousness.

analyzed: tat ca anuttamam śāstram idam eva vivakṣitam
translated: And that supreme scripture is intended to be this very [Upaniṣad].

analyzed: nirṇetavya arthānām ṛga ādi pada upalakṣitānām aśeṣa śāstrāṇām aparavidyā tvena ukta tvāt
translated: Because all the scriptures indicated by the words Ṛg etc., whose meanings are to be determined, are said to be lower knowledge.

analyzed: anyasya aprasaṅgāt paratva asambhavāt ca
translated: Because it is not possible for anything else, and because supremacy is not possible for it.

analyzed: sambhavati tu asya para tvam anugrāhaka tvāt
translated: But supremacy is possible for this [Upaniṣad] because it is the benefactor.

analyzed: etena upaniṣadaḥ para vidyā iti vyākhyānam iti parāstam
translated: Therefore, the explanation that the Upaniṣads are higher knowledge is refuted.

analyzed: ṛk ādi grahaṇena tāsām api gṛhīta tvāt
translated: Because they are also included by the mention of the Ṛg etc.

analyzed: brāhmaṇa parivrājaka nyāyaḥ ca agatikā gatiḥ
translated: And the reasoning of the Brahmin and the wandering ascetic is an unattainable goal.

analyzed: tad janyam jñānam para vidyā iti api na yuktam  adhigati karaṇa tva anupapatteḥ
translated: It is also not correct to say that the knowledge produced by that is higher knowledge.🔽Because it is not possible for it to be the instrument of attainment.

analyzed: aneka artha tā kalpanā āpatteḥ ca
translated: And because it would lead to the assumption of multiple meanings.

analyzed: atas nayā paravidyā ākhyayā asya śāstrasya sarva uttama prāmāṇya sādhanam upapannam iti
translated: Therefore, by this so-called higher knowledge, the proof of the highest authority of this scripture is established.

analyzed: vidyā śāstra śabdayoḥ samāna artha tvam
translated: The words 'vidyā' and 'śāstra' have the same meaning.

analyzed: yadi api vidyā śāstra śabdau śiṣya ācārya vyāpāra anubandhinau tathā api ubhaya anugata tattva jñāna karaṇa tva mātram upādāya dvayoḥ aikārthyam uktam iti avagantavyam
translated: Although the words 'vidyā' and 'śāstra' are related to the activities of disciples and teachers, it should be understood that their identity of meaning is stated by taking only the common property of being the means of true knowledge that inheres in both.

original: ṛgādyā aparā vidyā yadā viṣṇorna vācakāḥ /
analyzed: ṛc ādyāḥ aparāḥ vidyāḥ yadā viṣṇoḥ na vācakāḥ
translated: The Rg and other Vedas are the lower knowledge when they do not denote Viṣṇu.

original: tā eva paramā vidyā yadā viṣṇostu vācakāḥ' /
analyzed: tāḥ eva paramā vidyāḥ yadā viṣṇoḥ tu vācakāḥ
translated: They are the highest knowledge when they denote Viṣṇu.

analyzed: iti bhagavatpādīyam vyākhyānam api etam eva artham sūcayati
translated: This commentary by the revered Vyāsa also indicates this very meaning.

original: brahmamīmāṃsāśāstravyutpāditanyāyānupakṛtā hi vedādayo viṣṇoravācakāstadukṛtāśca tasya vācakā bhavantīti /
analyzed: brahma mīmāṃsā śāstra vyutpādita nyāya anupakṛtāḥ hi veda ādayaḥ viṣṇoḥ avācakāḥ tad ukṛtāḥ ca tasya vācakāḥ bhavanti iti
translated: For the Vedas etc., when aided by the reasoning expounded in the Mīmāṃsā śāstra, become the means of denoting Viṣṇu, and when not so aided, do not denote Him.

original: tathāpi kevalasya na paravidyātvaṃ labhyata iti cet /
analyzed: tathā api kevalasya na para vidyā tvam labhyate iti ced
translated: If it is argued that even so, the mere (Vedas etc.) cannot be regarded as the higher knowledge,

analyzed: mā lābhi  veda ādi itikartavya tā rūpasya asya pṛthak prāmāṇya anabhyupagamāt
translated: (we say) let it not be so regarded.🔽Because this (Mīmāṃsā) is not accepted as an independent means of knowledge, but only as a means of knowledge in regard to the Vedas etc.

analyzed: prāmāṇya mātre anumānam
translated: The inference (of the truth of the Vedas etc.) is only in regard to their (validity as) means of knowledge.

analyzed: guruḥ gurūṇām prabhavaḥ śāstrāṇām bādarāyaṇaḥ
translated: The teacher of teachers, the origin of scriptures, is Badarayana.

analyzed: yatas tat uditam mānam aja ādibhyaḥ tad arthataḥ
translated: From whom, for the sake of the meaning, this has been declared by him to the unborn and others as the standard.

original: evaṃ tāvadāgamenāsya śāstrasyānuttamaṃ prāmāṇyaṃ prasādhyādhunānumānato 'pi tat siṣādhayiṣurādau tāvatprāmāṇyamātre anumānaṃ vaktumāha gururiti
analyzed: evam tāvat āgamena asya śāstrasya anuttamam prāmāṇyam prasādhya adhunā anumānataḥ tat siṣādhayiṣuḥ ādau tāvat prāmāṇya mātre anumānam vaktum āha guruḥ iti
translated: Thus, having established the unsurpassed authority of this scripture through the scriptures, now, wishing to establish it through inference as well, he first states the inference regarding mere authority, saying the teacher and so on.

original: yato yatkāraṇaṃ bādarāyaṇo gurūṇāṃ jagatastattvopadeśakānāṃ brahmādīnāṃ gururupadeṣyā /
analyzed: yatas yat kāraṇam bādarāyaṇaḥ gurūṇām jagataḥ tattva upadeśakānām brahma ādīnām guruḥ upadeṣyā
translated: From whom, the teacher of teachers, of Brahma and others, the teachers of the truth of the world, is Badarayana.

original: yataśca śāstrāṇāṃ vedānāṃ bhāratādīnāṃ ca yathāsambhavaṃ prabhavo gurūṇāmaśeṣārthapratipādakānāṃ
analyzed: yatas ca śāstrāṇām vedānām bhārata ādīnām ca yathāsambhavam prabhavaḥ gurūṇām aśeṣa artha pratipādakānām
translated: And from whom, the origin of scriptures, of the Vedas and the Mahabharata and others, as appropriate, of the scriptures in detail that teach all meanings,

original: savistarāṇāṃ vedādiśāstrāṇāṃ gururmukhyaprabhavo na tu sampradāyamātrapravartaka iti vā /
analyzed: sa vistarāṇām veda ādi śāstrāṇām guruḥ mukhya prabhavaḥ na tu sampradāya mātra pravartakaḥ iti vā
translated: the teacher is the primary origin, not merely the propagator of the tradition.

analyzed: yatas ca aja ādibhyaḥ śrotṛbhyaḥ teṣām arthaḥ mokṣaḥ tad arthaḥ tasmai tad arthataḥ
translated: And for the sake of the meaning, for the sake of the liberation of the listeners such as the unborn,

original: taduditaṃ tena bādarāyaṇenopadiṣyamidaṃ śāstramato mānaṃ bhavitumarhati / /
analyzed: tat uditam tena bādarāyaṇena upadiṣyam idam śāstram atas mānam bhavitum arhati
translated: this scripture has been declared by him, Badarayana. Therefore, it deserves to be a standard.

analyzed: hetūnām sākṣāt sādhya nirdeśaḥ
translated: The direct statement of the conclusions of the reasons.

original: atra gururgurūṇāmityādihetūnāṃ vaktṛśrotṛprasaṅgānāmānukūlyānyeva sākṣātsādhyāni mānasīti tu paramasādhyanirdeśa iti jñātavyam /
analyzed: atra guruḥ gurūṇām ityādi hetūnām vaktṛ śrotṛ prasaṅgānām ānukūlyāni eva sākṣāt sādhyāni mānasī iti tu parama sādhya nirdeśaḥ iti jñātavyam
translated: Here, it should be understood that the ultimate thing to be established is faith (māna), and the favorable conditions of the speaker, listener, and context, such as the teacher of the teachers and so on, are the direct things to be established.

analyzed: tathā hi
translated: This is because:

original: vivakṣitārthatattvajñānaṃ karaṇapāṭavaṃ vivakṣā ceti trayaṃ vakturānukūlyaṃ nāma /
analyzed: vivakṣita artha tattva jñānam karaṇa pāṭavam vivakṣā ca iti trayam vaktuḥ ānukūlyam nāma
translated: The three things called favorable conditions of the speaker are: knowledge of the truth of the intended meaning, skill in the means, and the desire to speak.

analyzed: tattva jñāna yogya tā vaktṛ prīti viṣaya tā ca iti dvayam śrotuḥ
translated: The two things called favorable conditions of the listener are: fitness for the knowledge of truth, and being the object of the speaker's affection.

analyzed: śrotṛ prayojana uddeśaḥ prasaṅgasya
translated: The purpose of the listener is the context.

original: tatra gurūṇāṃ gururiti vakturbādarāyaṇasya vivakṣitārthatattvajñānasādhane hetuḥ /
analyzed: tatra gurūṇām guruḥ iti vaktuḥ bādarāyaṇasya vivakṣita artha tattva jñāna sādhane hetuḥ
translated: Among them, the teacher of the teachers is the reason for the speaker Bādarāyaṇa's knowledge of the truth of the intended meaning, which is the means of establishing it.

original: yo hi yasya tattvopadeṣyā sa tato 'dhikatattvajñānavānupalabdhaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ hi yasya tattva upadeṣyā sa tatas dhika tattva jñānavān upalabdhaḥ
translated: For it is observed that one who teaches the truth to another possesses a higher knowledge of the truth than that other person.

original: ayaṃ ca sarvajñakalpānāṃ brahmādīnāṃ tattvopadeṣyā brahmarudrādideveṣvityādyāgamādavagataḥ /
analyzed: ayam ca sarvajña kalpānām brahma ādīnām tattva upadeṣyāḥ brahma rudra ādi deveṣu ityādi āgamāt avagataḥ
translated: And this [Bādarāyaṇa] is known from the scriptures as the teacher of the truth to Brahmā and others, who are like omniscient beings, among the gods such as Brahmā, Rudra, and so on.

analyzed: atas savarjñaḥ bhavitum arhati iti
translated: Therefore, he is worthy of being omniscient.

original: gurūṇāṃ śāstrāṇāṃ guruḥ prabhava ityanenāpi tattvajñānaṃ karaṇapāṭavaṃ ca sādhyate /
analyzed: gurūṇām śāstrāṇām guruḥ prabhavaḥ iti anena api tattva jñānam karaṇa pāṭavam ca sādhyate
translated: By the phrase the teacher of the teachers of the scriptures, knowledge of the truth and skill in the means are also established.

original: yo hi yāvadatharpratipādakasyāgamasya prabhavaḥ sa tāvantamarthaṃ tattvato jānannavagataḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ hi yāvat athar pratipādakasya āgamasya prabhavaḥ sa tāvantam artham tattvataḥ jānan avagataḥ
translated: For one who is the source of a scripture that teaches up to a certain extent of meaning, it is understood that he knows that much of the meaning as a reality.

analyzed: ayam ca aśeṣa artha pratipādakasya āgamasya prabhavaḥ nu ktam pañcabhiḥ vedaiḥ utsannān bhagavān vedān iti ādi vacanāt avagataḥ
translated: And this source of a scripture that teaches all meanings is understood from the statement beginning with The Lord, the Vedas having been lost, created the five Vedas that had not been uttered before, etc.

analyzed: tatas bhavitavyam anena sarvajñena
translated: Therefore, he must be omniscient.

original: yaśca bahorāgamasya prabhavaḥ so 'sati nimittāntare paṭukaraṇo dṛṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ ca bahoḥ āgamasya prabhavaḥ saḥ sati nimitta antare paṭu karaṇaḥ dṛṣṭaḥ
translated: And one who is the source of much scripture is seen to have sharp faculties, in the absence of other causes.

original: ayaṃ cāparasya vedādeḥ prabhavaḥ kathamapaṭukaraṇo bhavediti /
analyzed: ayam ca aparasya veda ādeḥ prabhavaḥ katham apaṭu karaṇaḥ bhavet iti
translated: And how could this source of another Veda, etc. have dull faculties?

analyzed: tat uditam iti vacanena kāryeṇa vaktuḥ vivakṣā kāraṇa bhūtā upapāditā
translated: By the statement taught by him, the speaker's intention is established as the cause by the effect.

analyzed: gurūṇām iti śrotṛṇām tattva jñāna yogyatā upapādane hetuḥ
translated: By the teachers is the reason for establishing the disciples' fitness for the knowledge of reality.

original: nahi svayaṃ tattvajñānāyogyaḥ pareṣāṃ tattvopadeṣyā dṛṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: nahi svayam tattva jñāna ayogyaḥ pareṣām tattva upadeṣyā dṛṣṭaḥ
translated: For one who is himself unfit for the knowledge of reality is not seen to be able to teach reality to others.

analyzed: aja ādibhyaḥ iti vaktṛ prema āspada tva upapādanam
translated: By Brahmā and others establishes the speaker as the object of affection.

analyzed: brahma ādayaḥ hi parameśvara prema viṣayāḥ su prasiddhāḥ
translated: For Brahmā and others are well-known objects of the Supreme Lord's affection.

analyzed: tad arthataḥ iti prasaṅga ānukūlya upapādanam
translated: For that purpose establishes the suitability of the context.

analyzed: atra sarvatra akāraṇa kārya ūtvatti ādi prasaṅgaḥ vipakṣe bādhakaḥ tarkaḥ unneyaḥ
translated: Here, the reasoning that is the refutation in the case of the opposite [of the probandum] is to be understood as the consequence of the absurdity of being a cause without a cause, etc.

analyzed: kim madhye sādhya antara adhyāhāra kalpanayā
translated: What is the use of imagining the interpolation of another probandum in the middle?

original: nanvatra gururgurūṇāmityādīnāṃ śāstraprāmāṇyena yathāśruta eva sādhyasādhanabhāvo vyākhyāyatām /
analyzed: nanu atra guruḥ gurūṇām ityādīnām śāstra prāmāṇyena yathāśrutaḥ eva sādhya sādhana bhāvaḥ vyākhyāyatām
translated: Now, let the relation of probandum and probans be explained just as it is heard in the guru of the gurus etc., by the authoritativeness of the scripture.

analyzed: kim madhye sādhya antara adhyāhāra kalpanayā
translated: What is the use of imagining the interpolation of another probandum in the middle?

analyzed: yadi api yathāśrutānām eṣām vyadhikaraṇa tā
translated: Although these, as they are heard, have different subjects,

analyzed: tathā api tat uditam iti vacanāt vibhakti vipariṇāmena eka adhikaraṇa tā bhaviṣyati
translated: nevertheless, by the change of case endings due to the statement that which is taught by them, they will have the same subject.

analyzed: hetūṇām avyabhicarita tvam
translated: The non-deviation of the reasons

original: yadyapi caite pratyekaṃ bauddhāgamādau mānatāṃ vyabhicaranti /
analyzed: yadi api ca ete pratyekam bauddha āgama ādau māna tām vyabhicaranti
translated: Although these individually deviate from being authoritative in the Buddhist scriptures etc.,

analyzed: tathā api militānām hetutā astu
translated: nevertheless, let them be the reasons when combined.

analyzed: bhārata ādi aśeṣa sat śāstra prabhava praṇīta tva aṃśasya sapakṣa apraveśita tvena asādhāraṇyam syāt iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that the part of being composed by the one who is the source of all true scriptures such as the Bharata would be unestablished in the similar instance, therefore it would be inconclusive, it is not so.

analyzed: teṣu eva hetu vṛtti sambhavāt
translated: Because it is possible for the reason to occur in those [scriptures].

analyzed: tad prāmāṇyasya mahājana parigraha ādinā niścita tvāt
translated: Because the authoritativeness of those [scriptures] is ascertained by the acceptance of the great people and so on.

analyzed: evam tarhi bhārata ādi praṇayana viśiṣṭena
translated: If so, then by one who is distinguished by composing the Bharata and so on,

original: teṣāmapraṇītatvādbādarāyaṇena brahmādīnprati tanmokṣārtamupadiṣṭatvamātraṃ hetuḥ syāditi cedbāḍham /
analyzed: teṣām apraṇīta tvāt bādarāyaṇena brahma ādīn prati tat mokṣa ārtam upadiṣṭa tva mātram hetuḥ syāt iti ced bāḍham
translated: If that is so, then the mere fact that they were taught by Vyāsa to Brahmā and others for the sake of their liberation would be the reason, since they were not composed by him, like the Bhārata and others.

original: tāvanmātrasyaiva vyabhicārābhāvāt /🔽tathā sati gururgurūṇāṃ prabhavaḥ śāstrāṇāmiti vyarthamāpadyata iti cenna /
analyzed: tāvat mātrasya eva vyabhicāra abhāvāt  tathā sati guruḥ gurūṇām prabhavaḥ śāstrāṇām iti vyartham āpadyate iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that this is so, because there is no fallacy in this much alone,

analyzed: tasya dṛṣṭānta upadarśana ādinā sārthakya upapatteḥ iti
translated: then it is not so, because even without entering the body of the reason, its purpose is established by showing examples and so on.
The defense of the assumption of another probandum

analyzed: satyam
translated: It is true.

analyzed: tathā api na etat evam vijñātum śakyam
translated: Nevertheless, it cannot be known in this way.

analyzed: tathā sati uttara vākye vaktra ādi ānukūlyasya sādhya sambandha vyutpādanam syāt
translated: If that were so, then the explanation of the connection of the probandum in the subsequent statement with the favorability of the speaker and so on would be irrelevant.

analyzed: tat anumāna antaram bhaviṣyati iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that it will be another inference, that is not so.

analyzed: tathātve prāmāṇyam trividham
translated: If that were so, then there are three kinds of validity.

analyzed: upa ādi udbhāvam asaṃgatam  vaktṛ śrotṛ prasaktīnām yadā āptiḥ anukūla tā
translated: The conclusion is irrelevant.🔽The favorability of the speaker, hearer, and their inclinations,🔽by the statement of a trustworthy person, and likewise by the basis of scripture,

analyzed: āpta vākya tayā tena śruti mūla tayā tathā
translated: By being the words of a trustworthy person, and by having the Veda as its basis,🔽.🔽

analyzed: yukti mūla tayā ca eva prāmāṇyam trividham mahat
translated: And by reason of being based on reasoning, the threefold great authoritativeness

analyzed: dṛśyate brahmasūtrāṇām ekadhā anyatra sarvaśas
translated: is seen in the Brahmasutras, all in one place.

analyzed: nanu tarhi anena idam uditam bhavati
translated: But then this is said by this:

analyzed: etat śāstram pramāṇam anukūla vaktra ādimattvāt bhārata ādi vat
translated: This scripture is authoritative because it has a favorable speaker and other qualities, like the Mahabharata and others.

analyzed: vaktra ādi ānukūlyam ca ukta hetu siddham iti
translated: And the favorableness of the speaker and others is established by the stated reason.

analyzed: etat anupapannam
translated: This is not proper.

analyzed: āpta vākya tāyāḥ tatra upādhi tvāt
translated: Because the state of being a statement by a trustworthy person is a superimposition there.

original: naca pratyakṣādau satyapi prāmāṇye nāstyāptavākyatvamiti sādhyāvyāpakatvānnāyamupādhiriti vācyam /
analyzed: naca pratyakṣa ādau sati api prāmāṇye na asti āpta vākyatvam iti sādhya avyāpaka tvāt na ayam upādhiḥ iti vācyam
translated: And it should not be said that even when perception and others have authoritativeness, there is no being a statement by a trustworthy person, so this is not a superimposition because it is not pervaded by the probandum.

analyzed: vākya tva avacchinna sādhya vyāpaka tvena upādhi tva upapatteḥ
translated: Because it is a superimposition by pervading the probandum qualified by being a statement.

analyzed: tathā api apauruṣeye vede tad abhāvāt anupādhi tvam iti ced na
translated: Even so, if it is argued that it is not a superimposition because it is absent in the Veda which is not a product of a person, it is not so.

analyzed: veda apauruṣeya tvasya asambhavāt
translated: Because the non-productiveness of the Veda is impossible.

original: saṃmatatve vā sādhanāvacchinne pauruṣeyavākyatvāvacchinne vā sādhye 'syopādhitvopapatteriti /
analyzed: saṃmata tve vā sādhana avacchinne pauruṣeya vākya tva avacchinne vā sādhye sya upādhi tva upapatteḥ iti
translated: Or, if it is accepted, it is a superimposition because it is possible as a superimposition on the probandum qualified by the means of knowledge or on the probandum qualified by being a statement produced by a person.

analyzed: mā evam
translated: This is not so.

analyzed: abhiprāya an avagamāt
translated: Because the intention is not understood.

analyzed: nahi vayam vaktra ādi ānukūlyena śāstra prāmāṇyam sākṣāt sādhayitum udyatāḥ
translated: For we are not attempting to directly establish the authoritativeness of the scripture by its agreeableness to the speaker and others.

analyzed: yena atra upādhi udbhāvanam saṅgaccheta
translated: By which the raising of the limiting adjunct would be appropriate.

original: api tarhyanukūlavaktrādimattvasyāptavākyatayā vyāptatvāttena tāṃ prasādhya tayā prāmāṇyaṃ śāstrasya sādhyata ityāśayavānāha vaktṛśrotṛprasaktīnāmiti🔽yadyatra vākye vaktṛśrotṛprasaktīnāmanukūlatā tatrāptiḥ /
analyzed: api tarhi anukūla vaktra ādimattvasya āpta vākyatayā vyāpta tvāt tena tām prasādhya tayā prāmāṇyam śāstrasya sādhyate iti āśayavān āha vaktṛ śrotṛ prasaktīnām iti  yat yatra vākye vaktṛ śrotṛ prasaktīnām anukūla tā tatra āptiḥ
translated: But rather, because the possession of an agreeable speaker and others is pervaded by being the statement of a trustworthy person, by establishing that, authoritativeness of the scripture is established. Having this intention, he says the inclinations of the speaker, hearer, and the connected...🔽If in a statement there is agreeableness of the inclinations of the speaker, hearer, and the connected, there is trustworthiness.

analyzed: yat vaktra ādi ānukūlyayā upetam tat āpta vākyam iti yāvat
translated: That which is endowed with agreeableness to the speaker and others is the statement of a trustworthy person - this is the meaning.

analyzed: yatas evam vyāptiḥ yatas ca asya śāstrasya asti anukūla vaktra ādimattvam
translated: Because this is the pervasion, and because this scripture has agreeableness to the speaker and others,

original: tena siddhayā'ptavākyatayā mānamidaṃ śāstramiti pūrveṇa sambandhaḥ / /
analyzed: tena siddhayā āpta vākya tayā mānam idam śāstram iti pūrveṇa sambandhaḥ
translated: by the established trustworthiness, this scripture is authoritative - this is the connection with the previous.

analyzed: kaḥ yam āptaḥ
translated: What is this trustworthy person?

analyzed: etat uktam bhavati
translated: This is what is being said:

analyzed: vimatam āpta vākyam anukūlena vaktra anukūlān śrotṛn prati tadīya hita sādhana bodhāya upadiṣṭa tvāt sampratipanna vat
translated: The disputed statement of a trustworthy person is like what is commonly accepted, because it is taught by one who is agreeable to the hearer for the purpose of understanding the means of accomplishing their welfare.

analyzed: vimatam pramāṇam āpta vākya tvāt sampratipanna tvāt iti
translated: The disputed is a means of valid knowledge because it is the statement of a trustworthy person, like what is commonly accepted.

analyzed: vaktuḥ ānukūlya abhāvāt jaina ādi anāpta vākyam  śrotra ānukūlya virahāt bauddha ādi
translated: The words of a Jain or other untrustworthy person are not authoritative because they are not favorable to the speaker.🔽The words of a Buddhist or other person are not authoritative because they are not favorable to the listener.
The words of a poet or other person are not authoritative because they are not favorable to the context.

analyzed: nanu kaḥ yam āptaḥ nāma yat vākya tvam sādhyate
translated: Now, who is this trustworthy person whose words are to be established?

analyzed: yathā dṛṣṭa artha vādī iti ced na  bhrānti dṛṣṭārtha vādini api prasaṅgāt
translated: If it is said he is one who speaks of things as seen, that is not so.🔽Because it would follow that even one who speaks of things seen with deluded vision would be trustworthy.

original: pramāṇadṛṣṭeti viśeṣaṇe 'pi pramāṇadṛṣṭasya pramādādinānyathākathake api prasaṅgāt /
analyzed: pramāṇa dṛṣṭa iti viśeṣaṇe pi pramāṇa dṛṣṭasya pramāda ādinā anyathā kathake api prasaṅgāt
translated: Even if the qualification seen by valid means of knowledge is added, it would follow that one seen by valid means of knowledge but described otherwise due to negligence, etc. would also be trustworthy.

original: pramāṇena yathā dṛṣṭaṃ tathā vādīti cenna /
analyzed: pramāṇena yathā dṛṣṭam tathā vādi iti ced na
translated: If it is said he is one who speaks of things as seen by valid means of knowledge, that is not so.

analyzed: eka deśe tathābhūta vādi tve pi aṃśa antare atathābhūta tva ādini api prasaṅgāt
translated: Because it would follow that even one who speaks truly about one part but not another would be trustworthy.

analyzed: yāvat pramāṇa dṛṣṭam tāvataḥ vaktā iti ced na
translated: If it is said he is one who speaks of only as much as is seen by valid means of knowledge, that is not so.

analyzed: prāyeṇa a tathābhūta tvāt eva lakṣyāṇām tad avyāpteḥ
translated: Because most of those to be defined are not covered by that, since they are not like that.

analyzed: nahi kena api yāvat pramāṇa pramitam tāvat abhidhīyate
translated: For no one speaks of everything known by valid means of knowledge.

analyzed: yāvat pramāṇa dṛṣṭam tāvataḥ eva vaktā iti ced na
translated: If it is said he is one who speaks only of as much as is seen by valid means of knowledge, that is not so.

analyzed: ajñāta sandigdha anuvāda vākya prayoktuḥ anāpta tva prasaṅgāt
translated: Because it would follow that one who uses statements that repeat what is unknown or doubtful would be untrustworthy.

analyzed: bhīma agrajasya api kadācid cāṭu vādi tva sambhavena anāpta tva āpatteḥ ca
translated: And because even the elder brother of Bhima would become untrustworthy if he were sometimes to speak flattery.

analyzed: nirdoṣaḥ āptaḥ iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that he is faultless and trustworthy, it is not so.

original: āptānāmapi kvacidrāgādidoṣasambhavāt /🔽yatra viṣaye nirdoṣastatrāpta iti cenna /
analyzed: āptānām api kvacid rāga ādi doṣa sambhavāt  yatra viṣaye nirdoṣaḥ tatra āptaḥ iti ced na
translated: Because even trustworthy persons may sometimes have faults like attachment, etc.🔽If it is argued that he is trustworthy in matters where he is faultless, it is not so.

analyzed: yad tad śabdayoḥ viśeṣa viṣaya tvena asādhāraṇyāt avyāpteḥ iti
translated: Because the words that and this are specific and not universal, there is an over-extension.

analyzed: āpti svarūpa nirūpaṇam
translated: The definition of a trustworthy person

analyzed: mā evam
translated: This is not so.

analyzed: vivakṣita athar tattva jñānam avipralipsā vivakṣā karaṇa pāṭavam ca iti iyam āptiḥ
translated: Trustworthiness consists of the knowledge of the truth of what is intended, the absence of deception, and the ability to communicate.

analyzed: tadvān āptaḥ iti aṅgīkārāt
translated: Because it is accepted that one who lacks these is untrustworthy.

analyzed: āpta tva abhimate kadācid idam na asti iti ced mā bhūt
translated: If it is argued that even one who is considered trustworthy may sometimes lack these, let it be so.

analyzed: tadā asau anāptaḥ iti aṅgīkārāt
translated: Because it is accepted that at that time he is untrustworthy.

analyzed: kāla ādi bhedena avirodhāt
translated: Because there is no contradiction due to differences in time, etc.

original: evaṃ sati yo yatraivambhūtaḥ sa tatrāpta ityuktaṃ syāditi cedastu ko doṣaḥ /
analyzed: evam sati yaḥ yatra evambhūtaḥ sa tatra āptaḥ iti uktam syāt iti ced astu kaḥ doṣaḥ
translated: If this is so, it would be said that one who is of such a nature in a certain matter is trustworthy in that matter. Let it be so. What is the fault?

analyzed: yat tad śabda arthayoḥ ananugamaḥ iti ced
translated: If it is argued that the meanings of the words that and this are not universal,

analyzed: kaḥ yam ananugamaḥ nāma kim sārvatrika vyavahāra anaupāyika tvam uta ekasya aneka vṛtti tva abhāvaḥ
translated: what is this non-universality? Is it the lack of being a means of universal usage, or the absence of one thing occurring in many?

analyzed: na ādyaḥ
translated: The first is not so.

original: yo yasya sutaḥ sa tadīyaṃ dhanaṃ arhatītyādau sārvatrikavyavahārahetutopalambhāt /
analyzed: yaḥ yasya sutaḥ sa tadīyam dhanam arhati ityādau sārvatrika vyavahāra hetu tā upalambhāt
translated: For example, in the case of the son of so-and-so deserves the wealth of so-and-so, because it is observed to be the cause of universal usage.

analyzed: na dvitīyaḥ
translated: Not the second.

analyzed: a doṣa tvāt
translated: Because there is no fault.

original: yathā cānanugatasyāpi nāvyāptiḥ sārvatrikavyavahārahetutā ca tathā sāmānyaparīkṣāyāṃ vakṣyāmaḥ / /
analyzed: yathā ca ananugatasya api nā avyāptiḥ sārvatrika vyavahāra hetu tā ca tathā sāmānya parīkṣāyām vakṣyāmaḥ
translated: And how there is no over-extension even of what is not universal, and how it is the cause of universal usage, we will explain in the examination of universals.

analyzed: āpteḥ lakṣaṇa antaram
translated: Definition of a reliable person

original: etena nirdoṣaḥ pramitasyaiva vakteti lakṣaṇadvayamapi samāhitaṃ veditavyam /
analyzed: etena nirdoṣaḥ pramitasya eva vaktā iti lakṣaṇa dvayam api samāhitam veditavyam
translated: By this, it should be understood that the two definitions - one who is faultless and one who speaks only what is known - are combined.

analyzed: anuvādasya vāda viṣaya tvena tad prayoktuḥ api āpta tva avirodhāt
translated: Because there is no contradiction in the speaker also being a reliable person, since the restatement is the subject of the debate.

analyzed: evaṃca vaktuḥ ānukūlyam āpti ekadeśe eva
translated: Thus, the speaker's favorability is a part of reliability itself.

original: vipralipsā ca śrotṛprasaṅgānukūlataikanibandhanā tadabhāve nivartata iti vaktrādyānukūlyavattāyā āptavākyatayā susthaḥ pratibandhaḥ /
analyzed: vipralipsā ca śrotṛ prasaṅga anukūla tā eka nibandhanā tad abhāve nivartate iti vaktra ādi ānukūlyavat tāyāḥ āpta vākya tayā susthaḥ pratibandhaḥ
translated: And misrepresentation is based solely on the favorability towards the listener's engagement, and in its absence, it ceases. Thus, the restriction is well-established by the reliability of the speaker's words as having the quality of favorability.

analyzed: nanu āpta vākya tā sva kapola kalpiteṣu mālatī mādhava ādiṣu prāmāṇyam vyabhicarati
translated: But the reliability of a statement is contradicted in the case of the authenticity of the works of Kalidasa and others, which are self-invented.

original: nahi nāṭakādiprabandhaṃ viracayannapi kadāciduktalakṣaṇopapanno na bhavati bhavabhūtiriti cenna /
analyzed: nahi nāṭaka ādi prabandham viracayan api kadācid ukta lakṣaṇa upapannaḥ na bhavati bhavabhūtiḥ iti ced na
translated: If it be said that Bhavabhūti, though composing dramas and other compositions, is not always endowed with the characteristics mentioned, it is not so.

analyzed: yaḥ yatra evambhūtaḥ iti anena eva ukta uttara tvāt
translated: Because the answer has been given by the very words 'whoever is such and such'.

analyzed: āpti mūla vākyasya āpta vākya tayā vivakṣita tvāt ca
translated: And because the sentence based on testimony is intended to be the sentence of a trustworthy person.

analyzed: a bodhakam viparīta bodhakam vā vākyam apramāṇam iti ucyate
translated: A sentence that does not convey knowledge or conveys contrary knowledge is said to be not a means of valid knowledge.

analyzed: tatra ābodhakam vaktuḥ apaṭu kāraṇatayā bhavati
translated: Among them, a non-conveying sentence arises due to the indistinct cause of the speaker.

analyzed: viparīta bodhakam ca viparīta jñāna ādinā iti āpti pūrvaka vākya tvasya prāmāṇyena pratibandha siddhiḥ
translated: And a contrary-conveying sentence arises due to contrary knowledge, etc. Thus the establishment of the restriction of validity by the sentence preceded by testimony is successful.

analyzed: anyathā kāraṇena vinā kārya utpatti prasaṅgāt iti
translated: Otherwise, there would be the undesirable consequence of the production of an effect without a cause.

analyzed: madhye kim āpta vākya tā sādhanam
translated: What is the proof of the sentence of a trustworthy person in the middle?

analyzed: nanu ca anukūla vaktra ādimattayā prāmāṇya sādhanam eva atra vyākhyāyatām
translated: But let the proof of validity be explained here by the presence of a favorable speaker, etc.

analyzed: kim āpta vākya tā sādhanam madhye vyākhyāyate
translated: Why is the proof of the sentence of a trustworthy person explained in the middle?

analyzed: vyāpti pakṣa dharmatayoḥ atulya tvāt
translated: Because of the dissimilarity of pervasion and the property of the subject.

analyzed: nahi yat yat vayāpakasya vyāpakam tat tasya avyāpakam iti sambhavati
translated: For it is not possible that whatever is pervaded by a pervader is not pervaded by it.

original: anukūlavaktrādimattayā āptavākyatāsādhane vaktrānukūlyasyāptyekadeśatvena sādhyāviśiṣṭatā ca syāt /
analyzed: anukūla vaktra ādimattayā āpta vākyatā sādhane vaktra ānukūlyasya āpti eka deśa tvena sādhya aviśiṣṭa tā ca syāt
translated: And if the presence of a favourable face etc. were established as the reason for the statement of a trustworthy person, then the favourableness of the face would be the same as what is to be proved, because it is a part of trustworthiness.

original: vaktṛśrotṛprasaktīnāmiti vākyaṃ tu śaṅkitasya upādheḥ sādhanavyāpakatāpradarśanārthaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: vaktṛ śrotṛ prasaktīnām iti vākyam tu śaṅkitasya upādheḥ sādhana vyāpaka tā pradarśana artham bhaviṣyati
translated: But the statement of the speaker, hearer and the subject-matter will be for the purpose of showing the pervasion of the reason by the suspected reason.

analyzed: mā evam  āpta vākya tayā tena iti uttara vākya vaiyarthya prasaṅgāt
translated: This is not so.🔽Because it would lead to the futility of the subsequent statement by that as the statement of a trustworthy person.

analyzed: upādheḥ sādhana vyāpaka tāyāḥ vaktṛ śrotṛ prasaktīnām iti anena eva upapādita tvāt
translated: Because the pervasion of the reason by the reason has been established by this very statement of the speaker, hearer and the subject-matter.

original: nahi upādhiṃ dūṣayatā sādhanavyāpakatāṃ vyutpādya sādhanenopādheḥ pakṣe sādhanaṃ vidhāya tena sādhyaṃ sādhanīyamiti kuladharmaḥ / /
analyzed: nahi upādhim dūṣayatā sādhana vyāpaka tām vyutpādya sādhanena upādheḥ pakṣe sādhanam vidhāya tena sādhyam sādhanīyam iti kula dharmaḥ
translated: For it is not the general rule that one who refutes the reason should explain the pervasion of the reason by the reason, establish the reason of the reason in the subject, and then prove the probandum by that.

original: upādheḥ sādhanābhedaṃ pradarśya tena sādhyaṃ sādhyata iti cenna /
analyzed: upādheḥ sādhana abhedam pradarśya tena sādhyam sādhyate iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that the probandum is proved by that, having shown the non-difference of the reason from the reason, it is not so.

analyzed: āpteḥ vaktṛ mātra dharmasya sādhana abheda anupapatteḥ
translated: Because the non-difference of the reason from the reason is not possible for the speaker, whose property is merely that of a speaker.

analyzed: sādhya aviśiṣṭa tā tu na asti eva
translated: But the non-difference from what is to be proved does not exist at all.

analyzed: vaktra ādīnām ānukūlyena vaktuḥ āpti sādhane khalu aṃśataḥ sā syāt
translated: For that would be partially so in establishing the trustworthiness of the speaker by the favourableness of the face etc.

analyzed: anukūla vaktra ādimat tayā āpta vākya tā sādhyate iti ca uktam
translated: And it has been said that the truthfulness of the statement is established by the presence of a favourable face, etc.

analyzed: tathā api sādhya sādhanayoḥ āpti eka deśa anupraveśaḥ sti iti ced
translated: Even so, if it be said that there is an inclusion of a part of the trustworthy person in the probandum and the means of proof,

analyzed: satyam
translated: it is true.

analyzed: tathā api viśiṣṭa bhedena adoṣa tvāt
translated: Nevertheless, there is no fault, because of the difference of the qualified.

original: anyathā yo dhūmavānasāvagnimāniti vyāpyavyāpakabhāvo 'pi na syāt /
analyzed: anyathā yaḥ dhūmavān asau agnimān iti vyāpya vyāpaka bhāvaḥ na syāt
translated: Otherwise, even the relation of the pervaded and the pervader, that he who has smoke has fire, would not be possible.

analyzed: viśeṣya aṃśasya ubhayatra anupraveśāt
translated: Because the part of the qualified is included in both.

analyzed: kṛtaka tva anitya tvayoḥ sattā anupraveśe pi paraiḥ vyāpya vyāpaka bhāvasya aṅgīkṛta tvāt ca
translated: And because the relation of the pervaded and the pervader is accepted by others even when the two, being produced and being non-eternal, are included in existence.

original: yadā tu nirdoṣaḥ pramitasyaiva vaktā āpta ityāśritaṃ tadā sādhyaviśiṣṭatāyāḥ śaṅkaiva nāsti / /
analyzed: yadā tu nirdoṣaḥ pramitasya eva vaktā āptaḥ iti āśritam tadā sādhya viśiṣṭa tāyāḥ śaṅkā eva nā asti
translated: But when it is relied upon that the trustworthy person is the speaker of what is known to be faultless, then there is no doubt at all about the probandum being qualified.

analyzed: bhāṣyakṛtaḥ paramparā āśrayaṇe nimittam
translated: The reason for the author of the commentary relying on the series

analyzed: granthakṛtā api kasmāt iyam paramparā āśritā iti ced na
translated: If it be asked why the author of the text also relied on this series, it is not so.

analyzed: vaktra ādi ānukūlyena prāmāṇyam sādhayatā api antatas sya arthasya āśrayaṇīya tvāt
translated: Because even by one who establishes the validity by the favourableness of the speaker, etc., this meaning must ultimately be relied upon.

original: anyathāstu vaktrādyānukūlyaṃ vakturvipralipsāmūlatvenāprāmāṇyaṃ ca bhavatvityāśaṅkāyāḥ ko nivārayitā /
analyzed: anyathā astu vaktra ādi ānukūlyam vaktuḥ vipralipsā mūla tvena aprāmāṇyam ca bhavatu iti āśaṅkāyāḥ kaḥ nivārayitā
translated: Otherwise, let the favourableness of the speaker, etc. be, and let the invalidity be due to the speaker's deception - who can prevent this doubt?

original: yadyapi prāmāṇyaṃ svata eveti bādarāyaṇīyaṃ matam /
analyzed: yadi api prāmāṇyam svatas eva iti bādarāyaṇīyam matam
