translated: And because the difference of the non-existent universe, such as prior non-existence, from the existent, which is not a substratum of existence, is itself existent.

analyzed: pramitam eva
translated: It is indeed well-known.

original: yataścāsato 'bhāvasyaiva viśvasya prāgabhāvādeḥ sato vailakṣaṇyaṃ bhāvatvānadhikaraṇatvaṃ svayaṃ sadeva /
analyzed: yatas ca asataḥ bhāvasya eva viśvasya prāgabhāva ādeḥ sataḥ vailakṣaṇyam bhāva tva anadhikaraṇa tvam svayam sat eva
translated: And because the difference of the non-existent universe, such as prior non-existence, from the existent, which is not a substratum of existence, is itself existent.

original: ato bhedavādinastena viparītena pratijñātenāniṣyaṃ kathaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: atas bheda vādinaḥ tena viparītena pratijñātena aniṣyam katham bhavet
translated: Therefore, how can there be an undesirable consequence for the proponent of difference due to the opposite of what is asserted by the other?

analyzed: pratijñāta artha siddhau khalu aniṣyam bhavet
translated: For an undesirable consequence would occur if the meaning of the thesis were established.

analyzed: nahi pramāṇa bādhitaḥ sau siddhayati
translated: But that is not established when contradicted by a means of valid knowledge.

original: vyāvahārikabhāvatvābhāvatvagocaraṃ pramāṇaṃ tattvaviṣayeṇānumānenaiva bādhyata iti cenna /
analyzed: vyāvahārika bhāva tva abhāva tva gocaram pramāṇam tattva viṣayeṇa anumānena eva bādhyate iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that the means of valid knowledge that has the nature of existence and non-existence as its object is contradicted by inference that has reality as its object, that is not so.

analyzed: yatas smākam tāvat bhāva abhāva tva viṣayam pramāṇam tattva gocaram eva
translated: Because for us, the means of valid knowledge that has existence and non-existence as its object has reality as its domain.

analyzed: anyathā cakraka ādi prasaṅgāt atiprasaṅgāt ca iti
translated: Otherwise, there would be the fallacy of an infinite regress and the fallacy of over-extension.

original: dvitīye 'pyetadevottaram /🔽viśvasya sataḥ satyādvailakṣaṇyamapi mama svayaṃ svamatameva /
analyzed: dvitīye pi etat eva uttaram  viśvasya sataḥ satyāt vailakṣaṇyam api mama svayam sva matam eva
translated: In the second case also, this is the same reply.🔽The difference of the existent universe from the true is also my own opinion.

analyzed: tathā asataḥ vidyamānāt api vailakṣaṇyam svayam eva
translated: Similarly, the difference from the non-existent, the unreal, is also my own.

analyzed: atas tena sādhitena mama aniṣyam katham bhavet
translated: Therefore, how can there be an undesirable consequence for me due to what is established by that?

analyzed: bhavatu viśvasya ātmanaḥ śaśaviṣāṇa ādeḥ vailakṣaṇyam sva matam
translated: Let the difference of the universe, the self, from the horn of a hare, etc. be one's own opinion.

analyzed: sataḥ vailakṣaṇyam tu katham
translated: But how is there the difference of the existent?

analyzed: sattva aṅgīkārāt iti ced mā evam
translated: If it is argued that it is because existence is accepted, that is not so.

original: sato vidyamānasyāpyasato bhedaṃ vadato mama yathā viśvasyāsato vailakṣaṇyaṃ svayameva /
analyzed: sataḥ vidyamānasya api asataḥ bhedam vadataḥ mama yathā viśvasya asataḥ vailakṣaṇyam svayam eva
translated: For me who speak of the difference between the existent and the non-existent, just as the universe, though non-existent, is different from me,

original: tathā sato 'pi viśvasya sato vailakṣaṇyaṃ satāṃ bhedavādinaḥ svayameva /
analyzed: tathā viśvasya sataḥ vailakṣaṇyam satām bheda vādinaḥ svayam eva
translated: in the same way, for me who speak of the difference between the existent and the non-existent, the existent universe is also different from the existent.

analyzed: sat antara vailakṣaṇyāt  sattva asattva anadhikaraṇa tvam sat asat vilakṣaṇa tvam iti ced
translated: Because of the difference within existence.🔽If it is argued that being the locus of existence and non-existence is different from being different from the existent and the non-existent,

original: tadāpi sato viśvasyāsato vailakṣaṇyaṃ sadasadbhedavādinaḥ svayaṃ sadeva /
analyzed: tadā api sataḥ viśvasya asataḥ vailakṣaṇyam sat asat bheda vādinaḥ svayam sat eva
translated: then also for me who speak of the difference between the existent and the non-existent, the difference of the existent universe from the non-existent is only existent.

analyzed: atas tena sādhitena mama aniṣyam katham bhavet
translated: So how can my undesired consequence arise from that which is established by you?

analyzed: parasya eva aṃśataḥ siddhārtha tā bhavet
translated: Only a part of the opponent's position would be established.

analyzed: tarhi sattva anādhāra tvam eva sādhyate iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that only being the locus of existence is being established, that is not so.

original: asata eva hi sato vailakṣaṇyaṃ sattvānadhikaraṇatvaṃ bhedavādino mama svayaṃ sadeva niyamena bhavati /
analyzed: asataḥ eva hi sataḥ vailakṣaṇyam sattva anadhikaraṇa tvam bheda vādinaḥ mama svayam sat eva niyamena bhavati
translated: For me who speak of the difference, the difference of the existent from the non-existent, which is not being the locus of existence, is only existent by necessity.

original: tathāca viśvasya tena sattvānadhikaraṇatvena sādhitenāsattvāpattyā parasyaivāniṣyaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: tathā ca viśvasya tena sattva anadhikaraṇa tvena sādhitena asattva āpattyā parasya eva aniṣyam bhavet
translated: And in that way, when the universe is established by that as not being the locus of existence, the undesired consequence would only be for the opponent, due to the consequence of non-existence.

original: aniṣyaprasaṅgena paraṃ nigṛhītavato mamāniṣyaṃ kathaṃ bhavet // // /
analyzed: aniṣya prasaṅgena param nigṛhītavataḥ mama aniṣyam katham bhavet
translated: How can there be an undesirable consequence for me who have refuted the opponent by undesirable consequences?

original: athāsattvānadhikaraṇatve vādiprativādisiddhe sattvānadhikaraṇatvamapyadhikaṃ sādhyata iti cenna /
analyzed: atha asattva anadhikaraṇa tve vādi prativādi siddhe sattva anadhikaraṇa tvam api adhikam sādhyate iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that when the non-existence of a subject is established for both the proponent and the opponent, the additional property of not having existence as a subject is also being proved, that is not so.

analyzed: aniṣya anistārāt
translated: Because the undesirable cannot be avoided.

original: kiñca / na sattvaṃ nāmaikamanugataṃ kintu prativastu sattvāni bhidyante /
analyzed: kiñca na sattvam nāma ekam anugatam kintu prativastu sattvāni bhidyante
translated: Moreover, existence is not a single universal, but existences are different for each object.

original: tatra viyadāderasadvailakṣaṇye sati sattvānadhikaraṇatvaṃ sādhyamānaṃ kimekasattvānadhikaraṇatvamutānekasattvānadhikaraṇatvamatha sarvasattvānadhikaraṇatvam
analyzed: tatra viyat ādeḥ asat vailakṣaṇye sati sattva anadhikaraṇa tvam sādhyamānam kim eka sattva anadhikaraṇa tvam uta aneka sattva anadhikaraṇa tvam atha sarva sattva anadhikaraṇa tvam
translated: There, when space etc. have the property of being different from non-existence, the property of not having existence as a subject being proved, is it the property of not having one existence as a subject, or the property of not having many existences as a subject, or the property of not having all existences as a subject?

analyzed: kim vā aviśeṣita sattva anadhikaraṇa tvam
translated: Or is it the property of not having existence as a subject without any specification?

analyzed: athavā sarvathā sattva anadhikaraṇa tvam vivakṣitam
translated: Or is it intended that it should not have existence as a subject in any way?

analyzed: na ādyaḥ
translated: The first is not so.

original: viśvasyāsato 'pi vailakṣaṇyaṃ tāvanmama svayameva sato 'pi vailakṣaṇyaṃ sattvānadhikaraṇatvamapi svayameva /
analyzed: viśvasya asataḥ vailakṣaṇyam tāvat mama svayam eva vailakṣaṇyam sattva anadhikaraṇa tvam api svayam eva
translated: Even for me, the non-existence of the universe has the property of being different, and even for me, the existence has the property of being different, and also the property of not having existence as a subject is for me itself.

analyzed: katham
translated: How?

analyzed: sattva bheda vādinaḥ mama sataḥ pi sattva antara anadhikaraṇa tva aṅgīkārāt
translated: Because for me, who asserts the difference in existences, I accept that even the existent does not have another existence as a subject.

original: tathāca siddhena tena sādhyamānena mamāniṣyaṃ kathaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: tathā ca siddhena tena sādhyamānena mama aniṣyam katham bhavet
translated: And how can there be any undesirable consequence for me if that which is established is being proved by that which is to be established?

analyzed: evam eva caturtha nirākaraṇam api vyākhyeyam
translated: And in the same way, the refutation of the fourth [alternative] should also be explained.

analyzed: na dvitīya tṛtīyau
translated: [The third alternative] is not the second or third.

analyzed: viśvasya asataḥ vailakṣaṇyam asattva anadhikaraṇa tvam tāvat mama svayam eva
translated: The difference of the non-existent universe from non-existence, that is, not being the substratum of non-existence, is indeed mine by myself.

analyzed: sataḥ vailakṣaṇyam aneka sattva anadhikaraṇa tvam
translated: The difference of the existent from existence, that is, not being the substratum of many existences,

analyzed: sarva sattva anadhikaraṇa tvam tāvat mama svayam eva
translated: is indeed all existences not being the substratum, which is indeed mine by myself.

analyzed: sataḥ vailakṣaṇyam aneka sattva anadhikaraṇa tvam
translated: The difference of the existent from existence is not being the substratum of many existences.

analyzed: sarva sattva anadhikaraṇa tvam api svayam sat eva
translated: And not being the substratum of all existences is existence itself by itself.

analyzed: katham
translated: How is it so?

analyzed: bheda vādinā ekaikasya arthasya aneka sarva sattva asvīkārāt
translated: Because for the proponent of difference, each object is not accepted as all existences.

analyzed: svīkāre ca bheda bhaṅgaḥ syāt
translated: And if it were accepted, there would be a breakdown of difference.

analyzed: tatas ca tena aniṣyam katham bhavet
translated: Then how can there be any undesirable consequence for him?

analyzed: na pañcamaḥ
translated: [The fifth alternative] is not the fifth.

original: yataḥ sata evāsato vailakṣaṇyaṃ svayaṃ tadeva /
analyzed: yatas sataḥ eva asataḥ vailakṣaṇyam svayam tat eva
translated: Because the difference of the existent from the non-existent is indeed that itself by itself.

analyzed: niyatam eva asti
translated: It certainly exists.

original: yataścāsata eva sato vailakṣaṇyamapi niyatamevātastena sādhyamānena viśvasya sadasattvāpattyā bhedavādinaḥ kathamaniṣyaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: yatas ca asataḥ eva sataḥ vailakṣaṇyam api niyatam eva atas tena sādhyamānena viśvasya sat asat tva āpattyā bheda vādinaḥ katham aniṣyam bhavet
translated: And since the difference of the non-existent from the existent is also certainly established, how can the proponent of difference have anything undesirable when the existence and non-existence of the universe is being established by that?

analyzed: mayā hi ekasya eva sat asat tvam aṅgīkṛtam
translated: For I accept the existence and non-existence of only one thing.

analyzed: sva upādhau pratiṣedha apratiyogi tvāt para upādhau ca tad pratiyogi tvāt
translated: Because it is not the counter-correlate of negation in its own substrate, and because it is the counter-correlate of that in another's substrate.

original: dvayorapi sarvathā pratiṣedhātkathaṃ sadasattvaprasaṅga iti cettarhyasata eva sato vailakṣaṇyaṃ svayaṃ sanniyatameva /
analyzed: dvayoḥ api sarvathā pratiṣedhāt katham sat asat tva prasaṅgaḥ iti ced tarhi asataḥ eva sataḥ vailakṣaṇyam svayam sat niyatam eva
translated: If it is argued that the consequence of existence and non-existence does not follow because of the complete negation of both, then the difference of the non-existent from the existent is certainly established by itself.

original: ataḥ sadvailakṣaṇyamuktavā punarasato 'pi vailakṣaṇyena vyāhatena pratijñātena bhedavādinaḥ kathamaniṣyaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: atas sat vailakṣaṇyam uktavā vailakṣaṇyena vyāhatena pratijñātena bheda vādinaḥ katham aniṣyam bhavet
translated: Therefore, having stated the difference from the existent, how can the proponent of difference have anything undesirable when the thesis is contradicted again by the difference from the non-existent?

original: evaṃ sata evāsato 'pi vailakṣaṇyaṃ niyatamityasadvailakṣaṇyamuktavā punarviśvasya sadvailakṣaṇyapratijñā vyāhatā draṣṭavyā /
analyzed: evam sataḥ eva asataḥ pi vailakṣaṇyam niyatam iti asat vailakṣaṇyam uktavā punar viśvasya sat vailakṣaṇya pratijñā vyāhatā draṣṭavyā
translated: In the same way, the difference of the existent from the non-existent is also certainly established. Having stated the difference from the non-existent, the thesis that the universe is different from the existent should be seen as contradicted.

analyzed: na hi anirvācya siddheḥ prāk ayam vipratiṣedhaḥ nivārayitum śakyaḥ
translated: For this contradiction cannot be prevented before the inexpressible is established.

original: asmādeva hetostatsiddhiriti cettarhi mātā vandhyeti pratijñā kuto vipratiṣiddhā /
analyzed: asmāt eva hetoḥ tad siddhiḥ iti ced tarhi mātā vandhyā iti pratijñā kutas vipratiṣiddhā
translated: If it be said that the establishment of that (difference) is from this very reason (of the existence of the world), then why is the proposition 'the mother is barren' not contradicted?

analyzed: vakṣyamāṇa hetunā eva pratijñāta artha siddheḥ tatra api suvaca tvāt
translated: Because the meaning of the proposition is established by the reason to be stated, and because it can be easily stated even there.

original: sambhāvitaḥ pratijñāyā arthaḥ sādhyeta hetunā' /🔽iti nyāyāttatra hetvākāṅkṣaiva nāstīti cetsatyam /
analyzed: sambhāvitaḥ pratijñāyāḥ arthaḥ sādhyeta hetunā  iti nyāyāt tatra hetvākāṅkṣā eva na asti iti ced satyam
translated: The meaning of the proposition, which is possible, would be established by the reason.🔽If it be said that there is no desire for a reason there because of this rule, it is true.

original: kiñca sata eva viśvasyāsato vailakṣaṇyaṃ svayaṃ sadeva /
analyzed: kiñca sataḥ eva viśvasya asataḥ vailakṣaṇyam svayam sat eva
translated: Moreover, the difference of the existent world from the non-existent is itself existent.

analyzed: sākṣi pramitam asti
translated: It is known by the witness.

original: atastena bādhitena sarvathā sattvānadhikaraṇatvena pratijñātena bhedavādinaḥ kathamaniṣyaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: atas tena bādhitena sarvathā sattva anadhikaraṇa tvena pratijñātena bheda vādinaḥ katham aniṣyam bhavet
translated: Therefore, how can the proponent of difference have anything undesirable by the proposition that is contradicted by that (witness), which is not at all the substratum of existence?

analyzed: amukhya sattva āvedakam pramāṇam tat iti ced
translated: If it be said that the means of knowledge which indicates the existence of the secondary (existence) is that (witness),

analyzed: mama tāvat mukhyam eva tat satvam iti uktam
translated: it has been said that for me that existence is primary.

analyzed: parakīya pramāṇa tarkāṇām adya api gahane niviṣṭa tvāt iti
translated: Because the means of knowledge and arguments of others are still deeply entrenched.

original: kecitte tavāniṣyaṃ kataṃ na bhavediti vyācakṣate /
analyzed: kecid te tava aniṣyam katam na bhavet iti vyācakṣate
translated: Some explain that it (the proposition) would not be undesirable for you.

original: tatra na pādādāviti pratiṣedhasya nañā nirdiṣyamanityamiti samādhānamavaseyam / /
analyzed: tatra na pāda ādau iti pratiṣedhasya nañā nirdiṣyam anityam iti samādhānam avaseyam
translated: There, the solution should be understood that the negation 'not in the foot, etc.' is to be indicated by the negative particle as 'not impermanent.'

analyzed: sarvasmāt iti sat bheda saṃsthitiḥ
translated: If it is said that it is from all, the establishment of the difference of existence,

original: sanmātratvaṃ brahmaṇo 'pi tasmāt tadapi no bhavet // / / //
analyzed: sat mātra tvam tasmāt tat api no bhavet
translated: If it is said that the existence of Brahman also would not be, because of the establishment of the difference of existence from all.

analyzed: dvitīye dūṣaṇa antaram āha yadī ucyate iti
translated: In the second, he states another fault: If it is said.

analyzed: api śabdaḥ dūṣaṇa samuccaye
translated: The word api (also) is for the inclusion of faults.

analyzed: sarvasmāt api iti abhividhau vā
translated: Or, in the expression, it is for all.

analyzed: yadi iti śravaṇāt tarhi iti grāhyam
translated: From the hearing of yad (if), tarhi (then) should be understood.

analyzed: sarva śabdaḥ na eka arthaḥ  yadi anekasmāt sataḥ vailakṣaṇyāt
translated: The word sarva (all) has many meanings.

original: anekasattvānadhikaraṇatvaṃ viśvasya sādhyamityucyate tarhi satāṃ bhedasaṃsthitistataścāpasiddhāntaḥ /
analyzed: aneka sattva anadhikaraṇa tvam viśvasya sādhyam iti ucyate tarhi satām bheda saṃsthitiḥ tatas ca apasiddhāntaḥ
translated: If it is said that the non-subsistence of the universe in many existences is to be proved because of the difference from many existences, then there is the establishment of the difference of existences, and hence there is the contradiction of one's own doctrine.

analyzed: idam uktam bhavati
translated: This is what is said:

analyzed: viśvam aneka sattā anadhikaraṇam iti pratijānatā aneka sattvāni aṅgīkriyante na vā
translated: By one who asserts that the universe does not subsist in many existences, are many existences accepted or not?

analyzed: dvitīye na eka viśeṣaṇam
translated: In the second case, the many qualifications are useless.

analyzed: ādye pi ekasmin eva arthe na ekāni sattvāni uta ādhāra bhedena
translated: In the first case also, are there many existences in one object only, or with the difference of the substratum?

analyzed: na ādyaḥ
translated: Not the first.

analyzed: vaiyarthyāt
translated: Because it is useless.

analyzed: dvitīye tu idam upatiṣṭhate
translated: In the second, this is stated:

analyzed: sat bheda saṃsthitiḥ iti
translated: The establishment of the difference of existences.

analyzed: aneka sattva adhikaraṇatā pratiṣedha sāmarthyāt ekaika sattva svīkāra āpatteḥ iti vā
translated: Or, because of the implication of the denial of the existence of many beings, the acceptance of each individual being would follow.

analyzed: tṛtīyasya vā idam dūṣaṇa antaram
translated: Or, for the third, this is another fault.

original: yadi sarvasmātsato vailakṣaṇyaṃ sarvasattvānadhikaraṇatvaṃ viśvasya sādhyatayocyate tarhi sadbhedasaṃsthitiḥ /
analyzed: yadi sarvasmāt sataḥ vailakṣaṇyam sarva sattva anadhikaraṇa tvam viśvasya sādhya tayā ucyate tarhi sat bheda saṃsthitiḥ
translated: If the difference from all that exists, the non-existence of the universe in any existent being, is being proved, then the existence of different existents

analyzed: na hi aneka sat anaṅgīkāre sarva śabdasya
translated: is established. For without accepting many existents, there is no basis for the word 'all'.

original: santyevānekāni santi pāramāthirkaṃ tvekameveti cenna /🔽tatsiddhayarthamevādyāpi bhavatā prayatanāt /
analyzed: santi eva anekāni santi pāramāthirkam tu ekam eva iti ced na  tad siddhaya rtham evā adya api bhavatā prayatanāt
translated: If it is argued that there are indeed many existents, but the supreme existent is only one, that is not so.🔽Because you are still striving to prove that.

analyzed: tad anadhikaraṇa tva sādhana iṃśe
translated: And because of the contradiction in the part of the proof of non-existence in that.

analyzed: caturthe dūṣaṇa antaram āha sat mātra tvam iti
translated: In the fourth, he states another fault: 'The mere existence'.

analyzed: avivakṣita viśeṣam sattvam yasmāt brahmaṇaḥ api asti
translated: Because existence without any qualification exists even in Brahman,

analyzed: tasmāt kāraṇāt tasmāt sataḥ brahmaṇaḥ tad vailakṣaṇyam
translated: therefore, from that, from that existent Brahman, that difference,

analyzed: tad sattva anadhikaraṇa tvam api viśvasya no smākam matam bhavet
translated: that non-existence in that existence of the universe, would not be our view.

analyzed: tathā ca siddha tvāt tat api sādhyam no bhavet
translated: And thus, because it is already established, that also would not be our thesis.

analyzed: avivakṣita viśeṣa sattva anadhikaraṇa tve sādhye brahma gata sattva anadhikaraṇa tayā api pratijñāta artha upapatteḥ artha antara tā iti
translated: If the proposition is that the universe is not based on anything else, which is not specified, then the conclusion of the proposition is established by the fact that Brahman is not based on anything else, so it is irrelevant.
Refutation of the definition of existence in the opponent's view

analyzed: athavā kim idam sattvam nāma
translated: Or, what is this so-called existence?

analyzed: yat anadhikaraṇa tvam viśvasya sādhyate
translated: On what is not based is the universe being proved to be?

analyzed: kim sāmānya sattvam uta svarūpa sattvam
translated: Is it the general existence or the existence of its own nature?

analyzed: ādyam dūṣayati yadi ucyate iti
translated: He refutes the first by saying if it is said.

analyzed: sarvasmāt sarva artha anugatāt sāmānyāt vailakṣaṇyam tad anādhāra tvam iti yāvat
translated: The meaning is that it is not based on that, that is, it is different from the general which is present in everything.

analyzed: sādhya tayā yadi ucyate tadā sat bheda saṃsthitiḥ
translated: If it is said as the probandum, then the existence of the different kinds of existence

original: yadi sattaiva nāsti tadā tadanadhikaraṇatvapratijñā vyārthā syāt /
analyzed: yadi sattā eva na asti tadā tad anadhikaraṇa tva pratijñā vyārthā syāt
translated: If existence itself does not exist, then the proposition that it is not based on anything else would be meaningless.

analyzed: na idam śaśaviṣāṇa adhikaraṇam iti vat vipratipatteḥ eva anudayāt  sattā sāmānya aṅgīkāre ca sat bhedaḥ durvāraḥ eva
translated: Because the dispute itself does not arise, like saying this is not based on a rabbit's horn.🔽And if the general existence is accepted, then the difference of existence is indeed unavoidable.

analyzed: na hi eka āśrayam sāmānyam asti
translated: For there is no general which has a single basis.

original: santi sattādhikaraṇāni santīti cettarhi kānīti vaktavyāni /
analyzed: santi sattā adhikaraṇāni santi iti ced tarhi kāni iti vaktavyāni
translated: If it is said that there are bases of existence, then it must be said which ones.

analyzed: dravya ādīni iti ced katham tarhi teṣām eva tad anadhikaraṇa tva sādhanam
translated: If it be said that substance, etc. are so, then how is it that the non-substantiality of those very [things] is proved?

analyzed: vyavahārataḥ sarvam asti
translated: Everything exists conventionally.

analyzed: paramārthataḥ tu na iti ced na
translated: But not ultimately, if it be said. No.

analyzed: ukta uttara tvāt
translated: Because the answer has been given.

analyzed: etat ca para matena uttaram uktam veditavyam
translated: And this answer should be understood as given from the point of view of the opponent.

analyzed: sva matena tu siddhasādhana tvam draṣṭavyam
translated: But from our own point of view, it should be seen as an establishment of what is already established.

analyzed: dravya ādi atirikta anugata sattva sāmānyasya eva anaṅgīkārāt
translated: Because we do not accept any universal of existence that is different from substance, etc.

analyzed: dvitīyam dūṣayati sat mātra tvam iti
translated: He refutes the second [view] with If mere existence.

analyzed: sattā anapekṣam sattvam sanmātra tvam svarūpa sattvam iti yāvat
translated: Mere existence is existence that does not depend on existence, that is, it is mere existence, that is, existence as its own nature.

analyzed: tat brahmaṇaḥ pi asti yatas tasmāt kāraṇāt tasmāt brahmaṇaḥ tat vailakṣaṇyam abrahmatvam api viśvasya naḥ bhavet iti
translated: That exists even in Brahman. Therefore, for that reason, the difference of the universe from that Brahman, that is, its being not Brahman, would not be for us.

analyzed: athavā sāmānya sattā pakṣe doṣa antaram anena ucyate
translated: Or, this [verse] states another fault in the view of the universal of existence.

original: tathāhi sattāsāmānyavidhurasyāpi brahmaṇaḥ sanmātratvaṃ svarūpasattvaṃ tāvadasti /
analyzed: tathā hi sattā sāmānya vidhurasya api brahmaṇaḥ sanmātra tvam svarūpa sattvam tāvat asti
translated: For thus, Brahman, which is devoid of the universal of existence, does have mere existence, that is, existence as its own nature.

analyzed: na punar sattva vaidhuryāt asat anirvācyam vā brahma
translated: But Brahman is not non-existent or inexpressible as existent due to the absence of existence.

analyzed: tasmāt sattā vaidhuryasya asattva ādi ahetu tvāt tad sattā anadhikaraṇa tvam api viśvasya no bhavet iti
translated: Therefore, since non-existence is not the cause of the absence of existence, the universe cannot be non-existent, having existence as its substratum.

analyzed: etena brahma svarūpam sattvam iti pakṣaḥ api nirastaḥ
translated: By this, the view that Brahman's nature is existence is also refuted.

original: arthakriyākāritvaṃ jñānābādhyatvaṃ vā sattvamiti pakṣadvayaṃ sphuṭadoṣatvānna dūṣitam /
analyzed: arthakriyā kāri tvam jñāna abādhya tvam vā sattvam iti pakṣa dvayam sphuṭa doṣa tvāt na dūṣitam
translated: The two views that existence is the capacity for effective action or the non-sublation by knowledge are not refuted because they have obvious faults.

analyzed: arthakriyā iti vadatā mithyābhūtasya eva arthakriyā aṅgīkṛtā iti siddhānta virodhaḥ ca
translated: And by saying effective action, it is admitted that even what is false has effective action, so there is contradiction with the established conclusion.

analyzed: arthakriyā vidhurasya api brahmaṇaḥ sattvāt tad vaidhuryam na asāttva ādi hetuḥ
translated: And since Brahman, though devoid of effective action, exists, that absence of effective action is not the reason for non-existence, etc.

analyzed: arthakriyā anadhikaraṇa tā mātra sādhanam prakṛta anupayuktam tad viruddham ca
translated: The mere proof of non-subordination to effective action is irrelevant to the present topic and contradictory.

analyzed: jñāna abādhya tva vaidhuryam ca tad bādhya tvam eva
translated: And the absence of non-sublation by knowledge is just that sublation.

analyzed: tat ca hetvarthāt na bhidyate iti sphuṭam eva
translated: And that is not different from the meaning of the reason, as is clear.

analyzed: hetu antara abhidhāne vakṣyamāṇa nyāyena bādha siddhārtha tā ādi āpattiḥ sphuṭā eva
translated: Even if another reason is stated, the fault of the probandum being established by what is to be established is obvious, according to the method to be stated.

analyzed: yat atra uktam
translated: What is said here,

original: tvayāpi dve tattve sadasidati tattvaṃ vyavasthāpayatā yadeva sattvena vyavasthāpitaṃ tasyaiva mayāpyaṅgīkārānna sacchabdārthāniruktiriti /
analyzed: tvayā api dve tattve sat asit ati tattvam vyavasthāpayatā yat eva sattvena vyavasthāpitam tasya eva mayā api aṅgīkārāt na sat śabda artha aniruktiḥ iti
translated: You also, while establishing the truth in the assembly, have established only that which is existent. Since I also accept only that, there is no definition of the meaning of the word 'sat'.

analyzed: tat atīva mandam
translated: That is extremely foolish.

original: mayā hi /🔽kvacitsaditi bhāvo vyavahriyate /🔽kvacicca pratipannopādhau niṣedhāpratiyogi /
analyzed: mayā hi  kvacid sat iti bhāvaḥ vyavahriyate  kvacid ca pratipanna upādhau niṣedha apratiyogi
translated: For, by me,🔽in some cases, existence is spoken of.🔽In some cases, it is the non-counter-correlate of negation in the superimposition that is accepted.

analyzed: kvāpi mūrtam ityādi tat sarvam ca nirastam iti
translated: In some cases, it is the form, etc. All that has been refuted.

analyzed: jñāna bādhya tvam api tu na siddham prativādinaḥ
translated: But the opponent does not accept that it is to be refuted by knowledge.

analyzed: vijñātasya anyathā samyak vijñānam hi eva tat matam
translated: For he considers that the cognition of what is already known is itself the right knowledge.
Refutation of being refuted by what is accepted by the opponent

analyzed: evam pratijñām nirākṛtya hetum api apākaroti jñāna bādhya tvam iti
translated: Having thus refuted the thesis, he also refutes the reason, saying 'being to be refuted by knowledge'.

original: na kevalaṃ pratijñā duṣyā /🔽kiṃ nāma hetubhūtaṃ jñānabādhyatvamapītyarthaḥ /
analyzed: na kevalam pratijñā duṣyā  kim nāma hetu bhūtam jñāna bādhya tvam api iti arthaḥ
translated: Not only is the thesis faulty,🔽but also the reason, which is 'being to be refuted by knowledge'. This is the meaning.

analyzed: tuśabdaḥ siddhānti abhimatāt jñāna bādhya tvāt vayavacchinatti
translated: The word 'tu' (but) distinguishes it from the 'being to be refuted by knowledge' accepted by the proponent of the conclusion.

original: jñānabādhyatvaṃ hi jñānanivartyatvaṃ vā pratipannopādhau niṣedhapratiyogitvaṃ vā hetutvena parasyābhimatam /
analyzed: jñāna bādhya tvam hi jñāna nivartya tvam vā pratipanna upādhau niṣedha pratiyogi tvam vā hetu tvena parasya abhimatam
translated: For the opponent accepts that being annulled by knowledge means being destroyed by knowledge, or being the counter-correlate of negation in the accepted superimposition, as the reason.

analyzed: na ca prapañce tad prativādinaḥ mama siddham
translated: And that is not established for me, the opponent, regarding the world.

analyzed: atas nyatara asiddhaḥ hetuḥ iti
translated: Therefore, the reason is not established for one of the parties.

analyzed: nanu īśvara jñānena prapañca nivṛttiḥ tvayā api iṣyate eva
translated: But isn't the cessation of the world by the knowledge of God accepted by you as well?

analyzed: anyathā tasya saṃhāra kartṛ tva anupapatteḥ
translated: Otherwise, it would not be possible for Him to be the destroyer.

analyzed: jñāna ādimataḥ eva katṛ tvāt
translated: Because only one who has knowledge, etc. can be an agent.

analyzed: satyam
translated: True.

analyzed: na evam jñāna nivartya tvam parasya abhipretam
translated: But the opponent does not accept that being annulled by knowledge is meant in this way.

original: api tarhyajñānopādānakasya samāne viṣaye virodhitā jñānenopādāne nivṛtte svayameva vilapanam /
analyzed: api tarhi ajñāna upādānakasya samāne viṣaye virodhi tā jñānena upādāne nivṛtte svayam eva vilapanam
translated: Rather, when there is a contradiction between the cause of ignorance and knowledge regarding the same object, when the cause of knowledge ceases, it itself disappears.

analyzed: yathā āha
translated: As it is said:

original: ajñānasya svakāryeṇa vartamānena pravilīnena vā saha jñānena nivṛttibādhaḥ' / iti /
analyzed: ajñānasya sva kāryeṇa vartamānena pravilīnena vā saha jñānena nivṛtti bādhaḥ iti
translated: The cessation of ignorance is annulled by knowledge, whether it is present with its own effect or dissolved.

analyzed: na ca ayam prapañce smākam saṃmataḥ
translated: And this is not accepted by us regarding the world.

analyzed: kintu mudgara prahāra ādinā ghaṭasya iva īśvarasya jñāna icchā prayatna vyāpāraiḥ vināśaḥ eva
translated: But rather, the destruction of the world is by the activity of God's knowledge, will, and effort, just as a pot is destroyed by a hammer blow, etc.

analyzed: saḥ eva hetuḥ astu iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that that alone should be the reason, it is not so.

original: tathāvidhamapi jñānabādhyatvaṃ pakṣaikadeśe prakṛtyādau na siddhaṃ prativādina iti bhāgāsiddhatvāt /
analyzed: tathāvidham api jñāna bādhya tvam pakṣa eka deśe prakṛti ādau na siddham prativādinaḥ iti bhāga asiddha tvāt
translated: Even so, the fact of being destroyed by knowledge is not established in one part of the subject, in the primordial nature etc., for the opponent. Thus, because of partial non-establishment.

analyzed: kiñca satyasya api jñāna vināśya tvam astu
translated: Moreover, let there be the destructibility by knowledge even of the real.

original: naca vipakṣe kiñcidbādhakamastītyato 'prayojakatvājjñānabādhyatvaṃ na siddhamapi vyāpyatvāsiddhamapīti yāvat /
analyzed: naca vipakṣe kiñcid bādhakam asti iti atas prayojaka tvāt jñāna bādhya tvam na siddham api vyāpya tva asiddham api iti yāvat
translated: And there is no contradiction in the contrary case. Therefore, because of non-involvement, the fact of being destroyed by knowledge is not established, i.e., even though not established, the fact of being pervaded is not established.

analyzed: prativādinaḥ matena iti guḍajihvikā mātram
translated: That it is according to the opinion of the opponent is mere lip-service.

analyzed: bādhaka anupanyāse vādinaḥ u pi vyāpya tva asiddheḥ āvaśyaka tvāt
translated: Because, even if the contradiction is not stated, the fact of being pervaded is necessarily not established even for the proponent.

original: sato vināśe caitanyasyāpi vināśaprasaṅga iti cet /
analyzed: sataḥ vināśe caitanyasya api vināśa prasaṅgaḥ iti ced
translated: If it is argued that if the real is destroyed, then consciousness would also be destroyed,

analyzed: tarhi vināśa mātrasya sādhya prayojaka tvena jñāna bādhya tvam asiddham api
translated: then, because mere destruction is the cause of the probandum, the fact of being destroyed by knowledge is not established,

analyzed: vyartha viśeṣaṇa asiddham api syāt
translated: it would also be not established even though the qualifier is useless.

analyzed: nāśya tva mātram hetuḥ jñāna iti svarūpa kathana mātram
translated: The reason is mere destructibility by knowledge. It is merely a statement of the nature.

analyzed: sa ca ukta bādhaka sānāthyena na aprayojakaḥ iti ced na
translated: And it is argued that that is not non-involving because it is supported by the stated contradiction. But that is not so.

analyzed: sattva sāmye pi vināśa kāraṇa sat asat bhāvena viśeṣasya ukta tvāt
translated: Because the difference is stated by the presence and absence of the cause of destruction, even though existence is the same.

original: nanu ca nehanānāstītipratipannopādhau śrautaniṣedhātmā bādhaḥ prapañce 'stīti cenna /
analyzed: nanu ca na iha nānā asti iti pratipanna upādhau śrauta niṣedha ātmā bādhaḥ prapañce sti iti ced na
translated: If it be said that there is contradiction in the world because of the prohibition contained in the Vedic text, ‘Neha nānastyasti’ (Kaṭha.

analyzed: śruti artha nirṇaya uttara kālam eva etat
translated: [This is not so], because the ascertainment of the meaning of the Vedic text comes only after that.

analyzed: saḥ eva tu upapatti virodhāt aśakyaḥ iti ucyamāna tvāt
translated: [And] because it is said that that [ascertainment of the meaning of the Vedic text] itself is impossible due to contradiction with reason.

analyzed: athavā jñāna bādhya tvam asiddham vyāpti rahitam api iti yojyam
translated: Or, [the statement] 'being contradicted by knowledge' is not established and is devoid of pervasion, this should be connected.

analyzed: tathā hi
translated: Because it is so.

original: kiṃ tvadabhimataṃ jñānabādhyatvamatra hetūkriyate kiṃ vāsmadabhimatamiti vācyam /
analyzed: kim tvad abhimatam jñāna bādhya tvam atra hetūkriyate kim vā asmad abhimatam iti vācyam
translated: It should be said whether what is intended by you as being contradicted by knowledge is taken as the reason here, or what is intended by us.

analyzed: ādyam ced ukta nyāyena na siddham prativādinaḥ
translated: If the first, it is not established for the opponent by the stated reasoning.

analyzed: dvitīye vyāpti vaidhuryam iti
translated: In the second, there is a deficiency in pervasion.

analyzed: tat katham iti atas āha vijñātasya iti
translated: How is that? Therefore it is said 'of what is known otherwise'.

original: hi yasmādanyathāvijñātasya samyagvijñānameva bādhastadviṣayatvameva tadbādhyatvaṃ matamasmākam /
analyzed: hi yasmāt anyathā vijñātasya samyak vijñānam eva bādhaḥ tad viṣaya tvam eva tad bādhya tvam matam asmākam
translated: Because, for us, the contradiction of what is known otherwise is only the right knowledge itself, and being the object of that is itself being contradicted by that.

analyzed: tat ca ātmani vipakṣe gatam iti vyāpti vikalam iti vākyaśeṣaḥ
translated: And that is absent in the counter-example, the self. The rest of the sentence is that it is devoid of pervasion.

original: satyo 'pyātmā dehādyātmanā vijñāto vedāntajanitasamyagvijñānavṛttiviṣaya iti pareṇāpyaṅgīkāryam /
analyzed: satyaḥ pi ātmā deha ādi ātmanā vijñātaḥ vedānta janita samyak vijñāna vṛtti viṣayaḥ iti pareṇa api aṅgīkāryam
translated: Even if the self is real, it is accepted by the other party that it is the object of right knowledge produced by the Vedanta, being known as the self of the body etc.

analyzed: anyathā avidyā nivṛtti anupapatteḥ iti
translated: Otherwise, the cessation of ignorance would be impossible.
Definition of being contradicted

analyzed: athavā dṛṣṭāntam pratyācaṣṭe jñāna bādhya tvam iti
translated: Or else, he rejects the example, saying being contradicted by knowledge, etc.

analyzed: api padena sat asat vilakṣaṇa tva lakṣaṇam sādhyam anirvācya tvam samuccinoti
translated: By the word and, he includes the probandum, which is the characteristic of being inexpressible, which is different from existence and non-existence.

analyzed: tuśabdaḥ jñāna bādhya tvam abhimatāt vayavacchinatti  na siddhim śukti rajata ādau iti śeṣaḥ
translated: The word but excludes the intended from being contradicted by knowledge.🔽The remainder is: not the establishment of silver in a mother-of-pearl object, etc.

analyzed: śukti rajata ādeḥ anirvacanīya tvam tāvat prativādinaḥ mama asiddham
translated: First, the opponent does not accept the inexpressibility of silver in a mother-of-pearl object, etc.

analyzed: mayā atyanta asattvena aṅgīkṛta tvāt
translated: Because it is accepted by me as absolutely non-existent.

analyzed: atas eva jñāna bādhya tvam mama tatra a saṃmatam
translated: For this very reason, being contradicted by knowledge is not accepted by me in that case.

analyzed: tat hi jñāna nivartya tvam parasya abhimatam
translated: For that is accepted by the opponent as being negated by knowledge.

analyzed: na ca asataḥ tat sambhavati
translated: And that is not possible for what is non-existent.

analyzed: tasya nitya nivṛtta tvāt
translated: Because that is eternally negated.

analyzed: atas sādhya sādhana vikalaḥ yam dṛṣṭānta ābhāsaḥ
translated: Therefore, this is a fallacious example, lacking the probandum and the probans.

analyzed: nanu pratipanna upādhau niṣedha pratiyogi tvam bādhya tvam asti eva śukti rajata ādau
translated: But isn't there the being the object of negation in relation to the accepted superimposition, which is being contradicted, in the case of silver in a mother-of-pearl object, etc.?

analyzed: mā evam
translated: No, that is not so.

analyzed: tathā satya sattva prasaṅgāt
translated: Because if it were so, it would follow that it is non-existent.

analyzed: vakṣyate ca etat
translated: And this will be explained.

analyzed: yadi tarhi na bādhya tvam śukti rajata ādeḥ
translated: If, then, the silver of the nacre, etc., is not what is sublated,

analyzed: bāḍham
translated: Very well.

analyzed: nanu sakala loka virodha ādi prasaṅgaḥ
translated: But there is the contingence of the contradiction of the whole world, etc.

analyzed: mā evam
translated: Not so.

analyzed: tvad abhimatasya abhāve pi anyasya bādhya tvasya tatra vidyamāna tvāt
translated: Because, even in the absence of what is accepted by you, there is present there another kind of sublation.

analyzed: kim tat iti atas āha vijñātasya iti
translated: What is that? In answer to this he says: of what is known as, etc.

original: bādhyatvamiti prakṛtaprakṛtyarthaṃ bādhyaṃ taditi sāmānyena parāmṛśati /🔽kecinnedaṃ rajatamiti hyadhyastavastvabhāvabodhaṃ bādhamāhuḥ /
analyzed: bādhya tvam iti prakṛta prakṛti artham bādhyam tat iti sāmānyena parāmṛśati  kecid na idam rajatam iti hi adhyasta vastu abhāva bodham bādham āhuḥ
translated: The word 'sublated' refers to the general sense of the word 'sublated' as it occurs in the subject-matter under discussion.🔽Some people call the cognition of the non-existence of the superimposed object, as in the case of the statement 'this is not silver', sublation.

analyzed: apare tu śuktiḥ iyam iti virodhi bhāva antara jñānam
translated: Others, again, call it the cognition of another contradictory object, as in the case of the statement 'this is nacre'.

analyzed: tat ubhayam pratyekam avyāpakam
translated: Both of these are individually non-pervasive.

analyzed: śābda ādau dvayoḥ api bādha tva prasiddheḥ
translated: Because both are well known to be sublation in the case of verbal testimony, etc.

original: tasmādubhayānugatametaducyate /🔽rajatatvādinā vijñātasya purovartinaḥ śuktitvādinā vijñānaṃ khalvanyathāvijñātasya samyagvijñānaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: tasmāt ubhaya anugatam etat ucyate  rajata tva ādinā vijñātasya purovartinaḥ śukti tva ādinā vijñānam khalu anyathā vijñātasya samyak vijñānam bhavati
translated: Therefore, this is said to be common to both.🔽The cognition of the object in front, which is known as silver, etc., as nacre, etc., is indeed the right cognition of what is known otherwise.

original: evamasato rajatasya sattvādināvagatasyāsattvādinā vijñānamapyanyathāvijñātasya samyagvijñānaṃ bhavatyeva /
analyzed: evam asataḥ rajatasya sattva ādinā avagatasya asattva ādinā vijñānam api anyathā vijñātasya samyak vijñānam bhavati eva
translated: Similarly, the cognition of the non-existent silver, which is apprehended as existent, etc., as non-existent, etc., is also the right cognition of what is known otherwise.

original: samyagvijñānaṃ bādha ityevokte sarvamapi samyagjñānaṃ bādhaḥ prasajyeta /
analyzed: samyak vijñānam bādhaḥ iti eva ukte sarvam api samyak jñānam bādhaḥ prasajyeta
translated: If it is said that sublation is right cognition, then all right cognition would be sublation.

analyzed: na ca tathā vyavahāraḥ
translated: And that is not the usage.

analyzed: tad nivṛtti artham anyathā vijñātasya iti uktam
translated: To exclude that, of what is cognized otherwise is said.

original: anyathāvijñātasya jñānamityevokte dhārāvāhikabhrame rājatatvenāvagatasya śuktikāśakalasya punarnāgavaṅgatvādijñāne 'pi prasaṅgaḥ /
analyzed: anyathā vijñātasya jñānam iti eva ukte dhārāvāhika bhrame rājata tvena avagatasya śuktikā śakalasya punar nāga vaṅga tva ādi jñāne pi prasaṅgaḥ
translated: If it is said that the cognition of what is cognized otherwise is sublation, then there would be the undesirable consequence that even in the cognition of a mother-of-pearl as silver and then as a conch, a bangle, etc., it would be sublation.

analyzed: tad nirāsāya samyak iti uktam
translated: To exclude that, right is said.

analyzed: anyathā iti
translated: Otherwise means

analyzed: tad svarūpa apekṣayā
translated: in relation to its own nature.

original: tena ghaṭasyaiva paṭādyapekṣayānyathā ghaṭatvena jñānasya punarghaṭatvena jñāne prasaṅgo nirastaḥ /
analyzed: tena ghaṭasya eva paṭa ādi apekṣayā anyathā ghaṭa tvena jñānasya punar ghaṭa tvena jñāne prasaṅgaḥ nirastaḥ
translated: Therefore, the undesirable consequence of a jar being sublated by the cognition of a jar again in relation to a cloth, etc., is excluded.

analyzed: chala prasaṅgāt
translated: Because it would lead to the undesirable consequence of deception.

analyzed: tathā api rajata tvena avagatasya śuktikā śakalasya śukla tva ādi jñāne prasaṅgaḥ tad avasthaḥ
translated: Even so, the undesirable consequence remains that the cognition of the whiteness, etc., of a piece of mother-of-pearl which is cognized as silver would be sublation.

original: evamekenānyathāvijñātasya puruṣāntarasambandhini tasyaiva vā puruṣasya kālāntarabhāvinyājānasiddhe samyagvijñāne prasaṅgo 'pīti cenmaivam /
analyzed: evam ekena anyathā vijñātasya puruṣa antara sambandhini tasya eva vā puruṣasya kāla antara bhāvini ājāna siddhe samyak vijñāne
translated: If it is argued that even in the right cognition of another person who is cognized otherwise by one person, or of the same person at a later time, there would be the undesirable consequence of sublation, it is not so.

analyzed: bādhatiḥ khalu loḍane paṭhyate
translated: For the verb sublates is read as to overturn.

analyzed: tat ca jñāna asya arthasya vāstu
translated: And that can be of the cognition or of the object.

analyzed: na tāvat jñānasya
translated: Not of the cognition, first of all.

analyzed: tasya kṣaṇika tvena svatas eva loḍita tvāt
translated: Because that is destroyed by itself alone due to its momentariness.

analyzed: samyak vijñānasya api uttara jñāna vināśyasya bādhita tva vyavahāra prasaṅgāt
translated: And because there would be the consequence of the usage of being contradicted for correct cognition also, which is destroyed by subsequent cognition.

analyzed: na api arthasya
translated: Nor of the object.

analyzed: śuktiśakala ādeḥ tādavasthyāt
translated: Because of the persistence of the piece of shell etc.
And because silver etc. are not destroyed.

analyzed: atas pūrva jñāna prasañjitasya anyathākārasya loḍanam iva iti vaktavyam
translated: Therefore, it should be said that it is like the destruction of the form of something else superimposed by a previous cognition.

analyzed: tathāca sati kaḥ tiprasaṅgaḥ
translated: And if that is so, what is the overextension?

analyzed: tat kim vaktavyam etat
translated: So should this be stated?

analyzed: nahi
translated: No, it is not so.

analyzed: katham an ucyamānam jñāsyate
translated: How will it be known if not stated?

analyzed: anyathā vijñātasya iti vacana sāmarthyāt
translated: Because of the force of the statement of what is cognized otherwise.

analyzed: anyathā samyak vijñānam iti eva avakṣyat
translated: He would have simply said otherwise, correct cognition.

analyzed: kim anena iti
translated: What is the use of this?

analyzed: tad viṣaya tvam bādhya tvam iti śeṣaḥ
translated: The remainder is that the object of that is what is contradicted.
Refutation of the characteristic of the inexpressible

analyzed: athavā anirvacanīyam amukhyam sat iti uktam  tatra kim idam anirvacanīya tvam  kim nirukti virahaḥ
translated: Or it has been said that the inexpressible is a secondary existent.🔽What is this inexpressibility there?🔽Is it the absence of expression?
Or is it the absence of the cause of expression?

analyzed: na ādakyaḥ
translated: It is not the absence of expression.

analyzed: anirvacanīyam ityādi nirukteḥ sattvena asambhāvi tvāt
translated: Because it is not possible due to the definition beginning with indeterminate.

analyzed: dvitīye pi nirukti nimittam jñānam arthaḥ vā syāt
translated: In the second case also, the reason for the definition may be knowledge or object.

analyzed: na ādyaḥ
translated: Not the first.

analyzed: jñānasya ubhaya vādi siddhi sadbhāvāt
translated: Because the existence of knowledge is accepted by both parties.

analyzed: na dvitīyaḥ
translated: Not the second.

analyzed: yatā pratibhā samarthasya alaukikasya rajata ādeḥ māyā vādinā abhyupagata tvāt iti āśaṅkaya pareṇa anirvacanīyasya lakṣaṇa dvayam abhihitam
translated: Because the opponent has argued, suspecting that the indeterminate is not possible due to the impossibility of the definition, that the reason for the definition is the existence of the indeterminate.

analyzed: sat asat vilakṣaṇa tvam anirvacanīya tvam jñāna bādhya tvam ca iti
translated: The opponent has stated two characteristics of the indeterminate: being different from existent and non-existent, and being contradicted by knowledge.

analyzed: tatra ādyam tāvat nirākaroti vailakṣaṇyam sataḥ ca iti
translated: Among them, he first refutes the first with If it is different from the existent.

analyzed: vyākhyānāni tu pūrvavat eva
translated: The explanations are the same as before.

original: tatra yāvatsu pakṣeṣu siddhāthartvaparyavasānaṃ tāvatsvanirvacanīyatvasya sattvāvirodhitvena na sanprapañcaḥ kintvanirvacanīya ityārambhāsaṅgatirdeṣo
analyzed: tatra yāvatsu pakṣeṣu siddhāthartva paryavasānam tāvatsu anirvacanīya tvasya sattva avirodhi tvena na san prapañcaḥ kintu anirvacanīyaḥ iti ārambha asaṅgatiḥ
translated: There, as long as the conclusion is about the existent being established in the various positions, the indeterminate is not contradictory to existence, so the beginning is irrelevant, the fault being

analyzed: vagantavyaḥ
translated: that it should be understood.

analyzed: yatra punar bādhā ādi paryavasānam tatra avyāptiḥ avagantavyā
translated: Where the conclusion is about contradiction and so on, non-pervasion should be understood.

analyzed: athavā anirvacanīya tvena viyat ādikam śukti rajata ādikam ca parasya abhimatam
translated: Or, the sky, etc., and the silver in the shell, etc., are accepted by the opponent as indescribable.

original: tatra sata eva sattvena pramitasyaiva viyadāderviśvasyāsadvilakṣaṇatvameva svayaṃ sat /
analyzed: tatra sataḥ eva sattvena pramitasya eva viyat ādeḥ viśvasya asat vilakṣaṇa tvam eva svayam sat
translated: There, the very existence of the sky, etc., which are cognized as existent by their existence, and the entire universe, as different from the non-existent, is itself existent.

original: evamasata evāsattvena pramitasyaiva śuktirajatāderviśvasya sarvasyāpyāropitasya sadvilakṣaṇatvameva svayaṃ sat /
analyzed: evam asataḥ eva asattvena pramitasya eva śukti rajata ādeḥ viśvasya sarvasya api āropitasya sat vilakṣaṇa tvam eva svayam sat
translated: Similarly, the very existence of the silver in the shell, etc., which are cognized as non-existent by their non-existence, and the entire superimposed universe, as different from the existent, is itself existent.

analyzed: viyat ādau asat vilakṣaṇa tvam eva asti
translated: In the sky, etc., there is only difference from the non-existent.

analyzed: sat vailakṣaṇyam tu pramāṇa bādhitam
translated: But the difference from the existent is contradicted by valid cognition.

analyzed: tathā śukti rajata ādau sat vilakṣaṇa tvam eva asti
translated: Similarly, in the silver in the shell, etc., there is only difference from the existent.

analyzed: asat vailakṣaṇyam tu pramāṇa viruddham
translated: But the difference from the non-existent is contradicted by valid cognition.

original: ato 'sambhavinā tena lakṣaṇenoktena kathaṃ te 'niṣyaṃ nigrahasthānaṃ na bhavedityādiyojanā draṣṭavyā /
analyzed: atas sambhavinā tena lakṣaṇena uktena katham te niṣyam nigrahasthānam na bhavet ityādi yojanā draṣṭavyā
translated: Therefore, how can the stated reason, which is impossible, not be a ground of defeat for you? Such an arrangement should be seen.

original: bhedavādina ityanena māyāvādino viyadādau sadvailakṣaṇyāṅgīkāraḥ śuktirajatādau cāsadvilakṣaṇatvābhyupagatirāgrahamātramalaivetyabhipraiti
analyzed: bheda vādinaḥ iti anena māyā vādinaḥ viyat ādau sat vailakṣaṇya aṅgīkāraḥ śukti rajata ādau ca asat vilakṣaṇa tva abhyupagatiḥ āgraha mātra malā eva iti abhipraiti
translated: By this phrase for those who advocate difference, it is intended that the acceptance of difference from the existent in the sky, etc., and the acceptance of difference from the non-existent in the silver in the shell, etc., is mere non-apprehension.

analyzed: yadi ucyate iti atra api ukta rītyā asambhavi tva ādikam jñātavyam
translated: If it is said, here also, in the same way as stated, impossibility etc. should be understood.

analyzed: sat mātra tvam iti anena ativyāptiḥ ucyate
translated: By this being mere existence it is said that there is over-extension.

analyzed: tathā hi
translated: Thus it is.

analyzed: brahmaṇaḥ pi sat mātra tvam sattva anadhikaraṇa tvam iti yāvat
translated: Brahman also is mere existence, i.e., it is not the substratum of existence.

analyzed: māyā vādinā abhyupagatam iti śeṣaḥ
translated: The remainder is: accepted by the Māyāvādins.

analyzed: nirdharmaka tva aṅgīkārāt
translated: Because it is accepted as being without properties.

analyzed: asattva anadhikaraṇa tvam tu niścitam eva
translated: But not being the substratum of non-existence is certainly accepted.

analyzed: tasmāt tat api brahma api sannaḥ bhavet kintu anirvācyam prasajyeta iti
translated: Therefore, that also would be Brahman, but it would be absurd to say it is inexpressible.

original: sattvenāsattvena ca vicārāsahatvamanirvacanīyatvaṃ na punaḥ sattvāsattvadharmānadhikaraṇatvam /
analyzed: sattvena asattvena ca vicāra asaha tvam anirvacanīya tvam na punar sattva asattva dharma anadhikaraṇa tvam
translated: Being inexpressible is not being able to withstand scrutiny by means of existence or non-existence, not being the substratum of the properties of existence and non-existence.

original: brahma tu sattvena vicārasahaṃ kathamanirvacanīyaṃ syāditi cenna /
analyzed: brahma tu sattvena vicāra saham katham anirvacanīyam syāt iti ced na
translated: But how can Brahman, which is able to withstand scrutiny by means of existence, be inexpressible? No,

analyzed: sattvena iti tu apratyaya arthasya anabhyupagamāt
translated: because the meaning of the indeclinable tu is not accepted.

original: kiñca yo viyadādau vicāraḥ sa brahmaṇyapi samāna iti kathaṃ na tasyānirvacanīyatvam /
analyzed: kiñca yaḥ viyat ādau vicāraḥ sa brahmaṇi api samānaḥ iti katham na tasya anirvacanīya tvam
translated: Moreover, since the scrutiny that is in the case of ether etc. is the same in the case of Brahman, how can it not be inexpressible?

analyzed: yathā uktam
translated: As it is said:
Because of the acceptance of all difference. etc.

analyzed: nirākariṣyate ca asau durvicāraḥ tatra tatra iti
translated: And that [view] will be refuted here and there as a bad consideration.

analyzed: dvitīyam api lakṣaṇam nirākaroti jñāna bādhya tvam iti
translated: He also refutes the second definition, saying being contradicted by knowledge.

analyzed: yadi jñāna bādhya tvam nāma ukta vidhayā śukti rajata ādeḥ ca asatvena avidyā upādānaka tva abhāvāt
translated: If being contradicted by knowledge means that because the silver of a shell does not exist in the way described, it lacks being the material cause of ignorance,

analyzed: tatas ca asambhavi tvam lakṣaṇa doṣaḥ
translated: then that is a fault in the definition due to impossibility.

analyzed: yadi punar jñāna vināśya tva mātram
translated: But if it is merely being destroyed by knowledge,

original: tathāpi viyadādau nitye nityatvādeva śuktirajatādau cāsatvānna siddhamityavyāptiḥ /
analyzed: tathā api viyat ādau nitye nitya tvāt eva śukti rajata ādau ca asatvāt na siddham iti avyāptiḥ
translated: then even so, it is not established in the eternal ether, etc. because of eternality itself, and in the silver of a shell, etc. because of non-existence, so there is over-extension.

original: yadi ca pratipannopādhau niṣedhapratiyogitvaṃ tadapi viyadādau na siddhamityavyāptireva /
analyzed: yadi ca pratipanna upādhau niṣedha pratiyogi tvam tat api viyat ādau na siddham iti avyāptiḥ eva
translated: And if it is the property of being the counter-correlate of negation in the accepted substratum, then that also is not established in the ether, etc., so there is still over-extension.

analyzed: upapattayaḥ tu uktāḥ vakṣyamāṇāḥ ca anusandheyāḥ
translated: And the arguments have been stated and will be stated [in the following chapters] and should be understood.

analyzed: nanu bhavatā api bādhya tvam kim api aṅgīkaraṇīyam eva
translated: But even for you, something must be accepted as being contradicted,

analyzed: padasya nirarthaka tva ayogāt
translated: because it is not possible for a word to be meaningless.

analyzed: tat eva asmākam anirvacanīya lakṣaṇam bhavatu iti atas āha prativādinaḥ vijñātasya iti
translated: Let that itself be our definition of the inexpressible, to which he says of what is known to the opponent.

analyzed: prativādinaḥ mama matam iti sambandhaḥ
translated: The relation is my view, which is that of the opponent.

analyzed: tat ca ātmani anirvacanīye pi asti iti ativyāptam iti śeṣaḥ
translated: And that exists in the inexpressible self, so it is too wide, is the remainder.

analyzed: atra anyathā vijñānam eva bhrāntiḥ
translated: Here, non-erroneous cognition itself is error.

original: tatprasañjitānyathā'kāraloḍanaṃ samyagvijñānameva bādha ityavadhāraṇatayā matāntarāṇi nirastāni veditavyāni /
analyzed: tad prasañjita anyathā ākāra loḍanam samyak vijñānam eva bādhaḥ iti avadhāraṇa tayā mata antarāṇi nirastāni veditavyāni
translated: The superimposition of a different form produced by that is the very sublation of correct cognition. Thus, other views should be understood to have been refuted by this restriction.

analyzed: hi śabdena tatra pramāṇa prasiddhim sūcayati
translated: The word hi indicates the well-known means of knowledge in that regard.
Prabhākara's restatement of the theory of transformation

analyzed: atha pañcākhyātivādaḥ
translated: Now, the theory of five kinds of non-apprehension

original: iha khalu kecidyathārthameva sarvavijñānamiti manyamānā nānyathākhyātiṃ sahante /
analyzed: iha khalu kecid yathārtham eva sarva vijñānam iti manyamānāḥ na anyathā khyātim sahante
translated: Here, some, considering all cognition to be in accordance with reality, do not accept any other kind of apprehension.

analyzed: tathā hi
translated: Thus:

analyzed: kā iyam anyathākhyātiḥ nāma
translated: What is this so-called other-apprehension?

analyzed: yadi tāvat anyathā pariṇate vastuni khyātiḥ anyathā khyātiḥ
translated: If it is the apprehension of a thing transformed in another way as other-apprehension,

analyzed: tadā ghaṭa ādi pratyayāḥ sarve pi anyathā khyāti tvāt vibhramāḥ prasajyeran
translated: then all cognitions of things like pots would be erroneous because of being other-apprehensions.

original: kiñca śuktikāyā rajatākārapariṇāmaḥ kiṃ sakāraṇa utākāraṇaḥ /
analyzed: kiñca śuktikāyāḥ rajata ākāra pariṇāmaḥ kim sa kāraṇaḥ uta akāraṇaḥ
translated: Moreover, is the transformation of silver in a shell with a cause or without a cause?

analyzed: na tāvat akāraṇaḥ
translated: It cannot be without a cause.

analyzed: kādācitkatva anupapatteḥ
translated: Because it cannot be occasional.

analyzed: ādye kāraṇam vācyam
translated: In the first case, a cause must be stated.

analyzed: karaṇa doṣaḥ iti ced na
translated: If it is said to be a defect of the sense organ, that is not so.

analyzed: tasya karaṇa sambandhinaḥ śuktikā pariṇāma hetu tva anupapatteḥ
translated: Because it is not possible for that which is connected with the instrument to be the cause of the transformation of nacre into silver.

analyzed: anyathā tadā eva sakala arthānām rajata rūpa pariṇāma prasaṅgāt
translated: Otherwise, there would be the contingence of the transformation of all objects into the form of silver at that very time.

original: duṣyakaraṇasaṃsargo heturiti cettathāpi kiṃ śuktitvāpagamena rajatarūpapariṇāmaḥ /
analyzed: duṣi akaraṇa saṃsargaḥ hetuḥ iti ced tathā api kim śukti tva apagamena rajata rūpa pariṇāmaḥ
translated: If it is argued that the contact with a defective sense organ is the cause, even so, is the transformation into the form of silver with the removal of nacreity?

analyzed: kim vā tad anapagamena
translated: Or without its removal?

original: ādye puruṣāntareṇāpi tadā śuktitvaṃ na pratyetavyam /
analyzed: ādye puruṣa antareṇa api tadā śukti tvam na pratyetavyam
translated: In the first case, even by another person, nacreity should not be cognized at that time.

original: dvitīye bhrāntenāpi tatpratyetavyam /🔽kiñca śuktitvāpagame bādhe 'pi na tadbhāyāt /
analyzed: dvitīye bhrāntena api tat pratyetavyam  kiñca śukti tva apagame bādhe na tat bhāyāt
translated: In the second case, even by one who is deluded, it should be cognized.🔽Moreover, even in the case of contradiction when nacreity is removed, it should not appear.

original: atha punaḥ śuktayākāreṇa rajataṃ pariṇatamiti cenna /
analyzed: atha punar śuktayā ākāreṇa rajatam pariṇatam iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that silver is transformed into the form of nacre again, it is not so.

analyzed: karaṇa doṣasya kāraṇasya abhāvāt
translated: Because the defect of the instrument is the cause.

analyzed: bādho pi evam tena eva gṛhyate iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that contradiction is also grasped by that itself, it is not so.

analyzed: ghaṭa ādeḥ api kulāla ādi mātra vedya tā āpātāt
translated: Because there would be the contingence of the potter and others being known only by the pot and others.

analyzed: sukha ādi vat iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that it is like pleasure etc., it is not so.

analyzed: bāhya antara tvena viśeṣāt
translated: Because there is a difference in being external and internal.

analyzed: anyathā ukta atiprasaṅga anistārāt
translated: Otherwise, the stated contingence cannot be avoided.

original: kiñca doṣavaśādrajatākāreṇa pariṇatā cecchuktistadā doṣāpagame 'pi tathaiva kathaṃ nāvatiṣṭhate /
analyzed: kiñca doṣa vaśāt rajata ākāreṇa pariṇatā ced śuktiḥ tadā doṣa apagame tathā eva katham na avatiṣṭhate
translated: Moreover, if nacre is transformed into the form of silver due to a defect, then how does it not remain the same even after the removal of the defect?

analyzed: nahi nimitta kāraṇa nāśāt kārya nāśaḥ dṛṣṭaḥ
translated: For the destruction of an effect is not seen to follow from the destruction of the instrumental cause.

analyzed: kamala kuḍmala vikāsa nimitta sāvitra teja upagamasya vikāsa nivṛtti hetu tā dṛṣṭā iti ced mā evam
translated: If it be said that the disappearance of the expansion is seen to be caused by the disappearance of the sun's rays, which are the cause of the expansion of the lotus bud, we say, not so.

analyzed: dala vibhāgaḥ hi vikāsaḥ nāma
translated: For expansion is the name for the division of the petals.

analyzed: sa ca kṣaṇika tvāt sati eva sāvitra tejasi nivṛttaḥ
translated: And that, being momentary, ceases even when the sun's rays are present.

original: saṃyogapradhvaṃsastu na kadāpi nivartate punaḥ saṃyogalakṣaṇo mukulībhāvastu śītādinodanajanya eva /🔽sthāyitve 'pi vibhāgasyānyadeva tannāśe nimittamiti yatkiñcidetat /
analyzed: saṃyoga pradhvaṃsaḥ tu na kadāpi nivartate punar saṃyoga lakṣaṇaḥ mukulībhāvaḥ tu śīta ādi nodana janyaḥ eva  sthāyi tve pi vibhāgasya anyat eva tad nāśe nimittam iti yat kiñcid etat
translated: But the destruction of conjunction never ceases. The contraction characterized by conjunction is produced only by cold, etc.🔽Even if the division lasts, it is something else that is the cause of its destruction. So this is nothing.

analyzed: paratva ādi vat syāt iti ced na
translated: If it be said that it may be like distance, etc., we say, not so.

analyzed: vipratipatteḥ
translated: Because of contradiction.

original: kiñcotpannaṃ cedrajataṃ vinaṣṭaṃ tadā tathaiva pratītiḥ syāt na punarnedaṃ rajatamiti bādhabuddhiḥ /
analyzed: kiñca utpannam ced rajatam vinaṣṭam tadā tathā eva pratītiḥ syāt na punar na idam rajatam iti bādha buddhiḥ
translated: Moreover, if silver were produced and then destroyed, there would be cognition of it as such, and not again the contradictory cognition that this is not silver.

analyzed: etena duṣya karaṇa janyāt vijñānāt rajatam eti api parāstam
translated: By this, the argument that silver is produced from the cognition produced by a defective sense organ is also refuted.

analyzed: kā ca evam sati doṣa vācoyuktiḥ
translated: And what is the fault in this?

original: nahi mṛdo ghaṭākārapariṇāmasya nimittaṃ daṇḍacakrādikaṃ doṣatvena manyante /
analyzed: nahi mṛdaḥ ghaṭa ākāra pariṇāmasya nimittam daṇḍa cakra ādikam doṣa tvena manyante
translated: For they do not consider the stick, wheel, etc. to be faults in the production of the pot-shaped transformation of clay.

original: kiñca yasyāḥ pratītestadālambanaṃ tata eva tajjanma kiṃvā pratītyantarāt /
analyzed: kiñca yasyāḥ pratīteḥ tad ālambanam tatas eva tad janma kiṃvā pratīti antarāt
translated: Moreover, if the cognition of silver has that as its object, then it arises from that itself, or from another cognition?

analyzed: na ādyaḥ
translated: Not the first.

analyzed: paraspara āśraya prasaṅgāt  utpanne hi rajate tad ālambanāyāḥ pratīteḥ janma
translated: Because of the contingence of mutual dependence.🔽For, the cognition having silver as its object arises when the silver has arisen.

analyzed: tasyām jātāyām rajata utpattiḥ iti
translated: And when that has arisen, the silver arises.

analyzed: na khalu nirālambanā pratītiḥ utpadyate
translated: Certainly, a cognition without an object does not arise.

analyzed: dvitīye pi kim tad pratīti antaram śuktikā ālambanam  uta śuktikā rajata antar ālambanam
translated: In the second case also, is that other cognition having the mother-of-pearl as its object?🔽Or having the silver in the mother-of-pearl as its object?

analyzed: athavā artha antar ālambanam
translated: Or having an entirely different object?

analyzed: na ādyaḥ
translated: Not the first.

analyzed: sarvatra śukti pratīti anantaram rajata utpāda prasaṅgāt
translated: Because of the contingence of the production of silver everywhere immediately after the cognition of mother-of-pearl.

analyzed: śukti rajata pratīteḥ prāk śuktiḥ iti pratīti niyama abhāvāt ca
translated: And because there is no rule that the cognition of mother-of-pearl must precede the cognition of silver.
If it be said that the production of silver is due to the cognition of the form common to mother-of-pearl and silver as perceived by the defective sense-organ, that is not so.

analyzed: sādhāraṇa ākāra mātra darśana anantaram rajata pratīti niyama abhāvāt
translated: Because there is no rule that the cognition of silver must follow immediately after the perception of the form common to the two.

analyzed: kāraṇa vaikalyam tatra kalpyate iti ced
translated: If it be said that the deficiency of the cause is to be supposed in that case,

analyzed: syāt etat evam
translated: that may be so.

analyzed: yadi rajata janma pramitam syāt
translated: If the production of silver were known to be true.

analyzed: pratītim tu prakāra antareṇa upapādayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: We shall explain the cognition in another way.

analyzed: na dvitīyaḥ
translated: Not the second.

analyzed: pūrva rajatasya api tat eva kāraṇam iti rajata pratīti pravāha aviccheda prasaṅgāt
translated: Because the same cause is for the previous silver also, there would be the undesirable contingency of the continuity of the cognition of silver.

analyzed: na tṛtīyaḥ
translated: Not the third.

analyzed: atiprasaṅgāt
translated: Because of the undesirable contingency of over-extension.

analyzed: tat evam bhrānti bādhayoḥ anupapatteḥ na pariṇāma pakṣaḥ yuktaḥ
translated: Thus, because error and contradiction are not possible, the theory of modification is not proper.

analyzed: nā api vastunaḥ vastu antara ātmanā avabhāsaḥ nyathā khyātiḥ iti yuktam
translated: Nor is it proper to say that the appearance of an entity in the form of another entity is false cognition.

original: tathā hi kiṃ vastuno vastvantarātmanā satī utāsatī /
analyzed: tathā hi kim vastunaḥ vastu antarātmanā satī uta asatī
translated: Thus, is the form of another entity of an entity existent or non-existent?

analyzed: ādye na bhrāntiḥ na api bādhaḥ
translated: In the first case, there is neither error nor contradiction.

analyzed: sarveṣām ca sarvam sarva ātmanā pratīyeta
translated: And everything would be cognized in all forms by everyone.

analyzed: na hi doṣaḥ karaṇa saṃskāraḥ
translated: For, the defect is not a modification of the instrument.

analyzed: tathā sati aduṣya kāraṇena na kiñcid upalabhyeta
translated: If it were so, nothing would be perceived by the non-defective cause.

analyzed: kiñca evam sati rajata saṃvid samīcīnā śuktiḥ evā iyam iti ca asamīcīnā iti āpadyeta
translated: Moreover, in that case, it would follow that the cognition of silver is correct and the cognition that this is merely a shell is incorrect.

analyzed: na dvitīyaḥ
translated: Not the second.

analyzed: asataḥ pratīti anupapatteḥ
translated: Because the cognition of the non-existent is not possible.

analyzed: upapattau vā kim rajatasya api vastu tva grahaṇena
translated: If it were possible, then what is the use of grasping even silver as an entity?

analyzed: etena asambaddha viśeṣaṇa viśiṣṭa pratītiḥ anyathā khyātiḥ iti nirastam
translated: By this (argument) the theory that the cognition of an object qualified by an irrelevant attribute is a case of misapprehension is refuted.

analyzed: asataḥ viśeṣaṇa sambandhasya pratīti anupapatteḥ
translated: Because the relation of an attribute with a non-existent object cannot give rise to a cognition.

analyzed: upapattau vā kim asat khyāti vādibhiḥ apara arddham
translated: If it could, then what is the use of the advocates of the theory of misapprehension of the non-existent?

analyzed: atha brūṣe nyākāram jñānam anyathā khyātiḥ iti
translated: If you say that a cognition having a different form is a case of misapprehension,

analyzed: tat asat
translated: that is wrong.

analyzed: samīcīna jñānasya api āntara bāhya tva ādinā rtha vilakṣaṇa ākāra tvena vibhrama tva āpatteḥ
translated: Because even a correct cognition, being different from the object in having internal and external forms, etc., would become a case of illusion.

analyzed: anya ākāra ullekhi jñānam anya ālambanam anyathā khyātiḥ iti tu viruddham
translated: But it is contradictory to say that a cognition having a different form and having a different object is a case of misapprehension.

analyzed: tathā hi
translated: Because,

original: na tāvatsadasadbhāvamātreṇālambanaṃ sadbhāvamātrasya sarvavastupratyayasādhāraṇyena sarvapratyayānāṃ sarvārthālambanatvāpatteḥ /
analyzed: na tāvat sat asat bhāva mātreṇa ālambanam sadbhāva mātrasya sarva vastu pratyaya sādhāraṇyena sarva pratyayānām sarva artha ālambana tva āpatteḥ
translated: first of all, an object cannot be the substratum merely by being existent or non-existent, because mere existence being common to all things, all cognitions would have all objects as their substrata.

analyzed: sarvam sarvajña tā ca evam sati syāt
translated: In that case, everything would be known by everyone.

analyzed: atīta ādi viṣayasya nirālambana tā āpātaḥ ca
translated: And the cognition of past, etc., objects would be without a substratum.

analyzed: etena purodeśe sadbhāvena ālambana tvam api pratyuktam
translated: By this, the theory that an object is the substratum by existing in the place in front is also refuted.

analyzed: na ca kāraṇa tvena ālambanam
translated: And an object cannot be the substratum by being the cause.

analyzed: rūpa ādi jñānasya cakṣuḥ ādi api kāraṇam iti tad ālambana tva prasaṅgāt
translated: And since the eye, etc. are also causes of the knowledge of form, etc., it would follow that they are its objects.

analyzed: atīta anāgata viṣaya tvam ca jñānasya na syāt
translated: And knowledge would not have past and future objects,

analyzed: atīta anāgatayoḥ asattvena kāraṇa tva anupapatteḥ
translated: because it is not possible for them to be causes, since the past and future do not exist.

analyzed: etena viṣaya tayā kāraṇa tvam iti api nirastam
translated: By this, the claim that they are causes by way of being objects is also refuted.

analyzed: ātma āśraya tvam ca evam sati syāt
translated: And in that case, there would be the fault of self-dependence,

analyzed: viṣaya tvasya eva nirūpyamāṇa tvāt
translated: because the very nature of being an object is being determined.

analyzed: kiñca evam viṣaya tvam iti eva astu
translated: Moreover, in this way, let there just be the nature of being an object.

analyzed: kim kāraṇatayā vyarthayā anartha jananyā
translated: What is the use of the useless cause that generates harm, by way of being a cause?

analyzed: kim ca idam viṣaya tvam
translated: What is this nature of being an object?

original: yena yasyātiśaya utpadyate sa tasya viṣaya iti cet /
analyzed: yena yasya atiśayaḥ utpadyate sa tasya viṣayaḥ iti ced
translated: If it is said that that which produces a special quality in something is its object,

original: atiśayo hi jñātatā vā syādvayavahāro vā /
analyzed: atiśayaḥ hi jñātatā vā syāt vayavahāraḥ vā
translated: then a special quality would be either cognition or convention.

analyzed: na ādyaḥ
translated: Not the first,

analyzed: anabhyupagamāt  abhyupagame pi atīta ādi jñānasya nirviṣaya tva āpātāt
translated: because it is not accepted.🔽Even if it is accepted, the knowledge of the past, etc. would be without an object,

analyzed: na hi asati dharmiṇi dharma utpādaḥ yujyate
translated: because the arising of a quality is not possible when the substratum does not exist.

analyzed: na dvitīyaḥ
translated: Not the second,

analyzed: a tad arthinaḥ vyavahāra anutpattau aviṣaya tva āpatteḥ
translated: because if a convention does not arise for one who does not desire that, it would follow that it is not an object.

analyzed: vyāghra cora ādi jñāna anantaram ādīyamānasya daṇḍa ādeḥ api tad viṣaya tva prasakteḥ ca
translated: And because it would follow that even a stick, etc. that is taken up after the knowledge of a tiger, a thief, etc. is its object.

analyzed: yat vijñānam yad ākāram tat tat ālambanam iti tu tathāgata matam anudhāvati
translated: But the doctrine of the Tathāgata (Buddha) runs thus: That cognition which has such and such an aspect has such and such an object.

analyzed: yat sannikṛṣṭa karaṇena yat jñānam janyate tat tad viṣayam iti api na
translated: Nor is it that the object of a cognition is that with which the instrument of cognition is in contact.

analyzed: rūpa ādi jñānasya ākāśa ādi viṣaya tā āpātāt
translated: For then the cognition of colour, etc. would have space, etc. as its object.

original: nahi rūpādijñānamutpādayaccakṣurākāśādinā na sannikṛṣṭata iti yujyate /
analyzed: nahi rūpa ādi jñānam utpādayat cakṣuḥ ākāśa ādinā na sannikṛṣṭataḥ iti yujyate
translated: For it is not proper to say that the eye, which produces the cognition of colour, etc., is not in contact with space, etc.

original: pratyabhijñā ca tattāsannikṛṣṭakaraṇajanyā na tadviṣayā syāt /
analyzed: pratyabhijñā ca tattā sannikṛṣṭa karaṇa janyā na tad viṣayā syāt
translated: And the recognition produced by the instrument in contact with that (object) would not have that (object) as its object.

analyzed: na ca vākyam vākya arthena sannikṛṣṭate
translated: And a sentence is not in contact with the meaning of the sentence.

analyzed: yena tad janita jñānasya vākya arthaḥ viṣayaḥ syāt
translated: By which the cognition produced by it would have the meaning of the sentence as its object.

analyzed: ākāśa ādi viṣaya tā evam ca āpadyeta
translated: And then it would follow that it has space, etc. as its object.

analyzed: liṅga jñānāt ca ātma sannikṛṣṭāt jāyamānam liṅgi jñānam ātma viṣayam āpadyeta
translated: And the cognition of the inferred object produced from the cognition of the mark in contact with the self would have the self as its object.

analyzed: tasmāt yat jñānam yat pratibhāsam tat eva tasya ālambanam iti mantavyam
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that the object of a cognition is that which appears in it.

original: tatra rajatajñāne śuktiravabhāsate na veti vaktavyam /
analyzed: tatra rajata jñāne śuktiḥ avabhāsate na vā iti vaktavyam
translated: In that case, it should be said whether silver appears in the cognition of silver or not.

original: avabhāsata iti bruvāṇaḥ ślāghanīyaprajño devānāṃ priyaḥ /
analyzed: avabhāsate iti bruvāṇaḥ ślāghanīya prajñaḥ devānām priyaḥ
translated: One who says it appears is a person of praiseworthy wisdom, dear to the gods.

original: yadi saṃvidi bahumānavānneti brūyāttadā kathaṃ tacchuktikālambanaṃ syāt /
analyzed: yadi saṃvidi bahu mānavān na iti brūyāt tadā katham tat śuktikā ālambanam syāt
translated: If one were to say that it is not so, because of the high regard for consciousness, then how could it be the basis of mother-of-pearl?

original: kiñca rajatamavabhāsate śuktikālambanaṃ cedatiprasaṅgaḥ kataṃ pariharaṇīyaḥ /
analyzed: kiñca rajatam avabhāsate śuktikā ālambanam ced atiprasaṅgaḥ pariharaṇīyaḥ
translated: Moreover, if silver appears and is the basis of mother-of-pearl, how can the over-extension be avoided?

original: nanu rajatāvabhāsasya rajataviṣayakatve tena rajatena bhavitavyam /
analyzed: nanu rajata avabhāsasya rajata viṣayaka tve tena rajatena bhavitavyam
translated: But if the appearance of silver is of silver, then there must be that silver.

analyzed: katham na bhavitavyam  nahi sampratipanna samīcīna rajata svīkāre pi nimittam asti anyat rajata avabhāsāt
translated: How can it not exist?🔽For even when accepting the commonly recognized correct silver, there is no other cause than the appearance of silver.

analyzed: na hi anyatara rajata pratibhāsa pakṣapāte kāraṇam asti
translated: For there is no reason for favoring the appearance of one or the other silver.

analyzed: na asti atra rajatam iti api pratibhāsaḥ u sti iti ced
translated: If it is argued that there is also the appearance there is no silver here,

analyzed: satyam
translated: that is true.

analyzed: pratibhāsa sāmarthyāt rajata abhāvaḥ pi aṅgīkṛtaḥ eva puratas
translated: By the power of appearance, the absence of silver is also accepted right in front.

analyzed: pratītyoḥ virodhaḥ syāt iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that there would be a contradiction between the two cognitions, that is not so.

analyzed: yathā na virodhaḥ tathā vakṣyamāṇa tvāt
translated: Because it will be explained how there is no contradiction.

analyzed: na ca anyathā khyāti janane kāraṇam paśyāmaḥ
translated: And we do not see a cause for the production of mistaken cognition.

analyzed: na ca cakṣuḥ ādikam eva kāraṇam
translated: And the eye, etc. are not the cause.

analyzed: tasya samīcīna jñāna karaṇa tā avadhāraṇāt
translated: Because it is determined that they are the instruments of correct knowledge.

original: na khalu jarāmaraṇavidhvaṃsaheturjātu sudhā taddheturapi bhavati /
analyzed: na khalu jarā maraṇa vidhvaṃsa hetuḥ jātu sudhā tad hetuḥ api bhavati
translated: For nectar is never the cause of the destruction of old age and death, nor is it their cause.

analyzed: kāraṇa aikye kārya bhedasya ākasmika tva prasaṅgāt
translated: Because if the cause were one, the difference in the effect would be accidental.

analyzed: na ca adṛṣṭa bhedāt kārya bhedaḥ
translated: And the difference in the effect is not due to the difference in the unseen [force].

analyzed: tasya kārya bheda niścaya uttara kālam niśceya tvāt
translated: Because that [unseen force] is to be ascertained after the ascertainment of the difference in the effect.

analyzed: kārya bhedasya ca vipratipanna tvāt
translated: And because the difference in the effect is disputed.

analyzed: doṣa sahakṛtāt indriyāt eva anyathā jñāna jananam iti api asat
translated: It is also wrong to say that knowledge of a different kind arises from the sense organs etc. in association with defects.

analyzed: doṣāḥ hi kāraṇānām autsargika kārya janana sāmarthyam nighnanti  na tu viparīta kārya janana sāmarthyam ādadhāti
