translated: For defects destroy the inherent power of the causes to produce their usual effects.🔽But they do not impart the power to produce an effect that is contrary [to the usual one].

original: na khalu duṣyaṃ kuṭajabījaṃ vaṭaṃ janayati /
analyzed: na khalu duṣyam kuṭaja bījam vaṭam janayati
translated: For a defective kutaja seed does not produce a banyan tree.

analyzed: kim nāma na janayati eva kuṭaja aṅkuram
translated: What does it not produce at all? A kutaja sprout.

analyzed: na ca vaktavyam dāva dahana dagdha vetra bījānām kadalī kāṇḍa janana sāmarthyam upalabdham iti
translated: And it should not be said that the power to produce plantain shoots is observed in bamboo seeds burnt by a forest fire.

analyzed: pākena dravya antara utpatteḥ teṣām abīja tvāt
translated: Because a different substance arises from cooking, and those [seeds] are not seeds.

original: kiñca pradarśitākāravyabhicāre pratyayasya sarvatra vyabhicāraśaṅkā durvārā syāt /
analyzed: kiñca pradarśita ākāra vyabhicāre pratyayasya sarvatra vyabhicāra śaṅkā durvārā syāt
translated: Moreover, when there is deviation from the presented form, the suspicion of deviation everywhere in [the cognition] would be irresistible.

original: tathāca kathaṃ bāhyārthaninhavaṃ nirākurmaḥ /🔽tathāhi jñānameva khalu sarvatra vastuvyavasthāpakaṃ nānyat /
analyzed: tathā ca katham bāhya artha ninhavam nirākurmaḥ  tathā hi jñānam eva khalu sarvatra vastu vyavasthāpakam na anyat
translated: And how can we then deny the existence of external objects?🔽For thus, indeed, knowledge alone is the determiner of all things, and nothing else.

analyzed: tat ced kvacid vayabhicarati
translated: And if that [knowledge] errs somewhere,

analyzed: tadā tat sarvatra śaṅkita vyabhicāram eva
translated: then it is to be suspected of error everywhere.

analyzed: na ca tat śaṅkā paṅka saṅkṣālana kṣamam kiñcid anyat vijñānāt
translated: And nothing other than knowledge is able to wash away the stain of that suspicion.

analyzed: tat ca sakalam api śaṅkā kalaṅka saṅkocita prabhāvam na prabhavati iti uktam
translated: And it has been said that all of that [knowledge] is not powerful enough to remove the stain of suspicion.

analyzed: tatas ca kutas bāhya artha pratyāśā
translated: And from that, how can there be hope for external objects?

original: naca vācyaṃ yathā ghaṭādeḥ pārthivasya vahnivyabhicāre 'pi na dhūmasyāpi tadvayabhicāraḥ śaṅkayate /
analyzed: naca vācyam yathā ghaṭa ādeḥ pārthivasya vahni vyabhicāre na dhūmasya api tad vayabhicāraḥ śaṅkayate
translated: And it should not be said that just as, in the case of a pot and so on which are earthen, even when there is deviation from fire, the deviation of smoke from that [fire] is not suspected,

analyzed: evam eka jñānasya artha vyabhicāre pi na sarvatra vyabhicāra śaṅkā iti
translated: in the same way, even when there is deviation of one cognition from the object, there is no suspicion of deviation everywhere.

analyzed: vaiṣamyāt
translated: [This is] because of inequality.

original: asti hi tatra pārthivatvāviśeṣe 'pyavyabhicāraniścayopāyo dhūmatvādirevāvāntaro viśeṣaḥ /
analyzed: asti hi tatra pārthiva tva aviśeṣe pi avyabhicāra niścaya upāyaḥ dhūma tva ādiḥ eva avāntaraḥ viśeṣaḥ
translated: For there is indeed a means of ascertaining non-deviation even in the absence of a particular earthiness, namely, the specific property of being smoke and so on.

analyzed: nahi tatra bādhakam kiñcid
translated: For there is no contradiction there [in the case of smoke].

analyzed: tena upapadyate tatra āśvāsaḥ
translated: Therefore, confidence is possible there [in the case of smoke].

analyzed: prakṛte tu na jñāna tva avāntara viśeṣam anāśvāsa nirasana kṣamam īkṣāmahe
translated: But in the case in question we do not see any particular kind of knowledge which can remove the distrust.

analyzed: na ca bādhaka bhāva abhāva rūpāt viśeṣāt vayavasthā iti vācyam
translated: And it cannot be said that there is a distinction due to the presence or absence of contradiction.

analyzed: bādhakasya api jñāna tvena śaṅkā āspada tvāt
translated: Because even contradiction is a kind of knowledge and is therefore open to doubt.

analyzed: na khalu bādhakasya kim api śṛṅgam asti
translated: Indeed, there is no horn at all of contradiction.

analyzed: bādhaka abhāvaḥ ca anupasañjāta bādha bhrame samānaḥ
translated: And the absence of contradiction is the same in a delusion where contradiction has not yet arisen.

analyzed: saṃvādaka bhāva abhāvābhyām viśeṣaḥ iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that the distinction is due to the presence or absence of agreement, that is not so.

original: uktottaratvāt /🔽saṃvādakamapi jñānameveti tadapi kathaṃ saṃśayāspadaṃ na syāt /
analyzed: ukta uttara tvāt  saṃvādakam api jñānam evā iti tat api katham saṃśaya āspadam na syāt
translated: Because the answer has been given.🔽Even agreement is a kind of knowledge, so how can that also not be the basis of doubt?

analyzed: tatra api saṃvādaka antara anveṣaṇe navasthā kutas na bhavet
translated: And how could there not be an infinite regress in that case too, if one were to search for another agreement?

analyzed: aṅgīkṛtaḥ ca pareṇa dhārāvāhika bhrame nyonya saṃvādaḥ
translated: And mutual agreement in a series of delusions is accepted by the opponent.

analyzed: etena jñāna janya vyavahāra visaṃvāda avisaṃvāda lakṣaṇaḥ pi viśeṣaḥ parāstaḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: By this, the distinction characterized by the agreement or disagreement of the cognition-generated convention should also be refuted, it should be understood.

analyzed: tad viśeṣa grāhiṇī api viśvāsa kāraṇa abhāvāt
translated: Because there is no cause for confidence even in the one who perceives that distinction.

original: api ca pratīyamāno 'yaṃ rajatākāraḥ kutastya iti vaktavyam /
analyzed: api ca pratīyamānaḥ yam rajata ākāraḥ kutastyaḥ iti vaktavyam
translated: Moreover, it should be said from where this silver-form that is being cognized comes.

analyzed: na tāvat purovarti niṣṭhaḥ iti iṣyam anyathā khyāti vādinām
translated: It cannot be said that it is in the object in front, for the proponents of erroneous cognition do not accept that.

analyzed: bādha virodhaḥ ca tathā sati syāt
translated: And there would be contradiction with the sublating cognition, if that were so.

analyzed: na api deśa antara varti iti vakṣyāmaḥ
translated: Nor can it be said to be in a different place, as we shall explain.

analyzed: tatas ca jñāna sthaḥ eva ayam iti āpatitam
translated: Therefore, it follows that it must be in the cognition itself.

analyzed: tathā ca jitam sa ākāra vijñāna vādibhiḥ bauddhaiḥ
translated: And thus the Buddhists who propound the theory of cognition with forms have won.

analyzed: nanu tarhi idam rajatam ityādi pratyayasya kā gatiḥ
translated: But then, what is the explanation of the cognition this is silver and so on?

analyzed: ucyate
translated: We reply:

analyzed: rajatam idam iti dve jñāne smṛti anubhava rūpe
translated: There are two cognitions, in the form of memory and experience, this is silver.

analyzed: tatra idam iti purovarti dravya mātra grahaṇam  doṣa vaśāt tad gatasya śukti tva sāmānya viśeṣasya agrahaṇāt  tatra idam iti purovarti dravya mātra grahaṇam
translated: Among them, this is the apprehension of the mere substance in front.

analyzed: doṣa vaśāt tad gatasya śukti tva sāmānya viśeṣasya agrahaṇāt
translated: Due to a defect, the specific universal mother-of-pearl belonging to that is not apprehended.

original: tanmātraṃ ca gṛhītaṃ sadṛśatayā saṃskārodbodhakrameṇa rajatasmṛtiṃ janayati /
analyzed: tanmātram ca gṛhītam sadṛśa tayā saṃskāra udbodha krameṇa rajata smṛtim janayati
translated: And that mere [substance] which is grasped, by the process of arousing a trace, produces the memory of silver as similar.

analyzed: sā ca gṛhīta grahaṇa svabhāvā api doṣa vaśāt gṛhīta tatta aṃśa pramoṣeṇa gṛhīti sarūpā avatiṣṭhate
translated: And that [memory], although of the nature of grasping what is already grasped, due to a defect, stands as having the form of grasping, by the loss of the already grasped part [of the memory].

original: tathāca rajatasmṛteḥ purovṛttigrahaṇasya ca mithaḥ svarūpato viṣayataśca bhedāgrahaṇātsannihitarajatajñānasārūpyeṇedaṃ
analyzed: tathā ca rajata smṛteḥ purovṛtti grahaṇasya ca mithas svarūpataḥ viṣayataḥ ca bheda agrahaṇāt sannihita rajata jñāna sārūpyeṇa idam
translated: And so, because there is non-apprehension of the difference between the memory of silver and the apprehension of what is present in front, due to similarity with the knowledge of silver that is present,

original: rajatamiti bhinne api grahaṇasmaraṇe abhedavyavahāraṃ sāmānādhikaraṇyavyapadeśaṃ ca pravataryataḥ /
analyzed: rajatam iti bhinne api grahaṇa smaraṇe abheda vyavahāram sāmānādhikaraṇya vyapadeśam ca
translated: there is the usage of non-difference and the designation of co-reference even in the apprehension and memory that are different, in the form this is silver.

analyzed: kutas etat iti ced na
translated: If it is asked how is this so?, it is not so.

analyzed: anyathā anupapatteḥ ukta tvāt
translated: Because it has been said that it is not otherwise possible.

analyzed: kiñca idam iti purovarti nayana samprayoga jam jñānam anubhavaḥ iti avivādam
translated: Moreover, it is undisputed that this is the knowledge arising from the contact of the eye with what is in front, and is experience.

analyzed: rajata jñānam ca na tāvat indriya jam
translated: And the knowledge of silver is not produced by the sense organ.

analyzed: indriyasya sannikṛṣṭa athar eva jñāna janana sāmarthyāt
translated: Because the sense organ has the capacity to produce knowledge only of what is in close proximity.

analyzed: anyathā sarva sārvajña prasaṅgāt
translated: Otherwise, there would be the absurd consequence of everyone knowing everything.

analyzed: na ca viprakṛṣṭena rajatena sannikarṣaḥ sti
translated: And there is no proximity with the distant silver.

analyzed: tad kāryasya sākṣātkārasya kadāpi adarśanāt
translated: Because the effect of that, i.e., direct perception, is never seen.

analyzed: na ca śukti śakala sannikarṣāt eva indriyam rajata jñānam utpādayati iti sāmpratam
translated: And it is not correct that the sense organ produces the knowledge of silver only from the proximity of the piece of mother-of-pearl.

analyzed: atiprasaṅgāt
translated: Because it leads to absurdity.

analyzed: na ca doṣa sat asat bhāvābhyām vyavasthā
translated: And there is no restriction based on the presence or absence of defects.

analyzed: doṣāṇām viparīta kārya kāri tayā nirasta tvāt
translated: Because the faults have been refuted by producing effects contrary to their nature.

analyzed: bhasmaka doṣa dūṣitasya jāṭhara jātavedasaḥ bahutara āhāra pariṇati hetu tā upalabhyate iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that it is observed that the gastric fire, tainted by the fault of ashes, is the cause of the transformation of much food, it is not so.

analyzed: vipratipatteḥ
translated: Because of contradiction.

analyzed: doṣasya eva āhāra vikāra hetu tā upapatteḥ
translated: Because it is reasonable that the fault itself is the cause of the transformation of food.

original: naca dahanakāryaṃ kathaṃ doṣaḥ karotīti vācyam /
analyzed: na ca dahana kāryam katham doṣaḥ karoti iti vācyam
translated: And it should not be said how the fault produces the effect of burning.

analyzed: kārye pi vaijātya upalambhāt
translated: Because even in the effect, a difference in kind is observed.

original: jāṭharāgnipariṇatā hi rasāḥ śarīropacayahetavo na bhasmakapariṇatāstathā /
analyzed: jāṭhara agni pariṇatāḥ hi rasāḥ śarīra upacaya hetavaḥ na bhasmaka pariṇatāḥ tathā
translated: For the juices transformed by the gastric fire are the causes of the nourishment of the body, not those transformed by ashes.

analyzed: tasmāt na idam indriya jam
translated: Therefore, this is not produced by the sense organs.

analyzed: liṅga ādi anusandhāna vidhurāṇām api jāyamānam anumāna ādi prabhavam iti vaktum śakyate
translated: And it cannot be said that it arises even in those who are devoid of the recollection of inference etc., and is therefore produced by inference etc.

analyzed: atas pratyutpanna karaṇa abhāve pi utpadyamānena anena pariśeṣāt smaraṇena eva bhavitavyam
translated: Therefore, even in the absence of the present means, this which is being produced must necessarily be a memory by the method of difference.

analyzed: kiñca idam smaraṇam an ākalita rajatasya anutpadyamāna tvāt sampratipanna smaraṇa vat
translated: Moreover, this memory is like the accepted memory, because it does not arise in one who has not experienced silver.

analyzed: na ca idam asmaraṇam
translated: And this is not non-memory.

analyzed: tatta aṃśa vikala tvāt sampratipanna vat iti yuktam
translated: It is reasonable to say that it is like the accepted [memory] because it lacks the part of that [silver].

original: padātpadārthasmṛtau hariharādismṛtau ca vyabhicārāt kiñcānubhūtaṃ tāvanna samastaṃ smaryate /
analyzed: padāt padārtha smṛtau hari hara ādi smṛtau ca vyabhicārāt kiñca anubhūtam tāvat na samastam smaryate
translated: Because there is deviation in the recollection of a word and the recollection of Hari, Hara, etc. Moreover, not the entire experienced object is remembered.

analyzed: tattā aṃśaḥ ca atīta deśa kāla sambandhaḥ smaryamāṇa dharmaḥ
translated: And that part which is the relation to the past place and time is the attribute of the remembered object.

analyzed: tathā ca smaraṇam ca bhavatu  bhavatu doṣa vaśāt pramuṣita tad tad aṃśam
translated: And let there be recollection in that way.🔽Let it be that the part of that [relation] is lost due to a fault.

analyzed: na ca vipakṣe bādhakam kiñcid iti aprayojakaḥ hetuḥ
translated: And there is no counter-evidence in the contrary case. Therefore, the reason is not inconclusive.

analyzed: na ca nā iyam smṛtiḥ indriya janya tvāt
translated: And this is not memory, because it is produced by the sense organs.

analyzed: tat ca indriya vyāpāra anvaya vyatireka anuvidhāyi tvāt iti vācyam
translated: And that is because it conforms to the presence and absence of the operation of the sense organs. This cannot be said.

analyzed: smṛti bīja saṃskāra udbodha hetu purovarti sādhāraṇa ākāra grahaṇe eva indriya vyāpāra anvaya vyatirekayoḥ upakṣīṇa tvāt
translated: Because the conformity to the presence and absence of the operation of the sense organs is exhausted in the mere apprehension of the common form that awakens the seed of memory, the impression.

original: nanvevaṃ satyanāsvāditatiktasya śiśostiktasmaraṇānupapatteḥ kathaṃ tikto guḍa iti pratyaya iti cenna /
analyzed: nanu evam sati anāsvādita tiktasya śiśoḥ tikta smaraṇa anupapatteḥ katham tiktaḥ guḍaḥ iti pratyayaḥ iti ced na
translated: If that is so, then how is the idea bitter is sugar possible, since the child who has not tasted the bitter [substance] cannot remember it? This is not so.

analyzed: janma antara anubhūta tvāt
translated: Because it was experienced in a previous birth.

analyzed: adṛṣṭa vaśāt ca kasyacid eva smaraṇam upapadyate
translated: And the memory of someone arises by the power of the unseen [impressions].

original: athavā nāyaṃ niyamo grahaṇasmaraṇe evāgṛhītaviveke vyavahārādipravartake iti kintu kvacidgrahaṇe eva mitho 'gṛhītabhede /
analyzed: athavā na ayam niyamaḥ grahaṇa smaraṇe eva agṛhīta viveke vyavahāra ādi pravartake iti kintu kvacid grahaṇe eva mithas gṛhīta bhede
translated: Or, this rule does not apply only to the apprehension and recollection of things not distinguished, which give rise to practical activity etc., but to any apprehension at all of things whose difference is not grasped.

analyzed: yathā pītaḥ śaṅkhaḥ iti
translated: For example, the conch is yellow.

original: atra hi viniryannayanaraśmivartinaḥ pittadravyasya pītatvaṃ doṣavaśāddravyarahitaṃ gṛhyate /
analyzed: atra hi viniryat nayana raśmi vartinaḥ pitta dravyasya pīta tvam doṣa vaśāt dravya rahitam gṛhyate
translated: For here, the yellowness of the bile substance present in the light rays emanating from the eye is grasped as devoid of substance due to a fault.

analyzed: śaṅkhaḥ pi guṇa hīnaḥ sva rūpa mātreṇa gṛhyate
translated: The conch also is grasped merely in its own form, devoid of qualities.

analyzed: tat anayoḥ guṇa guṇinoḥ itaretara apekṣiṇoḥ a saṃsarga agrahāt sārūpyāt pīta cira bilva ādi phala pratyaya aviśeṣeṇa abheda vyavahāraḥ sāmānādhikaraṇya vyapadeśaḥ ca  bhavataḥ
translated: Due to the non-apprehension of the non-combination of these two, quality and qualified, which depend on each other, there is the usage of non-difference and the designation of co-reference, without distinction of the notion of yellow chiravilva fruit etc. due to similarity.

analyzed: yat tu kajjala kālima grahaṇam tat tiryak avasthānāt
translated: But the apprehension of the blackness of lampblack is due to its horizontal position.

analyzed: asvaccha tayā nayana raśmi pratibandhaka tvāt ca
translated: And because it obstructs the light rays of the eye due to its lack of transparency.

original: pittaṃ tu ājarvāvasthitaṃ kācamiva svacchaṃ na pratibandhakamiti viśeṣaḥ /
analyzed: pittam tu ājarva avasthitam kācam iva svaccham na pratibandhakam iti viśeṣaḥ
translated: But bile, when in a horizontal position, is transparent like glass and does not obstruct, so there is a difference.

analyzed: evam tiktaḥ guḍaḥ iti
translated: Similarly, the usage the molasses is bitter is also like that.

analyzed: kvacid punar smaraṇe eva agṛhīta viveke
translated: But in some cases, it is only in the recollection of things not distinguished.

original: yathā sa ghaṭastatrāsīditi /🔽anayaiva diśālātacakrādivyavahārāḥ sarve 'pi nirvāhyāḥ / /
analyzed: yathā sa ghaṭaḥ tatra āsīt iti  anayā eva diśā alāta cakra ādi vyavahārāḥ sarve nirvāhyāḥ
translated: As when it is said, 'That pot existed there.'🔽In this very way, all usages such as 'the stick-man' and 'the wheel' should be explained.

analyzed: kiñca viparyayam aṅgīkurvāṇena api viveka agrahaḥ grāhyaḥ eva
translated: Moreover, even one who accepts error must accept the non-apprehension of difference itself as the object of error.

analyzed: na hi viveka grahe viparyaya avakāśaḥ sti
translated: For when there is the apprehension of difference, there is no scope for error,

analyzed: virodhāt
translated: because of contradiction.

analyzed: anyathā viparyaya nivṛtti anupapatteḥ
translated: Otherwise, the cessation of error would be impossible.

original: tathāca tata eva sarvasyopapattau kiṃ viparyayakalpanayā /
analyzed: tathā ca tatas eva sarvasya upapattau kim viparyaya kalpanayā
translated: And so, if everything is possible by that alone, what is the use of postulating error?

analyzed: na ca anyathā ākhyātau kim api pramāṇam asti
translated: And there is no valid cognition at all in the case of misapprehension.

analyzed: bheda agraha prasajjita abheda vyavahāra bādhanena eva nā idam iti viveka jñānasya bādhaka tvam api upapadyate
translated: The knowledge of difference as 'this' is also logically possible as the sublater of the usage of non-difference, which is based on the non-apprehension of difference.

original: tadupapattau cāgṛhītavivekasya jñānadvayasya bhrāntitvamapi lokasiddhaṃ siddham /
analyzed: tad upapattau ca agṛhīta vivekasya jñāna dvayasya bhrānti tvam api loka siddham siddham
translated: And when that is logically possible, the fact that the two cognitions which do not apprehend difference are erroneous is also established by what is accepted in the world.

analyzed: tathā ca prayogaḥ  vigīta pratyayaḥ yathārthaḥ
translated: And so the argument is as follows.🔽The cognition of what is distinguished is valid.

analyzed: pratyaya tvāt sampratipanna vat
translated: Because it is a cognition, like what is accepted.

original: nanvatra vigītapratyayo nāma kiṃ purovartinirvikalpakajñānamuta sadṛśadarśanotthaṃ rajarasmaraṇam /
analyzed: nanu atra vigīta pratyayaḥ nāma kim purovarti nirvikalpaka jñānam uta sadṛśa darśana uttham rajara smaraṇam
translated: But here, what is the cognition of what is distinguished? Is it the non-conceptual cognition of what is in front, or is it the memory of rust arising from seeing something similar?

analyzed: kim vā ubhayam āhosvit rajata purovarti ekatā jñānam āhosvit pramuṣita bhedam vedana dvayam
translated: Is it both? Or is it the cognition of oneness in front of silver? Or is it the cognition of difference that has been forgotten?

analyzed: tatra ādya pakṣa traye siddha sādhana tā
translated: In the first three cases, it is the establishment of what is already established.

analyzed: caturthe vā ādi āśraya asiddha tvam apasiddhāntaḥ vyāghātaḥ ca
translated: In the fourth, there is the unestablished basis for the proponent, the doctrine of the established, and contradiction.

analyzed: pañcame prativādi āśraya siddha tā iti ced
translated: If it is argued that in the fifth, there is the established basis for the opponent,

analyzed: mā evam
translated: that is not so.

analyzed: asti tāvat purovarti nirvikalpaka jñānam
translated: There is indeed the non-conceptual cognition in front.

original: asti ca sadṛśapurovartidarśanajanitā rajatasmṛtiḥ /🔽tathāstyeva ca tatsamutthaṃ savikalpakamidamiti vedanātsavivādabhedābhedaṃ rajatavedanam /
analyzed: asti ca sadṛśa purovarti darśana janitā rajata smṛtiḥ  tathā asti eva ca tat samuttham sa vikalpakam idam iti vedanāt sa vivāda bheda abhedam rajata vedanam
translated: And there is the memory of silver produced by the perception of a similar object in front.🔽And there is indeed the conceptual cognition arising from that, the cognition of silver with difference, which is disputed, because of the cognition this is silver and the usage of co-reference such as this is silver.

original: tatra vipratipannau bhedābhedau vihāyedaṃ rajatamityavagamamātramidaṃ rajatamityādisāmānādhikaraṇyavyavahārakāraṇaṃ pakṣatvena vivakṣitaṃ cetko
analyzed: tatra vipratipannau bheda abhedau vihāya idam rajatam iti avagama mātram idam rajatam ityādi sāmānādhikaraṇya vyavahāra kāraṇam pakṣa tvena vivakṣitam ced kaḥ
translated: If the difference and non-difference that are disputed are set aside and only the understanding this is silver is intended as the subject, what

analyzed: virodhaḥ
translated: contradiction is there?

analyzed: nahi vipratipanna ākāreṇa eva pakṣīkāraḥ kvacid
translated: For the subject is not taken with the disputed form anywhere.

analyzed: mā hi bhūt nitya anitya agnimat anagnimat śabda parvata pakṣīkāre prakṛta doṣa anuṣaṅgāt bhaṅgaḥ nu māna mudrāyāḥ
translated: Let not the seal of inference be broken by the introduction of the eternal and non-eternal, the fiery and non-fiery, the mountain and the bird, as the subject, on account of the consequent introduction of the objections urged against the original proposition.

analyzed: kiñca siddhasya eva pakṣīkaraṇam
translated: Moreover, the subject is only what is admitted.

analyzed: vimata ākārasya api siddha tve kim sādhyeta
translated: If the form of the matter in dispute is also admitted, what is there to be proved?

analyzed: vimatau ca bheda abhedau vibhrama gocara vivāda avasare
translated: And in the matter in dispute, difference and non-difference are the objects of illusion, when there is dispute.

original: bhede hi vedanayoridaṃ vedanam purovatirmātragocaram na rajatavātā vetti /
analyzed: bhede hi vedanayoḥ idam vedanam purovatiḥ mātra gocaram na rajata vātāḥ vetti
translated: For if there is difference between the two cognitions, this cognition has for its object only the thing in front, and does not cognize silver.

original: rajatavedanamapi rajatamātragrāhi nedamiti purovartinamanūdya tasyaiva rajatatāmidaṃ rajatamiti /🔽vidadhāti /
analyzed: rajata vedanam api rajata mātra grāhi na idam iti purovartinam anūdya tasya eva rajata tām idam rajatam iti  vidadhāti
translated: And the cognition of silver also grasps only silver, and does not refer to the thing in front, and does not establish the silverness of that very thing, saying this is silver.

original: kintu rajatamityeva yasya kasyacidrajatatvamanusandhatte /🔽tacca na pramāṇaviruddhamiti kvānyathākhyātiḥ /🔽atastadvādibhirabheda eva vaktavyo 'pākartavyaścākhyātivādibhirityastyeva vipratipattiḥ /
analyzed: kintu rajatam iti eva yasya kasyacid rajata tvam anusandhatte  tat ca na pramāṇa viruddham iti kva anyathā khyātiḥ  atas tad vādibhiḥ abhedaḥ eva vaktavya u pākartavyaḥ ca akhyāti vādibhiḥ iti asti eva vipratipattiḥ
translated: But it merely thinks of the silverness of some silver or other.🔽And that is not contradicted by any means of valid knowledge. Where then is the other-cognition?🔽Therefore, those who maintain the doctrine of other-cognition must maintain non-difference, and those who maintain the doctrine of non-apprehension must abandon it. Thus there is indeed a dispute.

original: tato vipratipannākāraṃ parityajyedaṃ rajatamityavagamamātrapakṣīkāre na kaściddoṣaḥ /
analyzed: tatas vipratipanna ākāram parityajya idam rajatam iti avagama mātra pakṣīkāre na kaścid doṣaḥ
translated: Therefore, abandoning the disputed form, there is no fault in taking as the subject merely the cognition this is silver.

original: kathamanyathākhyātivādīdaṃ rajatamiti jñānasya purovartiviṣayatvasādhanāya sādhanamupanyasyannito doṣādvimucyeta /
analyzed: katham anyathā khyāti vādī idam rajatam iti jñānasya purovarti viṣaya tva sādhanāya sādhanam upanyasyan itas doṣāt vimucyeta
translated: Otherwise, how can the upholder of the theory of misapprehension escape the charge of futility when he adduces the following reason to prove that the judgment this is silver refers to the object in the vicinity, viz., the substratum of the above judgment is the mother-of-pearl which is present in the vicinity?🔽If the upholder of the above hypothesis argues that the judgment this is silver is the subject of inference and that he infers that the mother-of-pearl is the cause of the above judgment then he may be asked why does he beat about the bush?

original: atha rajatāthirnaḥ śuktikāyāṃ pravṛttau hetubhūtaṃ jñānaṃ mayā pakṣīkriyata iti cenmoccairvāccaḥ paro 'pi śroṣyati /🔽īśvarajñānena siddhasādhanatā syāditi cettavāpi bādhaḥ kathaṃ na syāt /🔽prakṛtapravṛttiheturanīśvarajñānaṃ pakṣīkriyata iti cenmamāpi tathaiva syāt /🔽tvayeśvarānabhyupagamādvayarthaṃ viśeṣaṇamiti cettarhi māṃ prati tavāpi kathaṃ na vyartham /
analyzed: atha rajatāthiḥ naḥ śuktikāyām pravṛttau hetu bhūtam jñānam mayā pakṣīkriyate iti ced mā uccais vāccaḥ śroṣyati  īśvara jñānena siddha sādhana tā syāt iti ced tava api bādhaḥ katham na syāt  prakṛta pravṛtti hetuḥ anīśvara jñānam pakṣīkriyate iti ced mama api tathā eva syāt  tvayā īśvara anabhyupagamāt vayartham viśeṣaṇam iti ced tarhi mām prati tava api katham na vyartham
translated: If the upholder of the above hypothesis argues that the judgment this is silver is the subject of inference and that he infers that the mother-of-pearl is the cause of the above judgment then he may be asked why does he beat about the bush?🔽If the upholder of the above hypothesis argues that the judgment this is silver is the subject of inference and that he infers that the mother-of-pearl is the cause of the above judgment then he may be asked why does he beat about the bush?🔽If the upholder of the above hypothesis argues that the judgment this is silver is the subject of inference and that he infers that the mother-of-pearl is the cause of the above judgment then he may be asked why does he beat about the bush?🔽If the upholder of the above hypothesis argues that the judgment this is silver is the subject of inference and that he infers that the mother-of-pearl is the cause of the above judgment then he may be asked why does he beat about the bush?🔽If the upholder of the above hypothesis argues that the judgment this is silver is the subject of inference and that he infers that the mother-of-pearl is the cause of the above judgment then he may be asked why does he beat about the bush?

original: tathāpi vyāptijñāne siddhasādhanateti cettatraiva tava bādhaprasaṅgaḥ /
analyzed: tathā api vyāpti jñāne siddhasādhana tā iti ced tatra eva tava bādha prasaṅgaḥ
translated: If the upholder of the above hypothesis argues that the judgment this is silver is the subject of inference and that he infers that the mother-of-pearl is the cause of the above judgment then he may be asked why does he beat about the bush?

analyzed: idam jñānāt agṛhīta vivekam rajata jñānam iti vipratipatti viṣayam uddhāṭayāmi iti ced samam etat mama api
translated: If the upholder of the above hypothesis argues that the judgment this is silver is the subject of inference and that he infers that the mother-of-pearl is the cause of the above judgment then he may be asked why does he beat

analyzed: kiñca vivāda adhyāsitam rajata jñānam rajata viṣayam rajata jñāna tvāt saṃmata vat
translated: Moreover, the cognition of silver, which is the subject of dispute, has silver for its object, because it is a cognition of silver, like the cognition of what is admitted.

analyzed: atra api pūrvavat vimati viṣayaḥ vivecanīyaḥ
translated: Here also, as before, the object of the doubt is to be examined.

analyzed: syāt etat
translated: Let this be so.

original: kimidaṃ rajatajñānaṃ nāma rajatasya jñānaṃ rajatajñānam /
analyzed: kim idam rajata jñānam nāma rajatasya jñānam rajata jñānam
translated: What is this called the cognition of silver? Is it the cognition of silver, the cognition of silver?

analyzed: rajatam ca tat jñānam ca iti vā
translated: Or is it silver and also knowledge?

original: rajataśabdollekhijñānaṃ vā rajatārthinaḥ pravṛttihetujñānaṃ vā rajatamiti jñānaṃ vā /
analyzed: rajata śabda ullekhi jñānam vā rajata arthinaḥ pravṛtti hetu jñānam vā rajatam iti jñānam vā
translated: Or is it the knowledge that leaves the impression of the word silver, or the knowledge that is the cause of activity for one who seeks silver, or the knowledge that silver exists?

analyzed: na prathamaḥ
translated: Not the first.

analyzed: ṣaṣṭhayarthasya viṣaṭa viṣayi bhāva vyatirekeṇa asambhavāt sādhya aviśiṣṭa tvāt
translated: Because the meaning of the genitive case is not possible except in the relation of object and subject, and because it is the same as the conclusion.

analyzed: na dvitīyaḥ
translated: Not the second.

analyzed: ubhaya asiddheḥ
translated: Because both are unestablished.

analyzed: jñānasya nirākāra tvāt
translated: Because knowledge is formless.

analyzed: na tṛtīyaḥ
translated: Not the third.

analyzed: ullekha arthasya viṣaya tve siddheḥ
translated: Because the meaning of the impression is not established as the object.

analyzed: tad jñāna janita smṛti mātra yoni tve pūrva pada mātra jñānena api rajata padasya smaraṇa sambhavena vyabhicārāt
translated: Because there is deviation, since the word silver can be remembered even by the mere knowledge of the first word, if it is the mere source of memory produced by that knowledge.

analyzed: na caturthaḥ
translated: Not the fourth.

analyzed: viveka graha vādinām idam iti jñānasya api śuktikā ālambanasya tad hetu tvena vyabhicārāt
translated: Because there is deviation, since the knowledge of this of those who maintain the apprehension of difference is also the cause of that.

analyzed: na pañcamaḥ
translated: Not the fifth.

analyzed: pūrva ukta pakṣa abahirbhāvāt iti
translated: Because it is outside the previously mentioned alternatives.

analyzed: mā evam  anyathākhyātivādinā kim śuktikā jñānam śukti viṣayam anyathākhyātiḥ ucyate
translated: This is not so.🔽If one advocates false cognition, is the cognition of nacre said to be an instance of false cognition with respect to nacre?

analyzed: uta rajata jñānam śukti viṣayam
translated: Or is the cognition of silver an instance of false cognition with respect to nacre?

analyzed: ādye na naḥ vivādaḥ yathārtha khyāti tvāt
translated: In the first case, we have no dispute, because it is a true cognition.

original: dvitīye rajatajñānaśabdena yo 'rthaḥ pareṇa vivakṣyate sa evāsmākaṃ heturbhaviṣyati /
analyzed: dvitīye rajata jñāna śabdena yaḥ rthaḥ pareṇa vivakṣyate saḥ eva asmākam hetuḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: In the second case, whatever object is intended by the opponent with the word cognition of silver will be our reason.

original: tathā hi na tāvadādyaḥ kalpaḥ pareṇāṅgīkartumucitaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi na tāvat ādyaḥ kalpaḥ pareṇa aṅgīkartum ucitaḥ
translated: To explain: First, the opponent should not accept the first alternative.

analyzed: vyāghāta prasaṅgāt
translated: Because it leads to a contradiction.

analyzed: śukti rajatayoḥ abheda prasaṅgāt ca
translated: And because it would lead to the non-difference of nacre and silver.

analyzed: na dvitīyaḥ
translated: Not the second.

analyzed: anabhyupagamāt
translated: Because it is not accepted.

analyzed: na tṛtīyaḥ
translated: Not the third.

Because it would lead to the fallacy of false cognition even in the case of the cognition of nacre, since it could sometimes be the cause of the recollection of the word silver which is conventionally associated with something else.

analyzed: na api caturthaḥ
translated: Nor the fourth.

original: yatra śuktikātadadhastadrajatamastīti vākyaṃ śrutavataḥ śuktijñānamapi rajatāthirpravṛttiheturbhavatīti tasyāpyanyathākhyātitāpātāt /
analyzed: yatra śuktikā tad adhas tat rajatam asti iti vākyam śrutavataḥ śukti jñānam api rajata āthiḥ pravṛtti hetuḥ bhavati iti tasya api anyathā khyāti tā āpātāt
translated: Because it would lead to the fallacy of false cognition even in the case of the cognition of nacre, since even that cognition becomes the cause of the inclination towards silver in one who has heard the sentence There is silver under the nacre.

analyzed: na api pañcamaḥ
translated: Nor the fifth.

analyzed: prāk ukta pakṣa abahirbhāvāt
translated: Because it is outside the alternatives mentioned earlier.

original: ato rajatajñānaṃ nāmoktapakṣeṣu kiñcidaṅgīkṛtya taddoṣo vā pariharaṇīyaḥ /
analyzed: atas rajata jñānam nāma ukta pakṣeṣu kiñcid aṅgīkṛtya tad doṣaḥ vā pariharaṇīyaḥ
translated: Therefore, in the case of the stated alternatives, one should either accept one of them and then refute the objection,

analyzed: pakṣa antaram vā utprekṣaṇīyam
translated: or imagine another alternative.

analyzed: tattvam eva mayā hetūkariṣyate iti yat kiñcid etat
translated: I will use that very [alternative] as the reason, so this is just a trifle.

original: kecitpunā rajataviṣayaṃ jñānamityeva hetvarthamupagamya rajatetarāviṣayatvaṃ sādhyamaṅgīkṛtya sādhyāviśiṣṭatādoṣaṃ pariharanti /
analyzed: kecid punar rajata viṣayam jñānam iti eva hetvartham upagamya rajata itara aviṣaya tvam sādhyam aṅgīkṛtya sādhya aviśiṣṭa tā doṣam pariharanti
translated: However, some accept the meaning of the reason as the cognition of silver itself, accept the probandum as not having silver as its object, and then refute the fault of the probandum being equivalent to the reason.

analyzed: tat asat
translated: That is wrong.

analyzed: rajata ghaṭau iti jñāne vyabhicārāt
translated: Because there is deviation in the cognition silver and pot.

analyzed: anyatara asiddheḥ ca
translated: And because one of them is not established.

analyzed: tasmāt uktaḥ eva parihāraḥ
translated: Therefore, the only way out is as stated.

analyzed: api ca jñāna tvam yathā ārtha mātra vṛtti jñāna mātra vṛtti tvāt pramā tva vat
translated: Moreover, the property of being a cognition occurs only in correct cognitions, because it occurs in all cognitions, like the property of being a valid cognition.

analyzed: śuktikā na rajata tvena avabhāsate tad rūpeṇa asattvāt
translated: A mother-of-pearl does not appear as silver, because it does not exist in that form.

analyzed: yat yad rūpeṇa asat tat tad rūpeṇa na avabhāsate
translated: Whatever does not exist in a certain form does not appear in that form.

analyzed: yathā meruḥ sarṣapa tvena
translated: Like Mount Meru does not appear as a mustard seed.

analyzed: idam rajata tādātmyam na pratyetum śakyam asattvāt kūrma roma vat
translated: This cannot be cognized as having the identity of silver, because it does not exist, like the hair of a tortoise.

analyzed: tasmāt akhyāti pakṣaḥ eva śreyān iti
translated: Therefore, the theory of non-apprehension is indeed better.
Refutation of Prabhakara's theory of non-apprehension

analyzed: atra ucyate
translated: To this we reply:

analyzed: yat tāvat anyathā khyāti lakṣaṇam nirākṛtam anya ākāra ullekhi ti antena tat iṣyam eva asmākam
translated: As for what has been said above in the form of the refutation of the theory of misapprehension, that is admitted by us.
Because we accept the definition of misapprehension as the cognition of one thing as another.

analyzed: yathā uktam asataḥ sattva pratītiḥ sataḥ sattva pratītiḥ iti anyathā pratītiḥ eva bhrānti tvāt iti
translated: As it has been said: “The cognition of the non-existent as existent, and of the existent as non-existent, is misapprehension, because it is erroneous.”

analyzed: nanu anyasya anya ātmatā satī uta asatī
translated: Now, is the other thing really of the nature of another or not?

analyzed: asati iti brūmaḥ
translated: We say it is not.

analyzed: asataḥ na pratītiḥ iti ced na
translated: If it is said that the non-existent cannot be cognized, that is not so.

analyzed: tasyāḥ upapādayiṣyamāṇa tvāt
translated: Because that will be established later.

original: evaṃ sati rajatasyāpi kutaḥ sattvamaṅgīkaraṇīyamiti cenna /
analyzed: evam sati rajatasya api kutas sattvam aṅgīkaraṇīyam iti ced na
translated: If that is so, then why should the existence of silver also be accepted? That is not so.

analyzed: kaḥ hi brūte rajatam sat iti
translated: For who says that silver exists?

analyzed: vakṣyāmaḥ hi abhinava anyathā khyāti svarūpam upariṣṭa tvāt
translated: Because we will explain the nature of the new theory of misapprehension later.

analyzed: atra kenacid pralapitam
translated: Here someone has prattled:

original: khaṇḍo gauḥ śuklaḥ paṭa ityādayaḥ sarva eva savikalpakapratyayā vibhramāḥ prasajyeran /
analyzed: khaṇḍaḥ gauḥ śuklaḥ paṭaḥ ityādayaḥ sarve eva sa vikalpaka pratyayāḥ vibhramāḥ prasajyeran
translated: All conceptual cognitions such as the cow is white, the cloth is white, etc. would be false,

analyzed: sāmānādhikaraṇya pratyayasya tādātmya ālambana tvāt
translated: because the cognition of co-reference has as its basis identity,

analyzed: tasya ca atra abhāvāt iti  tat atīva mandam
translated: and that is absent here.🔽That is extremely foolish.

analyzed: tathā hi
translated: Because it is like this.

analyzed: sāmānādhikaraṇya pratyayaḥ hi kayoḥ tādātmyam avalambate
translated: For the cognition of identity refers to what two things?

original: kiṃ guṇakriyājātyādeḥ dravyeṇota guṇādīnāmeva parasparamatha guṇāśrayasya kriyāśrayeṇetyādi /
analyzed: kim guṇa kriyā jāti ādeḥ dravyeṇa uta guṇa ādīnām eva parasparam atha guṇa āśrayasya kriyā āśrayeṇa ityādi
translated: Is it to the substance and the quality, action, universal, etc., or to the qualities themselves among themselves, or to the substratum of the quality and the substratum of the action, etc.?

analyzed: na ādyaḥ
translated: The first is not so,

analyzed: a saṃmateḥ
translated: because it is not accepted.

original: na hi śuklaḥ paṭa ityasya śauklayaṃ paṭa ityartho 'bhimato laukikānām /🔽naca calati paṭa ityasya calanaṃ paṭa ityartho 'bhimataḥ /
analyzed: na hi śuklaḥ paṭaḥ iti asya śauklayam paṭaḥ iti arthaḥ bhimataḥ laukikānām  na ca calati paṭaḥ iti asya calanam paṭaḥ iti arthaḥ bhimataḥ
translated: For the people of the world do not accept the meaning of 'the white cloth' to be 'the whiteness of the cloth'.🔽Nor do they accept the meaning of 'the cloth moves' to be 'the motion of the cloth'.

original: nāpi khaṇḍo gaurityetatkhaṇḍatvaṃ gotvaṃ ca piṇḍa evetyanena samānārtham /
analyzed: nā api khaṇḍaḥ gauḥ iti etat khaṇḍa tvam go tvam ca piṇḍaḥ eva iti anena samāna artham
translated: Nor is the meaning of 'the spotted cow' the same as that of 'the spottiness and the cowness in the same individual'.

analyzed: tathātve daṇḍī devadattaḥ iti asya api daṇḍa devadatta tādātmya viṣaya tā āpatteḥ
translated: If it were so, then the expression 'Devadatta with a stick' would also have to refer to the identity of the stick and Devadatta.

original: daṇḍīti śābdavyavahāre bhedārthapratyayaprayogājjñānamapi tādṛśaṃ kalpyata iti cetsamamatrāpi /
analyzed: daṇḍī iti śābda vyavahāre bheda artha pratyaya prayogāt jñānam api tādṛśam kalpyate iti ced samam atra api
translated: If it is argued that the cognition is also imagined to be of that kind because the use of the suffix denoting difference is found in the verbal expression 'with a stick', then the same applies here also.

analyzed: śuktaguṇaḥ sya asti iti asmin arthe rśa ādibhyaḥ jiti akāra pratyaya vidhānāt
translated: Because the suffix 'a' is prescribed by the rule 'arṣādibhyo'j' for the meaning 'this has the quality of whiteness'.

analyzed: calati ityādau tu sphuṭaḥ eva prakṛti pratyayayoḥ artha bhedaḥ
translated: But in 'moves', etc., the difference in the meaning of the prefix and suffix is quite clear.

analyzed: nahi gauḥ iti go tvam ucyate tathātve tu apratyaya vaiyarthyāt
translated: For the word 'cow' does not denote cowness; if it did, the word 'that' would be meaningless.

original: ata eva śuklaḥ paṭa ityuktvā śauklayaṃ paṭasyeti vyākartāro bhavanti / /
analyzed: atas eva śuklaḥ paṭaḥ iti uktvā śauklayam paṭasya iti vyākartāraḥ bhavanti
translated: For this very reason, after saying 'the cloth is white', the commentators say 'the whiteness belongs to the cloth'.

analyzed: atas eva na dvitīyaḥ
translated: For this very reason, the second [alternative] is not [correct].

original: na hi śuklaḥ paṭaścalatītyasya śauklayaṃ paṭatvaṃ calanaṃ caikamityarthaścetasi cakāsti pratipattṛṇām /
analyzed: na hi śuklaḥ paṭaḥ calati iti asya śauklayam paṭa tvam calanam ca ekam iti arthaḥ cetasi cakāsti pratipattṛṇām
translated: For the idea does not occur to the cognizers that the meaning of 'the white cloth moves' is that whiteness, clothness, and motion are one.

original: tathā sati daṇḍī kuṇḍalī devadatta ityasyāpi jñānasya daṇḍakuṇḍaladevadattatvatādātmyaviṣayatāpātāt /
analyzed: tathā sati daṇḍī kuṇḍalī devadattaḥ iti asya api jñānasya daṇḍa kuṇḍala devadatta tva tādātmya viṣaya tā āpātāt
translated: If it were so, then the cognition 'Devadatta has a staff, has earrings' would also have to be admitted as having the nature of being the same as the identity of having a staff, earrings, and Devadatta.

analyzed: tṛtīyaḥ tu syāt eva
translated: The third [alternative] may indeed be [correct].

original: samānamekamadhikaraṇaṃ yeṣāṃ te hi samānādhikaraṇāsteṣāṃ bhāvaḥ sāmānādhikaraṇyam /
analyzed: samānam ekam adhikaraṇam yeṣām te hi samāna adhikaraṇāḥ teṣām bhāvaḥ sāmānādhikaraṇyam
translated: Those that have the same substratum are called 'having the same substratum'; the state of that is 'having the same substratum'.

original: tathāca guṇādīnāmāśrayeṇa parasparaṃ ca bhedaḥ āśrayāṇāṃ cābhedaḥ sphuṭa eva /
analyzed: tathā ca guṇa ādīnām āśrayeṇa parasparam ca bhedaḥ āśrayāṇām ca abhedaḥ sphuṭaḥ eva
translated: And thus the difference of qualities etc. from their substratum and from each other, and the non-difference of the substrata, is indeed clear.

original: nahi svayameva svasyādhikaraṇam /🔽nāpi samānamadhikaraṇaṃ yeṣāmiti parasparābhede yujyate /
analyzed: nahi svayam eva svasya adhikaraṇam  na api samānam adhikaraṇam yeṣām iti paraspara abhede yujyate
translated: For a thing itself is not its own substratum.🔽Nor is it proper in the case of non-difference to say that those which have the same substratum are 'having the same substratum'.

analyzed: na ca āśraya bhede tasya samāna tā asti
translated: And when there is difference of substratum, there is no sameness of that [substratum].

analyzed: na ca guṇa ādi āśrayasya bhede pramāṇam asti
translated: And there is no proof for the difference of the substratum of qualities etc.

analyzed: viśiṣṭayoḥ bhede pi na tat guṇa ādi āśrayaḥ
translated: Even if there is difference between the qualified things, that is not the substratum of qualities etc.

analyzed: kintu guṇa ādi āśraya āśritam vastu antaram tat
translated: But that is a different entity, the substratum of qualities etc.

original: evañca yatra bhedo na tadabhedena pratibhāsate yaccābhedena pracibhāsate na tatra bheda iti kvātivyāptiḥ /
analyzed: evam ca yatra bhedaḥ na tat abhedena pratibhāsate yat ca abhedena pracibhāsate na tatra bhedaḥ iti kva ativyāptiḥ
translated: And thus, where there is difference, it does not appear as non-difference; and where it appears as non-difference, there is no difference. So where is the over-extension?

original: nanu guṇādīnāmāśrayeṇa parasparaṃ cābhedo bhagavato muneḥ siddhāntaḥ /
analyzed: nanu guṇa ādīnām āśrayeṇa parasparam ca abhedaḥ bhagavataḥ muneḥ siddhāntaḥ
translated: But the non-difference of qualities etc. from their substratum and from each other is the established doctrine of the Blessed Sage.

analyzed: kvacid bheda abhedau ca
translated: And in some cases there is both difference and non-difference.

analyzed: sāmānādhikaraṇya pratītiḥ tu bheda niṣṭhā eva vyākhyātā
translated: But the cognition of co-reference is explained as being based only on difference.

original: tathāca punaḥ śuklaḥ paṭa ityādipratyayā vibhramāḥ prasaktāḥ /
analyzed: tathā ca punar śuklaḥ paṭaḥ ityādi pratyayāḥ vibhramāḥ prasaktāḥ
translated: And thus, the cognitions like the white cloth etc. would again be illusory.

analyzed: mā evam
translated: Not so.

analyzed: sa viśeṣa tva aṅgīvakārāt
translated: Because we accept the existence of distinctions.

analyzed: viśadam ca etat viśeṣa nirūpaṇe vyutpādayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: And this will be explained clearly in the exposition of distinctions.

analyzed: yat punar anya ākāra ullekhi ityādinā asmad abhimata anyathā khyāteḥ anubhava virodham pratijñāya tad upapādanāya yat sannikṛṣṭa karaṇena ityantena ālambana lakṣaṇa nirākaraṇam
translated: As for what was stated by the phrase that which has a form different from... etc., taking as a premise the contradiction of the experience of the other-cognition accepted by us, and then by the phrase by the sense-organ in contact with... etc., the refutation of the definition of the object of perception,

analyzed: kṛtam tat anumatam eva asmākam
translated: that is accepted by us also.

original: yadvijñānaṃ yatsannikṛṣṭakaraṇena janyate sa tasya viṣaya ityaṅgīkārāt /
analyzed: yat vijñānam yat sannikṛṣṭa karaṇena janyate sa tasya viṣayaḥ iti aṅgīkārāt
translated: Because it is accepted that the object of a cognition is that which is produced by the sense organ that is in contact with it.

analyzed: nanu atra api doṣaḥ bhihitaḥ iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that the fault has been stated here too, it is not so.

analyzed: sannikarṣasya api kāraṇa tayā vivakṣita tvena tasya asambaddha tvāt
translated: Because contact is also intended as a cause, and it is not unrelated.

analyzed: nahi cakṣuḥ ādeḥ ākāśa ādi sannikarṣaḥ rūpa ādi jñāna kāraṇam
translated: For the contact of the eye etc. with space etc. is not the cause of the cognition of form etc.

analyzed: nā api vākyasya ākāśa ādi sannikarṣaḥ vākya artha jñāne hetuḥ
translated: Nor is the contact of the sentence with space etc. the reason for the cognition of the meaning of the sentence.

analyzed: na ca liṅga jñānasya ātmanā sannikarṣaḥ liṅgi jñāna nimittam
translated: Nor is the contact of the cognition of the inferential mark with the self the cause of the cognition of the thing to be inferred.

analyzed: kim nāma avarjanīya sannidhayaḥ te sannikarṣāḥ
translated: What are those contacts whose presence is unavoidable?

original: liṅgasya sādhyadharmisannikarṣo liṅgijñānakāraṇamiti cenna liṅgajñānasya karaṇatayābhyupagamāt /
analyzed: liṅgasya sādhya dharmi sannikarṣaḥ liṅgi jñāna kāraṇam iti ced na liṅga jñānasya karaṇa tayā abhyupagamāt
translated: If it is argued that the contact of the inferential mark with the subject to be inferred is the cause of the cognition of the thing to be inferred, it is not so, because the cognition of the inferential mark is accepted as the instrument.

analyzed: anena eva vākyasya śrotṛ śrotra sannikarṣa āśrayaṇena dūṣaṇam parāstam
translated: By this alone, the criticism based on accepting the contact of the sentence with the hearer's ear is refuted.

analyzed: vākya jñānasya eva karaṇa tva aṅgīkārāt
translated: Because the cognition of the sentence itself is accepted as the instrument.

original: tathāpi pratyabhijñāyāṃ tattāṃśena cakṣurāderliṅginā ca liṅgajñānasya vākyārthena vākyajñānasya sannikarṣābhāvādaviṣayatāpattiriti cenna asannikṛṣṭajñāpane 🔽'tiprasaṅgāt /
analyzed: tathā api pratyabhijñāyām tatta aṃśena cakṣuḥ ādeḥ liṅginā ca liṅga jñānasya vākya arthena vākya jñānasya sannikarṣa abhāvāt aviṣaya tā āpattiḥ iti ced na asannikṛṣṭa jñāpane  ti prasaṅgāt
translated: Even so, if it is argued that in recognition, since the eye etc. are the inferential mark, and the knowledge of the inferential mark is the antecedent, and since there is no contact with the meaning of the sentence, there would be the fault of being devoid of an object, this is not so, because of the fallacy of over-extension in the cognition of what is not in contact.

analyzed: tad anubhava janita saṃskāra sahakṛta indriyeṇa pratyabhijñā jāyate
translated: Because recognition arises from the sense organ aided by the impression produced by the experience of that.

analyzed: tad vayāpta liṅga viṣayeṇa ca liṅga jñānena liṅgi jñānam utpadyate
translated: And from the knowledge of the inferential mark, which has as its object the inferential mark pervaded by that, the knowledge of the inferential object arises.

analyzed: saṃsarga dharmaka padārtha vāci pada samudāya rūpa vākya viṣaya jñānena vākya artha jñānam janyate
translated: And from the knowledge which has as its object the sentence consisting of the collection of words which express the meanings of words having the property of relation, the knowledge of the meaning of the sentence is produced.

analyzed: atas na atiprasaṅgaḥ iti ced tarhi abhyupagataḥ sannikarṣaḥ
translated: Therefore, there is no over-extension. If this is so, then contact is accepted.

original: nahi saṃyogādireva sannikarṣaḥ kiṃ nāma pratyāsattimātram / /
analyzed: nahi saṃyoga ādiḥ eva sannikarṣaḥ kim nāma pratyāsatti mātram
translated: For contact is not just conjunction etc., but rather mere proximity.

analyzed: tathā api rūpa pratīteḥ ātmā viṣayaḥ prasajyeta
translated: Even so, the self would be the object of the cognition of form.

analyzed: tatra manasaḥ karaṇa tvāt
translated: Because the self is the instrument in that case.

analyzed: ātma manaḥ sannikarṣasya api rūpa jñānam prati kāraṇa tvāt iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that the contact of the self and the mind is also the cause of the cognition of form, this is not so.
Because an uncommon cause is intended.

analyzed: manasaḥ ca sādhāraṇa tvāt
translated: And because the mind is common.

original: tarhi manaḥsannikṛṣṭena cakṣuṣā jāyamānaṃ rūpajñānaṃ manoviṣayamāpannamiti cenna /
analyzed: tarhi manaḥ sannikṛṣṭena cakṣuṣā jāyamānam rūpa jñānam manaḥ viṣayam āpannam iti ced na
translated: If it be said that the visual cognition, which is produced by the eye in close proximity to the mind, becomes the object of the mind, no (says the siddhāntin);

analyzed: sannikarṣasya api asādhāraṇa kāraṇatayā vivakṣita tvāt
translated: because even the proximity is intended to be the uncommon cause.

analyzed: cakṣumarnaḥ sannikarṣaḥ hi dravya ādi jñāna sādhāraṇaḥ
translated: For the proximity of the eye and the mind is common to the cognition of substance, etc.

analyzed: evam anye trapa kṣudra upadravāḥ pariharaṇīyāḥ
translated: In the same way, other minor difficulties here are to be removed.

analyzed: tat evam janya jñāne viṣaya tvasya anyathā vyavasthita tvāt yat jñānam yat pratibhāsam iti anyathā paribhāṣaṇam anupapannam
translated: Thus, since the objectivity of the cognition produced is otherwise established, the definition of cognition as that which appears as what (it is not) is not proper.

analyzed: na ca evam sati anubhava virodhaḥ
translated: And thus there is no contradiction with experience.

analyzed: rajata avabhāsasya śuktikā sannikṛṣṭa karaṇa janya tvena tad viṣaya tva upapatteḥ
translated: Because the appearance as silver is possible as the object of that (cognition), since it is produced by the sense-organ in close proximity to the mother-of-pearl.

analyzed: na ca atiprasaṅgaḥ
translated: And there is no over-extension.

analyzed: doṣa janya tva tad abhāva ādinā vyavasthā upapatteḥ
translated: Because the distinction is possible by the presence or absence of being produced by a defect.

analyzed: anyathā rajata jñānāt arajate pravṛttau api katham na atiprasaṅgaḥ
translated: Otherwise, even in the case of activity with regard to silver on the part of one who has the cognition of silver, how can there be no over-extension?

analyzed: yat punar rajata avabhāsasya ityādi āśaṅkaya samādhānam abhihitam tad jñāna ekatva samarthanena nirākariṣyāmaḥ
translated: And the solution offered by raising the doubt beginning with But the appearance as silver, etc. we shall refute by establishing the oneness of cognition.

original: astu vā yadvijñānaṃ yatpratibhāsaṃ tattadviṣayamityeva vyavasthā /
analyzed: astu vā yat vijñānam yat pratibhāsam tat tat viṣayam iti eva vyavasthā
translated: Or let it be established that whatever cognition appears as what, that is the object of that.

analyzed: tathā api na anubhava virodhaḥ
translated: Even so, there is no contradiction with experience.

analyzed: tat kim rajata avabhāsasya śukti tva viṣaya tāyām anubhava virodham brūṣe uta idantva ākārasya
translated: Then do you say there is a contradiction with experience in the objectivity of the appearance of silver in the case of mother-of-pearl, or of the form 'this'?

analyzed: ādye sampratipattiḥ
translated: In the first case, there is agreement.

original: nahi vayamasminpratyaye śuktitvamāvabhāsata iti brūmo yena virodhaḥ syāt /
analyzed: nahi vayam asmin pratyaye śukti tvam āvabhāsate iti brūmaḥ yena virodhaḥ syāt
translated: For we do not say that mother-of-pearl appears in this cognition, by which there would be a contradiction.

analyzed: śukti tva pratibhāsasya rajata avabhāsa virodhi tva abhyupagamāt
translated: Because we accept that the appearance of mother-of-pearl is contradictory to the appearance of silver.

analyzed: dvitīye tu na kaścid virodhaḥ
translated: But in the second case, there is no contradiction at all.

original: virodhe vā samīcīnarajata idaṃ rajatamiti pratītirna syāt /
analyzed: virodhe vā samīcīna rajate idam rajatam iti pratītiḥ na syāt
translated: Or if there is a contradiction, the cognition 'this is silver' would not arise with regard to real silver.

analyzed: idam ākārasya rajata pratibhāsa viṣaya tām anabhyupagacchataḥ eva pratīti virodham vakṣyāmaḥ
translated: We will speak of the contradiction with experience even without accepting that the form 'this' is the object of the appearance of silver.

original: evaṃ sati rajatasyāpi jñānaviṣayatā prasajyata iti cet satyam /
analyzed: evam sati rajatasya api jñāna viṣaya tā prasajyate iti ced satyam
translated: If it is argued that in that case, silver also becomes the object of cognition, it is true.

analyzed: iṣyam eva etat
translated: We accept that very thing.

analyzed: na ca evam akhyāti pakṣapātaḥ
translated: And yet it is not a case of the theory of non-apprehension.

analyzed: jñāna aikya abhyupagamāt
translated: Because we accept the unity of cognition.

analyzed: na api śuktikā rajate
translated: Nor is it a case of mother-of-pearl and silver.

analyzed: iti jñānam vibhramaḥ prasajyate rajatasya asattva abhyupagamāt
translated: Thus, if the cognition is of silver, there would be the undesirable contingency of error, because the non-existence of silver is admitted.

analyzed: tādātmya avabhāsa abhyupagamāt ca
translated: And because the appearance of identity is admitted.

analyzed: atas eva uktam asataḥ sattva pratītiḥ sataḥ sattva pratītiḥ iti
translated: For this very reason it is said: The cognition of the existent as non-existent and of the non-existent as existent.

original: vakṣyati ca viṣayasya kuto bādha ityasato rajatatādātmyorjñānaviṣayatāmācāryaḥ /
analyzed: vakṣyati ca viṣayasya kutas bādhaḥ iti asatoḥ rajata tādātmyoḥ jñāna viṣaya tām ācāryaḥ
translated: And the teacher will say: How can there be contradiction of the object? The non-existent silver is the object of cognition.

analyzed: na ca anyathā khyāti janane kāraṇa abhāvaḥ
translated: And there is no absence of cause in the production of other-than-that-cognition.

analyzed: indriya ādeḥ eva tad kāraṇa tvāt
translated: Because the sense-organ itself is the cause of that.

analyzed: samīcīna jñāna kāraṇasya api tasya doṣa kaluṣitasya vibhrama hetu tva upapatteḥ
translated: Because it is possible that even the cause of correct cognition, when defiled by faults, becomes the cause of error.

analyzed: na ca doṣāṇām svārasika śakti virodhi tā mātram iti vācyam
translated: And it should not be said that the faults merely oppose the natural power.

original: tathā sati viparītaśaktayanādhāyakatvamaṅgīkartavyaṃ doṣāṇāmeva vā /🔽ādye paśuhiṃsā kiṃ dharmajanane svārasikaśaktimatī utādharmajanana iti vācyam /🔽ādye kataṃ kratubāhyāpi dharmaṃ na janayet /
analyzed: tathā sati viparīta śaktaya nādhāyaka tvam aṅgīkartavyam doṣāṇām eva vā  ādye paśu hiṃsā kim dharma janane svārasika śaktimatī uta adharma janane iti vācyam  ādye katam kratu bāhyā api dharmam na janayet
translated: If that were so, either the faults themselves would have to be admitted to give rise to contradictory power,🔽or in the first case, it should be said whether the injury to animals has the natural power to produce dharma or to produce adharma in the production of dharma.🔽If the first, how could it not produce dharma even outside the sacrifice?

analyzed: dvitīye katham kratvā antargatā api dharmam janayet
translated: If the second, how could it produce dharma even within the sacrifice?

original: sahakārivaśāditi cet aṅgīkṛtaṃ tarhi sahakāriṇāṃ svārasikaśaktipratibandhena viparītaśaktayādhāyakatvam /
analyzed: sahakāri vaśāt iti ced aṅgīkṛtam tarhi sahakāriṇām svārasika śakti pratibandhena viparīta śaktayā ādhāyaka tvam
translated: If it be said that it is due to the influence of auxiliaries, then it is admitted that auxiliaries, by obstructing the natural power, impart a contrary power.

analyzed: na dvitīyaḥ niyāmaka abhāvāt
translated: Not the second, because there is no determining factor.

original: kiñca kācādayo 'pi viparītajñānajanane sahakāriṇa evāṅgīkriyante /🔽doṣatvaṃ tviṣyakāryavighātitāmātreṇocyate /
analyzed: kiñca kāca ādayaḥ pi viparīta jñāna janane sahakāriṇaḥ evā aṅgīkriyante  doṣa tvam tviṣya kārya vighāti tā mātreṇa ucyate
translated: Moreover, it is admitted that even things like a piece of glass are only auxiliaries in producing contrary knowledge.🔽But the quality of being a defect is said to be merely obstructing the desired effect.

analyzed: kāmukasya kāminī vibhrameṣu guṇa tva abhimānāt  na ca evam
translated: Because the passionate man regards the errors of the beloved as virtues.🔽And it cannot be said that thus the roasted barley

original: kuṭajadhānā vaṭāṅkuraṃ kuto na janayayaṃ🔽tīti vācyam /
analyzed: kuṭaja dhānāḥ vaṭa aṅkuram kutas na  tis iti vācyam
translated: grains do not produce the banyan sprout.

analyzed: padārtha śakti vaicitṛyāt
translated: Because of the variety of the powers of word meanings.

analyzed: kecid vastu antara śaktim eva pratibadhnanti
translated: Some only obstruct the power of another thing,

analyzed: yathā bharjana ādayaḥ
translated: like roasting etc.

analyzed: kecid sahaja śakti pratibandhena viparītam api śaktim ādadhati
translated: Some, by obstructing the natural power, impart a contrary power also.

analyzed: yathā viṣasya māraka tva śaktim  śaktim ādadhānāḥ padārthāḥ
translated: Like things that, by obstructing the power to kill of poison, impart the power to produce health etc.

original: guṇā eva na te doṣā iti cet kācādayo 'pi guṇā eva na te doṣā ityuktameva /
analyzed: guṇāḥ eva na te doṣāḥ iti ced kāca ādayaḥ pi guṇāḥ eva na te doṣāḥ iti uktam eva
translated: If it be said that they are only qualities, not defects, it has been said that even things like a piece of glass are only qualities, not defects.

analyzed: nanu janakasya eva sākṣātkāri pratyaya viṣaya tvam dṛṣṭam
translated: But it is seen that only the cause is the object of a cognition that has direct perception.

analyzed: na ca rajatasya idam tādātmyasya vāsataḥ janaka tvam asti
translated: And the silver or the identity of this with that is not really the cause.

analyzed: tat katham viṣaya tvam iti
translated: So how can it be the object?

analyzed: mā evam
translated: No, that is not so.

original: tathā satīśvarajñānasya nityasyārtho viṣayo na syāt /
analyzed: tathā sati īśvara jñānasya nityasya arthaḥ viṣayaḥ na syāt
translated: If it were so, then the object of the eternal cognition of God would not be an object.

original: pratyabhijñānasya ca tattāṃśo viṣayo na bhavet /
analyzed: pratyabhijñānasya ca tatta aṃśaḥ viṣayaḥ na bhavet
translated: And the part of thatness of the recognition would not be the object.

analyzed: tad nirūpaka tva ādi mātreṇa viṣaya tva aṅgīkāre rajata ādeḥ api jñāna nirūpaka tvena viṣaya tva upapatteḥ
translated: If the object is accepted as such merely because it is what is determined by the cognition, then silver and so on would also be the object, because they are what is determined by the cognition.

analyzed: katham asataḥ nirūpaka tvam iti ced
translated: If it is asked how can something non-existent be what is determined,

analyzed: na
translated: No.🔽🔽

analyzed: gurūṇām ṭīkā kurūṇām kṣetram iti vat upapatteḥ
translated: Because it is acceptable like the statement the commentary of the teachers is the field of the Kurus.
And the object would not be what distinguishes the inference etc. whose object is past etc.

original: tatra vyāvartakaṃ kadācidasti rajatādikaṃ kadāpi nāstīti vaiṣamyamiti cet /
analyzed: tatra vyāvartakam kadācid asti rajata ādikam kadāpi na asti iti vaiṣamyam iti ced
translated: If it is argued that there is the inequality that what distinguishes that is sometimes existent like silver etc., and sometimes non-existent,

original: tatkiṃ yadākadācitsataḥ kāraṇatvaṃ pūrvakṣaṇe sato vā /
analyzed: tat kim yadā kadācid sataḥ kāraṇa tvam pūrva kṣaṇe sataḥ vā
translated: then is the causal nature of what is sometimes existent in some time, or of what is existent in the previous moment?

analyzed: na ādyaḥ
translated: Not the first,

analyzed: atiprasaṅgāt
translated: because of the absurdity of over-extension.

analyzed: dvitīye tu kim anena
translated: But in the second case, what is the use of this?

original: atha nātītādirarthaḥ svasāmarthyenānumityādikaṃ vyāvartayati yena tatsattāpekṣā syāt /
analyzed: atha na atīta ādiḥ arthaḥ sva sāmarthyena anumiti ādikam vyāvartayati yena tad sattā apekṣā syāt
translated: If, on the other hand, the object, past or future, does not by its own force set aside inference, etc., then it would not be necessary to assume its existence.

analyzed: kintu sva hetu sāmarthyāt artha vyāvṛttam jñānam utpadyate iti ced
translated: But if it be said that the cognition which is set aside by the object is produced by the force of its own cause,

analyzed: samam prakṛte pi
translated: the same may be said in the case in question also.

original: kiñca satyasthale 'pi na sākṣātsākṣātkāraṃ prati kāraṇatvamarthasya kintvindriyasannikarṣasyaiva /
analyzed: kiñca satya sthale pi na sākṣāt sākṣātkāram prati kāraṇa tvam arthasya kintu indriya sannikarṣasya eva
translated: Moreover, in the case of a real object also, the object is not directly the cause of the cognition, but only the contact of the sense-organ with it.

original: saca yatrāsatā nopapadyate tatrārthasattāmapekṣata iti pāramparyeṇaivārthasya kāraṇatvam /
analyzed: saca yatra asatā na upapadyate tatra artha sattām apekṣate iti pāramparyeṇa eva arthasya kāraṇa tvam
translated: And that contact requires the existence of the object only when it is not possible without it; so that the object is the cause only indirectly.

original: nanu tarhyasatā rajatādinā sannikarṣāyogātkathamindriyeṇa tajjñānajanmeti cenna /
analyzed: nanu tarhi asatā rajata ādinā sannikarṣa ayogāt katham indriyeṇa tad jñāna janma iti ced na
translated: But if it be said that, since there can be no contact with the non-existent silver, how can the cognition be produced by the sense-organ? We reply: No;

analyzed: śuktikā sannikṛṣṭam duṣyam indriyam tām eva atyanta asat rajata ātmanā avagāhamānam jñānam janayati iti aṅgīkārāt
translated: because we admit that the sense-organ, which is in contact with the mother-of-pearl, produces the cognition, apprehending the mother-of-pearl as absolutely non-existent silver.

analyzed: atas eva na asat khyāti prasaṅgaḥ
translated: For this very reason there is no possibility of the cognition of the non-existent.

original: yāvatkhalu vigīte pratyaye bhāsate tasya sarvasyāsattve 'satkhyātiḥ syāt /
analyzed: yāvat khalu vigīte pratyaye bhāsate tasya sarvasya a sattve sat khyātiḥ syāt
translated: For, indeed, if all that appears in the contradictory cognition were non-existent, there would be the cognition of the non-existent.

analyzed: na ca evam iti uktam
translated: But this is not so, as has been said.

original: yaccoktaṃ viṣayavyabhicāre jñānasya savartrānāśvāsa iti tat autsargikaṃ jñānānāṃ prāmāṇyamapavādādviparyaya iti vadatā'cāryeṇaiva parihariṣyate
analyzed: yat ca uktam viṣaya vyabhicāre jñānasya savartrā anāśvāsaḥ iti tat autsargikam jñānānām prāmāṇyam apavādāt viparyayaḥ iti vadatā ācāryeṇa eva parihariṣyate
translated: And as for what was said, that if there is error in the object, there is no confidence in any cognition, that will be refuted by the teacher himself, who holds that the general rule is that cognitions are valid, and that there is an exception only in the case of error.

original: sākṣī khalu caitanyarūpo niyatayāthārthyaḥ kadācidapi saṃśayānāskandito 'ntaḥkaraṇavṛttīnāṃ yāthārthyaṃ svayameva gṛhṇāti /
analyzed: sākṣī khalu caitanya rūpaḥ niyata yāthārthyaḥ kadācid api saṃśaya an āskanditaḥ ntaḥkaraṇa vṛttīnām yāthārthyam svayam eva gṛhṇāti
translated: The witness, which is of the nature of consciousness and is always true to the facts, grasps by itself the truth of the modifications of the internal organ, without ever being tainted by doubt.

analyzed: parīkṣā sahakṛtaḥ tu ayāthārthyam iti bādarāyaṇīyam matam
translated: But the opinion of the followers of Badarayana is that it is only when it is assisted by examination that it grasps the truth of the facts.

original: ata evānāśvāsanirasanopāyo na jñāneṣu kaścidviśeṣo 'stīti nirastam /
analyzed: atas eva anāśvāsa nirasana upāyaḥ na jñāneṣu kaścid viśeṣaḥ sti iti nirastam
translated: For this very reason, it has been refuted that there is no difference in the means of removing lack of confidence in cognitions.

original: anyathā parasyāpi kathaṃ viṣayavyabhicāre vyavahṛtervyavahārāntare samāśvāsaḥ syāt /
analyzed: anyathā parasya api katham viṣaya vyabhicāre vyavahṛteḥ vyavahāra antare samāśvāsaḥ syāt
translated: Otherwise, how could one have confidence in another transaction when there is error in one transaction even for the opponent?

analyzed: tad abhāve ca katham vyavahāra darśanena anvita arthe vyutpattiḥ
translated: And in the absence of that, how could there be learning of the connected meaning by observing transactions?

original: kvacidvivekāgrahe ca kathamanyatra viśiṣṭapratyaye viśvāso bhavet /
analyzed: kvacid viveka agrahe ca katham anyatra viśiṣṭa pratyaye viśvāsaḥ bhavet
translated: And how could there be confidence in a particular cognition elsewhere, if there is no firm grasp of the distinction in some case?

analyzed: tad abhāve ca katham niḥśaṅkā pravṛttiḥ
translated: And in the absence of that, how could there be action without doubt?

analyzed: bādhaka abhāva ādinā samāśvāsaḥ tu para ukta rītyā eva nirastaḥ
translated: And the removal of lack of confidence by the absence of sublating cognition, etc. has been refuted in the same way as stated by the opponent.

analyzed: kiñca pravṛtti uttara kālīnaḥ bādhaka abhāvaḥ katham niḥśaṅka pravṛttau upayujyate
translated: Moreover, how can the absence of sublating cognitions occurring after activity be of use in activity free from doubt?

original: bādhakābhāvādinā viśiṣṭajñānasvarūpaniścayamaṅgīkurvāṇaḥ kathaṃ svaprakāśavijñānavādaṃ na jahyāt /
analyzed: bādhaka abhāva ādinā viśiṣṭa jñāna svarūpa niścayam aṅgīkurvāṇaḥ katham sva prakāśa vijñāna vādam na jahyāt
translated: How can one who admits the ascertainment of the form of a cognition qualified by the absence of sublating cognitions and so on, avoid the doctrine of self-luminous cognition?

analyzed: autsargikī pravṛttiḥ apavādāt nivṛttiḥ iti ced
translated: If it be said that activity is normal and cessation is due to exceptions,

analyzed: samam prakṛte pi
translated: the same holds good in the case in question also.

analyzed: yat api uktam viparīta khyāti pakṣe jñānam sa ākāram āpatet iti
translated: As for the argument that if the doctrine of erroneous cognition be accepted, cognition must be admitted to be possessed of an image,

analyzed: tat anupapannam  atyanta asataḥ eva ākārasya sphuraṇa aṅgīkārāt
translated: that is untenable.🔽Because it is admitted that the image is absolutely non-existent.

analyzed: anyathā vyavahriyamāṇasya ākārasya bahis abhāvāt vayavahāraḥ pi tad ākāraḥ prasajyeta
translated: Otherwise, if the image which is used in the world were external, then the usage itself would be accompanied by the image.

original: yā caivaṃ prakriyā rajatamidamityādinoktā sā jñānadvitve rajatajñānasya ca smṛtitve pramāṇābhāvādanupapannā /
analyzed: yā ca evam prakriyā rajatam idam ityādinā uktā sā jñāna dvi tve rajata jñānasya ca smṛti tve pramāṇa abhāvāt anupapannā
translated: And the process of reasoning stated in the passage beginning with 'this is silver' is untenable because there is no proof for the existence of two cognitions and for the fact that the cognition of silver is a remembrance.

analyzed: viśiṣṭa jñāna bādhakānām parihṛta tvāt
translated: Because the objections against the doctrine of the non-existence of the external world have been answered.

analyzed: anumānānām ca dūṣṭa tvāt
translated: And because the inferences (of the Buddhist) are faulty.

original: yastu rajatajñānasya smṛtitve pariśeṣopanyāsaḥ so 'pi pratyutpannakakā
analyzed: yaḥ tu rajata jñānasya smṛti tve pariśeṣa upanyāsaḥ saḥ u pi
translated: As for the argument from parsimony (parisiṣṭha) in favour of the view that the cognition of silver is a remembrance, that is also refuted by the following cognition.

analyzed: raṇa duṣya indriya ādi janya tā upapādanāt pariśeṣa anupapatteḥ ayuktaḥ
translated: It is not proper because of the non-applicability of the remaining [alternative] due to the establishment of the production from the contact of the eye, etc. with the object.

analyzed: an ākalita rajatasya anutpadyamāna tvam gagana ādau anaikāntikam
translated: The non-production of what is not cognized as silver is inconclusive in the case of space, etc.

original: rajatajñānavata evotpadyamānatvaṃ vivakṣitamiti cenna tathāpi rajatasaṃskāravyavahārādau vyabhicārāt /
analyzed: rajata jñānavataḥ eva utpadyamāna tvam vivakṣitam iti ced na tathā api rajata saṃskāra vyavahāra ādau vyabhicārāt
translated: If it is said that the intended [meaning] is that it is produced only for one who has the knowledge of silver, then even so, there is the fallacy of non-applicability in the case of the impression of silver, usage, etc.

analyzed: jñāna tve sati iti viśeṣaṇāt adoṣaḥ iti ced na
translated: If it is said that there is no fault because of the qualification being knowledge, then it is not so.

analyzed: rajata nirvikalpaka jñānavataḥ eva utpadyamāne rajata savikalpaka anubhave vyabhicāra tādavasthyāt
translated: Because in the case of the experience of silver with conceptualization produced only for one who has the non-conceptual knowledge of silver, the fallacy of non-applicability remains.

analyzed: rajata savikalpaka jñānavataḥ eva utpadyamāna tvam vivakṣitam iti ced na hāna ādi buddhiṣu anaikāntika tā nistārāt
translated: If it is said that the intended [meaning] is that it is produced only for one who has the knowledge of silver with conceptualization, then it is not so because the fallacy of non-applicability is not overcome in the case of the cognition of abandonment, etc.

analyzed: saṃskāra mātra sahakṛta manaḥ janya tva upādhi grastam ca anumānam
translated: And the inference is also sublated by the limiting condition of being produced by the mind in association with the impression alone.

analyzed: na ca anena eva hetunā asya pakṣe sādhanam vyabhicārasya ukta tvāt
translated: And this is not a proof in the case of the subject by this very reason, because the fallacy of non-applicability has been stated.

original: kiñcedaṃ smaraṇatvaṃ sādhyaṃ na tāvatsāmānyaṃ guṇeṣu prābhākarairabhyupagatam /
analyzed: kiñca idam smaraṇa tvam sādhyam na tāvat sāmānyam guṇeṣu prābhākaraiḥ abhyupagatam
translated: Moreover, what is this being a recollection that is to be proved? Not the universal, which is accepted by the Prabhākaras among the qualities.

analyzed: ananubhava tvam iti ced
translated: If it is said to be the state of not being an experience,

analyzed: tat api kim anubhavāt anya tvam anubhava tva anadhikaraṇa tvam vā
translated: Is that also different from experience or is it not a substratum of the nature of experience?

analyzed: ādye nubhavasya api tad sambhavena siddha sādhana tā syāt
translated: If the first, then there would be the fallacy of proving what is already established, since that is possible even for experience.

analyzed: dvitīye nubhava tvam kim iti vācyam
translated: If the second, what is to be said about the nature of experience?

analyzed: smṛti anya tvam iti ced na
translated: If it is said to be the nature of being different from memory, no (it is not so).

analyzed: smṛtau api prasaṅgāt itaretara āśraya prasakteḥ ca
translated: Because of the contingence of the same in memory and because of the contingence of mutual dependence.

analyzed: jñāna saṃskāra mātra prabhava tvam smṛti tvam iti ced na
translated: If it is said that the nature of being memory is the nature of being produced only from the impression of knowledge, no (it is not so).

analyzed: mānasa pratyakṣa jā smṛtiḥ iti asmābhiḥ aṅgīkṛta tvena pakṣasya aprasiddha viśeṣaṇa tvāt dṛṣṭāntasya sādhya vaikalyāt ca
translated: Because for us, memory is accepted as born of mental perception, and so the subject is not well-known and the example is defective in the probandum.

analyzed: kiñca indriya vyāpāra anvaya vyatireka anuvidhāyi idam rajata jñānam tat kāyarm iti avasīyate
translated: Moreover, it is ascertained that this knowledge of silver conforms to the operation and absence of the sense organs.

analyzed: tathāca bādhita viṣaya tvam
translated: And so, it has an contradicted object.

analyzed: anvaya vyatirekayoḥ anyatra upayogāt na evam iti ced
translated: If it is said that it is not so because the concomitance and non-concomitance are useful elsewhere,

analyzed: tat kim asya smṛti tve siddhe nyatra upakṣayaḥ kalpyate uta evam eva
translated: then is the usefulness elsewhere imagined after the establishment of its being memory or just as it is?

analyzed: na ādyaḥ
translated: Not the first.

analyzed: tad abhāvāt asmāt eva anumānāt tad siddhau anyonya āśraya prasaṅgāt
translated: Because of the absence of that (usefulness elsewhere), and because of the contingence of mutual dependence if that is established from this very inference.

analyzed: na dvitīyaḥ
translated: Not the second.

analyzed: samīcīna rajata pratyaye pi tathātva prasaṅgāt
translated: Because in the case of a correct cognition of silver, the same would follow.

original: anyatropakṣayaḥ śaṅkita iti cenna tathāpi sandigdhakālātītatānistārāt /
analyzed: anyatra upakṣayaḥ śaṅkitaḥ iti ced na tathā api sandigdha kāla atīta tā nistārāt
translated: If it be said that the possibility of the other being impaired is suspected, we say—no; because even so, the time being doubtful, the fact of its being past cannot be ascertained.

original: samīcīnarajatānubhave 'pi kathamanyatrānupakṣayo niścito bhavatā /🔽anubhavatvaniścayāditi cenna indriyavyāpārasyānyatropayogaśaṅkayānubhavatvasyāpi sandigdhatvāt /
analyzed: samīcīna rajata anubhave pi katham anyatra anupakṣayaḥ niścitaḥ bhavatā  anubhava tva niścayāt iti ced na indriya vyāpārasya anyatra upayoga śaṅkayā anubhava tvasya api sandigdha tvāt
translated: Even in the case of a correct cognition of silver, how can it be ascertained that there is no impairment of the other?🔽If it be said that it is so because the fact of its being a cognition is certain,—we say—no; because even the fact of its being a cognition is doubtful, on account of the suspicion that the operation of the sense-organ may be useful elsewhere.

analyzed: purovarti vyavahāra saṃvādāt anubhava tva niścayaḥ iti ced na saṃvāda anubhavasya api aniścita tvāt
translated: If it be said that the certainty regarding its being a cognition is due to its being in conformity with the usage regarding the object before the eyes,—we say—no; because the cognition of conformity also is uncertain.

original: asati bādhake na vṛthānyatropakṣayaḥ śaṅkayata iti cet samaṃ prakṛte 'pīti /
analyzed: asati bādhake na vṛthā anyatra upakṣayaḥ śaṅkayate iti ced samam prakṛte pi iti
translated: If it be said that in the absence of any sublation, the possibility of impairment elsewhere should not be suspected,—the same is the case with the matter under consideration.

analyzed: etena apratyutpanna kāraṇa prabhava tvam smṛti tvam iti api ced na
translated: By this (argument) it may be said that the fact of being a recollection is the fact of having a cause that is not present at the time of its production. But this is not so.

analyzed: dvitīya ādi bhrame siddhasādhana tvāt sādhya viśiṣṭa tā prasaṅgāt ca
translated: Because in the case of the second and subsequent illusions, the argument would be futile, and it would also follow that the probandum is present where the probans is present.

analyzed: tatta aṃśa ullekhi tvam smṛti tvam iti ced na
translated: If it be said that the fact of being a recollection is the fact of having the part ‘that’ expressed,—we say—no.

analyzed: anubhava bādhita tvāt
translated: Because this is contradicted by experience.

analyzed: etena jñāna sambhinna artha gocara tvam iti api parāstam
translated: By this (argument) the fact of being a cognition whose object is mixed up with knowledge is also refuted.

analyzed: anena eva pratipakṣa anumāna dvayam api samāhitam veditavyam
translated: By this very [argument] the two inferences of the counter-position should also be understood to be included.

original: nedaṃ smṛtiriti vyavahartavyaṃ tattollekhādismṛticinhavikalatvāditi prathamaprayoge vivakṣitatvāt /
analyzed: na idam smṛtiḥ iti vyavahartavyam tatta ullekha ādi smṛti cinha vikala tvāt iti prathama prayoge vivakṣita tvāt
translated: This [cognition] should not be treated as memory, because it lacks the characteristics of memory such as recollection and so on, because this is intended in the first application.

analyzed: atas eva tikta guḍa ādi pratyaya prakriyā api parāstā
translated: For this very reason, the process of the cognition of bitter molasses and so on is also set aside.
