original: yadapi viparyayābhyupagame kalpanāgauravamuktaṃ tat vivekāgrahamātreṇa pravṛttyāderupapattau tathāstu /
analyzed: yat api viparyaya abhyupagame kalpanā gauravam uktam tat viveka agraha mātreṇa pravṛtti ādeḥ upapattau tathā astu
translated: And what is said about the heaviness of postulation in the acceptance of error, that is so when activity and so on are established by mere non-apprehension of difference.

analyzed: na ca evam iti vakṣyāmaḥ
translated: And we will say that it is not so.

original: kiñcaivamantyatantusaṃyogaparyantaṃ kāraṇakalāpamupādāya paṭo 'pi nāṅgīkaraṇīyaḥ tanmātreṇa sarvasyopapatteḥ /
analyzed: kiñca evam antya tantu saṃyoga paryantam kāraṇa kalāpam upādāya paṭaḥ pi nā aṅgīkaraṇīyaḥ tanmātreṇa sarvasya upapatteḥ
translated: And in this way, even cloth should not be accepted as produced from the totality of causes up to the final conjunction of threads, because everything is established by that alone.

original: paṭo 'pi pramito na hātuṃ śakyate /🔽naca tena vinaikatvādipratyayopapattiriti cet viparyaye 'pyevamiti kuto gauravam /
analyzed: paṭaḥ pi pramitaḥ na hātum śakyate  na ca tena vinā eka tva ādi pratyaya upapattiḥ iti ced viparyaye pi evam iti kutas gauravam
translated: Cloth, which is cognized, cannot be rejected.🔽If it is said that the cognition of oneness and so on is not established without it, then it is the same in the case of error. How is there heaviness?

analyzed: anyathā khyātau kim pramāṇam iti ced
translated: If it is asked what is the proof for the misapprehension,

analyzed: anubhavaḥ eva iti brūmaḥ
translated: we say that it is experience itself.

original: ta yathā hi purovartini rajate rajatamidamiti viśiṣṭaviṣayamekameva vijñānaṃ svaprakāśatayā
analyzed: yathā hi purovartini rajate rajatam idam iti viśiṣṭa viṣayam ekam eva vijñānam sva prakāśa tayā
translated: Just as in the case of silver in front, the cognition with a specific object, this is silver, appears either as self-luminous

original: vā mānasapratyakṣatayā vā sākṣiṇā vāvabhāsate tathedamapīti kuto 'sya na viśiṣṭaviṣayaikajñānatvam /
analyzed: vā mānasa pratyakṣa tayā vā sākṣiṇā vā avabhāsate tathā idam api iti kutas na viśiṣṭa viṣaya eka jñāna tvam
translated: or as mental perception or as directly experienced, in the same way, why should this not have a specific object and be one cognition?

original: na hi tato 'sya mātrayāpi viśeṣaṃ paśyāmaḥ /
analyzed: na hi mātrayā api viśeṣam paśyāmaḥ
translated: For we do not see even the slightest difference from that.

analyzed: darśane vā asmad pravṛttiḥ na syāt
translated: If we did, we would not engage in it.

original: kevalamekaṃ tādṛgviṣayasadbhāvādyathārthaṃ tadabhāvāparamayathārthamaviśiṣṭaviṣayamanekamapi tadviśiṣṭaviṣayaikatvena pratibhāsata iti cenna
analyzed: kevalam ekam tādṛś viṣaya sadbhāvāt yathārtham tad abhāva aparam ayathārtham aviśiṣṭa viṣayam anekam api tad viśiṣṭa viṣaya eka tvena pratibhāsate iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that it is simply one such, true due to the existence of that object, false due to the absence of that, with an unspecified object, though many, it appears as one with a specific object, that is not so.

original: anyasyāpi viśiṣṭaviṣayaikatve samāśvāsāsambhavaprasaṅgāt viparyayāṅgīkāraprasakteśca /🔽nāstyeva viśiṣṭaviṣayaikatvagrāhipratyaya iti cenna anubhavasiddhajñānāpalāpe smṛtyanubhavasvarūpāpalāpaprasaṅgāt /
analyzed: anyasya api viśiṣṭa viṣaya ekatve samāśvāsa asambhava prasaṅgāt viparyaya aṅgīkāra prasakteḥ ca  na asti eva viśiṣṭa viṣaya eka tva grāhi pratyayaḥ iti ced na anubhava siddha jñāna apalāpe smṛti anubhava svarūpa apalāpa prasaṅgāt
translated: Because if another also had confidence in having a specific object and being one, it would lead to the undesirable consequence of accepting error.🔽If it is argued that there is no cognition at all that grasps a specific object and is one, that is not so, because if a well-known cognition is denied, it would lead to the undesirable consequence of denying the nature of memory and experience.

analyzed: kiñca rajata arthinaḥ śuktikāyām pravṛttiḥ anyathā anupapanna anyathā jñānam ākṣipati
translated: Moreover, the engagement of one who desires silver in a shell, which is otherwise inexplicable, implies a false cognition.

analyzed: nanu iyam pravṛttiḥ svarūpataḥ viṣayataḥ ca agṛhīta bhedāt vedana dvayāt upapadyate iti ced
translated: If it be said that this activity is possible from the two cognitions which are not apprehended as different in form and object,

analyzed: kaḥ yam bhedaḥ nāma
translated: what is this difference called?

original: kiṃ svarūpam uta pṛthaktavam utānyonyābhāvaḥ athavāvaidharmyam /
analyzed: kim svarūpam uta pṛthaktavam uta anyonya abhāvaḥ athavā avaidharmyam
translated: Is it the form, or is it the distinctness, or is it the mutual absence, or is it the dissimilarity?

analyzed: na prathamaḥ
translated: Not the first.

analyzed: sva prakāśa jñāna jñeya pratibhāse tad anavabhāsa anupapatteḥ
translated: Because it is not possible that the form of the cognition and the object of cognition which are self-luminous should not appear.

analyzed: na dvitīyaḥ
translated: Not the second.

analyzed: guṇe guṇa an abhyupagamāt
translated: Because the quality is not accepted as a quality.

analyzed: sarvatra bheda agraha sambhavena anya arthinaḥ nyatra pravṛtti prasaṅgāt
translated: Because it would lead to the absurdity of the activity of one seeking one thing in another, as the non-apprehension of difference is possible everywhere.

analyzed: tṛtīye vaktavyam
translated: In the third, it should be said:

analyzed: kim idam rajata tvayoḥ anyonya abhāvaḥ na avabhāsate uta idam rajatayoḥ iti
translated: Is this mutual absence of silver and this not appearing, or is this of silver and this?

analyzed: na ādyaḥ
translated: Not the first.

analyzed: aparyāya śabda smārakayoḥ jāti vyaktayoḥ tad anavabhāsa asambhavāt
translated: Because the non-appearance of those two, the universal and the individual, which are remembered by synonymous words, is not possible.

analyzed: kiñca anyonya abhāvaḥ nāma anyonya svarūpam eva parasya
translated: Moreover, what is called mutual absence is just the mutual form of the other.

analyzed: tat ca upalabdham iti katham tad anupalambhaḥ
translated: And that is apprehended. So how can there be non-apprehension of that?

analyzed: atas eva na dvitīyaḥ
translated: For this very reason, not the second.

analyzed: na api caturthaḥ
translated: Nor is the fourth.

original: rajatāsambhavinaḥ purovartinīdantvasya purovartyasambhavinaśca rajate rajatatvasya gṛhītatvāt /
analyzed: rajata asambhavinaḥ purovartinī dantvasya purovarti asambhavinaḥ ca rajate rajata tvasya gṛhīta tvāt
translated: Because the silverness of the silver which is not possible in the present shell-object, and the silverness of the silver which is not possible in the present place, have been apprehended.

analyzed: idam rajata tvayoḥ asaṃsarga agrahaḥ vivakṣitaḥ iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that the non-apprehension of non-connection between this and silver is intended, it is not so.

analyzed: a saṃsargaḥ hi saṃsargasya abhāvaḥ
translated: For non-connection is the absence of connection.

original: sa cedaṃrajatatvayoḥ svarūpameva pareṣām iti kathaṃ tadavabhāse nāvabhāseta /
analyzed: sa ca idam rajata tvayoḥ svarūpam eva pareṣām iti katham tad avabhāse na avabhāseta
translated: And if that is the very nature of this and silver for others, how could it not appear when they appear?

analyzed: viparyaya abhyupagama vādibhiḥ api bheda agrahaḥ bhyupagamanīyaḥ eva
translated: Even those who accept error must accept the non-apprehension of difference.

analyzed: tatra api samānaḥ doṣaḥ iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that the same fault applies there also, it is not so.

analyzed: bhedasya svarūpa tāvat mātra tva anabhyupagamāt
translated: Because difference is not accepted as being of the same measure as the nature.

original: atha manyase purovatirno yaḥ śuktitvādidharmo rajatavyāvartako yaśca rajate vyavahitadeśatvādidharmaḥ purovartivyāvartakastayoragrahaṇaṃ pravartakamiti
analyzed: atha manyase purovatiḥ no yaḥ śukti tva ādi dharmaḥ rajata vyāvartakaḥ yaḥ ca rajate vyavahita deśa tva ādi dharmaḥ purovarti vyāvartakaḥ tayoḥ agrahaṇam pravartakam iti
translated: If you think that the non-apprehension of the property of shell-ness etc. which distinguishes silver in the present object, and the non-apprehension of the property of distant place etc. which distinguishes the present object in silver, is the instigator,

original: tadasat /🔽purovartino hi śuktitvāgrahe na śuktikārthī tatra pravarteta /
analyzed: tat asat  purovartinaḥ hi śukti tva agrahe na śuktikā arthī tatra pravarteta
translated: that is not so.🔽For if there is no apprehension of the shell-ness of the present object, one seeking a shell would not engage in it.

original: rajatasya cāsannihitatvādidharmāgrahe rajatārthī na tatra pravartatām /
analyzed: rajatasya ca asannihita tva ādi dharma agrahe rajata arthī na tatra pravartatām
translated: And if there is no apprehension of the property of silver being not present etc., one seeking silver would not engage in it.

analyzed: rajata arthinaḥ pravṛttiḥ tu kutas
translated: But how can there be activity towards something else on the part of one who desires silver, when there is no apprehension of difference?

original: kiñca bhedāgrahādanyārthino 'nyatra pravṛttimācakṣāṇaḥ praṣṭavyaḥ /🔽kimayameva vyavahāro bhedāgrahādanyastvabhedagrahāt /
analyzed: kiñca bheda agrahāt anya arthinaḥ nyatra pravṛttim ācakṣāṇaḥ praṣṭavyaḥ  kim ayam eva vyavahāraḥ bheda agrahāt anyaḥ tu abheda grahāt
translated: Moreover, one who maintains that activity towards something else on the part of one desiring something else is due to non-apprehension of difference should be asked:🔽Is this usage alone due to non-apprehension of difference, and something else due to apprehension of non-difference?

analyzed: uta sarvaḥ pi bheda agrahāt iti
translated: Or is all usage due to non-apprehension of difference?

analyzed: na ādyaḥ
translated: Not the first.

analyzed: aniyata kāraṇa tā āpātāt
translated: Because it would lead to the undesirable consequence of indeterminate causality.

analyzed: nanu ca sarvatra abheda grahaḥ eva pravartakaḥ
translated: But isn't the apprehension of non-difference itself the instigator in all cases?

analyzed: tad sārūpyāt bheda agrahaḥ tathā iṣyate
translated: The non-apprehension of difference is accepted as such due to its similarity to that.

analyzed: yathā hi
translated: For example,

original: asti tāvatpravartakatvābhimatapratyaye 'pyapekṣitopāyapurovṛttyavagamāṃśayoḥ svarūpato viṣayataśca bhedavirahādeva bhedāgrahaḥ /
analyzed: asti tāvat pravartaka tva abhimata pratyaye pi apekṣita upāya purovṛtti avagama aṃśayoḥ svarūpataḥ viṣayataḥ ca bheda virahāt eva bheda agrahaḥ
translated: in the cognition that is considered to be the instigator, there is non-apprehension of difference due to the absence of difference in the aspects of the understood object that is a means to the desired goal and the object in front, both in terms of their own nature and in terms of their object.

analyzed: tathā atra api avivecakam sādhāraṇam rūpam avagamyate
translated: In the same way, here too, a non-discriminating common form is understood.

analyzed: na avagamyate ca sādhāraṇa dharmaḥ vedyayoḥ vedanayoḥ ca
translated: And the discriminating uncommon property of the two objects of knowledge and the two cognitions is not understood.

analyzed: tatas ca eka pravartaka pratyaya sadṛśa vapuḥ upajanayati idam vedana dvayam pravṛttim iti
translated: Therefore, this pair of cognitions, which has a body similar to the single instigating cognition, produces activity.

analyzed: mā evam
translated: This is not so.

analyzed: aniyata hetuka tva anistārāt
translated: Because it does not escape having an indeterminate cause.

original: kiñca pravartakasādṛśyātpravṛttirityatraiva kalpyate uta yadyatsadṛśaṃ tattatkāryakārīti sarvatra niyamaḥ /
analyzed: kiñca pravartaka sādṛśyāt pravṛttiḥ iti atra eva kalpyate uta yat yat sadṛśam tat tat kārya kāri iti sarvatra niyamaḥ
translated: Moreover, is it only in the case of the activity being similar to the instigator that the activity is supposed to arise, or is the general rule that whatever is similar to something is the producer of that?

analyzed: na ādyaḥ
translated: Not the first.

analyzed: adṛṣṭa kalpanā prasaṅgāt
translated: Because it would lead to the assumption of the unseen.

original: pravṛttilobhāditthamāsthīyata iti cenna tasyā viparyayāṅgīkārādeva suvyavasthiteḥ /
analyzed: pravṛtti lobhāt ittham āsthīyate iti ced na tasyāḥ viparyaya aṅgīkārāt eva su vyavasthiteḥ
translated: If it is argued that it is accepted in this way out of greed for activity, it is not so, because the well-establishedness of that is accepted even by the opposite view.

analyzed: na dvitīyaḥ
translated: Not the second.

original: kṛśānusadṛśād guñjāpuñjacchītanivṛtteradarśanāt /🔽nanvidaṃ rajatamiti yathā rajatasādhyā buddhī rajatasadṛśācchuktiśakalādbhavati bhavatām /
analyzed: kṛśānu sadṛśāt guñjā puñjat śīta nivṛtteḥ adarśanāt  nanu idam rajatam iti yathā rajata sādhyā buddhī rajata sadṛśāt śuktiśakalāt bhavati bhavatām
translated: Because the cessation of cold is not seen from a heap of fireflies similar to fire.

analyzed: tathā pravartaka eka jñāna sadṛśāt jñāna dvayāt pravṛttiḥ api kutas na syāt
translated: Just as for you, the cognition of silver, which has silver as its object, arises from a piece of shell similar to silver, in the same way, why should not activity also arise from two cognitions similar to a single instigating cognition?

analyzed: mā evam
translated: Not so.

analyzed: arthasya sākṣāt jñāna kāraṇatva anabhyupagamāt
translated: Because the object is not accepted as the direct cause of cognition.

analyzed: sādṛśyam tu kāca ādi vat doṣatayā upayujyate
translated: But similarity is used as a fault, like a flaw.

original: api cedaṃ jñānadvayaṃ pravartakasādṛśyamātrādyadi pravṛttimupajanayennivṛttimapi kutā ena janayet /
analyzed: api ca idam jñāna dvayam pravartaka sādṛśya mātrāt yadi pravṛttim upajanayet nivṛttim api kutas ena janayet
translated: Moreover, if this pair of cognitions were to generate activity merely from the similarity to the instigator, why would it not also generate cessation?

analyzed: asti hi tatra nivartaka bheda graha sārūpyam abheda agrahaṇam
translated: For there is similarity to the apprehension of the difference of the restrainer, which is the non-apprehension of non-difference.

original: nanu ca yathā bhedāgraho bhavatāmabhedagrahaṃ janayati tathā pravṛttimapi kiṃ na janayediti /
analyzed: nanu ca yathā bheda agrahaḥ bhavatām abheda graham janayati tathā pravṛttim api kim na janayet iti
translated: But, (it may be asked,) why should not the non-apprehension of difference, just as it produces the apprehension of non-difference, produce also activity?

analyzed: mā evam
translated: No, (we reply).

analyzed: vaiṣamyāt
translated: Because there is a difference (between the two cases).

original: jñānajanane hi kāraṇānāṃ svātantṛyaṃ na puruṣasya /
analyzed: jñāna janane hi kāraṇānām svātantṛyam na puruṣasya
translated: For in the production of knowledge the causes are independent, not the Spirit.

analyzed: tāni ca yādṛśa sāmagrī madhya patitāni tādṛśam jñānam upajanayanti
translated: And they produce the knowledge which is in accordance with the nature of the aggregate of which they are a part.

analyzed: na tu puruṣa ākāṅkṣām apekṣante heya upekṣaṇīya jñāna jananāt
translated: But they do not depend on the Spirit's desire, because they produce the knowledge of what is to be rejected or accepted.

original: pravṛttau tu puruṣa eva svatantro na jñānam /🔽sa hi satyapi jñāne 'pekṣita eva pravartate /
analyzed: pravṛttau tu puruṣaḥ eva svatantraḥ na jñānam  sa hi sati api jñāne pekṣitaḥ eva pravartate
translated: But in activity the Spirit is the independent agent, not the knowledge.

original: natu jñānaṃ jātamityevodāsīnaviparītayorapi /🔽tathāca bhedāgrahadoṣakaluṣitāni nayanādīni viparyayaṃ janayanti /🔽natu puruṣaḥ pravartakasādṛśyamātreṇa pravartitumarhati /
analyzed: na tu jñānam jātam iti eva udāsīna viparītayoḥ api  tathā ca bheda agraha doṣa kaluṣitāni nayana ādīni viparyayam janayanti  na tu puruṣaḥ pravartaka sādṛśya mātreṇa pravartitum arhati
translated: For he is impelled to activity even when knowledge is present, and he is not so impelled when knowledge is absent.🔽And knowledge is not the cause of activity merely because it is similar to the impelling cause,

analyzed: tathātve vā nivartaka sādṛśyāt prekṣāvān nivarteta api iti uktam
translated: because if it were, then the man of discernment would desist from activity because knowledge is similar to the cause of desisting from activity.

original: kiñca jñānamarthe pravṛttiṃ kiṃ sākṣādupajanayati utecchāprayatnadvāreṇa /
analyzed: kiñca jñānam arthe pravṛttim kim sākṣāt upajanayati uta icchā prayatna dvāreṇa
translated: Moreover, does knowledge directly produce activity with regard to the object, or through desire and effort?

analyzed: na ādyaḥ
translated: Not the first,🔽because it is not seen to be so.

analyzed: heya upekṣaṇīyayoḥ api pravṛtti prasaṅgāt
translated: Because there would be activity even towards what is to be abandoned or ignored.

analyzed: dvitīye katham agṛhīta bhedāt jñāna dvayāt pravṛttiḥ
translated: In the second case, how can there be activity from two cognitions that do not apprehend the difference?

analyzed: purovarti pravṛtteḥ hi sākṣāt kāraṇam prayatnaḥ
translated: For the direct cause of activity towards what is in front is effort.

analyzed: tasya ca icchā
translated: And that is due to desire.

analyzed: tasyāḥ ca samīhita sādhana tā anumānam
translated: And that is due to the inference of being the means to what is desired.

analyzed: na ca tat sambhavati  rajata tvasya pakṣa dharma taā
translated: And that is not possible.

original: yāpratipannatvāt /🔽atha rajate pratipannena rajatatvena tatsamīhitasādhanatājñānamupajātaṃ bhedāgrahabhedagrahe 'bhedagraha
analyzed: yā a pratipanna tvāt  atha rajate pratipannena rajata tvena tad samīhita sādhana tā jñānam upajātam bheda agraha bheda grahe bheda graha
translated: Because the property of being a silver-possessor is not understood.

analyzed: sārūpyāt purovartinī icchām upajanayati iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that when silver is apprehended, the knowledge of being the means to what is desired by the property of being silver arises, and due to the apprehension of non-difference from the similarity of the apprehension of difference, it generates desire for what is in front, that is not so.

analyzed: tathā sati bheda graha sārūpyāt abheda agrahāt upekṣayā api āpātāt iti
translated: Because in that case, due to the similarity of the apprehension of difference, there would be the undesirable consequence of indifference even due to the apprehension of non-difference.

analyzed: nanu astu tarhi dvitīyaḥ pakṣaḥ
translated: If it is argued that then let the second view be accepted,

analyzed: tathā hi
translated: it is replied: It is like this.

analyzed: sati arajate tāvat asti rajata vyakti jñānam rajata tva jāti bodhaḥ ca
translated: In real silver, there is the knowledge of the individual silver and the understanding of the class property of silver.

analyzed: na ca asti a saṃsarga jñānam
translated: And there is no knowledge of non-connection.

analyzed: etāvatā eva tatra tad arthinām pravṛttiḥ
translated: With just this much, those who desire it engage in activity there.

analyzed: nahi tayoḥ tādātmyam paśyanti
translated: They do not see identity between those two.

analyzed: jāti vyaktayoḥ da tādātmya abhāvāt
translated: Because the class and the individual do not have the same nature.

original: naca tatra saṃsargagrahaḥ pravartakaḥ samavāyo hi tayoḥ saṃsargaḥ /
analyzed: na ca tatra saṃsarga grahaḥ pravartakaḥ samavāyaḥ hi tayoḥ saṃsargaḥ
translated: And the apprehension of the relation is not the prompter to activity. For the relation of those two is inherence.

analyzed: na ca asau pratyakṣaḥ
translated: And that is not perceived.

analyzed: indriya sannikarṣa abhāvāt
translated: Because there is no contact with the sense organs.

analyzed: na api anumānaḥ tadā śakyate jñātum
translated: Nor can it be known by inference at that time.

analyzed: liṅga abhāvāt
translated: Because there is no probans.

original: avisaṃvādivyavahārajanakatvaviśiṣṭasākāṃkṣarūparūpisahopalambho hi talliṅgam na cāvisaṃvāditvaṃ prāk pravṛtteḥ śakyādhigamam /
analyzed: avisaṃvādi vyavahāra janaka tva viśiṣṭa sākāṃkṣa rūpa rūpi saha upalambhaḥ hi tat liṅgam na ca avisaṃvādi tvam prāk pravṛtteḥ śakya adhigamam
translated: For the probans for that is the perception of the object with a desire, qualified by the property of generating a non-contradictory cognition. And non-contradiction cannot be ascertained before activity.

original: asti cedaṃ sakalamapi pravartakaṃ vibhrame 'pīti kuto viparyayābhāve pravṛttyanupapattiḥ /
analyzed: asti ca idam sakalam api pravartakam vibhrame pi iti kutas viparyaya abhāve pravṛtti anupapattiḥ
translated: And all this is a prompter to activity even in error. So how can there be an impossibility of activity in the absence of error?

analyzed: idam rajata tva ādhārayoḥ bheda grahaḥ vā sati arajate pravṛtti hetuḥ
translated: Or the apprehension of the difference between the substratum of this and the substratum of silver is the cause of activity when silver is real.

analyzed: asti ca asau prakṛte pi
translated: And that exists in the present case also.

analyzed: na ca purovartini rajata tva apratītau icchā anupapattiḥ iti vācyam
translated: And it should not be said that the desire is not possible when silver is not apprehended in the thing in front.

original: rajatatvena sahāgṛhītāsaṃsargatayā vā rajatādagṛhītabhedatayā vā samīhitasādhanatānumānopapatteriti etadapyayuktam /
analyzed: rajata tvena saha agṛhīta asaṃsarga tayā vā rajatāt agṛhīta bheda tayā vā samīhita sādhana tā anumāna upapatteḥ iti etat api ayuktam
translated: Because the inference of the means to the desired end is possible by the non-apprehension of the relation or by the non-apprehension of the difference from silver, even though it is not apprehended along with silver. This is also incorrect.

analyzed: a saṃsarga agraha bheda agrahayoḥ nirasta tvāt
translated: Because the non-apprehension of the relation and the non-apprehension of difference have been refuted.

analyzed: kiñca evam sati sa vikalpaka pratyakṣa uccheda prasaṅgaḥ
translated: Moreover, if this were so, there would be the undesirable consequence of the destruction of determinate perception.
Because the apprehension of mere things and the non-apprehension of non-connection are the same as indeterminate perception.

analyzed: rūpa rūpi bhāvaḥ savikalpake cakāsti
translated: The relation of form and that which has form appears in determinate [perception].

original: nirvikalpake tu vastusvarūpamātramiti bheda iti cet /🔽ko 'yaṃ rūparūpibhāvaḥ dharmadharmiṇoḥ parasparākāṅkṣāviṣayatvamiti cet /
analyzed: nirvikalpake tu vastu svarūpa mātram iti bhedaḥ iti ced  kaḥ yam rūpa rūpi bhāvaḥ dharma dharmiṇoḥ paraspara ākāṅkṣā viṣaya tvam iti ced
translated: But in indeterminate [perception], only the nature of the thing itself appears. Thus there is a difference. If this is argued,🔽what is this relation of form and that which has form? If it is said to be the mutual dependence of the property and the possessor of the property,

analyzed: tat kim tayoḥ svarūpam uta anyat
translated: is that the nature of those two or something else?

analyzed: ādye tat api nirvikalpake prakāśate eva
translated: If it is the first, that also appears in indeterminate [perception] itself.

analyzed: dvitīye kim tat aindriyakam uta atīndriyam
translated: If it is the second, is it perceptible or imperceptible?

analyzed: prathame katham avikalpake na prakāśeta
translated: If it is the first, how would it not appear in indeterminate [perception]?

original: dvitīye kathaṃ savikalpake prakāśeta /🔽ata tadvastudarśanasāpekṣadaśarnaṃ nirvikalpake 'cakāsadapi savikalpake bhātīti cet /
analyzed: dvitīye katham sa vikalpake prakāśeta  nirvikalpake cakāsat api savikalpake bhāti iti ced
translated: If it is the second, how would it appear in determinate [perception]?🔽If it is argued that although it does not appear in indeterminate [perception], it appears in determinate [perception] because it depends on the perception of that thing,

analyzed: tarhi na tat sa ṛṃga atiriktam asti iti saṃsarga grahāt eva savikalpaka upapattiḥ
translated: then it does not exist apart from that thing. Thus determinate [perception] is established by the apprehension of the relation itself.

analyzed: na ca nirvikalpakasya pravartaka tvam asti
translated: And indeterminate [perception] does not have the ability to initiate action.

analyzed: kiñca a saṃsarga agrahāt eva sarvatra pravṛtti aṅgīkāre madhyama vṛddha pravṛtteḥ api tathātvena
translated: Moreover, if it is accepted that activity everywhere is due to the non-apprehension of non-connection, then the activity of an adult in the middle would also be like that,

analyzed: bālasya tadīya saṃsarga jñāna anumāna upāya abhāvāt padānām anvita artheṣu vyutpatti anupapattau
translated: and because the child has no means of inferring the knowledge of his connection, the derivation of the meaning of words in relation to the connected meaning is not possible,

analyzed: śābda pramāṇa uccheda prasaṅgaḥ
translated: and there would be the undesirable consequence of the destruction of verbal testimony.

analyzed: atha evam manyeta
translated: If, on the other hand, one thinks thus:

analyzed: asti eva vyavahartuḥ anvaya jñānam
translated: The knower of relation does exist.

analyzed: kim nāma sat api na pravṛttau upayujyate
translated: What is there, even though existing, is not useful in activity?

analyzed: atas na kaścid doṣaḥ iti
translated: Therefore, there is no fault at all.

original: tatra kiṃ tadanvayajñānaṃ pravṛttau niyatamutāniyatamiti vācyam /
analyzed: tatra kim tad anvaya jñānam pravṛttau niyatam uta aniyatam iti vācyam
translated: In that case, it should be said whether that knowledge of relation is certain or uncertain in activity.

analyzed: ādye stu tad pravṛttau upayogi mā vā bhūt
translated: If the first, let it be useful in activity or not.

original: anyathākhyātiṃ vinā na rajatārthinaḥ purovartini pravṛttiriti tāvatsiddham /
analyzed: anyathā khyātim vinā na rajata arthinaḥ purovartini pravṛttiḥ iti tāvat siddham
translated: It is well established that without superimposition, there is no activity of one who desires silver in the thing in front.

analyzed: dvitīye tu śabda ucchedaḥ tad avasthaḥ
translated: But if the second, the destruction of words remains as it is.

analyzed: kiñca niyata pūrva bhāvi ca akāraṇam ca iti anupapannam
translated: Moreover, it is not possible that what precedes with certainty is not a cause.

original: pratibhāsamānayorasaṃsargāgrahe sati saṃsargagraho 'varjanīyasannidhiriti cenna viparyayasyāpi vaktuṃ śakyatvāt /
analyzed: pratibhāsamānayoḥ a saṃsarga agrahe sati saṃsarga grahaḥ varjanīya sannidhiḥ iti ced na viparyayasya api vaktum śakya tvāt
translated: If it is argued that when there is no apprehension of non-connection between the two appearing objects, the apprehension of connection is an unavoidable presence, it is not so, because the opposite can also be stated.

analyzed: avaśyam ca etat evam
translated: And this must necessarily be so.

analyzed: vyavahāraḥ hi vyavahartavya upalambha nibandhanaḥ yuktaḥ
translated: For usage is rightly based on the apprehension of what is to be used.

analyzed: na tu vyavaharaṇīya viparyaya anupalabdhi nibandhanaḥ
translated: But it is not based on the non-apprehension of the opposite of what is to be used.

analyzed: nahi ghaṭa vyavahāraḥ vyavahartavya jñāna puraḥsaraḥ vyavahāra tvāt ghaṭa vyavahāra vat
translated: For the usage of a pot is not preceded by the knowledge of what is to be used, because it is a usage, like the usage of a pot.

analyzed: vivāda padam jñānam purovarti viṣayam tad viṣaya vyavahāra janaka tvāt saṃmata vat
translated: The disputed cognition is about what is in front, because it produces usage about that, like what is agreed upon.

original: purovarti vā rajatajñānagocaro rajatajñānagocaro rajatānupāyatve sati tadarthipravṛttiviṣayatvātsamyagrajatavat /
analyzed: purovarti vā rajata jñāna gocaraḥ rajata jñāna gocaraḥ rajata anupāya tve sati tad arthi pravṛtti viṣaya tvāt samyak rajata vat
translated: Or what is in front is the object of the cognition of silver, because it is the object of the cognition of silver, even though not the means to it, since it is the object of activity by one who desires it, like real silver.

original: vivādapadaṃ rajatajñānamidaṃ jñānānna bhidyate prakāśamānāttato 'prakāśamānabhedatve sati prakāśamānatvātsampratipannarajatajñānavadityādayaḥ
analyzed: vivāda padam rajata jñānam idam jñānāt na bhidyate prakāśamānāt prakāśamāna bheda tve sati prakāśamāna tvāt sampratipanna rajata jñāna vat ityādayaḥ
translated: The disputed cognition of silver is not different from cognition, because it is manifest and not manifestly different from it, like the agreed-upon cognition of silver.

original: kiñca viparyayābhāve nedaṃ rajatamiti jñānasya bādhakatvamanupapadyamānaṃ taṃ gamayati /
analyzed: kiñca viparyaya abhāve na idam rajatam iti jñānasya bādhaka tvam anupapadyamānam tam gamayati
translated: Moreover, in the absence of error, the cognition this is not silver cannot be a sublater, which is not possible.

analyzed: nahi tathātve bādhaka tvam asti
translated: For if it were so, it could not be a sublater.

analyzed: na tāvat agrahaṇa nivartaka tayā bādhaka tvam
translated: First, it cannot be a sublater by causing the cessation of non-apprehension.

analyzed: sarva pratyayānām tathā tva āpātāt
translated: because in that case all cognitions would be so.

analyzed: nā api vyavahāra vicchedaka tvena
translated: Nor can it be by the cessation of practical affairs.

analyzed: atadarthinām vyavahāra anutpattau na idam rajatam iti jñānasya ābādhaka tva prasaṅgāt
translated: Because in the non-occurrence of practical affairs for one not desiring that, there would be the undesirable consequence that the cognition this is not silver would not be a sublater.

analyzed: vyāghra cora ādi jñānasya api pravṛtti vicchedaka tvena bādhaka tva prasakteḥ ca
translated: And because there would be the undesirable consequence that the cognition of a tiger, thief, etc. would also be a sublater by the cessation of activity.

analyzed: na ca arthasya vyavahāra yogya tā vicchedaka tvena
translated: Nor can it be by the cessation of the object's fitness for practical affairs.

analyzed: samaya antare pi tatra vibhramāt pravṛtti abhāva āpatteḥ
translated: Because even in another convention, the absence of activity due to error there would follow.

analyzed: na ca vyavahāra pratibandhaka tvena  aviveka nivṛttau kāraṇa abhāvāt eva vyavahāra anupapatteḥ pratibandhaka kalpanā yogāt
translated: Nor can it be by the obstruction of practical affairs.

analyzed: vyāghra cora ādi jñānasya bādhaka tā āpatteḥ ca
translated: Because the postulation of an obstruction is not proper due to the impossibility of practical affairs even in the absence of the cessation of non-discrimination, and because there would be the undesirable consequence that the cognition of a tiger, thief, etc. would be a sublater.

analyzed: vimatam ayathārtham bādhya tvāt vayavahāra vat iti
translated: The object of doubt is unreal because it is sublated, like a practical affair.

analyzed: atas eva bhrānti tva prasiddhayā api viparyāsa siddhiḥ
translated: And for this very reason, the establishment of error is also by the well-known nature of error.

analyzed: evam ca sati pratyaya tva anumānam kāla atyaya apadiṣyam veditavyam
translated: And when this is so, the inference of being a cognition should be understood to be one whose subject is past.

analyzed: aduṣya karaṇa janya tva upādhi grastam ca
translated: And it is also undermined by the limiting condition of being produced by unimpaired sense faculties.

analyzed: etena rajata jñāna tva anumānam api nirastam
translated: By this (argument) the inference of silver-cognition is also refuted.

analyzed: anyathā vimataḥ vyavahāraḥ yathārthaḥ vyavahāra tvāt
translated: Otherwise, the disputed usage would be true, because it is usage.

analyzed: rajata viṣayaḥ vā rajata vyavahāra tvāt iti api syāt
translated: Or, it would be about silver, because it is a usage about silver.

analyzed: yat api jñāna tvam ca yathārtha mātra vṛtti ityādi
translated: And what is said, And the universal of cognition occurs only in what is true, etc.

original: tatra kimidaṃ jñānatvaṃ sāmānyaṃ vā pratiniyataṃ vā /
analyzed: tatra kim idam jñāna tvam sāmānyam vā pratiniyatam vā
translated: There, is this universal of cognition a general one or a particular one?

analyzed: na ādyaḥ
translated: Not the first.

analyzed: vādi prativādinoḥ āśraya asiddheḥ
translated: Because the substratum is not established for both the proponent and the opponent.

original: dvitīye yathārthajñānavṛttijñānatve siddhasādhanatā /🔽vimatajñānavṛttijñānatvapakṣīkāre 'pi mātreti vyarthaṃ syāt /
analyzed: vimata jñāna vṛtti jñāna tva pakṣīkāre pi mātrā iti vyartham syāt
translated: In the second case, if it is the universal of cognition that occurs only in true cognition, then it is a proof of what is already established.🔽Even if the position is taken that it is the universal of cognition that occurs in the disputed cognition, only would be meaningless.

analyzed: tad tyāgena ca pratijñāne prathama anumāna doṣaḥ eva
translated: And if it is abandoned and asserted, then it is just the fault of the first inference.

analyzed: kiñca yathāthar mātra vṛtti iti ayathārtha avṛtti tva mātram vivakṣitam uta ayathāthar jñāna avṛtti tvam
translated: Moreover, is it intended that it occurs only in what is true, meaning it occurs only in what is not true, or that it does not occur in the cognition of what is not true?

analyzed: ādye siddhasādhanam ayathārtha vyavahāra avṛtti tvasya siddha tvāt
translated: In the first case, it is a proof of what is already established, because the fact that it does not occur in what is not true is already established.

analyzed: dvitīye parasya aprasiddha viśeṣaṇa tā
translated: In the second case, the qualifier is not well-known to the opponent.

analyzed: aduṣṭa sāmagrī janya mātra vṛtti tvam apādhiḥ ca
translated: And it is also a counter-example that it occurs only in what is produced by a faultless assemblage of causes.

analyzed: yat ca śuktikā rajata tvena ābhāsate ityādi
translated: And what is said about a shell appearing as silver, etc.

analyzed: tat api asat
translated: That is also wrong.

original: meruḥ sarṣapa ityādivāyānmerorapi sarṣapatvena pratibhāsāddṛṣṭāntasya sādhyavaikalyāt /
analyzed: meruḥ sarṣapaḥ ityādi vāyāt meroḥ api sarṣapa tvena pratibhāsāt dṛṣṭāntasya sādhya vaikalyāt
translated: Because of statements like Meru is a mustard seed, since Meru also appears as a mustard seed, the example is deficient in the probandum.

original: anyathā tathāvidhavākyābhāsaṃ śrutavatā tatpratiṣedho na kriyetāprasaktatvāt /
analyzed: anyathā tathāvidha vākya ābhāsam śrutavatā tad pratiṣedhaḥ na kriyeta aprasakta tvāt
translated: Otherwise, one who has heard such a deceptive statement would not negate it, because it is not relevant.

analyzed: nahi padārtha pratiṣedhaḥ yuktaḥ
translated: For it is not proper to negate the meaning of a word.

original: api caivaṃ satyagniranuguṇa iti bādhitaviṣayasya vākyasya ghaṭaḥ pacatītyapārthakādbhedo na syāt /
analyzed: api ca evam sati agniḥ anuguṇaḥ iti bādhita viṣayasya vākyasya ghaṭaḥ pacati iti apārthakāt bhedaḥ na syāt
translated: Moreover, if it were so, then there would be no difference between the statement fire is not conducive whose content is contradicted and the meaningless statement the pot cooks,

analyzed: yat api idam rajata tādātmyam ityādi
translated: And this the identity with silver, etc.

analyzed: tat ca ayuktam
translated: And that is improper.

analyzed: tad apratītau āśraya asiddheḥ
translated: Because if that is not cognized, the substratum is unestablished.

analyzed: pratītau vyāghātāt dṛṣṭāntasya sādhyasama tvāt ca iti āstām vistaraḥ
translated: If it is cognized, because of contradiction and because the example is equal to the probandum, let it be.
The commentary of Ramanuja.

analyzed: kaścid punar evam āha
translated: But someone else says this:

analyzed: tāsām trivṛtam trivṛtam ekaikām akarot ityādi śruteḥ
translated: From the Vedic text beginning with He made each one threefold by combining them,

analyzed: sametya anyonya saṃyogam ityādi purāṇāt
translated: From the Purana beginning with By combining with each other,

analyzed: tri ātmaka tva ādi sūtrāt ca
translated: And from the sutra on having three parts, etc.,

analyzed: line
translated: In the line...

analyzed: nyāyasudhā on madhvas anuvyākhyāna
translated: The nectar of logic on Madhva's Anuvakhyana.

analyzed: missing including brahmasūtra
translated: Missing including Brahmasutra.

analyzed: ro
translated: Vol. pp. and Vol.

analyzed: or pandurangis edition
translated: pp. of Pandurangi's edition
I. Jnanadhikarana continued.

analyzed: line
translated: Line.

original: anyathā śvetaketūddālakākhyāyikayā pratipāditatvādadvaitamapi na śrutyabhiprāyaḥ syāt /
analyzed: anyathā śvetaketu uddālaka ākhyāyikayā pratipādita tvāt advaitam api na śruti abhiprāyaḥ syāt
translated: Otherwise, even the non-dualism taught by the story of Shvetaketu and Uddalaka would not be the intention of the scriptures.

analyzed: tat ha etat paśyan ṛṣiḥ vāmadevaḥ pratipeda iham brahma asmi
translated: Seeing this, the sage Vamadeva realized, I am Brahman.

original: ityapi paropāsanānuvādo na svārthe tātparyavān syātatha yo 'nyāṃ devatāmupāste' /
analyzed: iti api para upāsana anuvādaḥ na svārthe tātparyavān yaḥ nyām devatām upāste
translated: This too would be a mere restatement of the worship of others, not having the purpose of one's own, as in One who worships another deity.

analyzed: itayupāsanā prakaraṇa tvāt
translated: Because this is the context of worship.

analyzed: tathā ca bahu viplavaḥ syāt
translated: And thus there would be much confusion.

analyzed: tasmāt sūtrakārasya eva ayam abhiprāyaḥ yat jagat janma ādi kāraṇatvam brahmaṇaḥ svarūpa antargatam eva lakṣaṇam iti
translated: Therefore, the intention of the author of the aphorisms is that the cause of the creation etc. of the world is itself the defining characteristic inherent in Brahman.

analyzed: tathā ca vispaṣṭa tadīya vākya antara balāt asya api sūtrasya svarūpa lakṣaṇa paratvam eva iti
translated: And thus, by the power of another clear statement of His, this aphorism too is only about the definition of His nature.

original: yata evaṃ jagajjanmādikāraṇatvaṃ svalakṣaṇamatra sūtre brahmaṇo 'bhidhīyate /
analyzed: yatas evam jagat janma ādi kāraṇatvam sva lakṣaṇam atra sūtre brahmaṇaḥ bhidhīyate
translated: Since the cause of the creation etc. of the world is thus stated here in the aphorism to be the defining characteristic of Brahman,

analyzed: tatas na paramate sya sūtrasya ārambhaḥ eva upapadyate
translated: Therefore, the commencement of this Sūtra is not possible in the opinion of others.

analyzed: iti āha atas iti
translated: Hence, he says 'therefore'.

analyzed: atas jīva aikyam api sa nirācakre jagadguruḥ
translated: Therefore, the Lord of the universe has also refuted the identity of the individual soul.

analyzed: lakṣaṇam hi sajātīya vijātīya vyavaccheda artham bhavati
translated: For a definition serves the purpose of excluding what is of the same or of a different class.
As it is said: 'The purpose of a definition is to exclude what is similar or dissimilar.'

analyzed: tathā ca anena lakṣaṇena sajātīyāt jīvāt vijātīyāt jaḍāt ca brahma vyāvartitam sūtrakāreṇa
translated: And thus by this definition, the author of the Sūtra has excluded Brahman from what is of the same class as the individual soul and from what is of a different class, i.e., from the insentient.

analyzed: jīva aikya nirākaraṇa sūtrasya ārambhaḥ katham jīva aikya vādinām syāt
translated: How can there be the commencement of the Sūtra refuting the identity of the individual soul for those who maintain the identity of the individual soul?

analyzed: syāt yadi idam kathañcid syāt kathañcid yadi idam
translated: It would be so if this were somehow, and if this were somehow.

analyzed: taṭastha lakṣaṇam syāt
translated: If this were a definition of the neutral [position].

analyzed: svarūpa lakṣaṇam iti ca upapāditam
translated: And it has been established that it is a definition of the nature [of Brahman].

original: syādayamadvaitināmanupapanno lakṣaṇārambho yadīdaṃ jīvavyāvṛttyarthaṃ lakṣaṇamuktaṃ syāt /
analyzed: syāt ayam advaitinām anupapannaḥ lakṣaṇa ārambhaḥ yadi idam jīva vyāvṛtti artham lakṣaṇam uktam syāt
translated: This commencement of the definition would be impossible for the non-dualists if this definition were stated for the purpose of excluding the individual soul.

original: jaḍamātravyāvṛttyarthaṃ tu lakṣaṇe vyākhyāyamāne kathaṃ jīvaikyavādināṃ lakṣaṇasūtrārambho 'nupapanna ityata āha nahīti //
analyzed: jaḍa mātra vyāvṛtti artham tu lakṣaṇe vyākhyāyamāne katham jīva aikya vādinām lakṣaṇa sūtra ārambhaḥ iti atas āha nahi iti
translated: But when the definition is explained for the purpose of excluding only the insentient, how is the commencement of the Sūtra on definition impossible for those who maintain the identity of the individual soul? With this in mind, he says 'not' [i.e., it is not impossible].

analyzed: nahi janma ādi hetu tvam jīvasya jagataḥ bhavet
translated: For the individual soul cannot be the cause of the origin, etc. of the world.

original: yatra hi lakṣaṇaṃ nāsti tatsarvaṃ tadvayāvartyamaṅgīkaraṇīyam /
analyzed: yatra hi lakṣaṇam na asti tat sarvam tad vayāvartyam aṅgīkaraṇīyam
translated: For wherever there is no definition, all that must be admitted to be excluded by that.

analyzed: anyathā lakṣaṇasya avyāpti prasaṅgāt
translated: Otherwise, there would be the undesirable consequence of the definition being too narrow.

analyzed: naca idam lakṣaṇam jīvasya asti
translated: And this definition does not apply to the individual soul.

analyzed: tat katham asau anena na vyāvartyate iti
translated: So how is it that it is not excluded by this?

original: kiñcānena lakṣaṇena yadi jīvo na vyāvartyate /
analyzed: kiñca anena lakṣaṇena yadi jīvaḥ na vyāvartyate
translated: Moreover, if the individual soul is not excluded by this definition,

analyzed: kintu saḥ pi lakṣya antargataḥ
translated: but is also included within the defined object,

original: tathā sati lakṣaṇasya jīve 'tivyāptimāśaṅkayetaravyapadeśāddhitākaraṇādidoṣaprasaktiriti sūtrakārīyaṃ tannirākaraṇamasaṅgataṃ syāt /
analyzed: tathā sati lakṣaṇasya jīve tivyāptim āśaṅkaya itara vyapadeśāt hita akaraṇa ādi doṣa prasaktiḥ iti sūtra kārīyam tat nirākaraṇam asaṅgatam syāt
translated: then, suspecting that the definition would be too broad with respect to the individual soul, the Sutra-writer's refutation of the objection that it would lead to the undesirable consequence of the individual soul being the agent of what is to be done, etc., would be irrelevant.

analyzed: nahi lakṣye evā ativyāptiḥ lakṣaṇasya kena api śaṅkayate
translated: For no one suspects that a definition is too broad with respect to the defined object itself.

original: kathañcicchaṅkāyāṃ vā tasyāpi lakṣyatvāṅgīkāraṃ parityajya tatra na lakṣaṇanirākaraṇaṃ kriyata ityāśavānāha hitākriyeti //
analyzed: kathañcid śaṅkāyām vā tasya api lakṣya tva aṅgīkāram parityajya tatra na lakṣaṇa nirākaraṇam kriyate iti āśavān āha hita akriyā iti
translated: Or, if there is some suspicion of that, then abandoning the admission that it is also the defined object, the refutation of the definition with respect to that is not done. With this in mind, he says the undesirable consequence of being the agent of what is to be done, etc.

analyzed: hita akriyā ādi doṣam ca vakṣyati eva svayam prabhuḥ
translated: And the Lord himself will speak of the undesirable consequence of being the agent of what is to be done, etc.

analyzed: yadi api pareṇa api jīvasya lakṣaṇa vyāvartya tvam aṅgīkṛtam eva
translated: Although the opponent also accepts that the individual soul is what is excluded by the definition,

analyzed: yathā āha sarvajñam sarva śaktim vihāya anyatas para parikalpitāt pradhāna ādeḥ acetanāt cetanāt api
translated: as he says: Apart from the omniscient and omnipotent, from anything else imagined by others, such as primordial matter, which is insentient, or even sentient,

original: paricchinnajñānakriyāśakteḥ saṃsāriṇo hiraṇyagarbhādutpattyādi na sambhāvayitumapi śakyate' / iti /
analyzed: paricchinna jñāna kriyā śakteḥ saṃsāriṇaḥ hiraṇyagarbhāt utpatti ādi na sambhāvayitum api śakyate iti
translated: the origination, etc. of the transmigrating individual soul, whose knowledge and action are limited, from the cosmic person Hiranyagarbha, cannot even be imagined.

analyzed: tathā api nyāyena upapādayitum idam uktam iti
translated: Still, this is said in order to establish it by reasoning.

analyzed: atha māyā vādi uktasya nirguṇa tvasya api sūtrakāraiḥ eva nirākṛta tā
translated: Now, even the attributelessness propounded by the Māyāvādins has been refuted by the authors of the aphorisms themselves.

original: ito 'pi māyāvādināṃ na brahmalakṣaṇasūtrārambhaḥ sambhavatītyāha nirguṇatvaṃ ceti //
analyzed: itas māyā vādinām na brahma lakṣaṇa sūtra ārambhaḥ sambhavati iti āha nirguṇa tvam ca iti
translated: For this reason also, the Māyāvādins cannot begin the aphorisms on the definition of Brahman. Thus he says: And attributelessness...

original: nirguṇatvaṃ ca tenaiva niṣiddhaṃ prabhuṇā svayam // / / //
analyzed: nirguṇa tvam ca tena eva niṣiddham prabhuṇā svayam
translated: And attributelessness has been refuted by the Lord Himself.

analyzed: lakṣaṇa vākyam hi sākṣāt lakṣyasya asādhāraṇa dharma saṃsargam pratipādayat arthāt itara vyāvṛttim pratipādayati
translated: For the definition statement, directly teaching the connection of the definiendum with its uncommon property, implicitly teaches its exclusion from others.

original: tato 'nenāpi lakṣaṇāvākyena brahmaṇo jagajjanmādikāraṇatvena tadavinābhūtaiḥ sarvajñatvādibhiśca saṃsargaḥ pratipādanīyaḥ /
analyzed: tatas nena api lakṣaṇā vākyena brahmaṇaḥ jagat janma ādi kāraṇatvena tad avinābhūtaiḥ sarvajñatva ādibhiḥ ca saṃsargaḥ pratipādanīyaḥ
translated: Then, by this characteristic statement also, the connection of Brahman with being the cause of the origin etc. of the world, and with omniscience etc. which are inseparable from that, should be taught.

analyzed: tathā ca nirviśeṣa tvam brahmaṇaḥ nena sūtreṇa niṣiddham
translated: And thus, the absence of distinctions in Brahman is denied by this aphorism.

original: nirviśeṣatvavādināṃ ca nirviśeṣatvaṃ niṣedhataḥ sūtrasyārambhaḥ kathamupapadyata iti /
analyzed: nirviśeṣa tva vādinām ca nirviśeṣa tvam niṣedhataḥ sūtrasya ārambhaḥ katham upapadyate iti
translated: And how can the commencement of the aphorism be justified for one who denies the absence of distinctions of those who maintain the absence of distinctions?

original: jagajjanmādikāraṇatvasya taṭasthatvakalpanā 🔽syādiyaṃ jīvabrahmaṇorekatvaṃ brahmaṇaśca nirguṇatvamaṅgīkurvatāṃ lakṣaṇasūtrārambhānupapattiḥ /
analyzed: jagat janma ādi kāraṇa tvasya taṭastha tva kalpanā  syāt iyam jīva brahmaṇoḥ ekatvam brahmaṇaḥ ca nirguṇa tvam aṅgīkurvatām lakṣaṇa sūtra ārambha anupapattiḥ
translated: The assumption that the being the cause of the origin etc. of the world is neutral🔽This is the non-commencement of the aphorism on characteristics for those who accept the non-difference of the individual soul and Brahman and the attributelessness of Brahman.

analyzed: yadi anena sūtreṇa jagat janma ādi kāraṇa tvam brahmaṇaḥ sva lakṣaṇam ucyate
translated: If by this aphorism the being the cause of the origin etc. of the world is stated to be the specific characteristic of Brahman,

analyzed: na ca evam kintu taṭa stham eva
translated: and not so, but is neutral.

original: nahi tathāvidhaṃ jagajjanmādikāraṇatvaṃ jīvabrahmaṇorekatvaṃ vā brahmaṇo nirguṇatvaṃ vā viruṇaddhi / /
analyzed: nahi tathāvidham jagat janma ādi kāraṇatvam jīva brahmaṇoḥ ekatvam vā brahmaṇaḥ nirguṇa tvam vā viruṇaddhi
translated: For such a being the cause of the origin etc. of the world does not contradict the non-difference of the individual soul and Brahman, or the attributelessness of Brahman.

analyzed: nanu sva lakṣaṇa tve pramāṇam uktam
translated: But a means of knowledge has been stated for being a specific characteristic.

analyzed: mā evam
translated: Not so.

analyzed: svasya lakṣaṇāni sva lakṣaṇāni iti vā
translated: Or, the characteristics of its own are its specific characteristics.

original: su samyak svarūpāntargatyā na lakṣaṇānīti vā tadarthopapatteḥ /
analyzed: su samyak svarūpa antargatyā na lakṣaṇāni iti vā tad artha upapatteḥ
translated: The meaning is that it is not the characteristics of Brahman that are well-known, but Brahman itself.

original: tarhi yato 'sya janmādi sā māyā tadāśrayo brahmeti nirdeśaḥ syāt /
analyzed: tarhi yatas janma ādi sā māyā tad āśrayaḥ brahma iti nirdeśaḥ syāt
translated: Then, since that is the source of its birth etc., the instruction should be that Maya is Brahman, which is its substratum.

analyzed: na tu janma ādyasya yatas tat brahma iti
translated: But it is not that Brahman is the source of its birth etc.

analyzed: mā evam
translated: This is not so.

original: yatra ghoṣaḥ sā gaṅgetivallakṣaṇayā prayogopapatteḥ /🔽nanu taṭasthenāpi jagajjanmādikāraṇatvena brahmaṇo jīvaikyaṃ nirguṇatvaṃ ca ni
analyzed: yatra ghoṣaḥ sā gaṅgā iti vat lakṣaṇayā prayoga upapatteḥ  nanu taṭasthena api jagat janma ādi kāraṇatvena brahmaṇaḥ jīva aikyam nirguṇa tvam ca ni
translated: Because the usage is justified by figurative expression, like where there is sound, that is the Ganges.

analyzed: viruddhayate
translated: But even by one who is neutral, the identity of Brahman with the individual soul and the attributelessness of Brahman are not contradicted by its being the cause of the birth etc. of the world.

analyzed: kāka nilayana tvam hi pareṇa taṭa stham lakṣaṇam udāhṛtam
translated: For the other party has cited as the definition of a bank, which is neutral, the fact of its being the abode of crows.

analyzed: tasya lakṣya antarbhāve kāka adhikaraṇa tvam api gṛha śabda arthaḥ syāt
translated: If that is included in what is to be defined, then the word house would also mean that which is the abode of crows.

original: tataśca kākavigame gṛhaikadeśabhaṅgabuddhiḥ syāt iti /🔽tatra kākādhikaraṇatvaṃ tadanadhikaraṇebhyo gṛhaṃ vyāvartayati na vā /
analyzed: tatas ca kāka vigame gṛha eka deśa bhaṅga buddhiḥ syāt iti  tatra kāka adhikaraṇa tvam tad anadhikaraṇebhyaḥ gṛham vyāvartayati na vā
translated: And then, when the crow departs, there would be the idea that a part of the house has collapsed.🔽There, does the fact of being the abode of crows distinguish the house from what is not its abode or not?

analyzed: na iti pakṣe nubhava virodhaḥ tad abhidhāna vaiyarthyam ca
translated: If not, then there is contradiction with experience and the statement is useless.

original: ādye brahmalakṣaṇamapi kathaṃ na jīvavyāvṛttiṃ karoti /
analyzed: ādye brahma lakṣaṇam api katham na jīva vyāvṛttim karoti
translated: If so, then how does the definition of Brahman not also distinguish it from the individual soul?

original: kathaṃ ca tatsambandhena saguṇaṃ na bhavatīti /
analyzed: katham ca tad sambandhena sa guṇam na bhavati iti
translated: And how is it not qualified by that relation?

analyzed: mā evam
translated: Not so.

original: yo hi kāryakāraṇasaṅghātādaviviktaṃ kartṛtvabhoktṛtvadoṣasaṃsargiṇamātmānaṃ matvā kliśyati sa jīvo vyāvartyata eva teane
analyzed: yaḥ hi kārya kāraṇa saṅghātāt aviviktam kartṛ tva bhoktṛ tva doṣa saṃsargiṇam ātmānam matvā kliśyati sa jīvaḥ vyāvartyate eva
translated: He who is afflicted by considering the self as inseparable from the aggregate of causes and effects, as associated with the faults of being an agent and an enjoyer, that jiva is indeed turned away from that by this characteristic.

analyzed: na lakṣaṇena
translated: Not by the definition.

original: tatra yaścaitanyadhātuḥ sa brahmaṇo na bhidyata ityabhyupagame virodhābhāvāt /
analyzed: tatra yaḥ caitanya dhātuḥ sa brahmaṇaḥ na bhidyate iti abhyupagame virodha abhāvāt
translated: There, the element of consciousness is not different from Brahman, so there is no contradiction in accepting this.

original: naca satyasya prapañcasya kāraṇabhūtāyāḥ satyāyā māyāyā āśrayo brahmeti sūtrārtho yena brahmaṇaḥ saviśeṣatvaṃ syāt /🔽kintu yadavaṣṭambho viśvo vivartaḥ prapañcastad brahmeti sūtrārthaḥ /
analyzed: na ca satyasya prapañcasya kāraṇa bhūtāyāḥ satyāyāḥ māyāyāḥ āśrayaḥ brahma iti sūtra arthaḥ yena brahmaṇaḥ sa viśeṣa tvam syāt  kintu yad avaṣṭambhaḥ viśvaḥ vivartaḥ prapañcaḥ tat brahma iti sūtra arthaḥ
translated: And the meaning of the sutra is not that Brahman is the substratum of the true illusion which is the cause of the true universe, by which Brahman would have specific attributes.🔽But the meaning of the sutra is that Brahman is that which is the support of the universe, the transformation, the universe.

original: sati caivaṃ sūtrārthe kathaṃ jīvabrahmaṇorekatvaṃ brahmaṇo nirguṇatvaṃ ca viruddhayata iti / /
analyzed: sati ca evam sūtra arthe katham jīva brahmaṇoḥ ekatvam brahmaṇaḥ nirguṇa tvam ca viruddhayataḥ iti
translated: And when the meaning of the sutra is thus, how does the oneness of the individual soul and Brahman, and the attributelessness of Brahman, contradict each other?

analyzed: jagat janma ādi kāraṇa tvasya taṭastha tva kalpanā ayuktā
translated: The assumption that the cause of the origin etc. of the world is neutral is improper

analyzed: atra ucyate
translated: Here it is said:

analyzed: āstām tāvatā iṣā
translated: Let that be.

analyzed: prapañcasya vivarta tā ādi vārtā pramāṇa abhāvāt prakṛti adhikaraṇe nirākariṣyamāṇa tvāt ca
translated: Because the doctrine of the evolution of the universe is not tenable in the absence of proof, and because it will be refuted in the chapter on Prakṛti.

original: taṭasthena jagajjanmādikāraṇatvenātra sūtre lakṣaṇayā brahma pratipādyata iti kuto 'ṅgīkaraṇīyam /
analyzed: taṭasthena jagat janma ādi kāraṇa tvena atra sūtre lakṣaṇayā brahma pratipādyate iti kutas ṅgīkaraṇīyam
translated: How can it be accepted that Brahman is taught by indirect indication in this aphorism as the cause of the creation, etc., of the world in a secondary sense?

analyzed: mukhya artha asambhave hi lakṣaṇa āśrayaṇam dṛṣṭam
translated: For indirect indication is seen to be resorted to only when the primary sense is impossible.

original: na tāvad brahmaṇo jagajjanmādikāraṇatvasya bādhakaṃ pratyakṣaṃ tadagocaratvāt /🔽nāpyanumānam śrutibādhitatvāt /
analyzed: na tāvat brahmaṇaḥ jagat janma ādi kāraṇatvasya bādhakam pratyakṣam tad agocara tvāt  na api anumānam śruti bādhita tvāt
translated: To begin with, perception is not a refutation of Brahman being the cause of the creation, etc., of the world, because that is beyond its scope.🔽Nor is inference, because it is contradicted by scripture.

analyzed: na api āgamaḥ tasya akliṣyakāri tva ādi arthatayā sa avakāśa tvāt
translated: Nor is scripture, because it has another scope, in that it has the sense of teaching what is not known.

analyzed: nanu arthāpattyā idam avasīyate  jīva brahmaṇoḥ eka tvam tāvat āvaśyakam
translated: But it is concluded by presumption.🔽The identity of the individual soul and Brahman is certainly necessary.

analyzed: na ca jagat janma ādi kāraṇatvasya sva lakṣaṇa tve tat sambhavati
translated: And that is not possible if the being the cause of the creation, etc., of the world is a specific property of Brahman.

analyzed: atas nyathā anupapattyā māyā gatam evā idam lakṣaṇam
translated: Therefore, by the method of difference, this property is imagined to belong to Brahman only figuratively.

original: janmādyasya yatastad brahmeti lakṣaṇayocyata iti kalpyata iti /
analyzed: janma ādyasya yatas tat brahma iti lakṣaṇayā ucyate iti kalpyate iti
translated: It is imagined that Brahman is said to be the cause of the creation, etc., of the world figuratively, because it is not possible otherwise.

analyzed: tatra āha bhedena eva iti
translated: To that he says by difference alone.

analyzed: bhedena eva tu mukhya artha sambhave lakṣaṇā kutas
translated: But when the primary meaning is possible by difference, how can there be secondary meaning?

original: yadi jīvabrahmaṇorekatvaparirakṣaṇāya yathāśrutaṃ sūtrārthaṃ parityajya lakṣaṇāśrīyate tarhi jīvabrahmaṇorbhedenaivāṅgīkṛtena sūtrasya mukhyārthasambhave
analyzed: yadi jīva brahmaṇoḥ ekatva parirakṣaṇāya yathāśrutam sūtra artham parityajya lakṣaṇā āśrīyate tarhi jīva brahmaṇoḥ bhedena eva aṅgīkṛtena sūtrasya mukhya artha sambhave
translated: If, in order to preserve the identity of the individual soul and Brahman, secondary meaning is accepted by abandoning the meaning of the sūtra as literally stated, then, when the primary meaning of the sūtra is possible by admitting the difference of the individual soul and Brahman,

analyzed: lakṣaṇā kasmāt āśrayaṇīyā
translated: how can secondary meaning be accepted?

original: nanvabhedamupādāya sūtre lakṣaṇā vā'śrayaṇīyā bhedamupādāya makhyavṛttirveti sandihyate /
analyzed: nanu abhedam upādāya sūtre lakṣaṇā vā āśrayaṇīyā bhedam upādāya makhya vṛttiḥ vā iti sandihyate
translated: But it is doubted whether secondary meaning should be accepted in the sūtra by taking non-difference, or the primary function by taking difference.

original: vayaṃ tu brūmaḥ dvitīyaḥ pakṣa eva śreyāniti /🔽aprāmāṇikaparirakṣaṇāya vākyānāṃ jaghanyavṛttirāśrīyamāṇā kvacidupalabdheti
analyzed: vayam tu brūmaḥ dvitīyaḥ pakṣaḥ eva śreyān iti  a prāmāṇika parirakṣaṇāya vākyānām jaghanya vṛttiḥ āśrīyamāṇā kvacid upalabdhā iti
translated: But we say that the second alternative is indeed better.

analyzed: d api dṛṣṭā iti

analyzed: tat idam uktam bhedena eva iti

analyzed: nanu katham jīva brahma aikyam aprāmāṇikam

analyzed: tattvam asi ityādi śruti siddham itvāt iti ced na

analyzed: upapatti parāhata tvāt

analyzed: tathā hi  tad śabdena abdasya
translated: This is how.🔽By the word that,

analyzed: mukhya arthaḥ yaḥ

analyzed: sat eva somya
translated: is stated.

original: ityādinā prakṛtaḥ prekṣāpūrvaṃ tejo 'bannādīnāṃ sraṣṭā sarvāsāṃ prajānāṃ mūlamāyatanaṃ pratiṣṭhā ca sakalāvadyagandhavidhuro 'paricchinnaguṇākaraḥ
analyzed: ityādinā prakṛtaḥ prekṣā pūrvam tejaḥ banna ādīnām sraṣṭā sarvāsām prajānām mūlam āyatanam pratiṣṭhā ca sakala avadya gandha vidhuraḥ paricchinna guṇa ākaraḥ
translated: Thus, the one who is the subject, the creator of fire, water, food, etc. with foresight, the root, the abode, the support of all beings, devoid of the smell of all faults, the mine of unlimited virtues,

analyzed: yaḥ ca tvam pada mukhya arthaḥ
translated: and the one who is the primary meaning of the word you, established by perception, etc.,

analyzed: siddhaḥ lpa śaktiḥ para adhīnaḥ doṣa kaluṣitaḥ vacchinna jñāna ādi guṇaḥ
translated: of limited power, dependent on others, tainted by faults, with limited knowledge and other qualities,

analyzed: tau upādāya anena vākyena aikyam ucyate
translated: taking those two, oneness is stated by this sentence.

analyzed: uta viruddha bhāga tyāgena lakṣaṇayā vā
translated: Or, by abandoning the contradictory part, by indication?

analyzed: na ādyaḥ

analyzed: paraspara virodhena yogyatā virahe jaradgava ādi vākya vat ābhāsatva prasaṅgāt
translated: Because of mutual contradiction, in the absence of fitness, like the sentence about an old cow, it would be a mere appearance.

analyzed: dvitīye doṣam āha bhedanā eva iti
translated: In the second, he states the fault: By the mere identity...

original: siṃho devadatta ityādivatsāmānādhikaraṇyamātraṃ gauṇamupādāya jīvabrahmaṇorbhedenā🔽naivāṅgīkṛtena padadvayasya mukhyārthatva
analyzed: siṃhaḥ devadattaḥ ityādi vat sāmānādhikaraṇya mātram gauṇam upādāya jīva brahmaṇoḥ bhedena  na eva aṅgīkṛtena pada dvayasya mukhya artha tva
translated: Like the lion is Devadatta, taking the mere co-reference as secondary, the difference of the individual soul and Brahman

analyzed: sambhavena  jahat ajahat lakṣaṇā kutas āśrayaṇīyā iti
translated: is not accepted. When the primary meaning of the two words is possible,🔽the figurative sense of abandoning and not abandoning cannot be resorted to.

original: nanu kiṃ sāmānādhikaraṇyaṃ mukhyamupādāya tattvaṃpadayorlākṣaṇikatvaṃ vyākhyeyam /
analyzed: nanu kim sāmānādhikaraṇyam mukhyam upādāya tattvam padayoḥ lākṣaṇika tvam vyākhyeyam
translated: But is the co-reference to be explained as primary, and the words that and you as figurative?

original: kiṃvā sāmānādhikaraṇyaṃ gauṇaṃ gṛhītvā tattvaṃpadayormukhyārthatā vyākhyātavyeti sandehe na vinigamanāyāṃ heturasti /
analyzed: kiṃvā sāmānādhikaraṇyam gauṇam gṛhītvā tattvam padayoḥ mukhya artha tā vyākhyātavyā iti sandehe na vinigamanāyām hetuḥ asti
translated: Or, taking the co-reference as secondary, should the primary meaning of the words 'tat' and 'tvam' be explained? In this doubt, there is no reason for the ascertainment.

analyzed: na na asti

analyzed: tyajet ekam kulasya arthaḥ iti nyāyasya vidyamāna tvāt
translated: Because the principle 'one should be sacrificed for the sake of the family' exists.

analyzed: tātparya liṅgānām tatra tatra bhedaḥ evā ānuguṇyasya vyutpādita tvāt
translated: Because the indications of purport have been explained as being in conformity with difference in various places.

analyzed: tat idam uktam bhedena eva iti
translated: This is what is meant by saying 'only as different'.

analyzed: kiñca virodhya ākāra parityāgena svarūpa mātra lakṣaṇayā a tattvam asi
translated: Moreover, by abandoning the contradictory form and indicating the mere nature by the word 'tat tvam asi',

original: iti vākyaṃ jīvabrahmaṇorekatvaṃ pratipādayatītyatra virodhyākāraparityāgo nāma na tāvadavivakṣāmātramityuktaṃ prāk /
analyzed: iti vākyam jīva brahmaṇoḥ ekatvam pratipādayati iti atra virodhya ākāra parityāgaḥ nāma na tāvat avivakṣā mātram iti uktam prāk
translated: the sentence 'that thou art' teaches the identity of the individual soul and Brahman. In this, abandoning the contradictory form does not mean mere non-assertion, as stated earlier.

analyzed: atha saḥ yam devadattaḥ ityādi vat virodhya ākārasya anitya tvam
translated: Or, like the statement 'this is Devadatta', the impermanence of the contradictory form.

analyzed: tatra āha katham iti
translated: There, he says 'how' (is it possible)?

analyzed: katham nitya guṇasya asya syāt aikyam guṇa hānataḥ
translated: How can this eternal attribute have identity by the loss of attributes?

analyzed: nitya guṇa tvam ca īśvarasya liṅga pāde sādhayiṣyate
translated: And the eternality of the attributes of God will be established in the Linga Parva.

analyzed: asya īśvarasya iti upalakṣaṇam
translated: 'Asya', of God, is a mere illustration.

analyzed: jīve pi pāratantrya ādi doṣāṇām nitya tvāt
translated: Even in the individual soul, because the faults like dependence are eternal.

analyzed: yathā uktam purāṇe alpa śaktiḥ a sārvajñam iti
translated: As it is said in the Purana: Limited power and non-omniscience.

original: nanu ca virodhyākāraparityāgena jīvasya brahmaikyamityasyārtho na virodhyākārāvivakṣāmātreṇeti nāpyanityatveneti /🔽kintu nirguṇena brahmaṇā jīvasyaikyamityeveti cenna /
analyzed: nanu ca virodhya ākāra parityāgena jīvasya brahma aikyam iti asya arthaḥ na virodhya ākāra avivakṣā mātreṇa iti na api anitya tvena iti  kintu nirguṇena brahmaṇā jīvasya aikyam iti eva iti ced na
translated: But it is not the meaning of the identity of the individual soul with Brahman by abandoning the contradictory forms, but by merely not intending the contradictory forms, nor by impermanence.

analyzed: nirguṇa tva
translated: But if it is said that it is the identity of the individual soul with Brahman, which is without qualities, no,

analyzed: syā eva nirūpayitum aśakya tvāt
translated: because being without qualities itself cannot be determined.

analyzed: tathā hi
translated: It is as follows.

analyzed: tat nirguṇam kim sa guṇāt īśvarāt bhinnam uta abhinnam vā
translated: Is that which is without qualities different from the qualified God or non-different?

analyzed: dvitīye tasya api sa guṇa tva prasaṅgena nirguṇa tva vyāghātaḥ
translated: In the second case, there is a contradiction in being without qualities due to the consequence of His being qualified.

original: ādye doṣamāha sadaiveti //🔽sadaiva guṇavattve 'sya bhinnaṃ syānnirguṇaṃ sadā // / / // /
analyzed: ādye doṣam āha sadā eva iti  sadā eva guṇavat tve bhinnam syāt nirguṇam sadā
translated: He states the fault in the first case with the words always and so on.🔽If this is always endowed with qualities, then that which is without qualities would always be different.

original: yadi nirguṇaṃ saguṇādatyantabhinnaṃ tarhyasya saguṇasya nityaṃ saguṇatvāttasmānnityameva nirguṇaṃ bhinnaṃ prasajyeta /
analyzed: yadi nirguṇam sa guṇāt atyanta bhinnam tarhi asya sa guṇasya nityam sa guṇa tvāt tasmāt nityam eva nirguṇam bhinnam prasajyeta
translated: If that which is without qualities is absolutely different from that which is qualified, then from that which is always qualified, that which is without qualities would always be different.

analyzed: tathāca na kadācid api kaivalyam syāt iti
translated: And thus there would never be liberation.

analyzed: nanu svabhāvataḥ nirguṇam evā īropitaiḥ mithyā guṇaiḥ sa guṇam iti bālaiḥ abhilapyate
translated: But it is said that that which is without qualities by nature is qualified by superimposed false qualities and is spoken of as qualified by the ignorant.

analyzed: āropita nīlimnā gaganam iva nīla tvena
translated: Like the sky, which is superimposed with blueness by the blueness of the clouds.

original: āropapravāhasya cānādinityatayā sadā saguṇatvaṃ ca nāniṣyam /
analyzed: āropa pravāhasya ca anādi nitya tayā sadā sa guṇa tvam ca na aniṣyam
translated: And the stream of superimposition is accepted as being always with qualities due to its beginninglessness and eternity.

analyzed: tathā ca mithyā bhūta virodhi ākāra parityāgena aikya upadeśaḥ pi nā anupapannaḥ
translated: And thus, the teaching of identity after abandoning the superimposed contradictory forms which are false, is also not incoherent.

analyzed: nīrūpam gaganam iti yathā
translated: Like the formless sky.

analyzed: yathā vā yat idam rajatam sā śuktiḥ iti evam pareṇa sva abhisandhau udghāṭite sati āha na ca iti
translated: Or like this silver is that mother-of-pearl, when the other's intention is revealed in this way, he says And it is not and so on.

analyzed: na ca mithyā guṇa tvam syāt anirvācyasya dūṣaṇāt
translated: And there would not be the quality of being false, because the indescribable is refuted.

analyzed: mithyā iti asat ucyate nirvacanīyam vā
translated: False means non-existent or indescribable.

analyzed: na ādyaḥ
translated: The first is not so.

analyzed: anaṅgīkārāt

analyzed: na dvitīyaḥ

analyzed: anirvācyasya prathama sūtre eva nirākṛta tvāt

original: ato guṇarāhityalakṣaṇaṃ nirguṇatvaṃ na sarvathā śakyanirūpaṇam /
analyzed: atas guṇa rāhitya lakṣaṇam nirguṇa tvam na sarvathā śakya nirūpaṇam

analyzed: nanu guṇa ādi pañcakasya nirguṇa tvam padārtha vidaḥ manyante
translated: But those who know the categories consider the set of five, beginning with qualities, to be without qualities.

analyzed: manyantām

analyzed: na hi idānīm nirguṇa vastu nirākaraṇam prastutam
translated: For now the refutation of a qualityless entity is not the topic.

analyzed: kim nāma advaidinā nirguṇam brahma nirūpayitum aśakyam iti
translated: What is it? That the non-dualists are unable to define Brahman as qualityless.

analyzed: guṇa śabdena a cā
translated: And by the word quality here,

analyzed: tra dharma mātram prakṛtam
translated: The subject under discussion is mere dharma.

analyzed: tad guṇa ādiṣu api sarva saṃmatam

analyzed: guṇa ādīnām ca sa guṇa tvam paramāṇu ārambha nirāse vakṣyate

analyzed: nanu ca sākṣī cetā kevalaḥ nirguṇaḥ ca

analyzed: iti nirguṇam brahma śrūyate
translated: Brahman is heard to be without qualities.

analyzed: mā evam
translated: This is not so.
Because it is contradicted by the stated inconsistency, it has a different meaning.

analyzed: anyathā sākṣi tva ādīnām api dharma tvāt vayāghātaḥ ca
translated: Otherwise, there would be a contradiction because even the characteristics of being a witness etc. are qualities.

analyzed: sākṣāt draṣṭā hi sākṣī
translated: For a witness is one who sees directly.

analyzed: yathā āha pāṇiniḥ
translated: As Panini says:

analyzed: sākṣāt draṣṭari saṃjñāyām iti

original: evaṃ dharmarāhityalakṣaṇaṃ nirguṇatvaṃ nirākṛtamapyāgrahamātreṇa yo 'ṅgīkaroti taṃ prati solluṇṭhamāha nirguṇatvamiti //
analyzed: evam dharma rāhitya lakṣaṇam nirguṇa tvam nirākṛtam api āgraha mātreṇa yaḥ ṅgīkaroti tam prati sa ulluṇṭham āha nirguṇa tvam iti
translated: Thus, even though the characteristic of being without qualities, which is the absence of qualities, has been refuted, he who accepts it merely out of obstinacy, to him he says with sarcasm being without qualities:

analyzed: nirguṇa tvam tadā ca syāt āsura tvam na ca anyathā  tadā ca yuktayā nirguṇe

translated: Even when the absence of qualities has been refuted by reasoning, if one were to have a liking for being without qualities, then it would be demonhood, characterized by the absence of all goodness indicated by the word qualities.

analyzed: anyathā nirūpayitum aśakya tvasya ukta tvāt
translated: Because it has been said that it cannot be determined otherwise.

analyzed: tena aikyam ca māyā vādinām anumanyāmahe iti
translated: Therefore, we accept the identity with the doctrine of the Mādhyamikas.

analyzed: etena brahmaṇaḥ nirguṇa tvāt asya lakṣaṇasya yat taṭastha tvam uktam
translated: By this, it is to be understood that the neutrality of this definition, which has been stated on the ground that Brahman is without qualities,

original: nahi nānāvidhakāryakriyāveśātmatvaṃ tatprasavaśaktayatmakaṃ vā jijñāsyaviśuddhabrahmāntargataṃ bhavitumarhati /

analyzed: tat api nirastam veditavyam  nirguṇa tva  syā eva nirākṛta tvāt
translated: That also should be understood to be refuted.🔽Because the very fact of Brahman being without qualities has been refuted.

translated: And what has been said, that this is not a qualification of Brahman, because it cannot be included within the nature of Brahman, which is without limiting adjuncts, on the ground of being a limiting adjunct of the world,

analyzed: tat uttaratra nirākariṣyate iti  atha tad uktasya guṇa guṇinoḥ anya tva ananya tvābhyām anirūpaṇam duṣṭa tā

analyzed: yat api guṇa guṇinoḥ anyatva ananyatvābhyām anirūpaṇāt iti lakṣaṇasya taṭastha tva ādi siddhaye pareṇa uktam tat dūṣayitum anuvadati lakṣya lakṣaṇayoḥ iti
translated: And what has been stated by the opponent for the establishment of the neutrality of the definition, etc., that the definition is not determined as being either different or non-different from the qualified Brahman, he repeats in order to refute it, saying between the definiendum and the definition.

analyzed: lakṣya lakṣaṇayoḥ bhedaḥ bhedaḥ vā yadi vā ubhayam
translated: The difference or non-difference of the characteristic and the characterized, or both,

analyzed: yat atra jagat janma ādi kāraṇa tvam

analyzed: khataḥ lakṣaṇam abhihitam ca abhiprāya vyāprā
translated: characteristic, and the possession of all qualities such as omniscience, which is implied,

analyzed: ptam iti uktam
translated: have been stated.

analyzed: tat ubhayam api lakṣaṇam lakṣyāt brahmaṇaḥ bhinnam abhinnam bhinna abhinnam vā
translated: Both of these characteristics are different from Brahman, the characterized, non-different, or different and non-different.

analyzed: na ādyaḥ
translated: The first is not so.

analyzed: sambandha sadbhāvāt na iti ced na

analyzed: na dvitīyaḥ

analyzed: anekaiḥ abhinnasya brahmaṇaḥ pi aneka tva āpatteḥ
translated: Because if Brahman is non-different from many, it would also become many.

analyzed: tathā ca ekam eva iti śruti virodhāt

analyzed: lakṣaṇānām vā eka tvam āpadyeta  tathā ācayataḥ vai imāni bhūtāni jāyante

analyzed: lakṣya lakṣaṇa bhāvaḥ guṇa guṇi bhāvaḥ ca abhede na upapadyate

analyzed: prasiddhena hi aprasiddham lakṣaṇīyam

translated: And it is not proper that the same thing should be both well known and not well known at the same time.

analyzed: guṇī ca guṇavān bhavati

analyzed: na ca svena eva tadvān bhavati

analyzed: na tṛtīyaḥ
translated: Not the third,

analyzed: paraspara virodhāt
translated: because of mutual contradiction.

analyzed: atas śakya nirūpaṇa tvāt na idam brahma svarūpa antargatam lakṣaṇam

analyzed: kintu taṭa stham eva

analyzed: na ca taṭa sthena tena brahmaṇaḥ dvitīya tva bhaṅgaḥ
translated: And the non-dual nature of Brahman is not destroyed by that separate [definition].

analyzed: yat rajatam iti abhāt sā śuktiḥ iti vat mithyābhūtena api prapañca kāraṇa tvena upalakṣaṇa yogāt iti
translated: Just as it is said That which appeared as silver is a shell, even by a falsely existent cause of the world, because it is suitable to be a distinguishing mark.

analyzed: evam anūdya nirākartum ārabhate iti pṛṣṭaḥ iti

analyzed: iti pṛṣṭe  vaktavyam iti śeṣaḥ
translated: When asked thus...🔽The rest is to be said.

analyzed: pṛṣṭe ita y upalakṣaṇam

analyzed: dūṣite ca iti api grāhyam

analyzed: dūṣaṇānām atyanta asambaddha tvāt pṛṣṭaḥ iti eva uktam
translated: Because the refutations are completely irrelevant, only when asked is stated.

analyzed: kim vaktavyam iti
translated: What is to be said?

analyzed: tatra jagat janma ādi kāraṇa tva ādīnām dharmāṇām bheda abhāve pi viśeṣasya sadbhāvāt tad balena

analyzed: sarvam utpadyate iti vaktum nirbheda vastuni pareṇa viśeṣasya an aṅgīkṛta tvāt ghaṭa ādīnām
translated: To say everything arises, the opponent does not accept a distinction in the undifferentiated entity, so it is said that the arising of the pot, etc.

original: ca mithyātvenāṅgīkṛtānāmanudāharaṇatvātsatya eva vastunyasāvudapapādanīya iti manvāna āha tadeti //
analyzed: ca mithyātvena aṅgīkṛtānām anudāharaṇa tvāt satye eva vastuni asau udapapādanīyaḥ iti manvānaḥ āha tadā iti
translated: Because the opponent does not accept any distinction in a thing without parts, and because pots etc., which are accepted as false, cannot be used as examples, he thinks that it should be established only in a real thing, and says that etc.

analyzed: tad aikyasya gatiḥ eva na vidyate
translated: There is no way at all for the unity of that [to be established].

original: yadyevaṃ pṛṣṭvā lakṣaṇaṃ dūṣayasi tadaikyasya gatirnirūpaṇaprakāro na vidyate /
analyzed: yadi evam pṛṣṭvā lakṣaṇam dūṣayasi tadā aikyasya gatiḥ nirūpaṇa prakāraḥ na vidyate
translated: If you ask this and then criticize the definition, then there is no way at all for the unity of that [to be established].

analyzed: ayam abhiprāyaḥ
translated: This is the idea.

analyzed: dvividham hi vākyam māyā vādinā tattva āvedakam aṅgīkṛtam
translated: For the proponent of illusion accepts two kinds of statements that reveal reality.

analyzed: ekam jīva brahmaṇoḥ aikya param mahāvākyam
translated: One is a great statement about the identity of the individual soul and Brahman,

analyzed: yathā tat tvam asi ityādi
translated: such as That thou art.

analyzed: aparam tad svarūpa param avāntaravākyam
translated: The other is a subordinate statement about its nature,

analyzed: yathā satyam jñānam anantam brahma ityādi
translated: such as Brahman is truth, knowledge, and infinite.

analyzed: tat ubhayam api sa viśeṣa abhinna vastu niṣṭham pareṇa aṅgīkaraṇīyam
translated: Both of these must be accepted by the opponent as referring to a non-different thing with distinctions.

analyzed: gati antara abhāvāt
translated: Because there is no other way.

analyzed: tatra tāvat ādyasya gati antaram na asti
translated: Among them, there is no other way for the first [statement].

analyzed: katham iti ced ucyate
translated: If it is asked how, it is said:

original: tattvamasītyādivākyapratipādyamaikyaṃ kiṃ tatpadalakṣitāccaitanyādabhinnamuta bhinnamatha bhinnābhinnamiti vācyam /
analyzed: tat tvam asi ityādi vākya pratipādyam aikyam kim tad pada lakṣitāt caitanyāt abhinnam uta bhinnam atha bhinna abhinnam iti vācyam
translated: It must be stated whether the non-duality taught by the sentences That thou art etc. is non-different from the consciousness indicated by the word that or different or different-non-different.

original: pareṇāṅgīkṛtatvena prādhānyādabhedapakṣaṃ tāvadādau nirākaroti aikyābheda iti //🔽aikyābhede na śāstreṇa jñeyaṃ tat svaprakāśataḥ // / / //
analyzed: pareṇa aṅgīkṛta tvena prādhānyāt abheda pakṣam tāvat ādau nirākaroti aikya abhedaḥ iti  aikya abhede na śāstreṇa jñeyam tat sva prakāśataḥ
translated: Since it is accepted by the opponent, the view of non-difference is first refuted on the ground of being primary.

original: aikyasya caitanyasvarūpābhede 'ṅgīkriyamāṇe tadaikyaṃ tattvamasītyādinā śāstreṇa pratipādyaṃ na syāt /
analyzed: aikyasya caitanya svarūpa abhede ṅgīkriyamāṇe tat aikyam tattvam asi ityādinā śāstreṇa pratipādyam na syāt
translated: If non-duality were non-different from the nature of consciousness, it would not be taught by the scriptures such as That thou art.

analyzed: kutas sva rūpasya sva prakāśa tvena nitya siddha tvāt
translated: Why? Because the nature of consciousness is eternally established by its own self-luminousness.

analyzed: tanmātra svarūpa tvāt ca aikyasya
translated: And because non-duality is of the nature of that alone.

analyzed: nahi prakāśamānam eva śāstra pratipādyam
translated: For what is manifest is not to be taught by the scriptures.

analyzed: vaiyarthya prasaṅgāt
translated: Because that would lead to the absurdity of uselessness.

analyzed: kiñca avedya tve satya parokṣa vyavahāra yogya tvam sva prakāśa tvam paroṇa aṅgīkṛtam
translated: Moreover, self-luminousness is accepted by the opponent as being fit for the usage of non-veiledness while being not an object of knowledge.

analyzed: tathā ca sva prakāśa caitanya ātmakam ca
translated: And thus, it is contradictory to say that it is of the nature of self-luminous consciousness

analyzed: śāstra pratipādyam ca iti vyāhatam
translated: and is to be taught by the scriptures.

original: atha śāstraṃ naikyaṃ pratipādayati kintu bhedabhramaṃ nirākaroti /
analyzed: atha śāstram na aikyam pratipādayati kintu bheda bhramam nirākaroti
translated: Now, if the scripture does not teach unity but rather refutes the delusion of difference,

original: yathoktam siddhaṃ tu nivartakatvāditi / na /🔽aikye prakāśamāne bhedabhramasyaivānavakāśāt /
analyzed: yathā uktam siddham tu nivartaka tvāt iti na  aikye prakāśamāne bheda bhramasya eva anavakāśāt
translated: as it is said: But when established, it is a cause of cessation. No.🔽Because when unity is manifest, the delusion of difference itself has no opportunity.

analyzed: tattva apratipatteḥ bhrānti hetu tvāt
translated: Because the non-understanding of reality is the cause of delusion.

analyzed: aikyam na prakāśate iti ced na
translated: If it is said that unity does not manifest, no.

analyzed: sva prakāśa caitanya mātra tva virodhāt
translated: Because it contradicts being mere self-luminous consciousness.
