analyzed: avidyā vaśāt sva prakāśasya api anavabhāsaḥ iti ced na sarvathā api anavabhāsa prasaṅgāt
translated: If it is said that due to ignorance, even the self-luminous does not appear, no, because it would follow that it does not appear at all.

analyzed: tathā ca adhiṣṭhāna anavabhāse vidyā āropasya api anupapatteḥ
translated: And thus, when the basis does not appear, the superimposition of ignorance is also not possible.

analyzed: na hi akhaṇḍe vastuni aṃśataḥ vidyā āvaraṇam sambhavati
translated: For in an undivided entity, the covering of ignorance by part is not possible.

analyzed: a sambhavanīya avabhāsa catura avidyā iti ced
translated: If it is said that ignorance is impossible to appear in four ways,

analyzed: tarhi sā jaḍeṣu eva kutas nā aṅgīkāryā
translated: then why is it not accepted only in the inert?

analyzed: anupapatteḥ tulya tvāt
translated: Because the impossibility is the same.

analyzed: tathā acasā na jaḍeṣu vastuṣu
translated: And thus, it is not in the inert things.

analyzed: iti ayuktam
translated: This is not correct.

analyzed: na śāstreṇa jñeyam tat iti upalakṣaṇam
translated: The phrase it is not to be known by scripture is a synecdoche.

analyzed: śāstra pratipādya tve pi tad padena eva siddha tvāt
translated: Even if it is taught by scripture, it is already established by the word that.

analyzed: tvam asi iti vyartham iti api draṣṭavyam
translated: It should also be seen that you are that is meaningless.

analyzed: tat iti etāvatā na bheda bhrama nivṛttiḥ  atas tvam asi iti sārthakam iti ced na
translated: By just saying that, the delusion of difference is not removed.

analyzed: tat padena evai
translated: If it is argued that therefore you are that is meaningful, it is not so.🔽Because oneness is conveyed by the word that itself.

analyzed: kyasya pratipādita tvāt aikya pratītau ca bheda bhramasya nirasta tvāt
translated: And when oneness is understood, the delusion of difference is removed.

analyzed: anyathā kadāpi anivṛtti prasaṅgāt
translated: Otherwise, it would never be removed.
If oneness is not conveyed by the word that, then the mere consciousness indicated by it cannot be established.

original: nanu kathaṃ tarhi so 'yaṃ devadatta iti vākyam /
analyzed: nanu katham tarhi saḥ yam devadattaḥ iti vākyam
translated: But how then is the sentence This is Devadatta possible?

analyzed: atra api viśeṣa anaṅgīkāre nupapattiḥ eva iti
translated: Here also, if the distinction is not accepted, there is an inconsistency.

analyzed: bhede mithyātvataḥ bheda satya tvam syāt balāt api
translated: If there is difference, there would be the truth of difference even by force, due to falsity.

analyzed: dvitīyam nirākaroti bhedaḥ iti
translated: He refutes the second view with the words If there is difference...

analyzed: aikyasya svarūpāt bhede ṅgīkriyamāṇe
translated: If oneness is accepted as different from its own nature, there is a logical fallacy.

analyzed: tattvamasi ādi vākyasya akhaṇḍa artha niṣṭha tāyāḥ māyāvādinā aṅgīkṛta tvāt
translated: Because the Mādhyamika accepts that the sentence That thou art etc. is based on the undivided meaning.

analyzed: mithyātva prasaṅgaḥ paraḥ doṣaḥ
translated: Another fault is the consequence of falsity.
Because everything except consciousness is accepted as false.

analyzed: anyathā advaitena eva satyena advaita vyāghātāt  aikya mithyātve kinnaḥ chinnam iti ced na
translated: Otherwise, by the truth of non-duality itself, there would be a contradiction with non-duality.

analyzed: mithyātvataḥ na śāstreṇa jñeyam tat iti anuvartanāt
translated: If the oneness is false, what is not cut off? No, because of the continuation of That should not be known by scripture because of falsity.

analyzed: anyathā tattvamasyādi śāstrasya a tattva āvedaka tvam syāt
translated: Otherwise, the scriptures beginning with That art thou would not convey the truth.

analyzed: kiñca jīva brahmaṇoḥ aikyasya mithyātvataḥ tad bheda satya tvam api syāt
translated: Moreover, because of the falsity of the oneness of the individual soul and Brahman, the truth of their difference would also be established.

analyzed: kutas balāt vayāpti balāt iti arthaḥ
translated: Why? By force, by the force of pervasion, is the meaning.

original: nanu na kutrāpi satayo bhedo 'smābhirabhyupeyate tatkathaṃ vyāptiḥ /
analyzed: nanu na kutra api satayaḥ smābhiḥ abhyupeyate tat katham vyāptiḥ
translated: But nowhere do we accept the truth of difference. How then is there pervasion?

analyzed: mā evam
translated: Not so.

analyzed: āstām tāvat parama artha cintā
translated: Let the consideration of the ultimate truth remain for the present.

original: yayordūrasthayorvanaspatyoraikyaṃ mithyā tayorbhedaḥ satya iti dṛṣṭam /🔽athavā yasya svarūpeṇa sato yo 'bhāvo mithyā tasya tadviparītaḥ satyo yathā brahmaṇo
analyzed: yayoḥ dūra sthayoḥ vanaspatyoḥ aikyam mithyā tayoḥ bhedaḥ satyaḥ iti dṛṣṭam  athavā yasya sva rūpeṇa sataḥ yaḥ bhāvaḥ mithyā tasya tad viparītaḥ satyaḥ yathā brahmaṇaḥ
translated: It is seen that the oneness of two distant trees is false, and their difference is true.

Or, the absence of something that exists in its own nature is false, and its opposite is true, just as the falsity of Brahman's untruth etc. implies its truth etc. Thus, by relying on the general pervasion, the argument is established.

analyzed: yathā āhuḥ paraspara virodhe tu na prakāra antara sthitiḥ iti
translated: As they say: But in mutual contradiction, there is no other alternative.

analyzed: tṛtīyam nirācaṣṭe bheda abhedau iti
translated: He refutes the third view, saying If difference and non-difference...

analyzed: bheda abhedau yadi  jīva brahmaṇoḥ aikyasya svarūpāt bheda abhedau yadi aṅgīkriyete
translated: If difference and non-difference...

original: tadā vaktavyaṃ tau kiṃ caitanyādabhinnāvuta bhinnau atha bhinnābhinnāviti /
analyzed: tadā vaktavyam tau kim caitanyāt abhinnau uta bhinnau atha bhinna abhinnau iti
translated: If the identity of the individual soul and Brahman is accepted as different from its own nature, then it should be said whether they are different or non-different from consciousness, or different and non-different.

analyzed: ādye caitanyasya api dvi tvam tayoḥ vā eka tvam iti ādi āpadyeta
translated: In the first case, consciousness would also have duality and they would have unity, and so on.

analyzed: dvitīyayoḥ deṣam āha tadā iti
translated: He states the fault in the second case, saying Then...

analyzed: tadā syāt eva hi anavasthitiḥ
translated: Then indeed there would be infinite regress.

analyzed: hi śabdena anavasthā vyutpādanāya spaṣṭa tām ācaṣṭe
translated: The word hi (in fact) indicates the clarity for the exposition of infinite regress.

analyzed: tathā hi
translated: It is as follows.

original: sa bhedaḥ kiṃ bhedibhyāṃ bhinno 'bhinno bhinnābhinno vā /
analyzed: sa bhedaḥ kim bhedibhyām bhinnaḥ bhinnaḥ bhinna abhinnaḥ vā
translated: Is that difference different, non-different, or different and non-different from the two things?

analyzed: prathame saḥ u pi bhedaḥ tathā iti anavasthā
translated: In the first case, that difference also would be so, resulting in infinite regress.

analyzed: dvitīye śabda paryāya tva ādayaḥ doṣāḥ
translated: In the second case, there are faults such as being a synonym.

analyzed: tṛtīyaḥ tu tṛtīye ntarbhavati
translated: The third is included in the third.

analyzed: tatra api ukta vidhayā anavasthā eva iti
translated: There also, by the stated method, there is only infinite regress.

original: nanu bhedasya bhedāntaraṃ bhedābhedayośca bhedābhedāntaramityetāvatā nānavasthā /
analyzed: nanu bhedasya bheda antaram bheda abhedayoḥ ca bheda abheda antaram iti etāvatā nā anavasthā
translated: But is it not the case that there is no infinite regress by just this much: that difference has another difference, and difference and non-difference have another difference and non-difference?

analyzed: utpatti jñapti pratibandhaka tva abhāvāt iti ced na
translated: Because there is no obstruction to origination and manifestation? No, that is not so.

analyzed: viśeṣeṇa pratītim antareṇa viśiṣṭa pratyaya anupapattyā jñapti pratibandhaka tvāt
translated: Because the cognition of the qualified is not possible without the cognition of the qualification, which is the cause of obstruction to cognition.

analyzed: tat idam uktam syāt eva iti
translated: This is what is meant by saying it may be so.

original: yadyapi bhedābhedāṅgīkāre virodho vaktuṃ śakyate tathāpi sphuṭatvānnoktaḥ /
analyzed: yadi api bheda abheda aṅgīkāre virodhaḥ vaktum śakyate tathā api sphuṭa tvāt na uktaḥ
translated: Even though contradiction can be stated in the acceptance of difference and non-difference, it is not stated here because it is obvious.

analyzed: evam aikyasya svarūpāt bheda pakṣe navasthā api iti
translated: Similarly, in the view that unity is different from its own nature, there is infinite regress.

analyzed: nanu aikyam caitanya abhinnam api sva nirvāhaka tvāt svābhāvika prakāśena aprakāśita tvam ātmanaḥ nirvakṣyati hiṣyati
translated: Now, even though unity is non-different from consciousness, it will be stated that the self is not illuminated by its own inherent light, because it is self-sustaining.

original: yadvā svarūpeṇaikyasya bhedābhedau stām /🔽tayośca bhedābhedāntarābhāve 'pi svanirvāhakatvādvayavahāropapattiriti cenna /
analyzed: yat vā svarūpeṇa aikyasya bheda abhedau stām  tayoḥ ca bheda abheda antara abhāve pi sva nirvāhaka tvāt vayavahāra upapattiḥ iti ced na
translated: Or let unity be different and non-different from its own nature.🔽And even if there is no further difference and non-difference of those two, the usage is possible because it is self-sustaining. If this is argued, it is not so.

analyzed: viśeṣa anabhyupagame sva nirvāhaka tvasya api vaktum aśakya tvāt iti abhiprāyeṇa āha sva nirvāhaka tā iti
translated: Because self-sustenance also cannot be stated without accepting a distinction. With this intention, he says self-sustenance etc.

analyzed: sva nirvāhaka tā ced syāt
translated: If self-sustenance were to be...

analyzed: aikyasya bheda abhedayoḥ vā sva nirvāhaka tā yadi aṅgīkṛtā syāt
translated: If the self-sustenance of unity or of difference and non-difference were to be accepted,

original: tadā pṛcchāmaḥ svasya nirvāhakaṃ hi svanirvāhakaṃ tasya bhāvaḥ svanirvāhakatā /🔽svasyeti ca karmaṇi ṣaṣṭhī /
analyzed: tadā pṛcchāmaḥ svasya nirvāhakam hi sva nirvāhakam tasya bhāvaḥ sva nirvāhaka tā  svasya iti ca karmaṇi ṣaṣṭhī
translated: And the genitive case in 'of itself' is in the accusative case.

analyzed: kartṛ karmaṇoḥ kṛti iti vacanāt
translated: Because of the rule 'kṛti is used for the agent and object'.

original: tathā caikasyaivaikasyāmeva nirvāhakriyāyāṃ karmakartṛtvalakṣaṇaṃ nirvāhyatvaṃ nirvāhakatvamityuktaṃ bhavati /🔽tannirvāhyatvaṃ nirvāhakatvaṃ ca parasparaṃ dharmiṇā kriyayā cātyantābhinnamutātyaṃ
analyzed: tathā ca ekasya eva ekasyām eva nirvāha kriyāyām karma kartṛ tva lakṣaṇam nirvāhya tvam nirvāhaka tvam iti uktam bhavati  tad nirvāhya tvam nirvāhaka tvam ca parasparam dharmiṇā kriyayā ca atyanta abhinnam uta atyam
translated: And thus it is said that the state of being the object to be caused and the state of being the cause, which are characterized by the action of the agent in the very same action of causing, are one and the same.

analyzed: tad bhinna abhinnam iti
translated: And is that state of being the object to be caused and the state of being the cause absolutely non-different from each other, or are they absolutely different, or are they neither different nor non-different?

analyzed: bāhyam bāhakam iti api
translated: And also 'the external' and 'the cause'.

analyzed: paryāyaḥ bhedavān vā syāt anavasthā ubhayatra ca
translated: Either they would be synonyms or have difference, and in both cases there would be infinite regress.

original: nirvāhyamiti nirvāhakamiti apiśabdānnirvāhakamityapi śabdasamūhaḥ paryāyaḥ prasajyeta ekārthatvāt /
analyzed: nirvāhyam iti nirvāhakam iti apiśabdāt nirvāhakam iti api śabda samūhaḥ paryāyaḥ prasajyeta eka artha tvāt
translated: The group of words 'the object to be caused', 'the cause', and also 'the cause' due to the word 'api' (also), would be a synonym, because they have the same meaning.

analyzed: na ca teṣām śabdānām kaścid paryāya tvam manyate
translated: And no one considers those words to be synonyms.

analyzed: dvitīyam anūdya dūṣayati bhedavān iti
translated: He repeats the second [alternative] and criticizes it, saying 'having difference'.

analyzed: vā śabdaḥ yadi arthe
translated: The word 'vā' (or) has the meaning of 'yadi' (if).

original: yadi nirvāhyatvādirarthaḥ parasparaṃ dharmiṇā na bhedavān syāttadā tadbhedadvayasya bhedisvarūpamātratve paryāyatvādidoṣaprasaṅgādbhedāntaravadityaṅgīkaraṇīyam
analyzed: yadi nirvāhya tva ādiḥ arthaḥ parasparam dharmiṇā na bhedavān syāt tadā tad bheda dvayasya bhedi svarūpa mātra tve paryāya tva ādi doṣa prasaṅgāt bheda antara vat iti aṅgīkaraṇīyam
translated: If the meaning were non-fulfillment etc., and were not different from the substratum, then, in the case of the two differences, being mere forms of the differents, the fault of being synonyms etc. would follow, and it would have to be accepted like another difference.

original: tathāca parasparaṃ bhedaṃ dharmibhedaṃ vā'śrityobhayatrānavasthā syāditi / /
analyzed: tathā ca parasparam bhedam dharmi bhedam vā āśritya ubhayatra anavasthā syāt iti
translated: And thus, depending on the difference from each other or the difference of the substratum, there would be an infinite regress in both cases.

analyzed: evam viśeṣa anabhyupagame mahāvākya artha anupapattim abhidhāya avāntaravākye tām atidiśati satya iti
translated: Thus, having stated the impossibility of the meaning of a great sentence in the absence of the acceptance of a particular, he extends it to a subordinate sentence also with the word 'satya' (true).

analyzed: satya jñāna ādike pi evam
translated: And so on in the case of 'satya jnana' (true knowledge) etc.

analyzed: satyam jñānam anantam brahma ityādike vā antara vākye pi evam vikalpya dūṣaṇam abhidhānīyam iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that in a subordinate sentence like 'Sat yam jnana-anantaram brahma' (Brahman is true, knowledge, infinite), the fault should be stated by considering it in the same way.

analyzed: tathā hi
translated: To explain:

original: satyajñānādikaṃ parasparaṃ brahmaṇā cātyantābhinnaṃ vā bhinnaṃ vā bhinnābhinnaṃ vā /
analyzed: satya jñāna ādikam parasparam brahmaṇā ca atyanta abhinnam vā bhinnam vā bhinna abhinnam vā
translated: Is 'satya jnana' etc. absolutely non-different from each other and from Brahman, or different, or different and non-different?

analyzed: na ādyaḥ
translated: Not the first.

analyzed: tathā sati sva prakāśa brahma ātmakasya tasya satya jñāna ādi śāstra pratipādya tva prasaṅgāt
translated: If so, then it would follow that it, which is self-luminous and of the nature of Brahman, is to be taught by the scriptures like 'satya jnana' etc.

analyzed: satya jñāna ādi padānām paryāya tva āpattyā sahaprayoga anupapatti prasaṅgāt ca
translated: And because of the consequence of the impossibility of the simultaneous use of the words 'true', 'knowledge', etc., because of their being synonyms.

analyzed: na dvitīyaḥ  apasiddhāntāt
translated: Not the second.🔽Because of the contradiction of one's own doctrine.

analyzed: mithyātva āpattyā śāstrasya atattva āvedaka tva prasaṅgāt ca
translated: And because of the consequence of the falsity of the scriptures, because of the consequence of their not teaching reality.

analyzed: ajñāna tva ādeḥ satya tva āpatteḥ ca
translated: And because of the consequence of the truth of ignorance, etc.

analyzed: na tṛtīyaḥ  anavasthā prasaṅgāt
translated: Not the third.🔽Because of the consequence of infinite regress.

analyzed: sva nirvāhaka tvasya ca ukta vidhayā nirvaktum aśakya tvāt iti
translated: And because of the impossibility of explaining self-sufficiency in the manner stated.

original: nanu satyajñānādīnāṃ parasparaṃ brahmaṇā cātyantamabheda eva /
analyzed: nanu satya jñāna ādīnām parasparam brahmaṇā ca atyantam abhedaḥ eva
translated: But surely, there is absolute non-difference between truth, knowledge, etc., and Brahman.

analyzed: na ca tāvatā satya jñāna ādi padānām paryāya tvam
translated: And even so, the words 'true', 'knowledge', etc., are not synonyms.

analyzed: vācya artha bheda sadbhāvāt
translated: Because of the existence of the difference in the denoted meanings.

original: parāparasāmānyavācināṃ saguṇabrahmavācināṃ vā teṣāṃ parabrahmaṇi lakṣaṇayā pravṛttyaṅgīkārāt /🔽naca vācyaṃ satyapadena lakṣitasyaiva jñānapadena lakṣaṇāyāṃ vaiyarthyāt /
analyzed: parāpara sāmānya vācinām saguṇa brahma vācinām vā teṣām para brahmaṇi lakṣaṇayā pravṛtti aṅgīkārāt  na ca vācyam satya padena lakṣitasya eva jñāna padena lakṣaṇāyām vaiyarthyāt
translated: Because they are accepted to be used by lakṣaṇā in the highest Brahman, being words denoting the general qualities of the higher and lower, or words denoting Brahman with qualities.🔽And it cannot be said that in the lakṣaṇā of what is indicated by the word 'true' by the word 'knowledge', there is uselessness,

analyzed: adhika lakṣaṇāyām ca na akhaṇḍa artha tā siddhiḥ iti
translated: and that in the lakṣaṇā of the additional, the establishment of the meaning as indivisible does not occur.

analyzed: lakṣya artha bheda abhāve pi āropita asatya tva ādi vyavṛtti artha tvena pada antarāṇām sa prayojana tvāt
translated: Even in the absence of difference in the meaning of the word, the other words have a purpose by having the meaning of excluding superimposed unreality etc.

analyzed: atas eva na śāstra vaiyarthyam
translated: For this very reason, the scriptures are not useless.

analyzed: sva prakāśe pi āropita ākāra vyāvṛtti artha tvena śāstrasya sa prayojana ttvāt iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that even in self-luminous Brahman, the scriptures have a purpose by having the meaning of excluding superimposed forms, that is not so.

analyzed: kim brahma viśeṣaṇa tvena asatya tva ādi vyāvṛtti bodhaḥ prayojanam ucyate
translated: Is the purpose stated to be the understanding of the exclusion of unreality etc. by qualifying Brahman?

analyzed: kiṃvā svatantraḥ eva vyāvṛtti bodhaḥ
translated: Or is the understanding of exclusion itself independent?

analyzed: ādye doṣam āha na vyāvṛttyā iti
translated: In the first case, he says the fault is that there is no purpose in exclusion.

analyzed: na vyāvṛttyā prayojanam
translated: There is no purpose in exclusion.

analyzed: vyāvṛttasya a viśeṣa tve
translated: If the excluded Brahman is without distinction...

analyzed: ittham bhūta lakṣaṇe tṛtīyā
translated: The instrumental case is used in the sense of being such.

original: brahmaviśeṣaṇatvenāsatyatvādivyāvṛttilakṣaṇaṃ prayojanaṃ satyādipadānāṃ tvayā vaktuṃ na śakyate /
analyzed: brahma viśeṣaṇa tvena asatya tva ādi vyāvṛtti lakṣaṇam prayojanam satya ādi padānām tvayā vaktum na śakyate
translated: You cannot state the purpose of excluding unreality etc. by qualifying Brahman as the meaning of words like sat etc.

analyzed: kutas iti atas āha vyāvṛttasya iti
translated: Why? Therefore he says of the excluded.

analyzed: vyāvṛtta tayā pratītasya brahmaṇaḥ viśeṣa tve sati iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: if the Brahman, which is cognized as excluded, is without distinction.

analyzed: abhāva viśeṣa aṅgīkāre ca bhāva viśeṣaiḥ kim aparāddham
translated: And if particular absences are accepted, what harm have particular existences done?

analyzed: dvitīyam dūṣayati na vyāvṛttasya iti
translated: He refutes the second view by saying of the excluded.

original: vyāvṛttervyāvṛttasya brahmaṇo 'viśeṣatve sā svatantrā vyāvṛttirna prayojanam /
analyzed: vyāvṛtteḥ vyāvṛttasya brahmaṇaḥ viśeṣa tve sā svatantrā vyāvṛttiḥ na prayojanam
translated: When there is no difference of Brahman, which is excluded, the exclusion itself is not the purpose, because it is not desired to be known.

analyzed: a jijñāsita tvāt
translated: Because it is not desired to be known.

original: mumukṣuṇā brahma vā taddharmo vā jijñāsitavyaḥ /
analyzed: mumukṣuṇā brahma vā tad dharmaḥ vā jijñāsitavyaḥ
translated: Either Brahman or its attribute should be desired to be known by one who desires liberation.

analyzed: tatra vyāvṛttiḥ na brahma
translated: There, exclusion is not Brahman.

original: tasya bhāvarūpatvādekatvānnirupādhikatvācca /🔽brahmadharmo 'pi na cetkathaṃ mumukṣuṇā jijñāsyeta /
analyzed: tasya bhāva rūpa tvāt eka tvāt nirupādhika tvāt ca  brahma dharmaḥ na ced katham mumukṣuṇā jijñāsyeta
translated: Because it is of the nature of existence, and because it is one and without limiting conditions.🔽If it is not an attribute of Brahman, how can it be desired to be known by one who desires liberation?

analyzed: ajijñāsita bodhanam ca katham prayojanam syāt iti
translated: And how can the teaching of what is not desired to be known be the purpose?

analyzed: kiñca satya ādi padāni brahmaṇi kim
translated: Moreover, do words like truth denote the attributes of truth etc. in Brahman, with the purpose of excluding non-existence etc.?

analyzed: uta anyathā vā
translated: Or in some other way?

analyzed: na ādyaḥ
translated: The first is not so.

analyzed: anaṅgīkārāt iti āha na vyāvṛttyā iti
translated: Because it is not accepted, he says exclusion is not the purpose etc.

original: vyāvṛttasya brahmaṇo 'viśeṣatve 'ṅgīkṛte sati /🔽viśeṣaṇābhidhānamukhena vyāvṛttiḥ padānāṃ prayojanamiti vaktuṃ na śakyata ityarthaḥ / /
analyzed: vyāvṛttasya brahmaṇaḥ viśeṣa tve ṅgīkṛte sati  viśeṣaṇa abhidhāna mukhena vyāvṛttiḥ padānām prayojanam iti vaktum na śakyate iti arthaḥ
translated: When the non-difference of Brahman, which is excluded, is accepted,🔽it cannot be said that the purpose of the words is exclusion by way of denoting attributes. This is the meaning.

analyzed: dvitīyam dūṣayati na vyāvṛttasya iti
translated: He refutes the second by saying exclusion of what is excluded is not the purpose etc.

original: vyāvṛttasya brahmaṇo 'viśeṣatve satyatvādidharmāpratipādana iti yāvat /🔽asatyatvādivyāvṛttiḥ padānāṃ prayojanamiti vaktuṃ na śakyate /
analyzed: vyāvṛttasya brahmaṇaḥ viśeṣa tve satya tva ādi dharma apratipādane iti yāvat  asatya tva ādi vyāvṛttiḥ padānām prayojanam iti vaktum na śakyate
translated: When Brahman is excluded, it cannot be said that the purpose of the words is to exclude non-existence, etc.

original: nahi tīre nadītvamanabhidadhato nadīpadasyānadītvavyāvṛttiḥ prayojanaṃ sambhavati /
analyzed: nahi tīre nadī tvam an abhidadhataḥ nadī padasya a nadī tva vyāvṛttiḥ prayojanam sambhavati
translated: For when the word 'river' does not denote the quality of being a river on the bank, it is not possible for the purpose to be the exclusion of non-riverhood.

analyzed: virodhya ākāra samarpaṇena hi virodhya ākāra antaram vyāvartanīyam
translated: For by presenting a contradictory form, another contradictory form is to be excluded.

analyzed: yat uktam śāstram ca āropita ākāra vyāvṛttyā sva prakāśe pi prayojana vat iti
translated: It has been said that even in self-luminous Brahman, the scripture has a purpose by excluding the superimposed form.

analyzed: tat api anena eva nirastam
translated: That also is refuted by this very [argument].

original: nirviśeṣe svayaṃprakāśamāne virodhyākārāropa evānupapanna iti coktam /
analyzed: nirviśeṣe svayam prakāśamāne virodhya ākāra āropaḥ eva anupapannaḥ iti ca uktam
translated: It has been said that in the self-luminous without distinctions, the superimposition of a contradictory form is itself impossible.

analyzed: evam viśeṣa anaṅgīkāre vākya dvayasya anupapattim abhidhāya upasaṃharati tat iti
translated: Having thus stated the impossibility of the two statements if distinctions are not accepted, he concludes with the word 'therefore'.

analyzed: tat akhaṇḍam ca khaṇḍitam
translated: And that is undivided and divided.

original: tattasmādakhaṇḍaṃ nirviśeṣaṃ vākyadvayapratipādyamityetanmataṃ khaṇḍitaṃ dūṣitaṃ veditavyamityarthaḥ / /
analyzed: tat tasmāt akhaṇḍam nirviśeṣam vākya dvaya pratipādyam iti etat matam khaṇḍitam dūṣitam veditavyam iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that this view that the subject matter of the two statements is undivided, without distinctions, should be understood to be divided, refuted.

analyzed: sva kriyā viruddham ca nirviśeṣa tva vacanam iti āha nirviśeṣa tvam iti
translated: And the statement of non-distinction is contradictory to its own action, he says: non-distinction would be like saying I am dumb.

analyzed: nirviśeṣa tvam etena mūkaḥ ham iti vat bhavet
translated: By this, non-distinction would be like saying I am dumb.

analyzed: yathā mūkaḥ ham iti etat sva kriyā viruddham
translated: Just as I am dumb is contradictory to its own action.

analyzed: vaktṛ tva abhāvaḥ hi anena ucyate vacana kriyayā ca vaktṛ tvam iti
translated: For by this [statement] the absence of being a speaker is stated, and by the action of speaking, speaking is stated.

analyzed: tathā nirviśeṣam brahma iti sva kriyā viruddham bhavet
translated: Similarly, Brahman is without distinction would be contradictory to its own action.

analyzed: katham
translated: How?

analyzed: etena nirviśeṣa tvena viśeṣeṇa āpatitena hetunā
translated: By this, by the reason of non-distinction, which has fallen into distinction.

original: viśeṣābhāvo hi nirviśeṣaṃ brahmeti vākyena pratipādayitumiṣyaḥ /
analyzed: viśeṣa abhāvaḥ hi nirviśeṣam brahma iti vākyena pratipādayitum iṣyaḥ
translated: For by the sentence Brahman is without distinction the absence of distinction is to be taught.

analyzed: pratipādana kriyayā ca viśeṣa abhāva lakṣaṇaḥ viśeṣaḥ prāpnoti iti
translated: And by the action of teaching, a distinction characterized by the absence of distinction is obtained.

original: ayamapi viśeṣo nirviśeṣamityanena nirākriyata iti kutastatrāpi svakriyāvirodhaḥ /
analyzed: ayam api viśeṣaḥ nirviśeṣam iti anena nirākriyate iti kutas tatra api sva kriyā virodhaḥ
translated: And this distinction is denied by without distinction. So how is there contradiction with its own action even there?

analyzed: pratīti virodhaḥ iti ced
translated: If it is said there is contradiction with cognition,

original: tarhyetadvacanakartṛtvamapi mūko 'hamityanena nirākriyata iti kutastatrāpi svakriyāvirodhaḥ /
analyzed: tarhi etad vacana kartṛ tvam api mūkaḥ ham iti anena nirākriyate iti kutas tatra api sva kriyā virodhaḥ
translated: then the fact of being the agent of this statement is also denied by I am dumb. So how is there contradiction with its own action even there?

analyzed: pratīti virodhaḥ iti ced
translated: If it is said there is contradiction with cognition,

analyzed: samaḥ samādhiḥ
translated: the solution is the same.

analyzed: para bodhana upāya abhāvāt viśeṣa abhāvaḥ upādīyate
translated: The absence of distinction is accepted because there is no means of knowing the supreme.

analyzed: na tu brahma viśeṣa tayā iti ced
translated: If it is argued that it is not because of the distinction in Brahman,

analyzed: atrā api para bodhana upāya abhāvāt evā idam vacanam
translated: here also this statement is because of the absence of means of knowing the supreme.

analyzed: vastutas tu asau mūkaḥ evā iti astu
translated: But let it be that in reality it is indeed silent.

analyzed: nirviśeṣam iti asya viśeṣa nirāsaḥ eva tātparyam
translated: The purport of the statement without distinction is only the denial of distinction.

analyzed: na nirviśeṣa tva viśeṣa vidhau
translated: Not in the injunction of the distinction of being without distinction.

analyzed: atas katham virodhaḥ iti ced
translated: Therefore, how can there be a contradiction?

analyzed: tarhi mūkaḥ ham iti asya api vaktṛ tva nirāse tātparyam
translated: If so, then the purport of the statement I am silent is only the denial of being a speaker.

analyzed: na etad vacana vaktṛ tve iti kutas tatra api virodhaḥ
translated: Not in being a speaker of this statement. How then is there a contradiction even there?

original: na tatra svavacanavirodhaḥ /🔽kintu svakriyāvirodha iti cet /
analyzed: na tatra sva vacana virodhaḥ  kintu sva kriyā virodhaḥ iti ced
translated: There is no contradiction with one's own statement there.🔽But if it is argued that there is a contradiction with one's own action,

analyzed: prakṛte pi kim anyaḥ bhihitaḥ iti āstām prapañcaḥ
translated: then why is something else stated in the present case? Let the elaboration rest.

analyzed: tat idam uktam mūkaḥ ham iti vat iti
translated: This is what is meant by like saying 'I am silent'...

analyzed: yad artham ayam prayatnaḥ tat āha abhinne pi iti
translated: For the sake of which this effort is made, he says Even in the non-different...

analyzed: abhinne pi viśeṣaḥ yam balāt āpatati hi atas
translated: This distinction, even in the non-different, falls by force. Therefore...🔽...

analyzed: atas ukta prakāreṇa mahāvākya avāntaravākyayoḥ anyathā anupapatti balāt bheda rahite pi brahmaṇi ayam anupapatti śānti hetuḥ viśeṣaḥ nāma śakti viśeṣaḥ ṅgīkaraṇīyaḥ
translated: Therefore, by the method stated, even in Brahman, which is devoid of difference, a special power called distinction, which is the cause of the removal of the inconsistency, must be accepted as the cause of the removal of the inconsistency, by the force of the impossibility of another explanation of the great sentence and the subordinate sentences.

analyzed: prāpnoti
translated: It is obtained.

analyzed: idam uktam bhavati
translated: This is what is said:

analyzed: mahāvākya pratipādyam aikyam avāntara vākya pratipādyam ca satya tva ādikam brahmaṇā parasparam ca abhinnam eva  ekadhā eva anudraṣṭavyam ityādi eka rasa tva
translated: The identity taught by the great sentence and the truthfulness taught by the subordinate sentence are non-different from each other,🔽because of the Vedic text teaching oneness, such as One should see only one thing,

analyzed: pratipādaka śruteḥ
translated: and the taste of oneness.

analyzed: na ca ukta doṣaḥ
translated: And the stated fault does not arise.

original: yato bhedahīne 'pi vastunyasti kaścicchaktiviśeṣo yena prakāśamānamapi na prakāśata ityādi yujyate /
analyzed: yatas bheda hīne vastuni asti kaścid śakti viśeṣaḥ yena prakāśamānam api na prakāśate ityādi yujyate
translated: Because even in a thing devoid of difference, there is some special power by which, even though it is manifested, it is not manifested, etc., is proper.

original: sa ca viśeṣo 'nayaivārthāpattyāvagamyata ityeva tvayā vaktavyamiti / /
analyzed: sa ca viśeṣaḥ nayā eva arthāpattyā avagamyate iti eva tvayā vaktavyam iti
translated: And that special power is understood by this very presumption. Thus you must say.

analyzed: nanu aṅgīkṛte viśeṣe na anupapatti śāntiḥ
translated: But even if the special power is accepted, the inconsistency is not removed.

original: so 'pi hi viśeṣo yadi vastuno bhinnastarhi bhedānavasthādi doṣaḥ syādabhinnatve ca viśeṣatadvadbhāvānupapattestādavasthyādityata āha viśeṣeti
analyzed: saḥ pi hi viśeṣaḥ yadi vastunaḥ bhinnaḥ tarhi bheda anavasthā ādi doṣaḥ syāt abhinna tve ca viśeṣa tadvat bhāva anupapatteḥ tādavasthyāt iti atas āha viśeṣa iti
translated: For if that distinction also is different from the entity, then there would be the fault of an infinite regress of distinctions. And if it is not different, then the relation of the distinguished and the distinguisher is not possible, because it remains as it is. To this he says:

analyzed: viśeṣa tadvatoḥ ca eva sva nirvāhaka tā bhavet  viśeṣa viśeṣiṇoḥ ca abhedaḥ eva aṅgīkaraṇīyaḥ
translated: And there would be self-establishment of the distinguished and the distinguisher.🔽And the non-difference of the distinguished and the distinguisher should be accepted.

analyzed: viśeṣa balāt ca viśeṣa tadvat bhāvaḥ pi upapādanīyaḥ iti śeṣaḥ
translated: And the relation of the distinguished and the distinguisher should be established by the power of the distinction. This is the remainder.

analyzed: tathā api viśeṣa parasparayā anavasthā syāt iti atas āha sva nirvāhaka tā iti
translated: Even so, there would be an infinite regress of distinctions. To this he says: by self-establishment.

original: sa eva viśeṣo viśeṣāntaramantareṇa viśeṣatadvadbhāvaṃ ca ghaṭayati /
analyzed: saḥ eva viśeṣaḥ viśeṣa antaram antareṇa viśeṣa tadvat bhāvam ca ghaṭayati
translated: That very distinction establishes the relation of the distinguished and the distinguisher without another distinction.

original: ekasyaiva nirvāhyatvaṃ nirvāhakatvaṃ ca tadbalādeva siddhayatītyaṅgīkaraṇīyamiti / /
analyzed: ekasya eva nirvāhya tvam nirvāhaka tvam ca tad balāt eva siddhayati iti aṅgīkaraṇīyam iti
translated: And the fact that the same is both that which is to be established and that which establishes it is established by its power alone. This should be accepted.

original: nanvabhinne vastuni bhedakāryanirvāhakatvaṃ viśeṣasya kutaḥ pramāṇāttaḥ
analyzed: nanu abhinne vastuni bheda kārya nirvāhaka tvam viśeṣasya kutas pramāṇāt tasmāt
translated: But from what means is the establishment of the distinguisher's ability to accomplish the effect of distinction in an undifferentiated entity known?

analyzed: siddham iti atas āha bheda hīne tu iti  tuśabdaḥ va dhāraṇe
translated: To this he says: But in the absence of distinction.🔽The word but is for emphasis.

analyzed: bheda hīne tu aparyāya śabda antara niyāmakaḥ
translated: In the absence of distinction, it is the regulator of synonyms and other words.

analyzed: viśeṣaḥ nāma kathitaḥ
translated: The difference is said to be...

analyzed: aparyāya śabda antara niyāmakaḥ iti aśeṣa bheda kāyaḥ nirvāhaka tva upalakṣaṇam
translated: The determiner of other words that are not synonyms is a figurative expression for the performance of all the effects of difference.

analyzed: etat uktam bhavati
translated: This is what is said.

analyzed: jīva brahma aikya ādīnām ekadhā eva ityādi śrutyā caitanya svarūpa mātra tvam pratīyate
translated: By the scripture of the self and Brahman, oneness, etc. are only one, etc., the mere nature of consciousness is understood.

analyzed: caitanye sva prakāśa tayā siddhe pi asiddhiḥ aparyāya śabda vedya tvam
translated: Even though consciousness is established as self-luminous, the fact that it is known by non-synonymous words is not established.

analyzed: caitanya prakāśasya na avidyā nivartaka tvam advaita jñānasya tad nivartaka tvam iti arthakriya viśeṣaḥ
translated: The difference in the effect of action is that the light of consciousness does not remove ignorance, but the knowledge of non-duality does remove it.

analyzed: caitanyam ekam satya tva ādīni anekāni iti saṅkhaya availakṣaṇyam ityādi bheda kāryāṇi ca avagamyate
translated: The difference in the number is that consciousness is one, and truth, etc. are many. Thus, the effects of difference are understood.

original: etadubhayānyathānupapattyā bhedarahite 'pi caitanye bhedrapratinidhistatkāyarkārī kaścidatiśayo 'stīti kalpyate /
analyzed: etad ubhaya anyathā anupapattyā bheda rahite caitanye kaścid atiśayaḥ sti iti kalpyate
translated: By the non-apprehension of these two, it is imagined that there is some excellence in consciousness, which is devoid of difference, that performs the effects of difference, as a substitute for difference.

analyzed: gati antara abhāvāt
translated: Because there is no other way.

analyzed: tathā ca arthāpattyā svarūpa grāhiṇyā bheda kārya nirvāhakaḥ eva ca
translated: And thus, by presumption, which grasps the nature [of consciousness], and which performs the effects of difference,

original: asau siddha iti kiṃ tatra pramāṇāntarānveṣaṇeneti /
analyzed: asau siddhaḥ iti kim tatra pramāṇa antara anveṣaṇena iti
translated: it is established. Therefore, what is the use of searching for another means of knowledge in that [case]?

original: anenaiva viśeṣasya lakṣaṇaṃ coktaṃ bhavati /🔽bhedahāne 'pyanupacaritabhedavyavahāranimittaṃ viśeṣa iti / /
analyzed: anena eva viśeṣasya lakṣaṇam ca uktam bhavati  bheda hāne pi anupacarita bheda vyavahāra nimittam viśeṣaḥ iti
translated: By this (verse) the definition of difference is also stated.🔽Even in the absence of difference, difference is the cause of the usage of non-figurative difference.

analyzed: anya vādibhiḥ api viśeṣaḥ ṅgīkāryaḥ
translated: Difference must be accepted even by the proponents of other views.

analyzed: evam advaita vādinā viśeṣam aṅgīkārayitvā anyān api aṅgīkārayati saḥ u sti iti
translated: Thus, having made the proponent of non-duality accept difference, he makes others also accept it, saying It exists.

analyzed: saḥ sti vastuṣu aśeṣatas
translated: It exists in all things without exception.

original: na kevalaṃ brahmaṇi māyāvādinā viśeṣo 'ṅgīkaraṇīyaḥ /🔽kiṃ nāma prapañcasatyatāvādibhirapyaśeṣadravyeṣu sa viśeṣo 'ṅgīkāryaḥ /
analyzed: na kevalam brahmaṇi māyā vādinā viśeṣaḥ ṅgīkaraṇīyaḥ  kim nāma prapañca satyatā vādibhiḥ api aśeṣa dravyeṣu sa viśeṣaḥ ṅgīkāryaḥ
translated: Not only should difference be accepted by the Māyāvādins in Brahman,🔽but also by those who assert the reality of the world, that difference should be accepted in all substances without exception.

original: tathā hi paṭastacchauklayaṃ ca tāvanna bhidyete /
analyzed: tathā hi paṭaḥ tad śauklayam ca tāvat na bhidyete
translated: For instance, a cloth and its whiteness are not different.

analyzed: aṅgulī dvaya vat bhedena anupalambhāt
translated: Because they are not perceived as different like two fingers.

analyzed: ayuta siddha tvāt iti ced
translated: If it is argued that it is because they are not independently existent,

analyzed: kim ayuta siddha tvam nāma
translated: what is meant by not being independently existent?

analyzed: avaśyam āśraya āśrayi bhāvena avasthānam iti ced
translated: If it is said that they necessarily exist in the relation of container and contained,

analyzed: kim etāvatā bhedena na pratyetavyam
translated: why should they not be cognized as different to this extent?

original: nāpi kuṇḍamiva paṭo 'dhikaraṇatvena badarāṇīva śauklayamādheyatvena parisphurati /
analyzed: nā api kuṇḍam iva paṭaḥ dhikaraṇa tvena badarāṇi iva śauklayam ādheya tvena parisphurati
translated: And the cloth does not appear as the container like a pot, and whiteness as the contained like jujubes.

analyzed: kim nāma tat eva tat iti
translated: But rather, it is said that it is that very thing itself.

analyzed: na ca eṣā pratītiḥ bhrāntiḥ
translated: And this cognition is not erroneous.

analyzed: bādhaka abhāvāt
translated: Because there is no contradiction.

analyzed: śauklaya paṭayoḥ bheda avagāhinī pratyakṣa pratītiḥ hi bādhikā bhavet  anumāna ādīnām abheda pratyaya
translated: For the perceptual cognition apprehending the difference between the cloth and whiteness could be contradictory.

analyzed: rodhena utthānasya eva asambhavāt
translated: Because inference etc. cannot arise by contradicting the cognition of non-difference.

analyzed: na ca bheda avagāhinī pratyakṣa pratītiḥ asti iti uktam
translated: And there is no perceptual cognition apprehending difference, as stated.

analyzed: tena pratyakṣataḥ eva siddhaḥ paṭa śauklayayoḥ abhedaḥ
translated: Therefore, the non-difference of cloth and whiteness is established by perception itself.

analyzed: dṛśyante ca bheda kāryāṇi
translated: And the effects of difference are seen.
The absence of the cognition of cloth and whiteness having less or more objects.

analyzed: tad śabdayoḥ aparyāya tvam aparyāya śabda smāraka tvam
translated: The non-synonymy of their words, the non-synonymous word-reminding.

analyzed: jala āharaṇa ādi artha kriyā bhedaḥ  paṭam ānaya iti ukte yat kiñcid śuklayā anānayanam
translated: The difference in the function of bringing water etc.🔽When it is said bring the cloth, any white thing is brought.

analyzed: śuklam ānaya iti ukte niyamena paṭasya ānayanam
translated: When it is said bring the white, the cloth is necessarily brought.

analyzed: apaṭaḥ paṭaḥ iti vat aśuklaḥ paṭaḥ iti anayoḥ virodha abhāvaḥ
translated: The absence of contradiction between not cloth is cloth and not white is cloth.

analyzed: andhasya api paṭaḥ yam iti vat śuklaḥ yam iti ca pratīti anutpattiḥ
translated: Like the blind, the cognition this is cloth and this is white does not arise.

analyzed: śukla apratipatti vat paṭa apratipatti abhāvaḥ
translated: The absence of the non-apprehension of cloth, like the non-apprehension of whiteness.

analyzed: mahārajana samparkeṇa śukla tva vat paṭasya āpyā
translated: Just as a cloth does not become white due to contact with great saffron,

analyzed: vṛtta tva abhāvaḥ
translated: so there is no non-obstruction of whiteness.

analyzed: paṭa vat vā śauklayasya api anāvṛtta tva abhāvaḥ
translated: Or just as a cloth does not become non-obstructed, so whiteness also does not become non-obstructed.

analyzed: iti evamādīni
translated: Such are the examples.🔽And this cognition is not false.

analyzed: na ca eṣā pratītiḥ bhāntiḥ  bādhita tva abhimānasya api abhāvāt  vyavahāra ādya visaṃvādāt ca tad etayoḥ abheda bheda kārya pratītyoḥ anyathā anupapattyā nirbhede
translated: Because there is no conception of being contradicted.🔽And because there is no contradiction with usage, etc. Thus, by the non-applicability of these cognitions of non-difference and difference, even in the non-different

original: 'pi paṭe 'sti kaścidatiśayo bhedapratinidhiryadvaśādidaṃ sarvaṃ samañjasaṃ syādityeva kalpanīyam /
analyzed: pi paṭe sti kaścid atiśayaḥ bheda pratinidhiḥ yad vaśāt idam sarvam samañjasam syāt iti eva kalpanīyam
translated: cloth, some special thing that is a substitute for difference must be imagined, by the power of which all this would be consistent.

analyzed: na ca atiśayaḥ bhinne viśeṣaka tvāt viśeṣaḥ iti gīyate
translated: And that special thing, though non-different, is called a difference because it is a distinguisher.

analyzed: evam anyatra api dravye viśeṣaḥ pratipattavyaḥ
translated: In the same way, a difference should be understood in other substances also.

original: nanu bhedābhedāṅgīkāreṇānupapatteḥ śamanāt kiṃ viśeṣeṇeti cenna /🔽parasparaviruddhayorbhedābhedayorekatrāvasthānaghaṭanāyāma
analyzed: nanu bheda abheda aṅgīkāreṇa anupapatteḥ śamanāt kim viśeṣeṇa iti ced na  paraspara viruddhayoḥ bheda abhedayoḥ ekatra avasthāna ghaṭanāyāma
translated: If it is argued that since non-applicability is removed by accepting difference and non-difference, what is the use of a special thing? It is not so.

analyzed: viśeṣasya api aṅgīkaraṇīya tvāt
translated: Because even when difference and non-difference, which are mutually contradictory, are established in one place, a special thing must also be accepted.

analyzed: pratīta tvāt kaḥ virodhaḥ iti ced
translated: If it is argued that what is the contradiction, since it is cognized?

analyzed: satyam
translated: It is true.

analyzed: pratītiḥ api katham upapannā iti cintāyām vastu svabhāva atiśayasya anusaraṇīya tvāt
translated: When the question arises as to how cognition is possible, it is because the excellence of the nature of the thing must be followed.

analyzed: bheda abheda anavasthā parihāra artham api viśeṣa aṅgīkārasya āvaśyaka tvasya ukta tvāt iti
translated: And because it has been said that the acceptance of a distinction is necessary even for the avoidance of the regress of identity and difference.

analyzed: nanu sarva vastuṣu yadi asti viśeṣaḥ
translated: Now, if there is a distinction in all things,

analyzed: sa ca vastunaḥ na bhidyate
translated: and that is not different from the thing,

original: prāptaṃ tarhi sakalavastūnāmaikyamityata āha viśeṣā iti // /
analyzed: prāptam tarhi sakala vastūnām aikyam iti atas āha viśeṣāḥ iti
translated: then it follows that all things are one. To this he says distinctions.

analyzed: viśeṣāḥ te pi anantāḥ ca paraspara viśeṣiṇaḥ  sva nirvāhaka tā yuktāḥ santi vastuṣu aśeṣatas
translated: Those distinctions are also infinite and mutually distinguished,🔽and are present in all things, connected with their own fulfillment.

original: te prakṛtasvarūpā viśeṣā aśeṣato vastuṣvananteṣu dravyeṣvanantā eva santi /
analyzed: te prakṛta svarūpāḥ viśeṣāḥ aśeṣatas vastuṣu ananteṣu dravyeṣu anantāḥ eva santi
translated: Those distinctions, which are the subject matter, are infinite in all things, in infinite substances.

analyzed: na punar ekaḥ eva sarvatra atas na ukta doṣaḥ
translated: And not just one everywhere. Therefore, the stated fault does not arise.

analyzed: saḥ asti iti ekavacanam tu samudāya apekṣayā prayuktam iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The singular is used with reference to the whole, this is the idea.

original: nanvekaikasmiṃśca dravye viśeṣo 'pyekaiko 'sti tadā paṭo mahāṃśchuklaścalatīti vicitrānekavyavahārānupapattiḥ /
analyzed: nanu ekaikasmin ca dravye viśeṣaḥ api ekaikaḥ sti tadā paṭaḥ mahān śuklaḥ calati iti vicitra aneka vyavahāra anupapattiḥ
translated: Now, if there is also a single distinction in each substance, then the occurrence of various multiple usages like the cloth is large, white, and moving is not possible.

analyzed: na hi ekasmāt avicitra svabhāvāt vicitra aneka kārya utpattiḥ dṛṣṭā
translated: For it is not seen that various effects arise from a single thing of undifferentiated nature.

analyzed: tathā sati ākasmika tva prasaṅgāt
translated: Because if it were so, it would lead to the absurdity of everything happening without any cause.

original: tataśca viśeṣāṅgīkāro vyarthaḥ syādityata āha viśeṣā iti //
analyzed: tatas ca viśeṣa aṅgīkāraḥ vyarthaḥ syāt iti atas āha viśeṣāḥ iti
translated: And therefore the admission of the distinctions would be useless. Hence he says: The distinctions, etc.

original: te 'pyuktalakṣaṇā viśeṣā aśeṣato 'pi vastuṣu pratyekamanantāḥ santyato noktadoṣāvakāśaḥ anantā ityupalakṣaṇam /
analyzed: te pi ukta lakṣaṇāḥ viśeṣāḥ vastuṣu pratyekam anantāḥ santi atas na ukta doṣa avakāśaḥ anantāḥ iti upalakṣaṇam
translated: Those distinctions, which have the characteristics stated, exist in all things, each one of them, in infinite number. Therefore there is no room for the objections stated. The word infinite is used figuratively.

original: yatra yāvanto vyavahārāstatra tāvanto viśeṣā iti jñātavyam /
analyzed: yatra yāvantaḥ vyavahārāḥ tatra tāvantaḥ viśeṣāḥ iti jñātavyam
translated: It should be understood that there are as many distinctions as there are usages.

analyzed: pratidravyam aneka tve viśeṣāṇām parasparam bhedena bhāvyam
translated: When there is multiplicity in each substance, the distinctions must exist as different from each other.

analyzed: bheda avinābhūta tvāt anekatvasya
translated: Because multiplicity is inseparable from difference.

original: tathāca bhinnanāṃ dravyābhede dravyasyāpi bhedaprasaṅga ityata āha parampareti //
analyzed: tathā ca bhinnanām dravya abhede dravyasya api bheda prasaṅgaḥ iti atas āha paramparā iti
translated: And thus, if the different substances are not different from the substance, the substance itself would have to be different. Hence he says: In a series, etc.

analyzed: paraspara viśeṣavat tvena eva aneka tvam sambhavati
translated: Multiplicity is possible only by having mutual distinctions.

analyzed: viśeṣasya bheda kārya kāri tāyāḥ ukta tvāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The meaning is that it has been stated that the distinction is the cause of the effect of difference.

analyzed: viśeṣāṇām api viśeṣa antara aṅgīkāre na avasthā iti atas āha sva nirvāhaka tā iti
translated: If distinctions are also admitted to have other distinctions, there would be an infinite regress. Hence he says: Self-supporting, etc.

analyzed: pūrvam dravyeṇa viśeṣasya abheda cintā
translated: Earlier, the non-difference of distinction from substance was considered.

analyzed: idānīm tu parasparam iti sphuṭaḥ rtha bhedaḥ
translated: But now, the meaning is clearly different, as it is said 'between each other'.

original: sarvaṃ caitadviśeṣasvarūpasādhakārthāpattyaiva siddhamiti na pṛthak pramāṇamuktam /
analyzed: sarvam ca etat viśeṣa svarūpa sādhaka arthāpattyā eva siddham iti na pṛthak pramāṇam uktam
translated: And all this is established by the inference of the fact that establishes the specific nature itself, so a separate means of valid knowledge is not stated.

analyzed: nahi svayam anupapannam anupapatti antara śāntyai prabhavati
translated: For what is itself incoherent cannot be effective in quelling another incoherence.

analyzed: kintu yathā yathā upapadyate tathā tathā eva svarūpa grāhiṇyā arthāpatyā eva kalpyate
translated: But rather, it is imagined by the inference of the fact itself, which grasps its own nature, just as it is coherent.

analyzed: yadi api viśeṣaḥ pratyakṣaḥ pi bhavati
translated: Even though the specific nature may be perceived,

analyzed: yena pratyakṣa siddhena
translated: by which it is established by perception.

analyzed: iti vakṣyamāṇa tvāt
translated: Because it will be said thus.

original: tathāpi vipratipanno na tanmātreṇa bodhayituṃ śakyata ityarthāpattirupanyasteti / /
analyzed: tathā api vipratipannaḥ na tad mātreṇa bodhayitum śakyate iti arthāpattiḥ upanyastā iti
translated: Nevertheless, one who disagrees cannot be convinced by that alone, so inference is presented.

original: yadarthaṃ tadaikyasyetyādinā sarvavādibhirviśeṣo 'ṅgīkāritastadidānīmāha ata iti //🔽ato 'nantaguṇaṃ brahma nirbhedamapi bhaṇyate // / / //
analyzed: yad artham tad aikyasya ityādinā sarva vādibhiḥ viśeṣaḥ ṅgīkāritaḥ tat idānīm āha atas iti  atas nanta guṇam brahma nirbhedam api bhaṇyate
translated: For the sake of which the specific nature is accepted by all proponents, beginning with 'therefore that unity', he now says 'therefore'.🔽Therefore, Brahman, though non-different, is said to have infinite qualities.

analyzed: nirbhedam api brahma atas viśeṣa sāmarthyāt ananta guṇam bhaṇyate iti
translated: Therefore, Brahman, though non-different, is said to have infinite qualities due to the power of the specific nature.

original: yatpareṇa pṛṣṭaṃ lakṣyalakṣaṇayorbheda ityādi tasyedamuttaram brahma nirbhedamiti //
analyzed: yat pareṇa pṛṣṭam lakṣya lakṣaṇayoḥ bhedaḥ ityādi tasya idam uttaram brahma nirbhedam iti
translated: This is the answer to what was asked by the opponent, namely, the difference between the characterized and the characteristic, and so on. Brahman is without distinction.

analyzed: yat atra uktam aneka lakṣara abhinnasya aneka tva prasaṅgaḥ
translated: Here it was said that if it is not different from many characteristics, it would follow that it is many.

analyzed: lakṣaṇānām vā aneka tva anupapattiḥ
translated: Or it would be impossible for the characteristics to be many.

analyzed: śabda paryaya tvam
translated: It would be a mere synonym.

analyzed: guṇa guṇi tva ādi anupapattiḥ iti
translated: The relation of quality and qualified, etc., would be impossible.

analyzed: tasya uttaram nirbhedam api atas viśeṣa śat guṇānām ananta tvam
translated: The answer to that is: Even though it is without distinction, the particular qualities are infinite.

analyzed: brahmaṇaḥ ca eka tvam
translated: And Brahman is one.

analyzed: anantāḥ guṇāḥ asya iti guṇa guṇi ādi bhāvaḥ
translated: The relation of quality and qualified, etc., is that it has infinite qualities.

original: brahma ca guṇāścetyapunaruktabhaṇanaṃ ca yujyata iti /🔽atra jagajjanmādikāraṇatvamiti vaktavye 'nantaguṇamiti vacanamidaṃ sūtramanantaguṇavat
analyzed: brahma ca guṇāḥ ca iti apunarukta bhaṇanam ca yujyate iti  atra jagat janma ādi kāraṇatvam iti vaktavye nanta guṇam iti vacanam idam sūtram ananta guṇavat
translated: And the statement Brahman and the qualities is not redundant.

original: tvameva brahmaṇo lakṣaṇamabhipretya tatsādhanāya jagajjanmādikāraṇatvalakṣaṇaṃ pratipādayituṃ pravṛttamiti sūcayitum /
analyzed: tvam eva brahmaṇaḥ lakṣaṇam abhipretya tad sādhanāya jagat janma ādi kāraṇatva lakṣaṇam pratipādayitum pravṛttam iti sūcayitum
translated: Here, where it should be said that the cause of the creation, etc., of the world is the characteristic, the statement having infinite qualities indicates that this aphorism is composed to establish that, intending that the characteristic of Brahman is having infinite qualities.

original: tadevaṃ jagajjanmādikāraṇatvasya svalakṣaṇatve bādhakābhāvānna taṭasthatvakalpanaṃ yuktamiti siddham /
analyzed: tat evam jagat janma ādi kāraṇatvasya sva lakṣaṇa tve bādhaka abhāvāt na taṭastha tva kalpanam yuktam iti siddham
translated: Thus, since there is no contradiction in the cause of the creation, etc., of the world being the specific characteristic, it is established that it is not proper to imagine it to be a general characteristic.

analyzed: atra āha
translated: Here it is said:

analyzed: kimartham lakṣya lakṣaṇayoḥ abhedam aṅgīkṛtya viśeṣa balena sarva vyavahāra samādhānam kriyate
translated: Why, accepting the non-difference of the characterized and the characteristic, is the settlement of all usage made by the force of distinction?

analyzed: bhedaḥ eva kasmāt na aṅgīkriyate
translated: Why is not difference itself accepted?

analyzed: guṇa guṇi bhāvaḥ tu samavāya sambandhāt bhaviṣyati
translated: But the relation of quality and qualified will be by the relation of inherence.

original: yadi ca sūtrakāreṇa samavāyo nirākariṣyata iti nāṅgīkārārhastadā guṇaguṇinoreva sa kaścittādṛśaḥ svabhāvabheda ityaṅgīkaraṇīyam /
analyzed: yadi ca sūtrakāreṇa samavāyaḥ nirākariṣyate iti na aṅgīkāra arhaḥ tadā guṇa guṇinoḥ eva sa kaścid tādṛśaḥ svabhāva bhedaḥ iti aṅgīkaraṇīyam
translated: And if inherence is to be denied by the author of the aphorisms, and is not to be accepted, then that kind of difference in nature between quality and qualified must be accepted.

original: nahi paṭādau bhedābhāve 'pi viśeṣabalādvayavahāraviśeṣadarśanamātreṇa brahmaṇyapi tathā kalpayituṃ yuktam /
analyzed: nahi paṭa ādau bheda abhāve pi viśeṣa balāt vayavahāra viśeṣa darśana mātreṇa brahmaṇi api tathā kalpayitum yuktam
translated: For even in the absence of difference in cloth etc., it is not proper to imagine it in Brahman merely by seeing the difference in usage by the force of distinction.

analyzed: niścāyaka pramāṇa abhāvāt
translated: Because there is no conclusive proof.

analyzed: niścāyaka pramāṇa upanyāsa artham hi sambhāvanā kalpyate
translated: Imagination is supposed for the purpose of stating a conclusive proof.

analyzed: yathā āhuḥ
translated: As they say:

analyzed: sambhāvitaḥ pratijñāya arthaḥ sādhyeta hetunā
translated: The meaning of the proposition may be established by a reason,

analyzed: na tasya hetubhiḥ trāṇam utpatan eva yaḥ mṛtaḥ
translated: Not that for which there is no salvation by reasons, like one who dies even while flying.

analyzed: iti
translated: Thus.

analyzed: na punar sambhāvanā eva arthasya
translated: But it is not that the meaning is established merely by imagination.

analyzed: sādhikā iti atas āha evam dharmān iti
translated: Therefore he says Thus the dharmas etc.

analyzed: evam dharmān iti śrutyā tat abhedaḥ u pi udīryate
translated: In the same way, by the text, ‘The dharmas of Brahman,’ the non-difference of Brahman and its attributes is also declared.

analyzed: apiśabdāt viśeṣaḥ pi
translated: And by the word ‘api’ (also) in the text, the difference (of Brahman and its attributes) is also (declared).

analyzed: atra hi brahma dharmāṇām pṛthak darśana nindayā abhedaḥ vagamyate
translated: For here, by the censure of the separate perception of the attributes of Brahman, the non-difference (of Brahman and its attributes) is understood.

analyzed: dharmān iti ca dharma bahu tva uktayā sa viśeṣa tvam
translated: And by the expression ‘the dharmas of Brahman,’ the plurality of the attributes is stated, and so the existence of difference (of Brahman and its attributes) is (also) stated.

analyzed: na ca dharma an iti anuvāda mātram  śrutim vinā tad asiddheḥ
translated: And it is not merely a restatement of the attributes of Brahman.🔽Because that (i.e., the existence of difference of Brahman and its attributes) is not established without the (direct) statement of the Veda.

original: mūlaśrutyaṅgīkāre saiva viśeṣābhidhātrī bhaviṣyatīti pramitametannirbhedameva brahma viśeṣabalādeva nānāvyavahārālambanamiti / /
analyzed: mūlaśruti aṅgīkāre sā eva viśeṣa abhidhātrī bhaviṣyati iti pramitam etat nirbhedam eva brahma viśeṣa balāt eva nānā vyavahāra ālambanam iti
translated: If the original statement (of the Veda) is accepted, that (original statement) itself will be the declarer of the difference (of Brahman and its attributes). So this is well-known that Brahman, which is free from difference, is the basis of the usage of various (names) by the power of difference (of its attributes).

original: atra yatpareṇa jagatkāraṇatvaṃ kiṃ brahmaṇo nimittatvamevotopādānatvamevāthobhayamapīti vimṛśya tṛtīyaḥ pakṣaḥ parigṛhītaḥ /
analyzed: atra yat pareṇa jagat kāraṇatvam kim brahmaṇaḥ nimitta tvam eva uta upādāna tvam eva atha ubhayam api iti vimṛśya tṛtīyaḥ pakṣaḥ parigṛhītaḥ
translated: Here, the other party having considered whether the causality of Brahman in the world is only the state of being the material cause or the state of being the efficient cause or both, has accepted the third alternative.

analyzed: upādāna tvam ca pariṇāmi tvena iti kaścid
translated: And some (think that) the state of being the material cause is the state of being the transformation (of Brahman).

analyzed: prapañca bhrama adhiṣṭhāna mātra tvena iti aparaḥ
translated: And others (think that) it is the state of being the mere substratum of the illusion of the world.

analyzed: tat etat sarvam prakṛti adhikaraṇe nipuṇataram nirākariṣyate
translated: All this will be refuted more carefully in the chapter on ‘Prakṛti’ (Prakṛtyadhikaraṇa).

original: tasmāduktalakṣaṇadvayopapannaṃ brahma nārāyaṇākhyaṃ mumukṣuṇā jijñāsyamiti sthitam /
analyzed: tasmāt ukta lakṣaṇa dvaya upapannam brahma nārāyaṇa ākhyam mumukṣuṇā jijñāsyam iti sthitam
translated: Therefore, it is established that Brahman, which possesses the two characteristics mentioned, and is called Narayana, should be sought to be known by one who desires liberation.

analyzed: iti śrīmat nyāyasudhāyām janma adhikaraṇam
translated: Thus ends the Jnanadhyaya in the Sridhara commentary on the Vedanta Sutras.
II. The Adhikarana on the Vedas being the source of knowledge.

analyzed: atha śrīmat nyāyasudhāyām śāstra yoni tva adhikaraṇam
translated: Now, in the Sridhara commentary on the Vedanta Sutras, the Adhikarana on the Vedas being the source of knowledge.

analyzed: atha jagat kāraṇatvasya pāśupata ādi agama anumāna avaṣṭambhena ativyāpti śaṅkā
translated: Now, the doubt of over-extension by the inference of the Pasupata and other scriptures regarding the quality of being the cause of the world.

analyzed: śāstra yoni tvāt
translated: Because of being the source of the Vedas.

analyzed: jagat janma ādi kāraṇa tvam para brahmaṇaḥ viṣṇoḥ lakṣaṇam abhihitam
translated: The quality of being the cause of the creation etc. of the world is stated as the characteristic of Vishnu, the supreme Brahman.

original: tasya harahiraṇyagarbhādicetaneṣu pradhānādyacetaneṣu ca pāśupatādyāgamānumānāvaṣṭambhenātivyāptimāśaṅkyātra pariharati bhagavāntsūtrakāraḥ
analyzed: tasya hara hiraṇyagarbha ādi cetaneṣu pradhāna ādi acetaneṣu ca pāśupata ādi āgama anumāna avaṣṭambhena ativyāptim āśaṅkya atra pariharati bhagavān sūtrakāraḥ
translated: Suspecting over-extension in that with regard to conscious beings like Hara and Hiranyagarbha, and unconscious beings like Pradhana, by the force of the inference of the Pasupata and other scriptures, the revered author of the aphorisms removes it here.

analyzed: tatra pūrvapakṣam āracayati śaiva ādya iti
translated: There, he raises the prima facie view with Saiva etc.

analyzed: śaiva ādi āgama samprāpta dṛṣṭa gena phalena tu
translated: But by the seen result obtained from the Saiva and other scriptures,

analyzed: tad vākya upamayā anyat ca pramāṇa tve numīyate
translated: and also by the analogy of those statements, which is inferred to be a means of knowledge,

analyzed: īśa vākya tvataḥ
translated: because of being the statement of the Lord.

analyzed: śivena racitaḥ śaivaḥ
translated: The Saiva is composed by Shiva.

analyzed: ādi grahaṇāt hiraṇyagarbha ādi racitāḥ gṛhyante
translated: By the word 'ādi' (beginning with), the scriptures composed by Hiraṇyagarbha and others are included.

original: taiḥ samprāptaṃ taduktasādanānuṣṭhānasamprāptam /🔽dṛṣṭaṃ dṛṣṭiḥ pratyakṣamiti yāvat /
analyzed: taiḥ samprāptam tad ukta sādana anuṣṭhāna samprāptam  dṛṣṭam dṛṣṭiḥ pratyakṣam iti yāvat
translated: That which is obtained by them, obtained by the performance of the means taught by them.🔽'Dṛṣṭa' means perception.

analyzed: tat siddham dṛṣṭa gam
translated: That which is established by that is 'dṛṣṭagata'.

analyzed: phalena tu tad vākyasya prāmāṇyam anumāya iti śeṣaḥ
translated: The remainder is that the validity of that statement is inferred by the result.

analyzed: pramāṇa tve iti viṣaya saptamī
translated: 'In the case of' is the locative case of the object.

analyzed: dṛṣṭa phala artham sādhanāni vidadhat vākyam tāvat pramāṇa tayā anumīyate
translated: The statement that prescribes the means for the purpose of the seen result is first inferred to be valid.

analyzed: kena liṅgena
translated: By what reason?

analyzed: phalena
translated: By the result.

analyzed: tasya pakṣa asambandhinaḥ nu māpaka tvam uktam śaiva ādi āgama samprāpta iti
translated: How can that which is not related to the subject be the inferential mark? To answer this, it is said 'obtained by the Śaiva and other scriptures'.

analyzed: ajñāna asiddhim parihatum uktam dṛṣṭa gena iti
translated: To avoid the fallacy of non-establishment of ignorance, it is said 'by the seen'.

analyzed: tuśabdaḥ numāna dvaye hetu viśeṣa dyotakaḥ
translated: The word 'tu' (but) indicates a special reason in the two inferences.

analyzed: īśa vākyatvataḥ iti atra ādi śabdaḥ yojyaḥ
translated: In 'because it is the statement of the Lord', the word 'ādi' (beginning with) should be connected.

analyzed: ayam arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is this.

analyzed: dvividhaḥ hi śiva praṇītaḥ āgamaḥ
translated: There are two kinds of scriptures composed by Śiva.

analyzed: kaścid pratyakṣa yogya sampad ādi phalam uddiśya sādhanāni vidadhat
translated: Some prescribe means for the sake of results such as the attainment of direct perception,

analyzed: aparaḥ tu saṅkalpa varga ādi apratyakṣa phalāni vidadhānaḥ śivasya jagat janma ādi kāraṇa tva sarvajña tva savar śakti tva satya saṅkalpa tva ādi aśeṣa guṇa pūrṇa tvam
translated: But another [commentator], setting forth the fruits of the imperceptible [results] of the Sankalpa and other [sections], establishes Śiva's completeness with all the qualities such as being the cause of the creation etc. of the world, omniscience, omnipotence, and truthfulness of resolve,

analyzed: niravadya tvam ca pratipādayati
translated: and his freedom from faults.

analyzed: tatra ādyaḥ tāvat pramāṇam
translated: Among them, the first is indeed a means of valid knowledge.

analyzed: tad ukta sādhana anuṣṭhāne sati pratyakṣatas eva phala darśanāt
translated: Because the result is seen directly when the means of knowledge stated by it are practiced.

analyzed: tat ayam prayogaḥ
translated: This is the argument.

analyzed: vimataḥ āgamaḥ pramāṇam sa phala pravṛtti janaka tvāt caraka suśruta ādi vat
translated: The disputed scripture is a means of valid knowledge because it generates successful action, like the works of Caraka and Suśruta.

analyzed: yadi apramāṇam abhaviṣyat na samarthām pravṛttim akariṣyat vipralambhaka vākya vat
translated: If it were not a means of valid knowledge, it would not generate effective action, like the words of a deceiver.

analyzed: tat uktam pramāṇataḥ rtha pratipattau pravṛtti sāmarthyāt arthavat pramāṇam iti
translated: It is said: Because of the efficacy of action when the object is known through a means of valid knowledge, the means of valid knowledge is meaningful.

original: tataśca tatpraṇetuḥ śivasya paramāptatvamavadhārya taddṛṣṭāntena tatpraṇītasya dvitīyasyāpyāgamasya prāmāṇyamavasīyate /
analyzed: tatas ca tad praṇetuḥ śivasya parama āpta tvam avadhārya tad dṛṣṭāntena tad praṇītasya dvitīyasya api āgamasya prāmāṇyam avasīyate
translated: And from that, ascertaining that the author Śiva is supremely trustworthy, the validity of the second scripture composed by him is ascertained by analogy with that.

analyzed: atra ca prayogaḥ
translated: And here the argument is this:

analyzed: vipratipannaḥ āgamaḥ pramāṇam śiva vākya tvāt sampratipanna vat iti
translated: The scripture that is contradicted is a means of valid knowledge, because it is the word of Śiva, like what is commonly accepted.

analyzed: vipakṣe śivasya anāpta tva prasaṅgaḥ bādhakaḥ
translated: The objection is that in the contrary case, Śiva would be a non-authoritative person.

analyzed: tat evam anumita prāmāṇyena śaiva āgamena śivasya jagat janma ādi kāraṇa tva asya
translated: Thus, by the Śaiva scripture, whose validity is inferred, it is stated that Śiva is the cause of the creation, etc. of the world.

analyzed: abhidhānāt na idam lakṣaṇam viṣṇoḥ upapadyate iti śaivāḥ
translated: Therefore, this definition does not apply to Viṣṇu, say the Śaivas.

original: anayaiva diśā tattadāgamaprāmāṇyaṃ tattaddevatāvādināṃ pratyavasthānāni draṣṭavyāni /
analyzed: anayā eva diśā tad tad āgama prāmāṇyam tad tad devatā vādinām pratyavasthānāni draṣṭavyāni
translated: In the same way, the validity of the various scriptures and the refutations of those who propound the various deities should be seen.

analyzed: upalakṣaṇam ca etat
translated: And this is only an illustration.

analyzed: anumānena api śiva ādīnām jagat janma ādi kāraṇa tvam sarvajñatva ādikam śakya sādhanam
translated: By inference also, the causality of Śiva and others in the creation, etc. of the world and their omniscience, etc. can be proved.

analyzed: tathā hi  kṣiti ādikam sa kartṛkam kāryatvāt ghaṭa vat
translated: Thus it is.🔽Earth, etc. have a maker, because they are effects, like a pot.

analyzed: vivāda adhyāsitam karma prayatna ādhāra jam karma tvāt sampratipanna vat
translated: The action that is the subject of dispute is supported by effort, because it is an action, like what is commonly accepted.

analyzed: vipratipanne pṛthivī udake
translated: In the case of the disputed earth and water,

analyzed: prayatnavatā dhṛte  guru tve satyapāti tvāt
translated: they are held by one who has effort.🔽Because they do not fall when heavy,

analyzed: sampratipanna vat
translated: like what is commonly accepted.

analyzed: kṣiti ādikam prayatna vat vināśyam vi
translated: Earth, etc. are to be destroyed by one who has effort,

analyzed: nāśya tvāt sampratipanna vat
translated: because they are destructible, like what is commonly accepted.

original: ityādibhiranumānairviśvodayasthitilayakartari sāmānyataḥ siddhe asmadādīnāṃ tadasambhavāt bhagavāṃśchiva eva pariśeṣājjagajjanmādikartā siddhayati
analyzed: ityādibhiḥ anumānaiḥ viśva udaya sthiti laya kartari sāmānyatas siddhe asmat ādīnām tad asambhavāt bhagavān śivaḥ eva pariśeṣāt jagat janma ādi kartā siddhayati
translated: Thus, by these inferences, the existence of the creator of the origin, sustenance, and dissolution of the universe being established in general, and it being impossible for us and others, Lord Śiva alone is established as the cause of the origin, etc. of the world by the method of difference.

original: yathā ca vicitrādikāryadaśarnāttadanuguṇa eva kartā kalpyate evaṃ vicitrānekakāryadaśarnātnena
analyzed: yathā ca eva kartā kalpyate evam
translated: And just as a creator who is in accordance with the observed diverse effects is imagined, in the same way, even when a creator is imagined due to the observation of diverse many effects,

analyzed: kalpyamānaḥ u pi kartā tad anuguṇaḥ sārvajña ādimān eva siddhayati
translated: he is established as having omniscience and other qualities that are in accordance with that.

original: athavā kṣityādikaṃ kartetyadantargatameva savarjñatvādikaṃ na yatnāntaramapekṣate /
analyzed: athavā kṣiti ādikam kartā iti at antargatam eva na yatna antaram apekṣate
translated: Or, the omniscience, etc. inherent in the creator of the earth, etc. do not require any other effort.

analyzed: nimitta upādāna phala ādi abhijñasya tad anuguṇa icchā prayatnavataḥ eva kartṛ tvam
translated: Only one who knows the cause, material cause, effect, etc. and has a desire and effort in accordance with that is a creator.

analyzed: evam hiraṇyagarbha ādiṣu api pariśeṣeṇa jagat kāraṇatvam yojyam iti
translated: In the same way, the causality of the world should be connected to Hiraṇyagarbha, etc. by the method of difference.

analyzed: atha śaiva ādi agama pramāṇya sādhaka anumāna nirāsaḥ
translated: Now, the refutation of the inferences proving the validity of Śaiva and other scriptures.

analyzed: evam āgamāt anumānāt ca anyeṣām jagat janma ādi kāraṇa tve prāpte prativihitam sūtrakṛtā
translated: Thus, when the causality of the origin, etc. of the world is established for others from the scriptures and inferences, it has been refuted by the author of the aphorisms.

analyzed: āgamāt anumānataḥ vā anye jagat kāraṇatvena na kalpanīyāḥ
translated: Others should not be imagined as the cause of the world on the basis of scripture or inference.

analyzed: kutas
translated: Why?

analyzed: śāstra yoni tvāt
translated: Because of being born from scripture.

original: ṛgyajuḥsāmātharvāścetyādinoktaṃ śāstraṃ yoniḥ kāraṇamabhivyañjakaṃ pramāṇamasyeti śāstrayoni tasya bhāvaḥ śāstrayonitvaṃ tasmāt /
analyzed: ṛk yajuḥ sāma atharvāḥ ca ityādinā uktam śāstram yoniḥ kāraṇam abhivyañjakam pramāṇam asya iti śāstra yoni tasya bhāvaḥ śāstra yoni tvam tasmāt
translated: The scripture mentioned beginning with Rg, Yajur, Sama, and Atharva is the womb, the cause, the manifestor, and the means of valid knowledge of this [world]. Thus it is born from scripture. The state of that is being born from scripture. Therefore,

analyzed: etat uktam bhavati
translated: this is what is said.

original: jagajjanmādikāraṇasya vastuno vedādiśāstraikasamadhigamyatvena śaivādyāgamānumānāgocaratvānna tairanyeṣāṃ jagatkāraṇatvaṃ kalpanīyam /
analyzed: jagat janma ādi kāraṇasya vastunaḥ veda ādi śāstra eka samadhigamya tvena śaiva ādi āgama anumāna agocara tvāt na taiḥ anyeṣām jagat kāraṇatvam kalpanīyam
translated: Since the cause of the origination, etc. of the world is to be known only through scriptures such as the Vedas, and is not the domain of Shaiva and other scriptures and inferences, the causality of the world by others should not be imagined through them.

original: kintu śāstraṃ yasya jagatkāraṇatvamācaṣṭe sa eva tathābhyupagantavya iti / /
analyzed: kintu śāstram yasya jagat kāraṇatvam ācaṣṭe saḥ eva tathā abhyupagantavyaḥ iti
translated: Rather, one should accept as it is taught in the scriptures that which is declared to be the cause of the world.

analyzed: syāt etat
translated: This may be argued:

original: yadi śāstraikasamadhigamyatvaṃ sautro hetuḥ siddhaḥ syānna caivam /
analyzed: yadi śāstra eka samadhigamya tvam sautraḥ hetuḥ siddhaḥ syāt na ca evam
translated: If the reason stated in the sutra [of Shakara] were established as being known only through scripture, it would not be so.

analyzed: pratyakṣa agamya tve pi śaiva ādi āgamaiḥ anumānaiḥ ca ukta vidhayā jagat kāraṇatvasya niścetum śakya tvāt
translated: Even if it is to be known through perception and scripture, the causality of the world can be ascertained through Shaiva and other scriptures and inferences in the manner stated.

original: ityāśaṅkaya sautrahetusiddhaye śaivādyāgamagamyatvaṃ tāvannirācikīrṣustatprāmāṇyasādhakaṃ paropanyastamanumānamapākaroti iti cediti //
analyzed: iti āśaṅkaya sautra hetu siddhaye śaiva ādi āgama gamya tvam tāvat nirācikīrṣuḥ tad prāmāṇya sādhakam para upanyastam anumānam apākaroti iti ced iti
translated: Fearing this, in order to establish the reason stated in the sutra, he first wishes to refute the fact that it is known from Shaiva and other scriptures. He refutes the inference presented by others to prove its validity, saying If it is argued...

analyzed: iti ced tad gavyabhicāriṇā
translated: If it is argued that it is a statement with deviation from that,

analyzed: a prāmāṇya anumā ca syān
translated: An inference of invalidity would also be...

original: tadgaḥ pratyakṣāvagataścāsau vyabhicāraḥ phalavyabhicāraśca so 'syastīti tadgavyabhicārivākyaṃ tena dṛṣṭāntabhūtena śivādīnāṃ jagatkāraṇatvāvagamahetubhūtā
analyzed: pratyakṣa avagataḥ ca asau vyabhicāraḥ phala vyabhicāraḥ ca tat ga vyabhicāri vākyam tena dṛṣṭānta bhūtena śiva ādīnām jagat kāraṇatva avagama hetu bhūtā
translated: That which has deviation from that, and that which has deviation in its result, that exists for this, so it is a statement with deviation from that. By that which serves as an example, the statement that is the cause of understanding Shiva and others as the cause of the world,

analyzed: gamasya īśa vākya tva ādinā hetunā aprāmāṇya anumitiḥ ca syāt
translated: By the reason of being the statement of the Lord, an inference of invalidity would also be.

original: etaduktaṃ bhavati /🔽yadi pratyakṣasaṃvādena dṛṣṭārthānāṃ śivādivākyānāṃ prāmāṇyamanumāya taddṛṣṭāntenādṛṣṭārthānāmapi śivādivākyatvena hetunā prāmāṇyamanumīyate /
analyzed: etat uktam bhavati  yadi pratyakṣa saṃvādena dṛṣṭa arthānām śiva ādi vākyānām prāmāṇyam anumāya tad dṛṣṭāntena adṛṣṭa arthānām api śiva ādi vākya tvena hetunā prāmāṇyam anumīyate
translated: This is what is said.🔽If, by the agreement with perception of statements with seen meaning, the validity of statements about Shiva and others is inferred, and by that example, the validity of those with unseen meaning is also inferred by the reason of being a statement about Shiva and others,

original: tarhi dṛṣṭārtheṣveva vākyeṣu yatpratyakṣata eva phalavyabhicāravaddṛśyate tasya /
analyzed: tarhi dṛṣṭa artheṣu eva vākyeṣu yat pratyakṣataḥ eva phala vyabhicāra vat dṛśyate tasya
translated: Then, in statements with seen meaning, that which is seen to have deviation in result by perception itself,

analyzed: vimatam apramāṇam asamartha pravṛtti janaka tvāt vipralambhaka vākya vat iti aprāmāṇyam anumāya
translated: Having inferred non-authoritativeness by the inference: The scripture of Śiva etc. is not authoritative, because it produces ineffective activity, like a deceptive statement.

analyzed: tad dṛṣṭāntena śiva ādi vākya tva ādi hetunā eva adṛṣṭa arthānām api
translated: By that example, even of unseen objects, by the reason of being a statement of Śiva etc.

analyzed: vimatāni apramāṇāni śiva ādi vākya tvāt sampratipanna vat iti aprāmāṇyam anumātum śakyate eva
translated: The other scriptures of Śiva etc. can be inferred to be non-authoritative by the inference: The other scriptures are non-authoritative, because they are statements of Śiva etc., like the accepted ones.

original: na hi dṛṣṭārthaṃ sarvameva śivavākyaṃ samarthapravṛttijanakam /
analyzed: na hi dṛṣṭārtham sarvam eva śiva vākyam samartha pravṛtti janakam
translated: Not all the statements of Śiva that have a seen purpose produce effective activity.

analyzed: viphala pravṛtti janakasya api bahulam upalambhāt
translated: Because many are found to produce fruitless activity.

analyzed: nanu tat api vākyam pramāṇam eva
translated: If it is argued that even that statement is authoritative,

original: phalavyabhicārastu kartṛkarmādivaiguṇyanimitta iti cettarhi tadapi vākyamapramāṇameva phalasaṃvāsadastu kākatālīyo vā jagadvayāmohakānāṃ śivādīnāṃ
analyzed: phala vyabhicāraḥ tu kartṛ karma ādi vaiguṇya nimittaḥ iti ced tarhi tat api vākyam apramāṇam eva phala saṃvāsa daḥ tu kākatālīyaḥ vā jagat vayā mohakānām śiva ādīnām
translated: and the deviation in result is due to defects in the agent, object etc., then that statement is also non-authoritative. The coincidence with result may be accidental, or it may be like a sweet-talking person.

original: guḍajihvikā vetyastu /🔽prāmāṇye hi sudṛḍhanirūḍhe vyabhicārasya kartrādivaiguṇyaṃ kāraṇaṃ kalpanīyam /
analyzed: guḍajihvikā vā iti astu  prāmāṇye hi su dṛḍha nirūḍhe vyabhicārasya kartṛ ādi vaiguṇyam kāraṇam kalpanīyam
translated: Or it may be like a sweet-talking person.🔽For when authoritativeness is firmly established, the deviation is to be imagined to have the agent etc. as its cause.

analyzed: phala avyabhicāreṇa eva prāmāṇyam parikalpayataḥ sphuṭam itaretarāśraya tvam
translated: For one who imagines authoritativeness itself by the non-deviation of result, the other-dependence is clear.
If it is argued that the statement being of Śiva is inconclusive because it is contradicted by the result, it is not so.

analyzed: tatra api phala visaṃvādinī anaikāntyāt
translated: Because there it is inconclusive because it is contradicted by the result.

original: kiñca yaḥ śivāgamasyādṛṣṭārthasyāpyevaṃ prāmāṇyaṃ manyate sa hiraṇyagarbhādyāgamānāmapi prāmāṇyamaṅgīkaroti na vā /
analyzed: kiñca yaḥ śiva āgamasya adṛṣṭa arthasya api evam prāmāṇyam manyate sa hiraṇyagarbha ādi āgamānām api prāmāṇyam aṅgīkaroti na vā
translated: Moreover, one who considers the Śaiva scriptures to be authoritative even for unseen purposes, does he accept the authoritativeness of the scriptures of Hiraṇyagarbha and others or not?

analyzed: na ādyaḥ
translated: The first is not so.

analyzed: paraspara viruddhayoḥ ubhayoḥ prāmāṇya ayogāt
translated: Because the authoritativeness of both cannot be reconciled if they are mutually contradictory.

analyzed: na dvitīyaḥ
translated: The second is not so.

analyzed: anumāna prakārasya samāna tve vaiṣamya anupapatteḥ
translated: Because the inconsistency is not justified if the type of inference is the same.

original: atha tadanumānamaprayojakaṃ hiraṇyagarbhavākyatve 'pyāgantukena vipralambhādīnāṃ doṣeṇaikasyāprāmāṇyasambhavāditi cet /
analyzed: atha tad anumānam aprayojakam hiraṇyagarbha vākya tve pi āgantukena vipralambha ādīnām doṣeṇa ekasya aprāmāṇya sambhavāt iti ced
translated: If it is argued that the inference is not conclusive because even in the case of the statement of Hiraṇyagarbha, one may be false due to some adventitious fault such as deception,

analyzed: samam samādhānam
translated: the answer is the same.

analyzed: anena eva nyāyena caitya vandana ādi vākyānām api prāmāṇyam śakya sādhanam
translated: By this very reasoning, the authoritativeness of the statements of worshiping a caitya etc. can also be established.

analyzed: nahi tad vaktā kadāpi satyam na avadīt
translated: For the speaker of that has never spoken falsely.

original: tadevaṃ śaivādyāgamaprāmāṇyasyāśakyasādhanatvānna tena jagatkartā siddhayati iti / /
analyzed: tat evam śaiva ādi āgama prāmāṇyasya aśakya sādhana tvāt na tena jagatkartā siddhayati iti
translated: Thus, because the authoritativeness of the Śaiva and other scriptures cannot be established, the creator of the world is not proved by them.

analyzed: atha jagat kāraṇatve anumāna anavakāśaḥ iti vyutpādanam
translated: Now, the explanation that there is no scope for inference in the case of the cause of the world.

analyzed: mā bhūt śaiva ādi āgamāt jagat janma ādi kartṛ siddhiḥ
translated: Let not the establishment of the creator of the world, etc. be from the Shaiva and other scriptures.

analyzed: ukta anumānaiḥ tu bhaviṣyati  tat katham śāstra eka samadhigamya tvam jagat kāraṇasya iti ced
translated: But it will be by the stated inferences.🔽If it is asked how then is the world's cause to be known only through scripture,

analyzed: kim śāstra anusāri anumānam jagat kāraṇe pramāṇam ucyate
translated: is inference following scripture said to be the means of knowledge regarding the world's cause?

analyzed: uta svatantram  ādyaḥ tu aṅgīkriyate eva
